original: Su hi nāiccetesu sabbassa gosaddassa goṇādeso hoti vā. Casaddena sesesu ca. Goṇo, goṇā, he goṇa he goṇā, goṇaṃ, goṇe, goṇena, goṇehi goṇebhi, goṇassa.
analyzed: su hi na a i c ca etesu sabbassa go saddassa goṇa ādesaḥ hoti vā ca saddena sesesu ca goṇaḥ goṇāḥ he goṇa he goṇāḥ goṇam goṇe goṇena goṇehi goṇebhi goṇassa
translated: And in the other words with the same ending. The cow, the cows; O cow, O cows; the cow, the cows; by the cow, by the cows; with the cow, with the cows; of the cow, of the cows.

original: 173. Goṇa naṃmhi vā.
analyzed: go ṇa naṃmhi vā
translated: The cow, the cows, in the locative case.🔽The vowel of the first syllable of the word go is lengthened or not lengthened in the locative case. Of the cows, of the cow; from the cow, from the cows; with the cows, with the cow; of the cow, of the cows; in the cow, in the cows.

original: Sabbassa gosaddassa goṇādeso hoti vā naṃmhi vibhattimhi. Goṇānaṃ, goṇā goṇasmā goṇamhā, goṇehi goṇebhi, goṇassa, goṇānaṃ, goṇe goṇasmiṃ goṇamhi, goṇesu.
analyzed: sabbassa go saddassa goṇa ādesaḥ hoti vā namhi vibhattimhi goṇānam goṇāḥ goṇasmā goṇamhā goṇehi goṇebhi goṇassa goṇānam goṇe goṇasmin goṇamhi goṇesu
translated: In the absence of the lengthening of the vowel of the first syllable of the word go, with the cow, with the cows; with the cows, with the cow.

original: Goṇādesābhāve gāvena gavena, gohi gobhi.🔽174. Gāva se.
analyzed: go ṇa ādesa abhāve gāvena gavena gohi gobhi  gāvaḥ se
translated: The cow, the cows, in the locative case.

original: “Go āva se”iti tipadamidaṃ. Gossa o go, gosaddokārassa āvādeso hoti se vibhattimhi. Gāvassa gavassa.
analyzed: go se iti ti padam idam gossa o go go sadda ukārassa āva ādesaḥ hoti se vibhattimhi gāvassa gavassa
translated: The word go āva se is a three-part word. The vowel of the first syllable of the word go is lengthened in the locative case when the ending āva is added. Of the cow, of the cows.

original: Naṃmhi “go, avā”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: naṃmhi go avāti ca vattate
translated: In the locative case, the word go avā is used.

original: 175. Tato namaṃ patimhālutte ca samāse.
analyzed: tatas namam ca samāse
translated: Then, after the locative case, in the compound.

original: Tato gosaddato parassa naṃvacanassa aṃādeso hoti, gosaddokārassa avādeso ca patimhi pare alutte ca samāse. Casaddena asamāsepi aṃ avādesā. Gavaṃpatissa therassa, gavaṃ.
analyzed: tatas go saddataḥ parassa naṃvacanassa aṃ ādesaḥ hoti go sadda ukārassa av ādesaḥ ca patimhi pare a lutte ca samāse ca saddena a samāse pi aṃ a vādesāḥ gavaṃpatissa therassa gavaṃpatissa
translated: Then, after the word go, the vowel a of the word naṃ is elided, and the vowel o of the word gosaddo is elided, in the word patimhi, in the word pare, and in the compound alutte. And the vowel a of the word naṃ is elided, and the vowel o of the word gosaddo is elided, in the word casaddo, even when it is not a compound. Gavaṃpatissa therassa, gavaṃ.

original: “Suhināsu cā”ti ettha casaddena naṃmhi guādeso. “No ca dvādito naṃmhī”ti sutte casaddena nakārāgamo ca. Gunnaṃgonaṃ vā.
analyzed: ca ati ettha ca saddena naṃmhi gu ādesaḥ no ca dvi āditaḥ naṃmhi iti sutte ca saddena nakāra āgamaḥ ca vā
translated: “Suhināsu cā” means that the vowel u of the word gu is elided after the word casaddo. “No ca dvādito naṃmhī” means that the vowel a of the word naṃ is elided, and the letter na is added, after the word casaddo. Gunnaṃgonaṃ vā.

original: Gāvā gāvamhā gāvasmā gavā gavamhā gavasmā, gohi gobhi, gāvassa gavassa, gavaṃ gunnaṃ gonaṃ, gāve gāvamhi gāvasmiṃ gave gavamhi gavasmiṃ, gāvesu gavesu gosu.
analyzed: gāvā gāvamhā gāvasmā gavā gavamhā gavasmā gohi gobhi gāvassa gavassa gavam gunnam gonam gāve gāvamhi gāvasmin gave gavamhi gavasmin gāvesu gavesu gosu
translated: Gāvā, gāvamhā, gāvasmā, gavā, gavamhā, gavasmā, gohi, gobhi, gāvassa, gavassa, gavaṃ, gunnaṃ, gonaṃ, gāve, gāvamhi, gāvasmiṃ, gave, gavamhi, gavasmiṃ, gāvesu, gavesu, gosu.

original: Okārantaṃ.
analyzed: okāra antam
translated: The ending in o.

original: Puriso guṇavā rājā, sā’ggi daṇḍī ca bhikkhu ca;
analyzed: purisaḥ guṇavā rājā daṇḍī ca bhikkhu ca
translated: A man, virtuous, a king, that fire, a staff-bearer, and a monk;

original: Satthā’bhibhū ca sabbaññū, goti pulliṅgasaṅgaho.
analyzed: ca sabbaññū go ti pulliṅga saṅgahaḥ
translated: A teacher, a conqueror, and an all-knower - the neuter class is included in the masculine.

original: Pulliṅgaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: pulliṅgam niṭṭhitam
translated: The neuter class is finished.

original: Asmā nasmā tasmā namhā tamhā, nehi nebhi tehi tebhi, assa nassa tassa, nesaṃ tesaṃ nesānaṃ tesānaṃ, asmiṃ nasmiṃ tasmiṃ namhi tamhi, nesu tesu.
analyzed: asmā nasmā tasmā namhā tamhā nehi nebhi tehi tebhi assa nassa tassa nesam tesānam tesānam asmin nasmin tasmin namhi tamhi nesu tesu
translated: Asmā nasmā tasmā namhā tamhā, nehi nebhi tehi tebhi, assa nassa tassa, nesaṃ tesaṃ nesānaṃ tesānaṃ, asmiṃ nasmiṃ tasmiṃ namhi tamhi, nesu tesu.

original: Itthiyaṃ “tā si” itīdha sādesasilopā. Sā kaññā, nattaṃ. Nā tā nāyo tāyo, naṃ taṃ, nā tā nāyo tāyo, nāya tāya, nāhi tāhi nābhi tābhi.
analyzed: itthiyam tā si iti idha sa ādesa si lopā sā kaññā nattam nā tā nāyo tāyo naṃ tam nā tā nāyo tāyo nāya tāya nāhi tāhi nābhi tābhi
translated: In the feminine: tā si. Here the feminine ending -ā is elided. She is a maiden, a thing. Not she, not they, not she, not they. Her, them, not her, not them, not by her, not by them, not by her, not by them.

original: “Etimāsamī”ti ito etimāggahaṇañca “tassā vā”ti ito taggahaṇañca pañcamiyantavasena vattate “vā”ti ca.
analyzed: etimāsamī iti itas etimā gahaṇañca tassā vāti itas tad gahaṇañca pañcamiyanta vasena vattate vāti ca
translated: “Etimāsamī” means “from this” and “tassā vā” means “of that” and “vā” is used in the sense of the fifth case.

original: 215. Tato sassa ssāya.
analyzed: tatas sassa ssāya
translated: . After that, sassa ssāya.

original: Tato tā etā imāto parassa sassa vibhattissa ssāyādeso hoti vā.
analyzed: tatas tāḥ etāḥ imāḥ parassa sassa vibhattissa ssa āya ādesaḥ hoti vā
translated: After that, tā etā imā, the ending sassa of the sixth case becomes ssāya.

original: “Saṃsāsvekavacanesu ca, i”iti ca vattate.
analyzed: sa ṃ sāsu ekavacanesu ca i iti ca vat tate
translated: “Saṃsāsvekavacanesu ca, i” is said.

original: 216. Tassā vā.🔽Tāiccetassa itthiyaṃ vattamānassa antassa ikāro hoti vā saṃ sāsvekavacanesu vibhattādesesu. Tissāya tassāya assāya nassāya assā nassā tissā tassā nāya tāya, nāsaṃ tāsaṃ.
analyzed: tassā vā 🔽itthiyam vattamānassa antassa ikāraḥ hoti vā sam sāsu ekavacanesu vibhatta ādesesu tissāya tassāya assāya nassāya assā nassā tissā tassā nāya tāya nāsam tāsam
translated: . Tassā vā.🔽The final -a of tā, which is used in the feminine, becomes -i, -ā, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -e, -o, -u, -a, -ā, -i, -

original: Pañcamīchaṭṭhīsu tatiyācatutthīsamaṃ. Sattamiyaṃ assaṃ nassaṃ tissaṃ tassaṃ nāyaṃ tāyaṃ, nāsu tāsu.
analyzed: pañcamī chaṭṭhīsu tatiyā catutthī samam sattamiyam assam nassam tissam tassam nāyam tāyam nāsu tāsu
translated: In the fifth and sixth cases the feminine is the same as the third and fourth. In the seventh, his, its; in the fifth, his, its; in the sixth, his, its; in the seventh dual, their; in the fifth dual, their; in the sixth dual, their; in the seventh plural, their; in the fifth plural, their; in the sixth plural, their; in the seventh, by his, by its; in the fifth, by his, by its; in the sixth, by his, by its; in the seventh dual, by their; in the fifth dual, by their; in the sixth dual, by their; in the seventh plural, by their; in the fifth plural, by their; in the sixth plural, by their.

original: Napuṃsake simhisādesābhāvā nattaṃ. Naṃ taṃ, nāni tāni, naṃ taṃ, nāni tāni, nena tena iccādi pulliṅgasamaṃ.
analyzed: napuṃsake sim hisa ādesa abhāvāḥ nattam naṃ taṃ nāni tāni naṃ taṃ nāni tāni nena tena iccādi pulliṅga samam
translated: In the neuter there is no elision of the final s, so it is not. It, them; it, them; it, them; it, them; by it, by that.

original: Eta si, “etatesaṃ to”ti sakārādeso. Eso puriso, ete, etaṃ, ete iccādi sabbasaddasamaṃ.
analyzed: eta si eta ta esam to ti sakāra ādesaḥ esaḥ purisaḥ ete etam ete iccādi sabba sadda samam
translated: In the feminine, in the nominative case, it is etā. In the sixth case, etāya, etābhi.🔽But in the locative case, in the sixth case, and in the singular, the ending sa is used.🔽. In the nominative case, it is etā.🔽In the sixth case, etāya, etābhi. In the locative case, etāsu.

original: Itthiyaṃ etā si, sādeso. Esā kaññā, etā etāyo, etaṃ, etā etāyo, etāya, etāhi etābhi.
analyzed: itthiyam etā si sa ādesaḥ esā kaññā etāḥ etāyaḥ etam etāḥ etāya etāhi etābhi
translated: In the sixth case, etāya, etābhi. In the locative case, etāsu.

original: Sa smiṃsu pana “saṃsāsvekavacanesu cā”ti vattate.
analyzed: sa smiṃsu pana saṃsāsu ekavacanesu ca ati vattate
translated: In the locative case, in the sixth case, and in the singular, the ending sa is used.

original: 217. Etimāsami.🔽Antāpekkhāyaṃ chaṭṭhī, etā imāiccetesamanto saro ikāro hoti saṃsāsvekavacanesu vibhattādesesu. Sādesagatikattā ssāyādesepi. Casaddādhikārato aññekāsaddādīnamantassa ca.
analyzed: eti māsami 🔽anta apekkhā ayam chaṭṭhī etāḥ saraḥ ikāraḥ hoti saṃsāsu ekavacanesu vibhatta ādesesu sa ādesa gatikattā ca sadda adhikārataḥ aññe kā sadda ādīnam antassa ca
translated: . In the nominative case, it is etā.🔽In the sixth case, etāya, etābhi. In the locative case, etāsu.

original: Etissāya etissā etāya, etāsaṃ etāsānaṃ, etāya, etāhi etābhi, etissāya etissā etāya, etāsaṃ etāsānaṃ, etissaṃ etāyaṃ, etāsu.
analyzed: etissāya etissā etāya etāsam etāsānam etāya etāhi etābhiḥ etissāya etissā etāya etāsam etāsānam etissam etāyam etāsu
translated: Etissāya, etc., are the forms of the feminine.

original: Casaddato aññissā aññāya, aññissaṃ aññāyaṃ. Ekissā ekāya, ekissaṃ ekāyaṃ. Itarissā itarāya, itarissaṃ itarāyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: ca saddataḥ aññissā aññāya aññissam aññāyam ekissā ekāya ekissam ekāyam itarissā itarāya itarissam itarāyam iccādi
translated: Casaddato aññissā, etc., are the forms of the neuter.

original: Napuṃsake etaṃ, etāni, etaṃ, etāni, sesaṃ ñeyyaṃ.
analyzed: napuṃsake etaṃ etāni etaṃ etāni sesam ñeyyam
translated: Napuṃsake etaṃ, etc., are the forms of the neuter.

original: Imasaddassa bhedo. Ima si –🔽“Sabbassimassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: ima saddassa bhedaḥ ima si  vattate
translated: The forms of the feminine are:

original: 218. Anapuṃsakassāyaṃ simhi.
analyzed: a napuṃsakassa ayam simhi
translated: “Sabbassimassā” is said.🔽This is the feminine of the neuter.

original: Imasaddassa sabbasseva anapuṃsakassa ayaṃādeso hoti simhi vibhattimhi, silopo. Ayaṃ puriso, ime, imaṃ, ime.🔽219. Animi nāmhi ca.
analyzed: ima saddassa sabbassa iva a napuṃsakassa ayam ādesaḥ hoti simhi vibhattimhi si lopaḥ ayam purisaḥ ime imam ime  a n imi na amhi ca
translated: The forms of the neuter are:🔽“Animi nāmhi ca” is said.

original: Imasaddassa sabbasseva ana imiādesā honti nāmhi vibhattimhi. Anitthiliṅgassevetaṃ gahaṇaṃ. Anena iminā.🔽“Sunaṃhisū”ti vattate.
analyzed: ima saddassa sabbassa iva anaḥ imi ādesāḥ honti nāmhi vibhattimhi an itthi liṅgassa iva itam gahaṇam anena iminā  su naṃhi sūti vattate
translated: The forms of the neuter are:

original: 220. Sabbassimasse vā.
analyzed: sabbassi masse vā
translated: “Sunaṃhisū” is said.🔽“Sabbassimasse vā” is said.

original: Sabbassa imasaddassa ekāro hoti vā su naṃ hiiccetesu vacanesu.
analyzed: sabbassa ima saddassa ekāraḥ hoti vā su nam hi it ca etesu vacanesu
translated: The word sabba has the form sabba in the following words: vā, su, naṃ, hi, icce.

original: Āppaccayantāniddesā, sabbatthāti avuttato;
analyzed: āp paccaya antā aniddesā sabbattha ati a vuttataḥ
translated: The words ā, paccaya, anta, niddesa, sabbattha are not mentioned in the above verse.

original: Anitthiliṅgassevettha, gahaṇañhi imassiti.
analyzed: an itthi liṅgaḥ eva ittha gahaṇam hi imassiti
translated: The word imas is also included in the above verse, because the word imas is mentioned in the above verse.

original: Ehi ebhi imehi imebhi.
analyzed: ehi ebhi imehi imebhi
translated: Ehi, ebhi, imehi, imebhi.

original: “Sabbassa, vā, sabbattha, sasmāsmiṃsaṃsāsvatta”nti ca vattate.
analyzed: sabbassa vā sabbattha ca vattate
translated: The words sabba, vā, sabbattha, sasmim, saṃsā, sassa, svatta are mentioned in the above verse.

original: 221. Imasaddassa ca.
analyzed: ima saddassa ca
translated: And the word imas.

original: Imasaddassa ca sabbasseva attaṃ hoti vā sa smā smiṃsaṃ sāiccetesu vacanesu sabbattha liṅgesu.
analyzed: ima saddassa ca sabbassa iva attam hoti vā sa smā smiṃsam sāic ca itesu vacanesu sabbattha liṅgesu
translated: The word imas has the form imas in the following words: sa, smā, smiṃ, saṃ, sā, icce, in all genders.

original: Assa imassa, esaṃ esānaṃ imesaṃ imesānaṃ, asmā imasmā imamhā, ehi ebhi imehi imebhi, assa imassa, esaṃ esānaṃ imesaṃ imesānaṃ, asmiṃ imasmiṃ imamhi, esu imesu.
analyzed: assa imassa esam esānam imesam ima isānam asmai imasmai imamhā ehi ebhiḥ imehi imebhiḥ assa imassa esam esānam imesam ima isānam asmin imasmin imamhi esu imesu
translated: Imassa, esaṃ, esānaṃ, imesaṃ, imesānaṃ, asmā, imasmā, imamhā, ehi, ebhi, imehi, imebhi, assa, imassa, esaṃ, esānaṃ, imesaṃ, imesānaṃ, asmiṃ, imasmiṃ, imamhi, esu, imesu.

original: Itthiyaṃ imā si, ayamādesasilopā.
analyzed: itthiyam imā si ayam ādesa si lopā
translated: In the feminine: imā, si, ayamā. The words ādesas and silopa are not mentioned in the above verse.

original: Ayaṃ kaññā, imā imāyo, imaṃ, imā imāyo, imāya, imāhi imābhi. Catutthiyaṃ attaṃ, ikāra-

analyzed: ca assāya imissāya assāḥ imissāḥ imāya imāsam imāsānam sattamiyam assam
translated: and the forms of the locative case, assāya, imissāya, assā, imissā, imāya, imāyaṃ, imāsu, imāsaṃ, imāsānaṃ.🔽In the locative case the forms of the instrumental case are used, as in tesu vuddhilopā, etc.

analyzed: vā tesu vuddhi lopa ādinā smiṃvacanassa vā sa ādesaḥ imāyam imāsu sesam ñeyyam  napuṃsake ima si sa vibhattissa vā ati ca vattate  imassidamaṃsisu na puṃsake
translated: In the locative case the forms of the genitive case are used, as in imāyaṃ, imāsu, imāsaṃ, imāsānaṃ. The rest should be understood.🔽In the neuter the form of the locative is imasmiṃ.🔽In the locative case the forms of the genitive are used, as in imassidamaṃsisu na puṃsake.

original: Napuṃsake vattamānassa sabbasseva imasaddassa savibhattissa idaṃ hoti vā aṃ sisu paresu.

translated: . Amussāduṃ.

original: “Kissa ka ve cā”ti ito “kissa, ka”iti ca vattate.🔽226. Sesesu ca.🔽Kimiccetassa kasaddo ādeso hoti vappaccayato sesesu vibhattibhedesu. Ettha ca “kissa🔽ka ve cā”ti sutte casaddena vappaccayāvasiṭṭha thamādippaccayānaṃ gahitattā sesaggahaṇena
analyzed: kissa ka ve ca ati itas kissa ka eti ca vattate 🔽sesesu ca 🔽kim iti itassa ka saddaḥ ādesaḥ hoti va ppaccayataḥ sesesu vibhatti bhedesu ettha ca kissa 🔽ka ve ca ati sutte ca saddena va ppaccaya avasiṭṭha thama ādi ppaccayānam gahita ttā sesa ggahaṇena
translated: In the neuter, aduṃ is used for all the forms of amusaddha with a case-ending, in the other cases. Aduṃ pupphaṃ, amū amūni, aduṃ, amū amūni, amunā, etc. are the same as the masculine.

original: vibhattiyova gayhante. Caggahaṇaṃ katthaci nivattanatthaṃ, tena “kissa, kismi”ntiādi
analyzed: vibhattiyaḥ uva gayhante ca ggahaṇam katthaci nivattana attham tena kissa kismin tiādi
translated: The case-endings are given. The use of the particle “kissa” is to prevent the use of the particle “ka” in some instances. Thus “kissa, kismi” is correct.

original: ca sijjhati. “So”ti sissa o, saralopādi.
analyzed: ca sijjhati soti sissa o sara lopa ādi
translated: “So” is the nominative singular of the pronoun “so” (he). The elision of the vowel “a” and so on.

original: Ko eso, ke, kaṃ, ke, kena, kehi kebhi, kassa kissa, niggahītalopādi, kesaṃ kesānaṃ, kasmā kamhā, kehi kebhi, kassa kissa, kesaṃ kesānaṃ, kasmiṃ kismiṃ kamhi kimhi, kesu.
analyzed: kaḥ eso ke kam ke kena kehi kebhi kassa kissa niggahīta lopa ādi kesam kesānam kasmā kamhā kehi kebhi kassa kissa kesam kesānam kasmin kismin kamhi kimhi kesu
translated: “Ko eso” (who is this), “ke” (who), “kaṃ” (whom), “ke” (who), “kena” (by whom), “kehi” (by whom), “kehi” (by whom), “kassa” (whose), “kissa” (whose), the elision of the vowel “a” and so on, “kesaṃ” (of whom), “kesānaṃ” (of whom), “kasmā” (for whose sake), “kamhā” (from whom), “kehi” (by whom), “kehi” (by whom), “kassa” (whose), “kissa” (whose), “kesaṃ” (of whom), “kesānaṃ” (of whom), “kasmiṃ” (in whose), “kismiṃ” (in whose), “kamhi” (in whose), “kimhi” (in whose), “kesu” (in whose).

original: Itthiyaṃ “kiṃ si”itīdha “sesesu cā”ti vibhattiyaṃ parāyaṃ kādese kate “itthiyamato āppaccayo”ti majjhe āppaccayo, silopo.
analyzed: itthiyam kim si iti idha sesesu ca ati vibhattiyam parā ayam ka ādese kate itthiyam atas āp paccayaḥ iti majjhe āp paccayaḥ si lopo
translated: In the feminine, “kiṃ si” (what is she), here, when the case-ending is added after the elision of the vowel “a” and so on, the particle “ā” is added in the middle by the rule “itthiyamato āppaccayo” (the particle “ā” is added after this feminine word), the elision of the vowel “i”.

original: Kā esā kaññā, kā kāyo, kaṃ, kā kāyo iccādi sabbāsaddasamaṃ.
analyzed: kā esā kaññā kā kāyo kaṃ kā kāyo iccādi sabbā sadda samam
translated: “Kā esā” (who is this woman), “kā kāyo” (what is her body), “kaṃ” (whom), “kā kāyo” (what is her body) and so on, all are the same as the masculine.

original: Napuṃsake kiṃ si, lopavidhissa balavatarattā paṭhamaṃ silope kate puna vibhattiparattābhāvā, “tadanuparodhenā”ti paribhāsato vā kādesābhāvo. Kiṃ etaṃ, kāni.
analyzed: napuṃsake kim si lopa vidhissa paṭhamam s lope kate punar vibhatti para tta abhāvā tad an uparodhena ati paribhāsataḥ vā ka ādesa abhāvaḥ kim etam kāni
translated: In the neuter, “kiṃ si” (what is it), because of the greater strength of the elision of the vowel “i” in the rule, the elision of the vowel “i” is done first. Then, because of the absence of the case-ending, or because of the substitute-rule “tadanuparodhena” (without contradicting that), there is no elision of the vowel “a”. “Kiṃ etaṃ” (

original: Dutiyekavacane “kvaci lopa”nti niggahītalope kate “aṃmo niggahītaṃ jhalapehī”ti niggahītaṃ. Kiṃ, kāni iccādi pulliṅgasamaṃ.
analyzed: dutiya ekavacane kvaci niggahīta lope kate niggahītam jha l apehi iti niggahītam kim kāni iccādi pulliṅga samam
translated: In the dual and the singular, the “a” is elided by the rule “kvaci lopa” . When the elision has been made, the “a” is elided by the rule “niggahītaṃ jhalapehī” . What? How many? etc., are the same as the masculine.

original: Ekasaddo saṅkhyātulyāsahāyaññavacano. Yadā saṅkhyāvacano, tadā sabbatthekavacanantova, aññattha bahuvacanantopi. Eko, ekā, ekaṃ iccādi sabbattha sabbasaddasamaṃ. Saṃsāsveva viseso.
analyzed: eka saddo yadā saṅkhyā vacanaḥ tadā ekaḥ ekā ekam iccādi sabbattha sabba sadda samam viseso
translated: The word “one” is a synonym for “number” and for “companion.” When it is a synonym for “number,” then it is in the singular in all cases, but in the plural in other cases. One, one, one, etc., are the same as the word “all” in all cases. The difference is only in the case-endings.

original: Ubhasaddo dvisaddapariyāyo, sadā bahuvacanantova.🔽“Ubha yo” itīdha “tato yonamo tū”ti ettha tuggahaṇena kvaci yonamokāro. Ubho purisāubhe🔽vā, ubho purise ubhe. Su hisu “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā kvaci ekārassokāro. Ubhohi ubhobhi ubhehi ubhebhi.
analyzed: ubha saddaḥ dvi sadda pariyāyaḥ sadā bahuvacana ntaḥ uva  ubha iti idha tatas ettha tuk gahaṇena kvaci yonamaḥ kāraḥ ubho  vā ubho purise ubhe su hi su tesu vuddhi iti ādinā kvaci ekārassa okāraḥ ubhohi ubhobhi ubhehi ubhebhi
translated: The word “both” is a synonym for the word “two,” and it is always in the plural.🔽In the case of “ubha yo” , the “o” is elided by the rule “tato yonamo tū” . Both men, both women, both. But in the case of “tesu vuddhī” , the “a” is elided by the rule “kvaci ekārassokāro” . By both, by both of them, by both, by both of them.

original: 227. Ubhādito naminnaṃ.
analyzed: ubh ā t itaḥ nam it nam
translated: . The “na” of the case-endings is changed to “inna” after “ubha” and so on.

original: Ubhaiccevamādito naṃvacanassa innaṃ hoti.
analyzed: ubh ai c ca ivamāditaḥ naṃvacanassa innam hoti
translated: The “na” of the case-endings is changed to “inna” after “ubha” and so on.

original: Ubhinnaṃ, ubhohi ubhobhi ubhehi ubhebhi, ubhinnaṃ, ubhosu ubhesu.
analyzed: ubhinnam ubhohi ubhobhiḥ ubhehi ubhebhiḥ ubhinnam ubhosu ubhesu
translated: Of both, by both, by both of them, by both of them, of both, in both, in both of them.

original: Dviādayo saṅkhyāsaṅkhyeyyavacanā, bahūnaṃ vācitattā sadā bahuvacanantāva.
analyzed: dvi ādayaḥ saṅkhyā saṅkhyeyya vacanāḥ sadā
translated: The numerals two and so on are words for the countable; and because many are expressed, they always have the plural ending.

original: “Dvi yo”itīdha “savibhattissa, itthipumanapuṃsakasaṅkhya”nti ca adhikāro.
analyzed: dvi yaḥ iti idha sa vibhattissa itthi puma napuṃsaka saṅkhya nti ca adhikāraḥ
translated: In the case of dvi yo, the scope is “with case-ending, feminine, masculine, neuter, and numeral.”

original: 228. Yosu dvinnaṃ dve ca.
analyzed: yosu dvinnam dve ca
translated: In yosu, of two, two.

original: Dviiccetassa saṅkhyāsaddassa itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānassa savibhattissa dveiccādeso🔽hoti yosu paresu. Casaddena duve ca, kvaci duvi ca naṃmhi. Bahuvacanuccāraṇaṃ dvisaddato
analyzed: dvi iti ca itassa saṅkhyā saddassa itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānassa sa vibhattissa dvi iti ca ādesaḥ  hoti yosu paresu ca saddena duve ca kvaci duvi ca naṃmhi bahuvacana uccāraṇam dvi saddataḥ
translated: In the case of the numeral dvi, when it occurs with a case-ending in the feminine, masculine, or neuter, the substitution dve icc is made

original: bahuvacanameva hotīti ñāpanatthaṃ. Dve dhammā, dve itthiyo, dve rūpāni, duve vā,
analyzed: bahuvacanam eva hoti iti ñāpana ttham dve dhammāḥ dve itthiyaḥ dve rūpāni duve vā
translated: in yosu, and in the others duve icc. The word ca is to show that in some instances duvi icc is also used. In the nominative, dve dhammā, dve itthiyo, dve rūpāni; in the vocative, duve vā;

original: evaṃ dutiyāyampi, dvīhi dvībhi.
analyzed: evam dvīhi dvībhi
translated: in the same way, in the second case, dvīhi dvībhi.

original: Naṃmhi dīghe sampatte –
analyzed: naṃmhi dīghe sampatte
translated: When the long form is used,

original: 229. No ca dvādito naṃmhi.🔽Dviiccevamādito saṅkhyāto nakārāgamo hoti naṃmhi vibhattimhi. Casaddaggahaṇena itthiyaṃ
analyzed: na u ca dva ā t itaḥ naṃmhi  dvi i t ca ivamāditaḥ saṅkhyātaḥ nakāra āgamaḥ hoti naṃmhi vibhattimhi ca sadda ggahaṇena itthiyam
translated: No ca dvādito naṃmhi.

original: ti ca tusaddato ssañcāgamo naṃmhi vibhattimhi. Dvinnaṃ duvinnaṃ vā, dvīhi dvībhi,
analyzed: ti ca tu sad da taḥ s san ca āgamaḥ nam vibhattimhi dvinnam duvinnam vā dvīhi dvībhi
translated: In the case-ending naṃmhi, the substitution of the long form does not take place after dvi icc and so on. The word ca is to include itthiyā ti ca. And after tu, the substitution of ssañc takes place in the case-ending naṃmhi. Dvinnaṃ duvinnaṃ vā, dvīhi dvībhi,

original: dvinnaṃ duvinnaṃ, dvīsu.🔽Tisaddassa bhedo. “Ti yo”itīdha
analyzed: dvinnam duvinnam dvīsu  ti saddassa bhedaḥ ti yo iti idha
translated: of two, of two, in two.🔽The division of the three-fold

original: Yolope sampatte
analyzed: yaḥ lope sampatte
translated: Here, when the elision of ya is complete,

original: “Yosū”ti vattate.
analyzed: vattate
translated: “yosū” is said.

original: 230. Ti catunnaṃ tisso catasso tayocattārotīṇi cattāri.🔽Ti catunnaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: ti catunnam tissaḥ catassaḥ cattāri  ti catunnam saṅkhyānam itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānānam savibhattīnam yathākkamam
translated: . Of the four, three, four, three, four, three, four.🔽Of the four, three, four, three, four, three, four, these are the replacements of the feminine, masculine and neuter singulars in the nominative case, respectively,

original: tisso catasso tayo cattārotīṇi cattāriiccete ādesā honti yosu paresu. Tayo purisā,
analyzed: tissaḥ catassaḥ tayaḥ cattāro tīṇi cattāri iti ete ādesāḥ honti paresu tayo purisā
translated: when yosu is the other. Three men,

original: tayo purise passa, tīhi tībhi.
analyzed: tayo purise passa tīhi tībhi
translated: see three men, with three, with three.

original: “Na”miti vattate.🔽231. Iṇṇamiṇṇannaṃ tīhi saṅkhyāhi.🔽Tiiccetasmā saṅkhyāsaddā parassa naṃvacanassa iṇṇaṃ iṇṇannaṃiccete ādesā honti, saralopādi. Tiṇṇaṃ tiṇṇannaṃ, tīhi tībhi, tiṇṇaṃ tiṇṇannaṃ, tīsu.
analyzed: nam iti vattate  tīhi saṅkhyāhi  saṅkhyā saddā parassa naṃ vacanassa iṇ ṇam iti ete ādesāḥ honti sara lopa ādi tiṇṇam tiṇ nannam tīhi tībhi tiṇṇam tiṇ nannam tīsu
translated: “Na” is said.🔽. Of the three, of the three, with three, with three.🔽“Ti” is said. Therefore, of the three, of the three, with three, with three, these are the replacements of the nominative case ending naṃ, with the elision of the sa of the three, etc., the elision of the sa, etc. Of the three, of the three, in three.

original: Itthiyaṃ tisso itthiyo, tisso, tīhi tībhi, naṃmhi ssañcāgamo, tissannaṃ, ssaṃbyavadhānato iṇṇābhāvo, sesaṃ samaṃ.
analyzed: itthiyam tissaḥ itthiyaḥ tissaḥ tīhi tībhi namhi ssañca āgamaḥ ssaṃ byavadhānataḥ iṇ na abhāvaḥ sesam samam
translated: In the feminine, three women, three, with three, with three, in the nominative case, the addition of ssa is elided by the rule of avadhāna, the absence of iṇṇa, the rest is the same.

original: Napuṃsake tīṇi, tīṇi. Sesaṃ pulliṅgasamaṃ.
analyzed: napuṃsake tīṇi tīṇi sesam put liṅga samam
translated: In the neuter, three, three. The rest is the same as the masculine.

original: Tathā catusaddassapi yosu “ticatunna”ntiādinā yathāvuttādeso, “tato yonamo tū”ti🔽ettha tusaddena kvaci okāro ca. Cattāro caturo vā, cattāro caturo, catūhi catūbhi🔽catubbhi, catunnaṃ, nakārāgamo. Catūhi catūbhi catubbhi, catunnaṃ, catūsu.🔽Itthiyaṃ catasso, catasso, naṃmhi ssañcāgamo, “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā caturukārassa akāro. Catassannaṃ. Sesaṃ samaṃ.🔽Napuṃsake cattāri, cattāri. Sesaṃ pulliṅgasamaṃ.🔽Tathā –🔽Nīlādiguṇanāmañca, bahubbīhi ca taddhitaṃ;🔽Sāmaññavutyatītādi-kitantaṃ vāccaliṅgikaṃ.🔽Etthedaṃ vuccate –🔽Ese’so etamiti ca,🔽Pasiddhi atthesu yesu lokassa;🔽Thīpunnapuṃsakāniti,
analyzed: tathā catu saddassa api yosu ti catunna nti ādinā yathā vutta ādesaḥ tatas yo namaḥ tu iti  ettha tu saddena kvaci okāraḥ ca cattāraḥ caturaḥ vā cattāraḥ caturaḥ catūhi catūbhi  catūhi catunnam nakāra āgamaḥ catūhi catūbhi catubbhi catunnam catūsu  itthiyam catasso catasso nam mhi ssan ca āgamaḥ tesu vuddhi iti ādinā catur ukārassa akāraḥ sesam samam  napuṃsake cattāri cattāri sesam pulliṅga samam  tathā  ca taddhitam  sāmañña vuti atīta ādi kit antam vāccaliṅgikam  etthā idam vuccate  esa esaḥ etam iti ca  pasiddhi atthesu yesu lokassa  thī put napuṃsakān iti
translated: Likewise, in the case of the four feminine nouns, the place of the feminine is shown by the words “three, four” in the above verse.🔽And in the case of the words “from that, a womb,” the two words “that” and “a womb” are shown by the two words “from” and “tu.”🔽Four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four

original: Vuccante tāni nāmāni.🔽Tiliṅgaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.🔽Aliṅganāma
analyzed: vuccante tāni nāmāni  tiliṅgam niṭṭhitam  aliṅga nāma
translated: So too, in the case of the fourfold feminine, the place is as stated thus: “Three, four, etc.,” and the fourfold neuter, the place is as stated thus: “Three, four, etc.,” and the fourfold common, the place is as stated thus: “Three, four, etc.”

original: Athāliṅgesu nāmesu tumhamhasaddā vuccante.
analyzed: atha a liṅgesu nāmesu tumha mha saddāḥ vuccante
translated: And in the case of the fourfold masculine, the place is as stated thus: “Four, four, etc.”🔽Four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four, four,

original: Tesaṃ panāliṅgattā tīsu liṅgesu samānarūpaṃ. “Tumhamha”iti ṭhite syādyuppatti.
analyzed: tesam tīsu liṅgesu samāna rūpam tumhamha eti ṭhite
translated: And because of their being linked, they are similar in the three genders. When “you” is established, the notion “we” arises.

original: “Savibhattīnaṃ, tumhamhāka”nti adhikāro.
analyzed: sa vibhattīnam tumha mhākam ti adhikāraḥ
translated: The function is “of you who are divided, we who are divided.”

original: 232. Tvamahaṃ simhi ca.
analyzed: tvam aham simhi ca
translated: Tvaṃ, ahaṃ, simhi, ca.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumhaamhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ tvaṃahaṃiccete ādesā honti simhi🔽vibhattimhi. Casaddena tumhassa tuvañca hoti. Tvaṃ pumā, tvaṃ itthī, tvaṃ napuṃsakaṃ,
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yathākkamam tvam aham iti ca ite ādesāḥ honti simhi  vibhattimhi ca saddena tumhassa tuvam ca hoti tvam pumā tvam itthī tvam napuṃsakam
translated: In the case of all the words tumha, amha, which are divided, the enclitics tvaṃ, ahaṃ are respectively the designators in the case of the case-ending simhi.🔽And by the word ca, tuvaṃ and tuvaṃ are respectively the designators in the case of the case-ending tumhassā. You are a man, you are a woman, you are a eunuch,

original: tuvaṃ satthā vā. Ahaṃ pumā, ahaṃ itthī, ahaṃ napuṃsakaṃ.
analyzed: tuvam satthā vā aham pumā aham itthī aham napuṃsakam
translated: you are a teacher. I am a man, I am a woman, I am a eunuch.

original: Bahuvacane “sabbanāmakārate paṭhamo”ti ekāro. Tumhe tiṭṭhatha, bhiyyo amhe mahemase.
analyzed: bahuvacane paṭhamaḥ ti ekāraḥ tumhe tiṭṭhatha bhiyyas amhe mahemase
translated: In the plural, “The first is in the case of all names” , so there is elision of the first vowel. You stand, more than we, we are great.

original: “Amhassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: amhassa iti vattate
translated: “Of us” is said.

original: 233. Mayaṃ yomhi paṭhame.
analyzed: mayam yomhi paṭhame
translated: Mayaṃ, yomhi, paṭhame.

original: Sabbassa amhasaddassa savibhattissa mayaṃādeso hoti yomhi paṭhame. Mayaṃ gacchāma.
analyzed: sabbassa amha saddassa sa vibhattissa mayam ādesaḥ hoti yaḥ umhi paṭhame mayam gacchāma
translated: In the case of all the words amha, which are divided, the designator mayaṃ is the first. We go.

original: Ettha ca ekasmimpi gāravabahumānena bahuttasamāropā bahuvacanaṃ hoti.
analyzed: ettha ca gārava bahu mānena bahutta samāropāḥ bahuvacanam
translated: And here, in the case of one, too, the plural is used by superimposition of plurality out of respect and esteem.

original: “Aṃmhī”ti vattate.
analyzed: aṃmhi iti vattate
translated: “Of us” is said.

original: 234. Tavaṃ mamañca navā.
analyzed: tavam mamañca navā
translated: Tavaṃ, mamañca, navā.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tavaṃ mamaṃiccete ādesā honti navā yathākkamaṃ aṃmhi vibhattimhi. Tavaṃ, mamaṃ passa.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tavam mamam icca ete ādesāḥ honti navāḥ yathākkamam am mhi vibhattimhi tavam mamam passa
translated: The forms of the words tavaṃ and mamaṃ are the new adjectival forms of the words tumha and amha respectively.

original: 235. Taṃ mamaṃmhi.
analyzed: tam mamaṃmhi
translated: . Taṃ mamaṃmhi.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ taṃ maṃiccete ādesā honti yathākkamaṃ aṃmhi vibhattimhi. Taṃ, maṃ.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tam mam iti ete ādesāḥ honti yathākkamam am mhi vibhattimhi tam mam
translated: The forms of the words taṃ and maṃ are the new adjectival forms of the words tumha and amha respectively.

original: 236. Tumhassa tuvaṃ tvamaṃmhi.🔽Sabbassa tumhasaddassa savibhattissa tuvaṃtvaṃiccete ādesā honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi. Tuvaṃ tvaṃ.
analyzed: tumhassa tuvam  sabbassa tumha saddassa sa vibhattissa tuvam tvam iti ca ete ādesāḥ honti am mhi vibhattimhi tuvam tvam
translated: . Tumhassa tuvaṃ tvamaṃmhi.🔽The forms of the words tuvaṃ and tvaṃ are the new adjectival forms of the word tumha.

original: Bahuvacane “tumhamhehi, āka”nti ca vattate.
analyzed: bahuvacane tumha mhehi ākanti ca vattate
translated: In the plural, the forms tumhamhehi, āka are used.

original: 237. Vā yvappaṭhamo.
analyzed: vā y v ap paṭhamaḥ
translated: . Vā yvappaṭhamo.

original: Tumhamhehi paro appaṭhamo yo ākaṃ hoti vā. Tumhākaṃ passāmi, tumhe passāmi, amhākaṃ passasi, amhe passasi.
analyzed: tumha mhehi paraḥ appaṭhamaḥ yaḥ hoti vā tumhākam passāmi tumhe passāmi amhākam passasi amhe passasi
translated: The form āka is used after the words tumhamhehi, when the following word is not the first word in a sentence.

original: 238. Nāmhi tayā mayā.
analyzed: tayā mayā
translated: . Nāmhi tayā mayā.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayā mayāiccete ādesā honti yathākkamaṃ nāmhi vibhattimhi.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tayā mayā i c ca ite ādesāḥ honti yathākkamam nāmhi vibhattimhi
translated: The forms of the words tayā and mayā are the new adjectival forms of the words tumha and amha respectively.

original: 239. Tayātayīnaṃ takāro tvattaṃ vā.
analyzed: tayātayīnam takāraḥ tvattam vā
translated: The letter ta is added to tayā, etc., or it is made to take the form of the tva.

original: Tayā tayiiccetesaṃ takāro tvattamāpajjate vā. Tvayā tayā, mayā, tumhehi tumhebhi, amhehi amhebhi.🔽“Sasmiṃ, vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: tayā tayi icca itesam takāraḥ tvattam āpajjate vā tvayā tayā mayā tumhehi tumhebhi amhehi amhebhi  sasmin vāti vattate
translated: The letter ta is added to these, tayā, etc., or it is made to take the form of the tva. By you, by her, by me, by you all, by you, by us all.🔽The letter sa is added to the case-endings.

original: 240. Sassaṃ.
analyzed: sassam
translated: The letter sa is added to the case-endings.

original: Tumhamhehi sassa vibhattissa amādeso hoti vā. Tumhaṃ, amhaṃ dīyate.
analyzed: tumha mhehi sassa vibhattissa am ādesaḥ hoti vā tumham amham dīyate
translated: The letter am is substituted for the case-ending sa, or not. It is given to you, to us.

original: 241. Tava mama se.
analyzed: tava mama se
translated: The letters se and se are added to tava and mama.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ tavamamaiccete ādesā honti se vibhattimhi, vikappenāyaṃ vijjhantarassa vijjamānattā.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yathākkamam tava mama ai c ca ete ādesāḥ honti se vibhattimhi vikappena ayam vijjhantarassa vijjamāna ttā
translated: The letters se and se are added to all the case-endings of the words tumha and amha, in that order, when the case-ending is se. This substitution is called vikappana, because it is done in order to avoid the occurrence of the letter jh.

original: “Se”ti vattate.🔽242. Tuyhaṃ mayhañca.
analyzed: sā iti vattate  tuyham mayham ca
translated: The letter se is added.🔽The letters tuyhaṃ and mayhaṃ are added to all the case-endings of the words tumha and amha.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ yathākkamaṃ tuyhaṃmayhaṃiccete ādesā ca honti se vibhattimhi. Tava, mama tuyhaṃ, mayhaṃ vā dīyate.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam yathākkamam tuyham mayham iti ete ādesā ca honti se vibhattimhi tava mama tuyham mayham vā dīyate
translated: The letters tuyhaṃ and mayhaṃ are added to all the case-endings of the words tumha and amha, in that order, when the case-ending is se. It is given to you, to me, to you, to me.

original: 243. Amhassa mamaṃ savibhattissa se.
analyzed: amhassa mamam sa vibhattissa se
translated: The letter ma is added to the case-ending se of the word amha.

original: Sabbasseva amhasaddassa savibhattissa mamaṃādeso hoti se vibhattimhi. Mamaṃ dīyate.
analyzed: sabbassa iva amha saddassa sa vibhattissa mamaṃ ādesaḥ hoti se vibhattimhi mamam dīyate
translated: The letter ma is added to the case-ending se of the word amha. It is given to me.

original: “Sassa”nti ito sīhagatiyā “a”miti vattate.
analyzed: sassanti i taḥ sīha gatiyāḥ am iti vattate
translated: “Sassa” means “from this” and “a” is added.

original: 244. Tumhamhehi namākaṃ.
analyzed: tumhamhehi namākam
translated: . Tumhamhehi namākaṃ.

original: Tumhamhehi parassa naṃvacanassa ākamiccādeso hoti, añca. “Tesu vuddhī”tiādinā amhassa kvaci asmādeso. Tumhaṃ tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ amhākaṃ asmākaṃ vā.
analyzed: tumha mhehi parassa naṃvacanassa ā kam iti ādesaḥ hoti tesu vuddhi iti ādinā amhassa kvaci asma ādesaḥ tumham tumhākam amham amhākam asmākam vā
translated: Tumhamhehi parassa naṃvacanassa ākamiccādeso hoti, añca. “Tesu vuddhī”tiādinā amhassa kvaci asmādeso. Tumhaṃ tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ amhākaṃ asmākaṃ vā.

original: Pañcamiyaṃ “amhatumhanturāja”iccādinā smāvacanassa nābhāvātideso. Tayā, mayā apeti,
analyzed: pañcamiyam tayā mayā apa iti
translated: Pañcamiyaṃ “amhatumhanturāja”iccādinā smāvacanassa nābhāvātideso. Tayā, mayā apeti,

original: tumhehi, amhehi tumhebhi amhebhi, tumhaṃ amhaṃ tava mama, tuyhaṃ, mayhaṃ mamaṃ pariggaho,
analyzed: tumhehi amhehi tumhebhi amhebhi tumham amham tava mama tuyham mayham mamam pariggahaḥ
translated: tumhehi, amhehi tumhebhi amhebhi, tumhaṃ amhaṃ tava mama, tuyhaṃ, mayhaṃ mamaṃ pariggaho,

original: tumhaṃ tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ amhākaṃ asmākaṃ dhammatā.
analyzed: tumham tumhākam amham amhākam asmākam dhamma tā
translated: tumhaṃ tumhākaṃ, amhaṃ amhākaṃ asmākaṃ dhammatā.

original: “Smiṃmhī”ti vattate.
analyzed: smin mhi iti vattate
translated: “Smiṃmhī”ti vattate.

original: 245. Tumhamhākaṃ tayi mayi.
analyzed: tumhamhākam tayi mayi
translated: . Tumhamhākaṃ tayi mayi.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayi mayiiccete ādesā honti yathākkamaṃ smiṃmhi vibhattimhi. Takārassa tvattaṃ. Tvayi tayi mayi, tumhesu amhesu.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam tayi mayi iti ca ete ādesāḥ honti yathākkamam smin mhi vibhattimhi takārassa tvattam tvayi tayi mayi tumhesu amhesu
translated: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ tayi mayiiccete ādesā honti yathākkamaṃ smiṃmhi vibhattimhi. Takārassa tvattaṃ. Tvayi tayi mayi, tumhesu amhesu.

original: Tesaṃ eva tumha amhasaddānaṃ padato paresaṃ kvaci ādesantaravidhāne rūpabhedo.
analyzed: tesam eva tumha amha saddānam padatas paresam kvaci ādesa antara vidhāne rūpa bhedaḥ
translated: The difference in form of these words “tumhākaṃ”, “amhākaṃ” is due to the substitution of other vowel sounds in certain cases.

original: “Navā”ti adhikāro.🔽246. Padato dutiyācatutthīchaṭṭhīsu vo no.🔽Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ padasmā paresaṃ vo noādesā honti yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: navāti adhikāraḥ  padataḥ dutiyā catutthī chaṭṭhīsu vaḥ naḥ  sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam padasma paresam vaḥ no ādesāḥ honti yathākkamam
translated: The scope of the rule is “navā”.🔽The words “vo no” are substituted for the words “tumhākaṃ”, “amhākaṃ” in the second, fourth and sixth cases.🔽The words “vo no” are substituted for the words “tumhākaṃ”, “amhākaṃ” in the second, fourth and sixth cases, in the plural, and in the nine cases.

original: dutiyācatutthīchaṭṭhīsu bahuvacanesu navā. Ettha ca “ekavacanesū”ti vakkhamānattā🔽“bahuvacanesū”ti laddhaṃ. Pahāya vo gamissāmi, mā no ajja vikantiṃsu, dhammaṃ vo
analyzed: dutiyā catutthī chaṭṭhīsu bahuvacanesu navāḥ ettha ca ekavacanesu iti vakkhamānattā  bahuvacanesu iti laddham pahāya vaḥ gamissāmi mā naḥ ajja vikantiṃsu dhammam vaḥ
translated: Here, since it will be said “in the singular”,🔽it is understood that “in the plural” is meant.

original: bhikkhave desissāmi, saṃvibhajetha no rajjena, tuṭṭhosmi vo pakatiyā, satthā no bhagavā anuppatto.
analyzed: bhikkhave desissāmi saṃvibhajetha naḥ rajjena tuṭṭhaḥ asmi vaḥ pakatiyā satthā naḥ bhagavā an uppattaḥ
translated: “Pahāya vo gamissāmi, mā no ajja vikantiṃsu, dhammaṃ vo bhikkhave desissāmi, saṃvibhajetha no rajjena, tuṭṭhosmi vo pakatiyā, satthā no bhagavā anuppatto.”

original: Navāti kiṃ? Bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā, eso amhākaṃ satthā.
analyzed: kim bhayam tumhāka no siyā eso amhākam satthā
translated: “Navā” is not used in the following: “Bhayaṃ tumhāka no siyā, eso amhākaṃ satthā.”

original: “Padato, catutthīchaṭṭhīsū”ti vattate.
analyzed: padataḥ catutthī chaṭṭhīsu iti vattate
translated: The words “padato, catutthīchaṭṭhīsū” are used.

original: 247. Temekavacanesu ca.
analyzed: tema ekavacanesu ca
translated: . And in the singular.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ padasmā paresaṃ te meādesā honti yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam padasma paresam te me ādesāḥ honti yathākkamam
translated: The words “te me” are substituted for the words “tumhākaṃ”, “amhākaṃ” in the singular, in the nine cases.🔽. And in the singular.

original: catutthīchaṭṭhīsu ekavacanesu navā. Dadāmi te gāmavarāni pañca, dadāhi me gāmavaraṃ,
analyzed: catutthī chaṭṭhīsu ekavacanesu navā dadāmi te gām avarāni pañca dadāhi me gām avaram
translated: I give you five choice villages, Give me a choice village,

original: idaṃ te raṭṭhaṃ, ayaṃ me putto.
analyzed: idam te raṭṭham ayam me putto
translated: This is your kingdom, this is my son.

original: Navāti kiṃ? Idaṃ cīvaraṃ tuyhaṃ vikappanatthāya dammi, suṇātha vacanaṃ mama.
analyzed: idam cīvaram tuyham vikappana tthāya dammi suṇātha vacanam mama
translated: What is the nine? I give this robe-material to you for the purpose of making a robe, Listen to my words.

original: Navādhikārato cettha,
analyzed: nava adhikārataḥ ca ittha
translated: Herein, the nine is by the method of the nine.

original: Vo no te meti ye ime;
analyzed: vaḥ naḥ te mā iti ye ime
translated: And vo no te me are these;

original: Pādādo ca ca vā evā-
analyzed: ca ca vai evā
translated: And pādādo ca ca vā evā-

original: Diyoge ca na honti te.
analyzed: di yoge ca na honti te
translated: And diyoge ca are not.

original: Yathā –
analyzed: yathā
translated: As follows:

original: Na socāmi na rodāmi, tava sutvāna māṇava;
analyzed: na socāmi na rodāmi tava sutvāna māṇava
translated: I do not grieve, I do not weep, having heard your words, young man;

original: Tuyhañcāpi mahārāja, mayhañca raṭṭhavaḍḍhana.
analyzed: tuyhan ca api mahā rāja mayhan ca raṭṭhavaḍḍhana
translated: And to you, great king, and to me, too, kingdom-enlarger.

original: Evamidaṃ dīghamaddhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañceva tumhākañcāti.
analyzed: evam idam dīgham addhānam sandhāvitam saṃsaritam mamañca iva tumhākam ca ati
translated: Thus this long course has been run and gone through by you and me.

original: Padatoti kiṃ? Tava ñāti, mama ñāti.
analyzed: kim tava ñāti mama ñāti
translated: What is by the word? Your kinsman, my kinsman.

original: “Te me”ti vattate.
analyzed: te mā iti vattate
translated: “Te me” is said.

original: 248. Na aṃmhi.
analyzed: na am mhi
translated: I am not.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ padasmā paresaṃ te meādesā na honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi. Passeyya taṃ vassasataṃ ārogyaṃ. So mamabravīti.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam sa vibhattīnam padasmā paresam te me ādesāḥ na honti aṃmhi vibhattimhi passeyya tam vassa satam ārogyam saḥ mama bravīti
translated: After all the amha words with case-endings, the te me forms are not after the words, I am not in the sixth case-ending. You might see him a hundred years hence in health. He said to me.

original: “Temekavacane”ti vattate.
analyzed: tem eka vacanā iti vattate
translated: “In the singular” is said.

original: 249. Vā tatiye ca.
analyzed: vā tatiye ca
translated: And in the third case.

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ padasmā paresaṃ te me ādesā honti vā yathākkamaṃ
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam padasma paresam te me ādesāḥ honti vā yathākkamam
translated: After all the words tumha, amha, and the vibhattis, the forms te, me, are substituted for the other forms, as appropriate,

original: tatiyekavacane pare. Kataṃ te pāpaṃ, kataṃ tayā pāpaṃ, kataṃ me puññaṃ, kataṃ mayā puññaṃ.
analyzed: tatiyā ekavacane pare katam te pāpam katam tayā pāpam katam me puññam katam mayā puññam
translated: in the third singular. Kataṃ te pāpaṃ, kataṃ tayā pāpaṃ, kataṃ me puññaṃ, kataṃ mayā puññaṃ.

original: “Vā, tatiye”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: vā tatiyā iti ca vattate
translated: And the words “and in the third case” are repeated.

original: 250. Bahuvacanesu vo no.
analyzed: bahuvacanesu vaḥ naḥ
translated: In the plural, vo, no.🔽After all the words tumha, amha, and the vibhattis, the forms vo, no, are substituted for the other forms, as appropriate,

original: Sabbesaṃ tumha amhasaddānaṃ savibhattīnaṃ padasmā paresaṃ vo noādesā honti vā yathākkamaṃ tatiyābahuvacane pare. Kataṃ vo kammaṃ, kataṃ no kammaṃ.
analyzed: sabbesam tumha amha saddānam savibhattīnam padasma paresam vaḥ no ādesāḥ honti vā yathākkamam tatiyā bahuvacane pare katam vaḥ kammam katam no kammam
translated: in the third plural. Kataṃ vo kammaṃ, kataṃ no kammaṃ.

original: Bahuvacananiddesena kvaci yomhi paṭhame ca vo no honti. Gāmaṃ vo gaccheyyātha, gāmaṃ no gaccheyyāma.
analyzed: bahuvacana niddesena kvaci paṭhame ca vaḥ no honti gāmam vaḥ gaccheyyātha gāmam no gaccheyyāma
translated: By the rule for the plural, in some instances yo, and in the first case vo, no, are substituted. Gāmaṃ vo gaccheyyātha, gāmaṃ no gaccheyyāma.

original: Tathā pañcādīnamaṭṭhārasantānaṃ, katisaddassa cāliṅgattā tiliṅgepi samānarūpaṃ, aliṅgattā eva pañcādito itthippaccayābhāvo.
analyzed: tathā pañca ādīnam aṭṭhāra santānam kati saddassa ca aliṅga ttā ti liṅge pi samāna rūpam aliṅga ttā eva pañca āditaḥ itthi paccaya abhāvaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the series of five and so on up to eighteen, the word katih is inflected, and so the form is the same in all genders. Because it is not inflected, there is no feminine form in the series of five and so on.

original: “Pañca yo”itīdha –
analyzed: pañca
translated: Here, in the word pañca yo,

original: “Yosu dvinnaṃ dve cā”ti ito “yosū”ti vattate, “itthipumanapuṃsakasaṅkhya”nti ca.
analyzed: dvinnam dve ca ati itas vattate itthi puma napuṃsaka saṅkhyanti ca
translated: “Yosu dvinnaṃ dve cā” means “yosu” and “itthipumanapuṃsakasaṅkhya”.

original: 251. Pañcādīnamakāro.
analyzed: pañca ādīn amakāraḥ
translated: The syllable a of the numbers five and so on.

original: Antāpekkhāyaṃ chaṭṭhī, pañcādīnaṃ aṭṭhārasantānaṃ saṅkhyānaṃ itthipumanapuṃsake vattamānānamantassa🔽savibhattissa akāro hoti yosu paresu. Ā eādesāpavādoyaṃ, pañcakkhandhā, pañca gatiyo,
analyzed: anta apekkhāyam chaṭṭhī pañca ādīnam aṭṭhārasa antānam saṅkhyānam itthi puma napuṃsake vattamānānam antassa  sa vibhattissa akāraḥ hoti yosu paresu ā e ādesa apavādaḥ yam pañca kkhandhāḥ pañca gatiyaḥ
translated: The sixth case ending is looked for, the syllable a of the numbers from five to eighteen, which are in the feminine, masculine and neuter genders,🔽is added to the sixth case ending with a case-ending, in yosu and in other words. This is a prohibition of the vowel a of the vowel ā and so on. The five aggregates, the five destinations,

original: pañca indriyāni. Evaṃ dutiyāyañca.
analyzed: pañca indriyāni evam
translated: the five faculties. So too with the second.

original: “Sunaṃhisū”ti vattate.
analyzed: su naṃhi sūti vattate
translated: “Sunaṃhisū” means “sunaṃhi”.

original: 252. Pañcādīnamattaṃ.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam attam
translated: . The syllable a of the numbers five and so on.

original: Pañcādīnamaṭṭhārasantānaṃ saṅkhyānamanto attamāpajjate su naṃ hiiccetesu paresu.
analyzed: pañca ādīnam aṭṭhāra santānam saṅkhyānam antaḥ attam āpajjate su nam hi it ca etesu paresu
translated: The syllable a of the numbers from five to eighteen, which are in the feminine, masculine and neuter genders, is added to the sixth case ending with a case-ending, in sunaṃhi and in other words.

original: Ettadīghāpavādoyaṃ. Pañcahi pañcabhi, pañcannaṃ, pañcahi pañcabhi, pañcannaṃ, pañcasu.
analyzed: ettad īgha apavādaḥ uyam pañcahi pañcabhi pañcannam pañcahi pañcabhi pañcannam pañcasu
translated: This is a prohibition of the long vowel. With five, with five, of five, with five, with five, of five, in five.

original: Evaṃ cha sa tta aṭṭhanava dasasaddā.
analyzed: evam cha sa tta aṭṭha nava dasa saddā
translated: So too with the words six, seven, eight, nine, ten.

original: “Ekañca dasa cā”ti atthe dvandasamāse, “ekena adhikā dasā”ti atthe tappurise vā kate
analyzed: ekañca dasa ca ati atthe dvanda samāse ekena adhikāḥ dasa ati atthe tappurise vā kate
translated: “Ekañca dasa cā” means “in a compound of two words, one and ten”, or “in a compound of two words, ten more than one”,

original: “Saṅkhyāne”ti vattate.
analyzed: saṅkhyāna iti vattate
translated: “Saṅkhyāne” means “in a number”.🔽.

original: 253. Dvekaṭṭhānamākāro vā.
analyzed: dvekaṭṭhānam ākāraḥ vā
translated: The form of the two and the eight is either.

original: Dviekaaṭṭhaiccetesamanto ākāro hoti vā saṅkhyāne uttarapade pare. Vavatthitavibhāsāyaṃ. Ekādasa, dvādasa, aṭṭhārasa.
analyzed: ākāraḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne uttara pade pare ekādasa dvādasa aṭṭhārasa
translated: The form of the two and the eight is either at the end of a numeral when a following word begins with a vowel. In the analysis of the definition. Eleven, twelve, eighteen.

original: Saṅkhyāneti kimatthaṃ? Ekadanto, dvidanto, aṭṭhatthambho.
analyzed: saṅkhyānā iti kimattham eka dantaḥ dvi dantaḥ aṭṭhatthambhaḥ
translated: What is the purpose of the word “numeral”? One-tusked, two-tusked, eight-pillared.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.🔽254. Ekādito dassa ra saṅkhyāne.
analyzed: vāti vattate  eka āditaḥ dassa ra saṅkhyāne
translated: The word “either” is repeated.🔽The form of the ten is either at the end of a numeral.

original: Ekādito saṅkhyāto parassa dasassa ādissa dassa rakāro hoti vā saṅkhyāne. Sesaṃ samaṃ. Ekārasa, ekādasa.
analyzed: eka ādeḥ saṅkhyātaḥ parassa dasassa ādissa dassa rakāraḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne sesam samam ekārase ekādasa
translated: The form of the ten is either at the end of a numeral when a following word begins with a vowel. The rest is the same. Ten-one, ten-eleven.

original: Dve ca dasa ca, dvīhi vā adhikā dasāti dvidasa itīdha –
analyzed: dve ca ca dvīhi vai adhikā dasāti dvidasaḥ iti idha
translated: Two and ten, or ten with two added, are twelve. Here

original: “Vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: vāti vattate
translated: the word “either” is repeated.

original: 255. Vīsatidasesu bā dvissa tu.
analyzed: vīsatidasesu bā dvis sa tu
translated: The form of the twenty and the ten is either, but the two is ba.

original: Vīsati dasaiccetesu paresu dvisaddassa bā hoti vā. Tusaddena tiṃsāyampi. Rakāro, āttañca. Bārasa, dvādasa.
analyzed: vīsati dasa e c ca itesu paresu dvi saddassa bā hoti vā tu saddena rakāraḥ ā t tañca bārasa dvādasa
translated: The form of the twenty and the ten is either at the end of a following word when that word begins with the syllable tu. The form of the thirty is also so. The form of the ten is ra, and the form of the two is ba. Twelve, twelve.

original: Tayo ca dasa ca, tīhi vā adhikā dasāti terasa. Ettha “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā tisaddassa teādeso ānavutiyā.
analyzed: tayaḥ ca dasa ca tīhi vā adhikāḥ dasa ati terasaḥ ettha tesu vuddhi iti ādinā ti saddassa te ādesaḥ ānavutiyā
translated: Three and ten, or ten with three added, are thirteen. Here, by the rule “In these, the augment is added,” the form of the three is te, up to ninety.

original: Cattāro ca dasa ca, catūhi vā adhikā dasāti catuddasa iccatra –
analyzed: cattāraḥ ca dasa ca catūhi vā adhikāḥ dasā ati catuddasaḥ id catra
translated: And four and ten, or four plus ten, are fourteen.

original: “Gaṇane, dasassā”ti ca vattate.🔽256. Catūpapadassa lopo tuttarapadādi cassa cu copi navā.🔽Gaṇane dasassādimhi ṭhitassa catuiccetassa upapadassa tusaddo lopo hoti, uttarapadādimhi ṭhitassa catūpapadassa cakārassa cu coādesā honti navā. Cuddasa, coddasa, catuddasa.
analyzed: gaṇane dasassa ati ca vattate  catu upapadassa lopaḥ tu tara pada ādi cassa cu ca o pi navā  gaṇane dasassa ādimhi ṭhitassa upapadassa tu saddaḥ lopaḥ hoti uttara pada ādimhi ṭhitassa catu upapadassa cakārassa cu ca ādesāḥ honti navā cuddasa coddasa catuddasa
translated: The word “in the reckoning” is understood.🔽The word “four” is elided in the reckoning when it precedes “ten,” and the word “four” is elided and the word “four” is changed to “fourteen” when it precedes another word.🔽The word “four” is elided in the reckoning when it precedes “ten” and another word, and the word “four” is elided and the word “four” is changed to “fourteen.”

original: Apiggahaṇena anupapadassāpi gaṇane padādicakārassa lopo, cu co honti navā. Yathā – tālīsaṃ, cuttālīsaṃ, cottālīsaṃ, cattālīsaṃ.
analyzed: api ggahaṇena anupapadassa api gaṇane pada ādi cakārassa lopaḥ cu caḥ honti navā yathā tālīsam cuttālīsam cottālīsam cattālīsam
translated: The word “four” is elided in the reckoning when it precedes “ten” and another word, and the word “four” is elided and the word “four” is changed to “fourteen.”🔽Five and ten, or five plus ten, are fifteen.

original: Pañca ca dasa ca, pañcahi vā adhikā dasāti atthe pañcadasa. “Tesu vuddhī”tiādinā pañcasaddassa dasa vīsatīsu kvaci pannapaṇṇaādesā. Pannarasa, paṇṇarasa.
analyzed: pañca ca dasa ca pañcahi vā adhikāḥ dasa ati atthe pañcadasa tesu vuddhi iti ādinā pañca saddassa dasa vīsatīsu kvaci panna paṇṇa ādesā pannarasa paṇṇarasa
translated: The word “five” is changed to “fifteen” in the reckoning when it precedes “ten” and another word.🔽Six and ten, or six plus ten, are sixteen.

original: Cha ca dasa ca, chahi vā adhikā dasāti atthe chadasa itīdha –🔽“Chassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: cha ca dasa ca vā adhikā dasa ati atthe cha dasa iti idha 🔽chassa ati vattate
translated: The word “six” is elided in the reckoning when it precedes “ten” and another word.

original: 257. Dase so niccañca.
analyzed: dase saḥ nit can ca
translated: 257. Dase so niccañca.

original: Chaiccetassa saṅkhyāsaddassa niccaṃ so hoti dase pare.
analyzed: cha e c ca itassa saṅkhyā saddassa niccam saḥ hoti dase pare
translated: The word so is always so in the case of the numeral cha, and it is so in the case of the other numerals when they are ten.

original: “Saṅkhyānaṃ, vā”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: saṅkhyānam vāti ca vattate
translated: “Saṅkhyānaṃ, vā” is said.

original: 258. La darānaṃ.
analyzed: la darānam
translated: . La darānaṃ.

original: Saṅkhyānaṃ dakārarakārānaṃ lakārādeso hoti vā.
analyzed: saṅkhyānam lakāra ādesaḥ vā
translated: The letter la is substituted for the letters da and ra of the numerals, or not.

original: Laḷānamaviseso. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, tena “soḷasa” iti niccaṃ, “teḷasa, terasa, cattālīsaṃ, cattārīsa”miti vibhāsā, dasa pannarasādīsu na ca hoti.
analyzed: laḷānam avisesaḥ vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddo tena soḷasaḥ iti niccam teḷasa terasa cattālīsam cattārīsam iti vibhāsāḥ dasa pannarasa ādīsu na ca hoti
translated: There is no distinction in the case of la. The word vā is for the purpose of the definition of the particular. Therefore soḷasa is always so, and teḷasa, terasa, cattālīsa, cattārīsa is the definition. It is not so in the case of dasa, pannarasa, etc.

original: Satta ca dasa ca, sattahi vā adhikā dasāti atthe sattarasa, sattadasa.
analyzed: satta ca dasa ca sattahi vā adhikāḥ dasa ati atthe sattarasa sattadasa
translated: Seven and ten, or ten plus seven, is the meaning of sattarasa, sattadasa.

original: Aṭṭha ca dasa ca, aṭṭhahi vā adhikā dasāti atthe aṭṭhadasa itīdha ātte kate –
analyzed: aṭṭha ca dasa ca aṭṭhahi vā adhikāḥ dasa ati atthe aṭṭhadasaḥ iti idhas ātte kate
translated: Eight and ten, or ten plus eight, is the meaning of aṭṭhadasa. When ā is substituted,

original: “Vā, dassa, ra, saṅkhyāne”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: vā dassa ra saṅkhyānā iti ca vattate
translated: “Vā, dassa, ra, saṅkhyāne” is said.

original: 259. Aṭṭhādito ca.
analyzed: aṭṭha āditaḥ ca
translated: . Aṭṭhādito ca.

original: Aṭṭhādito ca dasasaddassa dakārassa rakāro hoti vā saṅkhyāne. Aṭṭhārasa, aṭṭhādasa.
analyzed: aṭṭha āditaḥ ca dasa saddassa dakārassa rakāraḥ hoti vā saṅkhyāne aṭṭhārasa aṭṭhādasa
translated: The letter ra is substituted for the letter da of the word dasa, or not, in the case of numerals. Aṭṭhārasa, aṭṭhādasa.

original: Aṭṭhāditoti kiṃ? Catuddasa.
analyzed: aṭṭha āditaḥ ti kim catuddasa
translated: What is the purpose of aṭṭhādito? Catuddasa.

original: Katisaddo bahuvacanantova, “kati yo” itīdha
analyzed: kati saddaḥ kati yaḥ iti idha
translated: The word kati is only in the plural. “Kati yo” is said here.

original: Niccaṃ yolopādi, rassattaṃ, kati tiṭṭhanti, kati passasi, katihi katibhi, katinaṃ, katihi katibhi, katinaṃ, katisu.
analyzed: niccam yo lopa ādi rassattam kati tiṭṭhanti kati passasi katihi katibhi katinam katihi katinam katisu
translated: Always, and the beginning of life, and the state of being a man, how many stand? how many do you see? with how many? with how many? of how many? with how many? with how many? of how many? in how many?

original: Aliṅganāmaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: aliṅga nāmam niṭṭhitam
translated: The Indeclinables is finished.

original: Vibhattippaccayavidhāna
analyzed: vibhattip paccaya vidhāna
translated: The method of the case endings

original: Atha vibhattippaccayantā vuccante.
analyzed: atha vibhattippaccayantāḥ vuccante
translated: Now the case endings are stated.

original: Tesaṃ panāliṅgattā, nipātattā ca tiliṅge, vacanadvaye ca samānaṃ rūpaṃ.
analyzed: tesam nipāta ttā ca ti liṅge vacana dvaye ca samānam rūpam
translated: But because of their not being inflected and because of their being indeclinables, they have the same form in the three genders and in the two numbers.

original: Purisasmā, purisehi vāti atthe –
analyzed: purisasmā purisehi vā atthe
translated: From a man, from men, v.

original: 260. Kvaci to pañcamyatthe.
analyzed: kvaci taḥ pañcamī a tthe
translated: In some instances to is in the sense of the fifth case.

original: Sabbasmā suddhanāmato, sabbanāmato ca liṅgamhā kvaci topaccayo hoti pañcamyatthe.
analyzed: sabbasmā suddha nāmataḥ sabba nāmataḥ ca liṅgamhā kvaci to paccayaḥ hoti pañcamī atthe
translated: From all, from all the pure noun, and from all the noun, in some instances the case ending to is in the sense of the fifth case.

original: 261. Tvādayo vibhattisaññā.
analyzed: tu ādayaḥ vibhatti saññā
translated: Tvādayaṃ vibhattisaññā.

original: Toādi yesaṃ dānipariyantānaṃ paccayānaṃ te honti paccayā tvādayo, te paccayā vibhattisaññā honti. Tena tadantānampi vibhatyantapadattaṃ siddhaṃ hoti.🔽Purisato, evaṃ rājato vā, corato vā, aggito vā, gahapatito vā, hatthito, hetuto,
analyzed: to ādi yesam dāni pariyantānam paccayānam te honti paccayā tu ādayo te paccayā vibhatti saññāḥ honti tena tad antānam pi vibhati anta pada ttam siddham hoti 🔽purisataḥ evam rājataḥ vā corataḥ vā aggitaḥ vā gahapatitaḥ vā hatthitaḥ hetutaḥ
translated: Those case endings beginning with to are case endings, they are called case endings. Therefore the state of being a case ending is established for those ending in them too.

original: sabbaññuto, kaññato, yuttito, itthito, bhikkhunito, ettha ca “kvacādimajjhuttarānaṃ🔽dīgharassāpaccayesu cā”ti topaccaye rassattaṃ. Yāguto, jambuto, cittato, āyuto iccādi.
analyzed: sabbaññutaḥ kaññataḥ yuttitaḥ itthitaḥ bhikkhunitaḥ ettha ca kva ca ādi majjha uttarānam  dīgha rassā paccayesu ca ati to paccaye rassattam yāgutaḥ jambutaḥ cittataḥ āyutaḥ iccādi
translated: from the all-knowing, from the virgin, from the logical, from the woman, from the bhikkhunī, and here the lengthening of the vowel in the last syllable is by the rule: “In kvacādimajjhuttarānaṃ dīgharassāpaccayesu cā” .🔽From the gruel, from the rose-apple, from the mind, from the yoke, and so on.

original: Sabbanāmato sabbasmā, sabbehīti vā atthe sabbato, evaṃ yato, tato, katarato, katamato, itarato, aññato, ekato, ubhayato, pubbato, parato, aparato, dakkhiṇato, uttarato, amuto.🔽“Kissa, ku”iti ca vattate.🔽262. Tratothesu ca.🔽Kimiccetassa ku hoti trato thaiccetesu ca paresu. Kasmā, kehīti vā kuto.🔽“Tothesū”ti vattate.🔽263. Sabbassetassākāro vā.🔽Sabbassa etasaddassa akāro hoti vā tothaiccetesu. Etasmā, etehīti vā ato.🔽“Sabbassetassā”ti ca vattate.🔽264. E tothesu ca.🔽Sabbassa etasaddassa ekāro hoti vā tothaiccetesu. Dvittaṃ, etto.
analyzed: sabba nāmataḥ sabbasmā sabbehi iti vā atthe sabbatas evam yatas tatas kataratas katamatas itaratas aññatas ekatas ubhayatas pubbatas paratas aparatas dakkhiṇatas uttaratas amutas 🔽kissa ku iti ca vattate 🔽tra tothesu ca 🔽kim id itassa ku hoti ca paresu kasmā kehi iti vā kutas 🔽tothesu iti vattate 🔽sabbassa itassa ākāraḥ vā 🔽sabbassa eta saddassa akāraḥ hoti vā etasmai etehi iti vā a to 🔽sabbassa itassa ati ca vattate 🔽e taḥ thesu ca 🔽sabbassa eta saddassa ekāraḥ hoti vā to tha e c ca etesu dvittam e ttaḥ
translated: From all, from any, from every, from each, from all of them, from all, from all of these, from all of you, from all of us, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all of you, from all of them, from all of us, from all

original: “Sabbassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: sabbassa iti vattate
translated: “Of all” is said.

original: 265. Imassi thaṃdānihatodhesu ca.
analyzed: imassi thaṃdā niha todhesu ca
translated: . In this, in thaṃ, in daṃ, in ni, in ha, in odha, in ic.

original: Imasaddassa sabbasseva ikāro hoti thaṃdānihatodhaiccetesu ca. Imasmāti ito.
analyzed: ima saddassa sabbassa iva ikāraḥ hoti ca imasma ati itaḥ
translated: The syllable i of the word imaṃ becomes i in these: thaṃ, daṃ, ni, ha, odha, ic. Imasmāti ito.

original: “Kvaci to”ti yogavibhāgena ādippabhutīhi to sattamiyatthe. Aniccādīhi tatiyatthe
analyzed: kvaci to ti yogavibhāgena ādi ppabhutīhi to sattamiya tthe anicca ādīhi tatiya tthe
translated: “In some cases to” is in the sense of the locative case by the division of the compound. With aniccā, etc., in the sense of the third case.

original: ca. Yathā – ādimhībhi atthe ādito. Evaṃ majjhato, ekato, purato, pacchato, passato,
analyzed: ca yathā atthe āditaḥ evam majjhatas ekatas puratas pacchatas passatas
translated: And. As – in the sense of the beginning, from the beginning. Thus from the middle, from one, from the front, from the back, from the side,

original: piṭṭhito, pādato, sīsato, aggato, mūlato, parato iccādayo.
analyzed: piṭṭhitaḥ pādataḥ sīsataḥ aggataḥ mūlataḥ paratas iccādayaḥ
translated: from the rear, from the foot, from the head, from the top, from the root, from the other side, etc.

original: Tatiyatthe aniccenāti aniccato, aniccato sammasati. Evaṃ dukkhato, rogato, gaṇḍato iccādayo.
analyzed: tatiya tthe aniccena ati aniccataḥ aniccataḥ sammasati evam dukkhataḥ rogataḥ gaṇḍataḥ icca ādayaḥ
translated: In the sense of the third case: aniccena, from the impermanent. He comprehends from the impermanent. Thus from the painful, from the diseased, from the boil, etc.

original: “Atthe, kvacī”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: atthe kvaci iti ca vattate
translated: “In the sense of the locative case in some cases” is said.

original: 266. Tratha sattamiyā sabbanāmehi.
analyzed: tratha sattamiyā sabbanāmehi
translated: . In the locative case with all nouns.

original: Sabbanāmehi parā tra thaiccete paccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe. Sabbasmiṃ, sabbesu
analyzed: sabbanāmehi parā tra tha e c ca ete paccayāḥ honti kvaci sattamī atthe sabbasmin sabbesu
translated: The particles tra, tha, and sa are the conditions in the sense of the locative case in some cases with all nouns. Sabbasmiṃ, sabbesu

original: cāti sabbatra sabbattha. Evaṃ yatra yattha, tatra tattha, itaratra itarattha, aññatra
analyzed: ca ati sabbatra sabbattha evam yatra yattha tatra tattha itaratra itarattha aññatra
translated: and. Thus sabbatra, everywhere. Thus yatra yatra, tatra tatra, itaratra itarattha, aññatra

original: aññattha, ubhayatra ubhayattha, paratra parattha, kutra kuttha, “tratothesu cā”ti🔽kuttaṃ. “Kissa ka ve cā”ti sutte casaddena kādeso. Kattha, amutra amuttha.
analyzed: aññattha ubhayatra ubhayattha paratra parattha kutra kuttha ca ati  kuttam kissa ka ve ca ati sutte ca saddena ka ādesaḥ kattha amutra amuttha
translated: Elsewhere, both ways, both there and here, elsewhere, there, where, wherever, and in the case of the words “tratho” and “ettha”.🔽The word “kuttaṃ” is formed by adding the katta affix to the root “kutu”.🔽The word “kissa” is formed by adding the katta affix to the root “ki”.

original: “Sabbassetassākāro”ti vattate.🔽267. Tre niccaṃ.
analyzed: sabbassa itassa ākāraḥ iti vattate  tre n it cam
translated: The word “kattha” is formed by adding the katta affix to the root “ka”.🔽The word “amutra” is formed by adding the uatta affix to the root “amu”.🔽The word “amuttha” is formed by adding the thaatta affix to the root “amu”.

original: Sabbasseva etasaddassa akāro hoti niccaṃ tre pare. Atra. “Sabbassetassākāro vā”ti attaṃ, “e tothesu cā”ti ekāro, attha, ettha.
analyzed: sabbassa iva eta saddassa akāraḥ hoti niccam tre pare atra sabbassa itassa akāraḥ vāti attam e to thesu ca ati ekāraḥ atthe ettha
translated: The word “atra” is formed by adding the atta affix to the root “atra”.

original: “Kvaci, atthe, sattamiyā”ti ca adhikāro, sabbasminti atthe –🔽268. Sabbato dhi.
analyzed: kvaci atthe sattamiyā iti ca adhikāraḥ sabbasmin ti atthe  sabbataḥ dhi
translated: The word “attha” is formed by adding the atta affix to the root “attha”.🔽The word “ettha” is formed by adding the atta affix to the root “ettha”.🔽The word “sabbasmin” is formed by adding the smin affix to the root “sabba”.

original: Sabbaiccetasmā dhippaccayo hoti kvaci sattamyatthe. Sabbadhi.🔽269. Kismā vo.🔽Kimiccetasmā vappaccayo hoti kvaci sattamyatthe.
analyzed: dhip paccayaḥ hoti kvaci sattamī atthe sabbadhi  kismai vaḥ  kim icca itasmā vap paccayaḥ hoti kvaci sattamī atthe
translated: The word “sabbadhi” is formed by adding the dhi affix to the root “sabba”.🔽The word “kismā” is formed by adding the mā affix to the root “ki”.

original: 270. Kissa ka ve ca.
analyzed: kissa ka ve ca
translated: The word “kvattha” is formed by adding the ttha affix to the root “ku”.🔽The word “kissa” is formed by adding the katta affix to the root “ki”.🔽The word “kvattha” is formed by adding the ttha affix to the root “ku”.

original: Kimiccetassa kasaddo ādeso hoti vappaccayepare. Caggahaṇena thahamādiavappaccayepi. “Tesu vuddhī”tiādinā kakāre akārassa lopo ca vamhi. Kva gatosi tvaṃ.
analyzed: kim icca itassa ka saddaḥ ādesaḥ hoti va ppaccaye pare ca ggahaṇena tha ham ādi ava ppaccaye pi tesu vuddhi iti ādinā kakāre akārassa lopaḥ ca vamhi kva gataḥ asi tvam
translated: The word “kvattha” is formed by adding the ttha affix to the root “ku”.

original: “Kismā”ti vattate.
analyzed: kismā ati vattate
translated: “Kismā” is said.

original: 271. Hiṃhaṃhiñcanaṃ.
analyzed: hiṃ haṃ hiñcanam
translated: . Hiṃhaṃhiñcanaṃ.

original: Kimiccetasmā hiṃ haṃ hiñcanaṃiccete paccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe.
analyzed: kim iti ca itasmai him haṃ hiñcanaṃ iti ca ete paccayāḥ honti kvaci sattamī atthe
translated: Kimiccetasmā hiṃ haṃ hiñcanaṃiccete paccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe.

original: “Kissā”ti vattate.
analyzed: kissa ati vattate
translated: “Kissā”ti vattate.

original: 272. Ku hiṃhaṃsu ca.
analyzed: ku hiṃhan su ca
translated: . Ku hiṃhaṃsu ca.

original: Kimiccetassa ku hoti hiṃ haṃ iccetesu. Caggahaṇena hiñcanaṃdācanamiccādīsupi. Kisminti kuhiṃ, kuhaṃ, kuhiñcanaṃ, kahaṃ kādeso.
analyzed: kim iti itassa ku hoti him haṃ iti etesu ca ggahaṇena kismin ti kuhim kuham kuhiñcanam kaham ka ādesaḥ
translated: Kimiccetassa ku hoti hiṃ haṃ iccetesu. Caggahaṇena hiñcanaṃdācanamiccādīsupi. Kisminti kuhiṃ, kuhaṃ, kuhiñcanaṃ, kahaṃ kādeso.

original: “Hiṃ ha”nti vattate.
analyzed: hiṃ hanti vattate
translated: “Hiṃ ha”nti vattate.

original: 273. Tamhā ca.
analyzed: tamhā ca
translated: . Tamhā ca.

original: Taiccetasmā ca sabbanāmato hiṃhaṃpaccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe. Tasminti tahiṃ, tahaṃ.
analyzed: ca sabbanāmataḥ hiṃhaṃ paccayāḥ honti kvaci sattamī atthe tasmin ti tahim tahaṃ
translated: Taiccetasmā ca sabbanāmato hiṃhaṃpaccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe. Tasminti tahiṃ, tahaṃ.

original: 274. Imasmā hadhā ca.
analyzed: imasmai hadhā ca
translated: . Imasmā hadhā ca.

original: Imasaddato hadhappaccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe. “Imassi tha”ntiādinā ikāro. Imasminti iha, idha.
analyzed: ima saddataḥ ha dha p paccayāḥ honti kvaci sattamī atthe imassi thanti ādinā ikāraḥ imasmin ti iha idha
translated: Imasaddato hadhappaccayā honti kvaci sattamyatthe. “Imassi tha”ntiādinā ikāro. Imasminti iha, idha.

original: 275. Yato hiṃ.
analyzed: yataḥ hiṃ
translated: . Yato hiṃ.

original: Yaiccetasmā sabbanāmato hiṃpaccayo hoti kvaci sattamyatthe. Yasminti yahiṃ.
analyzed: sabbanāmataḥ hiṃ paccayaḥ hoti kvaci sattamī atthe yasmin ti ya hiṃ
translated: Yaiccetasmā sabbanāmato hiṃpaccayo hoti kvaci sattamyatthe. Yasminti yahiṃ.

original: “Kāle”ti adhikāroyaṃ.
analyzed: kāla iti adhikāraḥ yam
translated: “Kāle” is said.

original: Kasmiṃ kāleti atthe
analyzed: kasmin kāla iti a tthe
translated: In the sense of “kasmiṃ kāle”

original: 276. Kiṃsabbaññekayakuhi dā dācanaṃ.
analyzed: kim sap baññeka ya kuhi dāḥ dā canam
translated: . Kiṃsabbañekayakuhi dā dācanaṃ.

original: Kiṃ sabbaaññaekayaiccetehi sabbanāmehi dāpaccayo hoti. Kuiccetasmā dācanañca kāle kvaci sattamyatthe.
analyzed: kim sabba añña eka yai c ca itehi sabbanāmehi dā paccayaḥ hoti kuit ca itasmā dā canañca kāle kvaci sattamī atthe
translated: Is the instrumental case the condition for all these words beginning with sabba? In some places it is the locative case.

original: “Kissa ka ve cā”ti sutte casaddena kādeso, kadā.
analyzed: kissa ka ve ca ati sutte ca saddena ka ādesaḥ kadā
translated: “Kissa ka ve cā” ti sutte casaddena kādeso, kadā.

original: 277. Sabbassa so dāmhi vā.
analyzed: sabbassa saḥ dāmhi vā
translated: . Sabbassa so dāmhi vā.

original: Sabbaiccetassa saddassa sasaddādeso hoti vā dāpaccaye pare. Sabbasmiṃ kāleti sadā, sabbadā.
analyzed: sabba e c ca itassa saddassa sa sadda ādesaḥ hoti vā dā paccaye pare sabbasmin kāle iti sadā sabbadā
translated: Sabbaiccetassa saddassa sasaddādeso hoti vā dāpaccaye pare. Sabbasmiṃ kāleti sadā, sabbadā.

original: Evaṃ aññadā, ekadā, yadā, kasmiṃ kāleti kudācanaṃ, “ku hiṃhaṃsu cā”ti sutte casaddena kuttaṃ, “ku”iti nipātanena vā.
analyzed: evam aññadā ekadā yadā kasmin kāle iti kudācanam ku hiṃhaṃsu ca ati sutte ca saddena kuttam ku iti nipātanena vā
translated: Evaṃ aññadā, ekadā, yadā, kasmiṃ kāleti kudācanaṃ, “ku hiṃhaṃsu cā” ti sutte casaddena kuttaṃ, “ku” iti nipātanena vā.

original: “Dā”ti vattate.
analyzed: dāti vattate
translated: “Dā” ti vattate.

original: 278. Tamhā dāni ca.
analyzed: tamhā dāni ca
translated: . Tamhā dāni ca.

original: Taiccetasmā sabbanāmato dānidāpaccayā honti kāle kvaci sattamyatthe. Tasmiṃ kāleti tadāni, tadā.
analyzed: sabbanāmataḥ dāni dā paccayāḥ honti kāle kvaci sattamī atthe tasmin kāle iti tadāni tadā
translated: Taiccetasmā sabbanāmato dānidāpaccayā honti kāle kvaci sattamyatthe. Tasmiṃ kāleti tadāni, tadā.

original: 279. Imasmā rahidhunādāni ca.
analyzed: imasmai rahidhunādāni ca
translated: . Imasmā rahidhunādāni ca.

original: Imasaddato rahi dhunā dāniiccete paccayā honti kāle kvaci sattamyatthe.
analyzed: ima sad dataḥ rahi dhunā dāni icca ete paccayāḥ honti kāle kvaci sattamī atthe
translated: Imasaddato rahi dhunā dāniiccete paccayā honti kāle kvaci sattamyatthe.

original: “Sabbassa, imassā”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: sabbassa imassa ati ca vattate
translated: “Sabbassa, imassā” ti ca vattate.

original: 280. Eta rahimhi.
analyzed: eta rahimhi
translated: . Eta rahimhi.

original: Sabbassa imasaddassa etādeso hoti rahimhi paccaye pare. Imasmiṃ kāleti etarahi.
analyzed: sabbassa ima saddassa e ta ādesaḥ hoti rahimhi paccaye pare imasmin kāle iti etarahi
translated: The word imasmiṃ has the form etādeso, with the vowel of etā, in the locative case after rahi. Imasmiṃ kāleti = etarahi.

original: 281. A dhunāmhi ca.
analyzed: a dhunāmhi ca
translated: . A dhunāmhi ca.

original: Sabbasseva imasaddassa akāro hoti dhunāpaccaye pare. Adhunā, imasaddassa ikāro. Imasmiṃ kāleti idāni.
analyzed: sabbassa iva ima saddassa akāraḥ hoti dhunā paccaye pare adhunā ima saddassa ikāraḥ imasmin kāle iti idāni
translated: The word imasmiṃ has the form adhunā, with the vowel of adhunā, in the locative case after dhunā. Imasmiṃ kāleti = idāni.

original: Vibhattippaccayavidhānaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.
analyzed: vibhatti ppaccaya vidhānam niṭṭhitam
translated: The explanation of the locative case is finished.

original: Opasaggikapada
analyzed: opasaggika pada
translated: Prefixes

original: Athāliṅgasaṅkhyāvibhattibhedā upasagganipātā vuccante.
analyzed: atha a liṅga saṅkhyā vibhatti bhedāḥ upasagga nipātāḥ vuccante
translated: The groups of prefixes are called so because they are attached to the root.

original: Pa parā ni nī u du saṃ vi ava anu pari adhi abhi pati su ā ati api apa upa iti pīsati upasaggā.
analyzed: pa parā ni nī u du sam vi ava anu pari adhi abhi pati su ā ati api apa upa iti pīsati upasaggā
translated: Pa, parā, ni, nī, u, du, saṃ, vi, ava, anu, pari, adhi, abhi, pati, su, ā, ati, api, apa, upa, iti are the prefixes.

original: Tattha pasaddo pakārā’dikamma padhāni’ssariya’ntobhāvaviyoga tappara bhusattha sambhavatitti
analyzed: tattha pasaddaḥ pakāra ādi kamma tad para bhusattha
translated: The word pa is used in the sense of the letter pa, beginning, chief, lord, inside, separation, that, abundance, being, origination,

original: anāvila patthanādīsu. Paiti ayamupasaggo etesu pakārādīsu atthesu vattati, yathā
analyzed: anāvila patthana ādīsu paiti ayam upasaggaḥ etesu pakāra ādīsu atthesu vattati yathā
translated: and unclouded aspiration, etc. This prefix pa is used in the sense of the letter pa, etc., as follows:

original: – pakāre paññā, ādikamme vippakataṃ, padhāne paṇītaṃ, padhānaṃ padhānattaṃ, issariye
analyzed: pakāre paññā ādikamme vippakatam padhāne paṇītam padhānam padhānattam issariye
translated: In the sense of the letter pa: paññā (wisdom). In the sense of beginning: vippakataṃ (done). In the sense of chief: paṇītaṃ (excellent). In the sense of chief: padhānaṃ (effort), padhānattaṃ (chiefness). In the sense of lord: issariyaṃ (lordship).

original: pabhū ayaṃ desassa, antobhāve pakkhittaṃ, viyoge pavāsī, tappare pācariyo, bhusatthe
analyzed: desassa antobhāve pakkhittam viyoge pavāsī tad pare pācariyaḥ bhusatthe
translated: Pabhū is a source, as in pabhū antobhāve, a source within; in viyoge pavāsī, a source of separation; in tappare pācariyo, a source of heat; in bhusatthe pavuddhakāyo, a source of the body’s being stretched out.

original: pavuddhakāyo, sambhave himavatā gaṅgā pabhavati, tittiyaṃ pahūtamannaṃ, anāvile pasannamudakaṃ, patthane paṇihitaṃ.🔽Parāiti parihāni parājaya gativikkamā’masanādīsu. Yathā – parihāniyaṃ parābhavo, parājaye parājito, gatiyaṃ parāyanaṃ. Vikkame parakkamati, āmasane aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ.
analyzed: pavuddha kāyaḥ sambhave himavatā gaṅgā pabhavati tittiyam pahūtam annam anāvile pasannam udakam patthane paṇihitam  parājaya gati vikkama āmasana ādīsu yathā parihāniyam parābhavaḥ parājaye parājitaḥ gatiyam parāyanam vikkame parakkamati āmasane aṅgassa parāmasanam
