original: Jaramara iccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ jīrajīyyamīyyādesā honti vā, saralopādi. Jīrati, jīranti. Jīyyati, jīyyanti. “Kvacā”disuttena ekayakārassa kvaci lopo hoti. Jīyati, jīyanti.
analyzed: dhātūnam honti vā sara lopa ādi jīrati jīranti jīyyati jīyyanti kvaca ādi suttena eka yakārassa kvaci lopaḥ hoti jīyati jīyanti
translated: The forms of these roots with the meaning of “to die” have the des- ignations jīra, jīyya, etc., or the elision of the r, etc. Jīrati, jīranti. Jīyyati, jīyyanti. The single k of kvacā is elided in some cases by the rule of the sutra. Jīyati, jīyanti.

original: Kamme jīrīyati, jīrīyanti. Jīyiyyati, jīyiyyanti. Jīratu, jīyyatu. Jīreyya, jīyyeyya. Ajīrī, jīrī, jīyyī. Jīrissati, jīyyissati. Ajīrissa, ajīyyissa.
analyzed: kamme jīrīyati jīrīyanti jīyiyyati jīyiyyanti jīratu jīyyatu jīreyya jīyyeyya ajīrī jīrī jīyyī jīrissati jīyyissati ajīrissa ajīyyissa
translated: In the passive voice: jīrīyati, jīrīyanti. Jīyiyyati, jīyiyyanti. Jīratu, jīyyatu. Jīreyya, jīyyeyya. Ajīrī, jīrī, jīyyī. Jīrissati, jīyyissati. Ajīrissa, ajīyyissa.

original: Mara pāṇacāge, mīyyādeso, mīyyati, mīyyanti. Mīyati, mīyanti vā. Marati, maranti iccādi.🔽Disa pekkhaṇe.
analyzed: mara pāṇa ca āge mīyya ādesaḥ mīyyati mīyati mīyanti vā marati maranti iti ādi  disa pekkhaṇe
translated: The forms of these roots with the meaning of “to kill” have the designations mīyya, etc. Mīyyati, mīyyanti. Mīyati, mīyanti. Marati, maranti, etc.🔽The forms of these roots with the meaning of “to look” have the designations disa, etc.

original: 483. Disassa passa dissa dakkhā vā.🔽Disaiccetassa dhātussa passa dissa dakkhaiccete ādesā honti vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, tena dissādeso kammani sabbadhātuke eva. Passati, passanti. Dakkhati, dakkhanti.
analyzed: disassa passa dissa dakkhā vā 🔽disa i c ca itassa dhātussa passa dissa dakkha i c ca ete ādesāḥ honti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ tena dissa ādesaḥ kammani sabbadhātuke eva passati passanti dakkhati dakkhanti
translated: . Disassa passa dissa dakkhā vā.🔽The forms of this root with the meaning of “to see” have the designations passa, disa, dakkha, etc. The word vā here has the sense of “distinction” and “specification,” and therefore the designation disa is used only in the passive voice.

original: Kammani yakāralopo, dissate, dissante. Dissati, dissanti. Vipassīyati, dakkhīyati. Passatu, dakkhatu, dissatu. Passeyya, dakkheyya, disseyya.
analyzed: kammani yakāra lopaḥ dissate dissante dissati dissanti vipassīyati dakkhīyati passatu dakkhatu dissatu passeyya dakkheyya disseyya
translated: In the verb-root, the syllable ka is dropped, and dissate, dissante are seen. Dissati, dissanti. Vipassīyati, dakkhīyati. Passatu, dakkhatu, dissatu. Passeyya, dakkheyya, disseyya.

original: Hiyyattaniyaṃ “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhātuikārassa attaṃ, addasā, addasa. Kammani adissa.
analyzed: kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dhātu i kārassa attam addasā addasa kammani adissa
translated: In the passive, the syllable ka of the root is lengthened by the rule “In some cases the root” , and so addasā, addasa. In the verb-form, adissa.

original: Tathā apassi, passi, apassiṃsu, passiṃsu. Apassi, passi, apassittha, passittha. Apassiṃ,
analyzed: tathā apassi passi apassiṃsu passiṃsu apassi passi apassittha passittha apassiṃ
translated: Likewise apassi, passi, apassiṃsu, passiṃsu. Apassi, passi, apassittha, passittha. Apassiṃ,

original: passiṃ, apassimha, passimha. Addasi, dasi, addasaṃsu, dasaṃsu. Kammani adissaṃsu.
analyzed: passim a passimha passimha addasi dasi addasaṃsu dasaṃsu kammani adissaṃsu
translated: passiṃ, apassimha, passimha. Addasi, dasi, addasaṃsu, dasaṃsu. In the verb-form, adissaṃsu.

original: Addakkhi, addakkhiṃsu.
analyzed: addakkhi addakkhiṃsu
translated: Addakkhi, addakkhiṃsu.

original: Passissati, passissanti. “Bhavissantimhi ssassa cā”ti yogavibhāgena ssassa lopo,
analyzed: passissati passissanti bhavissantimhi ssassa ca ati yoga vibhāgena ssassa lopaḥ
translated: Passissati, passissanti. By the rule “In the future tense the syllable ss is dropped and the syllable ka is lengthened” ,

original: ikārāgamo ca, dakkhiti, dakkhinti. Lopābhāve dakkhissati, dakkhissanti. Apassissa, adakkhissa iccādi.
analyzed: ikāra āgamaḥ ca dakkhiti dakkhinti lopa abhāve dakkhissati dakkhissanti apassissa adakkhissa iccādi
translated: the syllable ss is dropped and the syllable ka is lengthened, and so dakkhiti, dakkhinti. If the dropping does not take place, dakkhissati, dakkhissanti. Apassissa, adakkhissa, etc.

original: Sada visaraṇagatyāvasānesu.
analyzed: sada visaraṇa gatya avasānesu
translated: Sada is used in the sense of “going out” and “ending.”

original: “Sabbatthā”ti vattate, maṇḍūkagatiyā “kvacī”ti ca.
analyzed: sabbattha iti vattate maṇḍūka gatiyā kvaci iti ca
translated: It is used everywhere, and in some cases by the manner of a frog’s jump.

original: 484. Sadassa sīdattaṃ.
analyzed: sadassa sīdattam
translated: The root sad, to sit down.

original: Sadaiccetassa dhātussa sīdādeso hoti sabbattha vibhattippaccayesu kvaci. Sesaṃ neyyaṃ.
analyzed: sa da e c ca itassa dhātussa sī t ādesaḥ hoti sabbattha vibhatti paccayesu kvaci sesam na iyyam
translated: The substitution of sīd for the root sad is found in all cases, in some instances. The rest is to be inferred.

original: Nisīdati, nisīdanti. Bhāve nisajjate, idha kvacādhikārena sīdā-deso na bhavati. Nisīdatu.
analyzed: nisīdati nisīdanti bhāve nisajjate kva ca adhikārena sīda ādesaḥ na bhavati nisīdatu
translated: He sits down, they sit down. In the formation of the gerund nisajja, the substitution of sīd does not take place here by the influence of kva. Let him sit down.

original: Nisīde. Nisīdi. Nisīdissati. Nisīdissa iccādi.
analyzed: nisīde nisīdi nisīdissati nisīdissaḥ iccādi
translated: Let him sit down. He sat down. He will sit down. He would sit down.

original: Yaja devapūjāsaṅgatikaraṇadānesu. Yajati, yajanti.
analyzed: yaja deva pūjā saṅgati karaṇa dānesu yajati yajanti
translated: The root yaj, to worship, to sacrifice, to give. He worships, they worship.

original: Kammani “yamhī”ti vattate.🔽485. Yajassādissi.
analyzed: kammani yamhi iti vattate  yajassa ādiḥ si
translated: The form yamhi is used in the optative.🔽The substitution of ijjhati is found in the optative.

original: Yajaiccetassa dhātussa ādissa yakārassa ikārādeso hoti yappaccaye pare, saralopo.
analyzed: yaja e c ca itassa dhātussa ādissa yakārassa ikāra ādesaḥ hoti ya p paccaye pare sara lopo
translated: The substitution of i for the y of the root yaj is found in the optative, with the omission of the vowel.

analyzed: ijjate mayā buddhaḥ tathā yajatu ijjatam yaje ijjetha yaji ijjittha yajissati

original: Vadaiccetassa dhātussa sabbassa vajjādeso hoti vā sabbāsu vibhattīsu. Vibhatyādhikārattā cettha sabbāsūti atthato siddhaṃ.
analyzed: vada e t ca itassa dhātussa sabbassa vajja ādesaḥ hoti vā sabbāsu vibhattīsu vibhatyā adhikāra ttā ca ittha sabbāsu iti atthataḥ siddham
translated: If it is said, then the whole of that element has the state of a base in all the cases. But here the meaning of all is established by the super-rule of the case-endings.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.🔽487. Lopañcettamakāro.
analyzed: vāti vattate  lopaḥ ced tamakāraḥ
translated: The word “or” is repeated.🔽If it is said, then the vowel a of the element is elided.

original: Bhūvādito paro appaccayo ettamāpajjate, lopañca vā. Vikaraṇakāriyavidhippakaraṇato cettha akāroti appaccayo gayhati.
analyzed: bhū āditaḥ paraḥ appaccayaḥ lopam ca vā vikaraṇa kāriya vidhi ppakaraṇato ca ittha akāro ti appaccayaḥ gayhati
translated: The element that comes after a bhū-vowel takes the state of a, or the elision. But here the element is taken as a by the super-rule of the case-endings.

original: Bhūvādito juhotyādi-to ca appaccayo paro;
analyzed: bhū āditaḥ juhoti āditaḥ ca appaccayaḥ paraḥ
translated: The element that comes after a bhū-vowel, and after juhoti, etc.,🔽Takes the state of a, or the elision, and no other,

original: Lopamāpajjate nāñño, vavatthitavibhāsatoti.
analyzed: lopam āpajjate na aññaḥ vavatthita vibhāsataḥ ti
translated: By the definition of the case-endings.

analyzed: appaccayassa e kāraḥ sara lopa ādi vajjeti vadeti vadati antimhi
translated: The vowel a of the element, the elision of the simple, etc., is vajjeti, vadeti, vadati, at the end –

original: 488. Kvaci dhātuvibhattippaccayānaṃ dīghaviparītādesalopāgamā ca.
analyzed: kvaci dīgha viparīta ādesa lopa āgamā ca
translated: . In some instances there is lengthening, reversal, elision, and addition of the element, the case-ending, and the suffix.

analyzed: dhātu ādhikāre ākhyāte kitake ca avihita lakkhaṇesu payogesu kvaci dhātūnam
translated: Here, in the section on the element, in the optative, and in the verbs whose characteristic is not specified, in some instances the elements,

analyzed: t y ādi vibhattīnam dhātu vihita ppaccayānam ca dīgha tap biparīta ādesa lopa āgama e c ca etāni
translated: the case-endings beginning with ty-ādi, and the suffixes specified by the element, have lengthening, reversal, elision, and addition.

analyzed: kāriyāni jina vacana anurūpataḥ bhavanti
translated: are done in accordance with the words of the Victor. Herein:

original: Nāmhi rasso kiyādīnaṃ, saṃyoge caññadhātunaṃ;🔽Āyūnaṃ vā vibhattīnaṃ, mhā, ssāntassa ca rassatā.🔽Gamito cchassa ñcho vāssa, gamissajjatanimhi gā;
analyzed: nāmhi rassaḥ kiyā ādīnam saṃyoge cañña dhātunam  āyūnam vā vibhattīnam mhā ssa antassa ca rassa tā  gamitaḥ cchassa ñchaḥ vā assa gamissajja tanimhi gā
translated: I am short, etc., in the case of many, and in the case of other bases in compounds,🔽In the case of the long vowels, and in the case of the case-endings, and in the case of the particles, and in the case of the short.

original: Ucāgamo vā tthamhesu, dhātūnaṃ yamhi dīghatā.🔽Eyyeyyāseyyāmettañca, vā ssessettañca pāpuṇe;🔽Okārā attamittañca, ātthā papponti vā tthathe.
analyzed: u c āgamaḥ vā dhātūnam yamhi dīgha tā  vā ssessettam ca pāpuṇe  okārāḥ ātthā papponti vā tthathe
translated: The long vowel is removed in the case of the past tense, or the long vowel is in the case of the future tense, and in the case of the imperative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the present tense, and in the case of the conditional, and in the case of the optative, and in the case of the bases.

original: Tathā brūtoti antīnaṃ, au vāha ca dhātuyā;🔽Parokkhāya vibhattimhi, anabbhāsassa dīghatā.
analyzed: tathā antīnam au vā āha ca  parokkhāya vibhattimhi an ap bhāsassa dīgha tā
translated: The long vowel is in the case of the past passive participle, and in the case of the superlative, and in the case of the comparative, and in the case of the absolutive.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the infinitive, and in the case of the locative, and in the case of the instrumental, and in the case of the dative.

original: Saṃyoganto akārettha, vibhattippaccayādi tu;🔽Lopa māpajjate nicca-mekārokārato paroti.🔽Ekārato parassa antiakārassa lopo, vajjenti, vadenti, vadanti. Vajjesi, vadesi, vadasi,
analyzed: saṃyoga antaḥ akāra ittha vibhatti paccaya ādi tu  lopa māpajjate niccam ekāra ukārato  ekārataḥ parassa anti akārassa lopaḥ vajjenti vadenti vadanti vajjesi vadesi vadasi
translated: The long vowel is in the case of the genitive, and in the case of the ablative, and in the case of the vocative, and in the case of the nominative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the locative, and in the case of the instrumental, and in the case of the dative, and in the case of the genitive.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the ablative, and in the case of the vocative, and in the case of the nominative, and in the case of the accusative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the accusative, and in the case of the ablative, and in the case of the vocative, and in the case of the nominative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the nominative, and in the case of the accusative, and in the case of the ablative, and in the case of the vocative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of the vocative, and in the case of the nominative, and in the case of the accusative, and in the case of the ablative.

analyzed: vajjetha vadetha vadatha vajjemi vajjāmi vademi vadāmi vajjema vadema vadāma
translated: The long vowel is in the case of the ablative, and in the case of the vocative, and in the case of the nominative, and in the case of the accusative.🔽The long vowel is in the case of

original: Kammani vajjīyati, vajjīyanti. Vajjati, vajjanti. Vadīyati vā. Vajjetu, vadetu, vadatu.🔽Vajje, vajjeyya, vade, vadeyya, vajjeyyuṃ, vadeyyuṃ. Vajjeyyāsi, vajjesi, vadeyyāsi.
analyzed: vajjīyati vajjīyanti vajjati vajjanti vadīyati vā vajjetu vadetu vadatu  vajje vajjeyya vade vadeyya vajjeyyum vadeyyum vajjeyyāsi vajjesi vadeyyāsi
translated: Vajjīyati, vajjīyanti. Vajjati, vajjanti. Vādiyati. Vadetu, vade, vadeyya.🔽Vajje, vajjeyya, vade, vadeyya, vajjeyyuṃ, vadeyyuṃ. Vajjeyyāsi, vajjesi, vadeyyāsi.

original: Avadi, vadi, vadiṃsu. Vadissati, vadissanti. Avadissa iccādi.
analyzed: avadi vadi vadiṃsu vadissati vadissanti avadissaḥ iccādi
translated: Avādi, vadi, vadiṃsu. Vadissati, vadissanti. Avadissa, etc.

original: Kamu padavikkhepe, appaccaye kate “kvacādivaṇṇānamekassarānaṃ dvebhāvo”ti dvittaṃ, kavaggassa cavaggo.
analyzed: kamu pada vikkhepe appaccaye kate kva ca ādi vaṇṇānam eka ssarānam dve bhāvaḥ ti dvittam ka vaggassa ca vaggaḥ
translated: In the case of the verb kam, after the affix -a- has been added in the sense of the passive, the rule is: “The first of two or more identical syllables becomes dvīsan” (Dhp. 10), so that the second syllable of the verb is elided, and the final vowel of the first syllable is lengthened.

original: Abbhāsaggahaṇamantaggahaṇaṃ, vāggahaṇañca vattate.🔽489. Niggahītañca.🔽Abbhāsante niggahītañcāgamo hoti vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, tena kamādīnamevetaṃ. Caṅkamati, caṅkamanti iccādi. Kamati, kamanti iccādi.
analyzed: ap bhāsa ggahaṇam anta ggahaṇam vāc gahaṇam ca vattate  niggahītam ca  niggahītam ca āgamaḥ hoti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ tena kama ādīnam eva etam caṅkamati caṅkamanti iccādi kamati kamanti iccādi
translated: The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaghaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .🔽The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .

original: Cala kampane, cañcalati, calati.
analyzed: cala kampane cañcalati calati
translated: The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called “abbhāsaggahaṇa” , and the lengthening of the vowel is called “antaggahaṇa” .

original: Cala dalane, daddallati.
analyzed: cala dalane daddallati
translated: The elision of the final vowel of the first syllable is called

original: Jhecintāyaṃ, appaccaye “o, sare, e”ti ca adhikicca “te āvāyā”ti yogavibhāgena akāritepi ekārassa āyādeso, jhāyati, jhāyanti iccādi, visesavidhānaṃ.
analyzed: a p paccaye o sare e ti ca adhik itca te yogavibhāgena a kārite pi ekārassa āya ādesaḥ jhāyati jhāyanti iccādi visesa vidhānam
translated: The augment āyā is added to the singular and plural of the present tense of the root jhā, to meditate, in the optative mood, although the optative is not formed by the addition of an augment, because of the special rule jhecintāyaṃ, appaccaye “o, sare, e”ti ca adhikicca “te āvāyā”ti yogavibhāgena akāritepi ekārassa āyādeso, jhāyati, jhāyanti iccādi, visesavidhānaṃ.

original: Avuddhikabhūvādinayo.
analyzed: avuddhika bhū vādinayo
translated: The method of the roots avudhi, bhū, etc.

original: Tuda byathane, tyādyuppatti appaccayo, “aññesu cā”ti etthānuvattita vāggahaṇena tudādīnaṃ vuddhiabhāvova viseso, tudati, tudanti. Tudasi, tudatha. Tudāmi, tudāma.
analyzed: byathane appaccayaḥ aññesu ca ati viseso tudati tudanti tudasi tudatha tudāmi tudāma
translated: The augment ā is added to the present tense of the root tu, to strike, in the optative mood, because of the special rule tyādyuppatti appaccayo, “aññesu cā”ti etthānuvattita vāggahaṇena tudādīnaṃ vuddhiabhāvova viseso, tudati, tudanti. Tudasi, tudatha. Tudāmi, tudāma.

original: Kamme “tassa cavagga”iccādinā sadakārassa yappaccayassa jakāro dvittaṃ, tujjate,
analyzed: kamme tassa ca vagga ai c ca ādinā sa dakārassa ya p paccayassa jakāraḥ dvi ttam tujjate
translated: In the aorist the augment y is added to the root tu, to strike, because of the special rule “tassa cavagga”iccādinā sadakārassa yappaccayassa jakāro dvittaṃ, tujjate,

original: tujjante. Tujjati, tujjanti, tujjare vā. Tathā tudatu, tudantu. Tude, tudeyya, tudeyyuṃ.
analyzed: tujjante tujjati tujjanti tujjare vā tathā tudatu tudantu tude tudeyya tudeyyum
translated: tujjante. Tujjati, tujjanti, tujjare vā. Tathā tudatu, tudantu. Tude, tudeyya, tudeyyuṃ.

original: Atudi, tudiṃsu. Atudi, atudittha. Atudiṃ, atudimha. Atujjittha, atujji. Tudissati. Atudissa iccādi.
analyzed: atudi tudiṃsu atudi atudittha atudiṃ atudimha atujjittha atujji tudissati atudissaḥ icca ādi
translated: Atudi, tudiṃsu. Atudi, atudittha. Atudiṃ, atudimha. Atujjittha, atujji. Tudissati. Atudissa iccādi.

original: Visa pavesane papubbo, so gāmaṃ pavisati, pavisanti. Pavisasi, pavisatha. Pavisāmi, pavisāma.
analyzed: visa pavesane papubbaḥ saḥ gāmam pavisati pavisanti pavisasi pavisatha pavisāmi pavisāma
translated: The augment ub is added to the present tense of the root vi, to enter, in the optative mood, because of the special rule visa pavesane papubbo, so gāmaṃ pavisati, pavisanti. Pavisasi, pavisatha. Pavisāmi, pavisāma.

original: Kamme pavisiyyate, pavisiyyante. Pavisiyyati, pavisiyyanti. Pavissate vā. Tathā pavisatu,
analyzed: kamme pavisiyyate pavisiyyante pavisiyyati pavisiyyanti pavissate vā tathā pavisatu
translated: In the verb pavisiyyate, pavisiyyante, pavisiyyati, pavisiyyanti, pavissate, etc., the vowel of the root is lengthened by the affix -iyy- .

original: pavisantu. Paviseyya. Pāvisi, pavisi, pāvekkhi pathaviṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ajjatanimhi
analyzed: pavisantu paviseyya pāvisi pavisi pāvekkhi pathavim kvacid dhātu uti ādinā ajja tanimhi
translated: So too in pavisatu, pavisantu, paviseyya, pāvisi, pavisi, pāvekkhi pathaviṃ, “kvaci dhātū”ti ādinā ajjatanimhi visassa vekkhādeso ca.

original: visassa vekkhādeso ca. Pāvisiṃsu, pavisiṃsu.
analyzed: visassa vekkhā deso ca pāvisiṃsu pavisiṃsu
translated: Pāvisiṃsu, pavisiṃsu.

original: Kamme pāvisīyittha, pavisīyittha, pāvisīyi, pavisīyi. Pavisissati, pavisissanti. Pavisīyissate, pavisissate. Pāvisissa. Pāvisīyissa iccādi.
analyzed: kamme pāvisīyittha pavisīyittha pāvisīyi pavisīyi pavisissati pavisissanti pavisīyissate pavisissate pāvisissa pāvisissa iccādi
translated: In the verb pāvisīyittha, pavisīyittha, pāvisīyi, pavisīyi, pavisissati, pavisissanti, pavisīyissate, pavisissate, pāvisissa, pāvisīyissa, etc., the vowel of the root is lengthened by the affix -īy- .

original: Nuda khepe, nudati, nudanti.
analyzed: nuda khepe nudati nudanti
translated: Nuda, to throw away, nudati, nudanti.

original: Disa atisajjane, uddisati, uddisanti.
analyzed: disa atisajjane uddisati uddisanti
translated: Disa, to point out, uddisati, uddisanti.

original: Likha lekhane, likhati, likhanti.
analyzed: likha lekhane likhati likhanti
translated: Likha, to write, likhati, likhanti.

original: Phusa samphasse, phusati, phusanti iccādi.
analyzed: samphasse phusati phusanti iccādi
translated: Phusa, to touch, phusati, phusanti.

original: Tudādinayo.
analyzed: tud ādi nayoḥ
translated: The same applies to the verbs tudati, etc.

original: Hū, bhū sattāyaṃ, tyādyuppatti “bhūvādito a”iti appaccayo, “vā”ti adhikicca “lopañcettamakāro”ti
analyzed: hū bhū sattā ayam bhū vā āditaḥ aiti appaccayaḥ vāti
translated: The word bhū is formed by the addition of the affix -ā to the root hu, which is the first of the roots beginning with hu. The affix -ā is added by the rule “bhūvādito a” (Gr. 115), and the vowel of the root is lengthened by the rule “vā” (Gr. 116). The vowel of the affix is elided by the rule “lopañcettamakāra” (Gr. 117).

original: bhūvādito parassa appaccayassa lopo, “aññesu cā”ti vuddhi. So hoti, te honti, “kvaci
analyzed: bhū vā āditaḥ parassa appaccayassa lopaḥ aññesu ca ati so hoti te honti kvaci
translated: The vowel-sign is dropped before a following vowel, “and in other cases” the vowel-lengthening. He is, they are, “in some cases

original: dhātū”tiādinā parasarassa lopo. Hosi, hotha. Homi, homa. Bhāve hūyate.
analyzed: dhātu uti ādinā lopaḥ hosi hotha homi homa bhāve hūyate
translated: the root-sign” and so on, the vowel-sign is dropped before a following vowel. He is, you are, I am, we are. In the future he will be.

original: Tathā hotu, hontu. Hohi, anakāraparattā hilopo na bhavati, hotha. Homi, homa. Bhāve hūyataṃ.
analyzed: tathā hotu hontu hohi an akāra parattā hi lopaḥ na bhavati hotha homi homa bhāve
translated: So let it be, let them be. Be, you be, we be. In the future let it be.

original: Sattamiyaṃ saralopādi, heyya, heyyuṃ. Heyyāsi, heyyātha. Heyyāmi, heyyāma. Heyyaṃ vā. Bhāve hūyetha.
analyzed: sattamiyam sara lopa ādi heyya heyyum heyyāsi heyyātha heyyāmi heyyāma heyyam vā bhāve hūyetha
translated: This is the seventh section, dealing with the dropping of the vowel-sign and so on. He should be, they should be. You should be, you all should be. I should be, we should be. Or he should be. In the future let him be.

original: Hiyyattaniyaṃ appaccayalope “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā hūdhātussa ūkārassa uvādeso. Ahuvā,🔽ahuvu, ahuvū. Ahuva, ahuvo, ahuvattha. Ahuvaṃ, ahuvamha. Ahuvattha, ahuvatthuṃ. Ahuvase,
analyzed: ap paccaya lope kvaci dhātu uti ādinā hū dhātussa ūkārassa u vā ādesaḥ a hu vā  ahuvu ahuvū ahuva ahuvaḥ ahuvattha ahuvam ahuvamha ahuvattha ahuvatthum ahuvase
translated: In the third person singular the vowel-sign is dropped by “in some cases the root-sign” and so on, and the ū of the root-sign is changed to ū by “and in other cases”. He was,

original: ahuvavhaṃ. Ahuviṃ, ahuvamhase. Bhāve ahūyattha.
analyzed: ahuvavham ahuvim ahuvamhase bhāve ahūyattha
translated: they were, they were. He was, he was, you were. He was, we were. You were, you all were. He was, we were. You were, you all were. He was, we were. You were, you all were. He was, we were. In the future let him be.

original: Ajjatanimhi “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā hūto īvibhattissa lopo rassattaṃ, so ahu, lopābhāve
analyzed: ajja tanimhi kvaci dhātu uti ādinā hūtaḥ ī vibhattissa lopaḥ rassa ttam saḥ lopa abhāve
translated: In the present tense by “in some cases the root-sign” and so on the vowel-sign of the root-sign is dropped and the short vowel becomes long, he was, without the dropping of the vowel-sign,🔽he was.

original: “karassa kāsattamajjatanimhī”ti ettha “sattamajjatanimhī”ti yogavibhāgena sāgamo,🔽vuddhi, ahosi, ahesuṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā okārassekāro. Ahavuṃ vā. Ahosi, ahosittha.
analyzed: karassa kā satta majja tanimhi iti ettha satta majja tanimhi iti yogavibhāgena sa āgamaḥ  ahosi ahesum kvaci dhātu uti ādinā okāraḥ ikāraḥ vā ahosi ahosittha
translated: In the words karassa, kāsattamajjatanimhi, the prefix sa is compounded with the first syllable of the first word and with the first syllable of the second word.🔽The augment -u- is added, and the -a- of the first word and the -i- of the second word are elided.🔽The words ahosi, ahesuṃ, kvaci dhātū are formed by the addition of the augment -u- and the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the final -i- of the second word.

original: Ahosiṃ, ahuṃ, parasarassa lopo, rassattañca, ahosimha, ahumha, rassattaṃ. Bhāve ahūyittha.🔽“Hi lopaṃ vā”ti ito “lopo, vā”ti ca vattate.🔽490. Hotissare’hohe bhavissantimhi ssassa ca.
analyzed: ahosim ahum parasa rassa lopaḥ rassattam ca ahosimha ahumha rassattam bhāve ahūyittha  hi lopam vāti itas lopaḥ vāti ca vattate  hoti ssare ho he bhavissantimhi ssassa ca
translated: The words ahovuṃ, ahosi, ahositha, ahosiṃ, ahuṃ, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.🔽The words ahosimha, ahumha, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.🔽The words ahūyittha, ahūyitha, are formed by the addition of the augment -u- and the elision of the final -a- of the first word.🔽The words hotissare, hohe, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.

original: Hūiccetassa dhātussa saro eha oha ettamāpajjate bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi, ssassa ca lopo hoti vā. Ikārāgamo, saralopādi.🔽Hehiti, hehinti. Hehisi, hehitha. Hehāmi, hehāma. Lopābhāve – hehissati, hehissanti.
analyzed: hū i t ca itassa dhātussa saraḥ e haḥ o haḥ e t tam āpajjate bhavissantimhi vibhattimhi ssassa ca lopaḥ hoti vā ikāra āgamaḥ sara lopa ādi  hehiti hehinti hehisi hehitha hehāmi hehāma lopa abhāve hehissati hehissanti
translated: The words bhavissantimhi, ssassa ca, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.🔽The words hehiti, hehinti, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.🔽The words hehisi, hehitha, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.🔽The words hehāmi, hehāma, are formed by the elision of the final -a- of the first word and the addition of the augment -u-.

original: Hehissasi, hehissatha. Hehissāmi, hehissāma. Ohādese – hohiti, hohinti. Hohisi, hohitha.
analyzed: hehissasi hehissatha hehissāmi hehissāma oha ādese hohiti hohinti hohisi hohitha
translated: The words hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi, hehi

original: Hohāmi, hohāma. Tathā hohissati, hohissanti. Hohissasi, hohissatha. Hohissāmi, hohissāma.
analyzed: hohāmi hohāma tathā hohissati hohissanti hohissasi hohissatha hohissāmi hohissāma
translated: Hohāmi, hohāma. Tathā hohissati, hohissanti. Hohissasi, hohissatha. Hohissāmi, hohissāma.

original: Ekārādese – heti, henti. Hesi, hetha. Hemi, hema. Hessati, hessanti. Hessasi, hessatha.
analyzed: ekāra ādese heti henti hesi hetha hemi hema hessati hessanti hessasi hessatha
translated: In the ekārādeśa, heti, henti. Hesi, hetha. Hemi, hema. Hessati, hessanti. Hessasi, hessatha.

original: Hessāmi, hessāma. Bhāve hūyissate.
analyzed: hessāmi hessāma bhāve
translated: Hessāmi, hessāma. In the future hūyissate.

original: Kālātipattiyaṃ ahavissa, ahavissaṃsu. Ahuyissatha iccādi.
analyzed: kāla atipattiyam iccādi
translated: In the aorist ahavissa, ahavissaṃsu. Ahuyissatha, etc.

original: Hū, bhū sattāyaṃ, bhū itīdha anupubbo, tyādyuppatti appaccayassa lopavuddhiyo, anubhoti, anubhonti. Anubhosi, anubhotha. Anubhomi, anubhoma.
analyzed: hū bhū sattā ayam bhū iti idha anupubbaḥ appaccayassa lopa vuddhiyaḥ anubhoti anubhonti anubhosi anubhotha anubhomi anubhoma
translated: Hū, bhū, sattāyaṃ, bhū. Here the order is in regular sequence. The arising of tyādyuppatti, the elision of the indeclinable, and the addition of the augment are as follows: Anubhoti, anubhonti. Anubhosi, anubhotha. Anubhomi, anubhoma.

original: Kamme anubhūyati, anubhūyanti. Tathā anubhotu, anubhontu. Anubhohi, anubhotha. Anubhomi,
analyzed: anubhūyati anubhūyanti tathā anubhotu anubhontu anubhohi anubhotha anubhomi
translated: In the passive, anubhūyati, anubhūyanti. Tathā anubhotu, anubhontu. Anubhohi, anubhotha. Anubhomi,

original: anubhoma. Anubhūyatu, anubhūyantu. Anubhave, anubhaveyya. Anubhūyeyya. Anubhosi,
analyzed: anubhoma anubhūyatu anubhūyantu anubhave anubhaveyya anubhūyeyya anubhosi
translated: anubhoma. Anubhūyatu, anubhūyantu. Anubhave, anubhaveyya. Anubhūyeyya. Anubhosi,

original: anubhavi. Anubhossati, anubhossanti. Anubhossasi, anubhossatha. Anubhossāmi, anubhossāma.
analyzed: anubhavi anubhossati anubhossanti anubhossasi anubhossatha anubhossāmi anubhossāma
translated: anubhavi. Anubhossati, anubhossanti. Anubhossasi, anubhossatha. Anubhossāmi, anubhossāma.

original: Anubhavissati vā. Anubhossa, anubhavissa vā iccādi.
analyzed: anubhossati vā anubhossa anubhavissa vā iccādi
translated: Anubhavissati vā. Anubhossa, anubhavissa vā, etc.

original: Sī saye appaccayalopo, vuddhi ca, seti, senti. Sesi, setha. Semi, sema. Sete, sente iccādi.
analyzed: sī saye a p paccaya lopaḥ ca seti senti sesi setha semi sema sete sente iccādi
translated: In seti, etc., there is no elision of the vowel of the base, and there is lengthening: seti, senti; sesi, setha; semi, sema; sete, sente, etc.

original: Appaccayalopābhāve –
analyzed: ap paccaya lopa abhāve
translated: In the absence of elision:

original: “Sare”ti vattate, dhātuggahaṇañca.
analyzed: sarā iti vattate dhātu ggahaṇam ca
translated: “Sare” is used, and the verbal root is taken.

original: 491. E aya.
analyzed: e aya
translated: E aya.

original: Ekārassa dhātvantassa sare pare ayādeso hoti, saralopādi. Sayati, sayanti. Sayasi, sayatha. Sayāmi, sayāma.
analyzed: ekārassa dhātu antassa sare pare aya ādesaḥ hoti sara lopa ādi sayati sayanti sayasi sayatha sayāmi sayāma
translated: When the final vowel of a verbal root is followed by sare, the vowel is replaced by aya, and the sare is elided, etc.: sayati, sayanti; sayasi, sayatha; sayaṃi, sayaṃa.

original: Kamme atipubbo, “kvaci dhātvā”dinā yamhi rassasarassa dhātvantassa dīgho, atisīyate, atisīyante. Atisīyati, atisīyanti. Bhāve sīyate.🔽Tathā setu, sentu. Sehi, setha. Semi, sema. Sayatu, sayantu. Saya, sayāhi, sayatha.🔽Sayāmi, sayāma. Sayataṃ, sayantaṃ. Sayassu, sayavho. Saye, sayāmase. Atisīyataṃ,
analyzed: kamme atipubbaḥ kvaci dhātu ādinā yamhi rassa sarassa dhātu antassa dīghaḥ atisīyate atisīyante atisīyati atisīyanti bhāve sīyate  tathā setu sentu sehi setha semi sema sayatu sayantu saya sayāhi sayatha  sayāmi sayāma sayatam sayantam sayassu sayavhaḥ saye sayāmase atisīyatam
translated: In the passive, the prefix ati is added: atisīyate, atisīyante; atisīyati, atisīyanti. In the denominative: sīyate.

original: atisīyantaṃ. Atisīyatu, atisīyantu. Bhāve sīyataṃ.
analyzed: atisīyantam atisīyatu atisīyantu bhāve sīyatam
translated: Similarly: setu, sentu; sehi, setha; semi, sema; sayatu, sayantu; saya, sayāhi, sayatha; sayaṃi, sayaṃa; sayaṃ, sayaṃ; sayassu, sayavho; saye, sayāmase; atisīyataṃ, atisīyantaṃ; atisīyatu, atisīyantu; in the denominative: sīyataṃ.

original: Saye, sayeyya, sayeyyuṃ. Atisīyeyya. Bhāve sīyetha.
analyzed: saye sayeyya sayeyyum atisīyeyya bhāve sīyetha
translated: Saye, sayeyya, sayeyyuṃ. Atisīyeyya. Bhāve sīyetha.

original: Asayi, sayi, asayiṃsu, sayiṃsu, asayuṃ. Sāgame atisesi, atisesuṃ. Kamme accasīyittha, accasīyi, atisīyi. Bhāve sīyittha.
analyzed: asayi sayi asayiṃsu sayiṃsu asayum sa āgame atisesi atisesum kamme accasīyittha accasīyi atisīyi bhāve sīyittha
translated: Asayi, sayi, asayiṃsu, sayiṃsu, asayuṃ. Sāgame atisesi, atisesuṃ. Kamme accasīyittha, accasīyi, atisīyi. Bhāve sīyittha.

original: Sayissati, sayissanti. Ikārāgamābhāve sessati, sessanti. Kamme atisīyissatha, atisīyissati. Bhāve sīyissate.
analyzed: sayissati sayissanti ikāra āgama abhāve sessati sessanti kamme atisīyissatha atisīyissati bhāve sīyissate
translated: Sayissati, sayissanti. Ikārāgamābhāve sessati, sessanti. Kamme atisīyissatha, atisīyissati. Bhāve sīyissate.

original: Asayissā, asayissaṃsu. Kamme accasīyissatha iccādi.
analyzed: kamme icca ādi
translated: Asayissā, asayissaṃsu. Kamme accasīyissatha iccādi.

original: Nī pāpuṇane, dvikammakoyaṃ, ajaṃ gāmaṃ neti, nenti. Nesi, netha. Nemi, nema. Lopābhāve nayati, nayanti iccādi. Kamme nīyate gāmaṃ ajo devadattena, nīyare, nīyante. Nīyati, nīyanti.
analyzed: pāpuṇane ajam gāmam neti nenti nesi nemi nema lopa abhāve nayati nayanti iccādi kamme nīyate gāmam ajaḥ devadattena nīyante nīyante nīyanti
translated: Nī pāpuṇane, dvikammakoyaṃ, ajaṃ gāmaṃ neti, nenti. Nesi, netha. Nemi, nema. Lopābhāve nayati, nayanti iccādi. Kamme nīyate gāmaṃ ajo devadattena, nīyare, nīyante. Nīyati, nīyanti.

original: Tathā netu, nayatu. Nīyataṃ, nīyantaṃ. Naye, nayeyya. Nīyetha, nīyeyya. Anayi, nayi,
analyzed: tathā netu nayatu nīyatam nīyantam naye nayeyya nīyetha nīyeyya anayi nayi
translated: Tathā netu, nayatu. Nīyataṃ, nīyantaṃ. Naye, nayeyya. Nīyetha, nīyeyya. Anayi, nayi,

original: anayiṃsu, nayiṃsu. Vinesi, vinesuṃ. Anīyittha, nīyittha. Nayissati, nessati. Nayissate,
analyzed: anayiṃsu nayiṃsu vinesi vinesum anīyittha nīyittha nayissati nessati nayissate
translated: anayiṃsu, nayiṃsu. Vinesi, vinesuṃ. Anīyittha, nīyittha. Nayissati, nessati. Nayissate,

original: nīyissate, nīyissati. Anayissa, anīyissa iccādi.
analyzed: nīyissate nīyissati anayissa anīyissaḥ iccādi
translated: is being led, will be led. He is being led, he is being led.

original: Ṭhā gatinivattimhi, “vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: ṭhāḥ gati nivattimhi vāti vattate
translated: In the sense of ‘standing’ and ‘going’ and ‘returning’, ‘vā’ is said.

original: 492. Ṭhā tiṭṭho.
analyzed: ṭhā tiṭṭhaḥ
translated: ‘Ṭhā’ is ‘tiṭṭha’.

original: Ṭhāiccetassa dhātussa tiṭṭhādeso hoti vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, appaccayalopo.
analyzed: ṭhā i t ca i tassa dhātussa ti ṭṭhā ādesaḥ hoti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ a paccaya lopo
translated: The locative case of the root ‘ṭhā’ is ‘ṭhā’ or ‘tiṭṭha’. This word ‘vā’ is for the purpose of distinguishing the analysis, there is no elision of the prefix.

original: Tiṭṭhati, tiṭṭhanti. Ṭhāti, ṭhanti. Lopābhāve “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ṭhāto hakārāgamo
analyzed: tiṭṭhati tiṭṭhanti ṭhāti ṭhanti lopa abhāve kvacid dhātu uti ādinā ṭhātaḥ hakāra āgamaḥ
translated: He stands, they stand. He stands, they stand. In the absence of elision, by the rule ‘kvaci dhātū’ etc., the ‘ha’ of ‘ṭhā’ becomes ‘ā’

original: ca rassattaṃ, saṃpubbo saṇṭhahati, saṇṭhahanti. Ette adhiṭṭheti, adhiṭṭhenti.
analyzed: ca rassa ttam saṃpubbaḥ saṇṭhahati saṇṭhahanti ette adhiṭṭheti adhiṭṭhenti
translated: and the ‘ra’ is elided, the compound is ‘saṇṭhahati’, ‘saṇṭhahanti’. He determines, they determine.

original: Kamme –
analyzed: kamme
translated: In the passive voice –

original: 493. Yamhi dādhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha mathādīnamī.
analyzed: mā hā
translated: . In the sense of ‘becoming’ and ‘action’, ‘yamhi dā dhā mā ṭhā hā pā maha mathādīnamī’.

original: Bhāvakammavisaye yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hāpā maha matha iccevamādīnaṃ dhātūnaṃ🔽anto īkāramāpajjate, niccatthoyamārambho. Upaṭṭhīyati, upaṭṭhīyanti. Hakārāgame rassattaṃ,
analyzed: bhāva kamma visaye yamhi paccaye pare dā dhā mā ṭhā hāpā maha mathaḥ iti evamādīnam dhātūnam  antar īkāram āpajjate nicca atthaḥ yam ārambhaḥ upaṭṭhīyati upaṭṭhīyanti hakāra āgame rassattam
translated: In the sense of ‘becoming’ and ‘action’, in the case where the conditions are other, the ‘i’ is substituted for the ‘ā’ of the roots ‘dā’, ‘dhā’, ‘mā’, ‘ṭhā’, ‘hā’, ‘pā’, ‘maha’, ‘matha’ etc.🔽This is begun for the purpose of permanence. It is attended to, they are attended to. The ‘ha’ becomes ‘ā’ and the ‘ra’ is elided,

original: īkārāgamo ca, patiṭṭhahīyati, patiṭṭhahīyanti. Bhāve ṭhīyate.
analyzed: īkāra āgamaḥ ca patiṭṭhahīyati patiṭṭhahīyanti bhāve ṭhīyate
translated: and the ‘i’ is substituted, it is firmly established, they are firmly established. In the sense of ‘becoming’, it is stood upon.

original: Tathā tiṭṭhatu, tiṭṭhantu. Ṭhātu, ṭhantu. Saṇṭhahatu, saṇṭhahantu. Tiṭṭhe, tiṭṭheyya.🔽Saṇṭhe, saṇṭheyya, saṇṭheyyuṃ. Saṇṭhahe, saṇṭhaheyyuṃ. Aṭṭhāsi, aṭṭhaṃsu. Saṇṭhahi,
analyzed: tathā tiṭṭhatu tiṭṭhantu ṭhātu ṭhantu saṇṭhahatu saṇṭhahantu tiṭṭhe tiṭṭheyya  saṇṭhe saṇṭheyya saṇṭheyyum saṇṭhahe saṇṭhaheyyum aṭṭhāsi aṭṭhaṃsu saṇṭhahi
translated: Likewise let it stand, let them stand. Let it stand, let them stand. Let it be, let them be. Let it stand, let them stand.🔽Let it be, let them be, let them be. Let it be, let them be. It stood, they stood. Let it be, let them be.

original: saṇṭhahiṃsu. Pakiṭṭhissati, patiṭṭhissanti. Ṭhassati, ṭhassanti. Patiṭṭhahissati,🔽patiṭṭhahissanti. Patiṭṭhissa, patiṭṭhissaṃsu. Patiṭṭhahissa, patiṭṭhahissaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: saṇṭhahiṃsu pakiṭṭhissati patiṭṭhissanti ṭhassati ṭhassanti patiṭṭhahissati  patiṭṭhahissanti patiṭṭhissa patiṭṭhissaṃsu patiṭṭhahissa patiṭṭhahissaṃsu iccādi
translated: It will stand firm, they will stand firm. It will stand, they will stand. It will stand firm, they will stand firm. It will stand firm, they will stand firm.

original: Pā pāne, “vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: pā pāne vāti vattate
translated: Pā pāne, “vā” is said.

original: 494. Pā pibo.
analyzed: pā pibo
translated: Pā pibo.

original: Pāiccetassa dhātussa pibādeso hoti vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo.
analyzed: dhātussa piba ādesaḥ hoti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ
translated: The vowel of the root pā is changed to ā, or not, in the present tense. This word vā has the purpose of distinguishing the different vibhattis.

original: Pibati. Pibatu. Pibeyya. “Kvaci dhātvā”dinā bakārassa vakāro, pivati, pivanti. Pāti,
analyzed: pibati pibatu pibeyya kvaci dhātu ādinā bakārassa vakāro pivati pivanti pāti
translated: Pibati, pibatu, pibeyya. By the rule “Kvaci dhātvā” the ka of the third person singular is changed to 0, pivati, pivanti. Pāti,

original: pānti, panti vā. Pīyate, pīyante. Pīyati, pīyanti. Pivatu. Piveyya. Apāyi, pivi.
analyzed: pānti panti vā pīyate pīyante pīyati pīyanti pivatu piveyya apāyi pivi
translated: pānti, panti, or pīyate, pīyante. Pīyati, pīyanti. Pivatū, piveyya. Apāyi, pivi.

original: Pivissati. Apivissa iccādi.
analyzed: pivissati apivissaḥ iccādi
translated: Pivissati. Apivissa.

original: Asa bhuvi, vibhattuppatti, appaccayalopo, asa itīdha –
analyzed: asaḥ bhuvi ap paccaya lopaḥ asaḥ iti idha
translated: Asa bhuvi, vibhattuppatti, appaccayalopo, asa itīdha –

original: “Asasmā, antalopo”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: a sasmai anta lopaḥ iti ca vattate
translated: “After a, the vowel-sign is deleted” is what is said.

original: 495. Tissa tthittaṃ.
analyzed: tissa tthittam
translated: Tissa tthittaṃ.

original: Asaiccetasmā dhātumhā parassa tissa vibhattissa tthittaṃ hoti, dhātvantassa lopo ca. Atthi.
analyzed: dhātumhā parassa tissa vibhattissa tthittam hoti dhātu antassa lopo ca atthi
translated: After a, the vowel-sign of the particle is the tth- sign, and the vowel-sign of the preceding syllable is deleted. Atthi.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: vāti vattate
translated: “Vā” is said.

original: 496. Sabbatthāsassādi lopo ca.
analyzed: sabbattha a sassa ādi lopaḥ ca
translated: Sabbatthāsassādi lopo ca.

original: Sabbattha vibhattippaccayesu ca asaiccetāya dhātuyā ādissa lopo hoti vā, vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo. Santi.
analyzed: sabbattha vibhatti ppaccayesu ca dhātuyāḥ ādissa lopaḥ hoti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ santi
translated: After all the case-endings, the vowel-sign of the particle is deleted after the syllable a, or not, according to the rule of the Vavatthitavibhatti. Santi.

original: “Asasmā, antalopo”ti ca adhikāro.
analyzed: anta lopaḥ iti ca adhikāraḥ
translated: “Asasmā, antalopo” is the extension.

original: 497. Simhi ca.
analyzed: simhi ca
translated: . Simhi ca.

original: Asadhātussa antalopo hoti simhi vibhattimhi ca. Tvaṃ asi.
analyzed: a sa dhātussa anta lopaḥ hoti simhi vibhattimhi ca tvam asi
translated: After the syllable a, the vowel-sign is deleted, and after the case-ending si. Tvaṃ asi.

original: 498. Thassa tthattaṃ.
analyzed: thassa ttha ttam
translated: . Thassa tthattaṃ.

original: Asaiccetāya dhātuyā parassa thassa vibhattissa tthattaṃ hoti, dhātvantassa lopo ca. Tumhe attha.
analyzed: dhātuyā parassa thassa vibhattissa tthattam hoti dhātu antassa lopaḥ ca tumhe attha
translated: After the syllable a, the vowel-sign of the case-ending tha is the tth- sign, and the vowel-sign of the preceding syllable is deleted. Tumhe attha.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: vāti vattate
translated: “Vā” is said.

original: 499. Asasmā mimānaṃ mhimhāntalopo ca.
analyzed: a sasmā mimānam mhi mha anta lopaḥ ca
translated: . Asasmā mimānaṃ mhimhāntalopo ca.

original: Asaiccetāya dhātuyā parāsaṃ mi maiccetāsaṃ vibhattīnaṃ mhimhaiccete ādesā honti vā, dhātvantassa lopo ca. Amhi, amha. Asmi, asma.
analyzed: dhātuyā parāsam mi mait cetāsam vibhattīnam mhi mhait cete ādesāḥ honti vā dhātu antassa lopaḥ ca amhi amha asmi asma
translated: The endings mhi, mha, amhi, amha, asmi, asma are formed by the addition of mhi, mha, amhi, amha, asmi, asma to the base of the present stem, and by the elision of the final vowel of the base.

original: 500. Tussa tthuttaṃ.🔽Asaiccetāya dhātuyā parassa tussa vibhattissa tthuttaṃ hoti, dhātvantassa lopo ca. Atthu. Asassādilopo ca, santu. Āhi, attha. Asmi, asma.🔽Sattamiyaṃ asassādilopo, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā asato eyyaeyyuṃ vibhattīnaṃ iyāiyuñca honti. Siyā, siyuṃ.🔽Lopābhāve “kvaci dhātvā”dinā asato eyyādīnaṃ sadhātvantānaṃ ssa ssu ssa ssatha ssaṃ ssāmaādesā honti.
analyzed: tussa tthuttam  dhātuyā parassa tussa vibhattissa tthuttam hoti dhātu antassa lopaḥ ca atthu asassa ādi lopaḥ ca santu āhi attha asmi asma  a sassa ādi lopaḥ kvacid dhātu uti ādinā asataḥ vibhattīnam iyā iyuṃ ca honti siyā siyum  lopa abhāve kvacid dhātu ādinā asataḥ eyyā ādīnam sa dhātu antānam honti

original: Brūtu, bruvantu. Brūhi, brūtha. Brūmi, brūma. Brūtaṃ, bruvantaṃ. Bruve, bruveyya,🔽bruveyyuṃ. Bruveyyāsi, bruveyyātha. Bruveyyāmi, bruveyyāma. Bruvetha, bruveraṃ. Abruvā, abruvū.🔽Parokkhāyaṃ “brūbhūnamāhabhūvā parokkhāya”nti brūdhātussa āhaādeso, saralopādi, supine kira māha, tenāhu porāṇā, āhaṃsu vā iccādi.🔽Ajjataniyaṃ abravi, abruvi, abravuṃ. Bravissati. Abravissa iccādi.🔽Hana hiṃsāgatīsu, timhi kvaci appaccayalopo, hanti, hanati, hananti. Hanasi, hanatha. Hanāmi, hanāma.
analyzed: brūtu bruvantu brūhi brūtha brūmi brūma brūtam bruvantam bruve  bruveyyum bruveyyāsi bruveyyātha bruveyyāmi bruveyyāma bruvetha bruveram abruvau abruvū  parokkhāyanti parokkhāyanti brū dhātussa āha ādesaḥ sara lopa ādi supine kira mā āha tena āhu porāṇāḥ vā iccādi  ajjataniyam abravi abruvi abravum bravissati abravissaḥ iccādi  hana hiṃsā gatīsu timhi kvaci ap paccaya lopaḥ hanti hanati hananti hanasi hanatha hanāmi hanāma
translated: Let him speak, let them speak. Speak, speak. Let us speak, let us speak. Let them speak, let them speak. I speak, we speak. Let them speak, let them speak. I would speak, we would speak. Let them speak, let them speak. I would speak, we would speak. Let us speak, let us speak. I spoke, we spoke.🔽In the remote past, “Brūbhūnamāhabhūvā parokkhāya” (P. 1.1. 10), there is the substitution of āha for brūdhā, the elision of the initial syllable, etc. It is said that in a dream he spoke. Therefore the ancients said, “They spoke” and so on.🔽In the present, he spoke, they spoke. He will speak. He would speak. And so on.🔽In the sense of killing, striking, and going, in some cases the suffix -ya is elided. He kills, he strikes, they kill. You kill, you all kill. I kill, we kill.
