original: Hanaiccetassa dhātussa vadhādeso hoti vā sabbattha vibhattippaccayesu, vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ🔽vāsaddo. Vadheti. Vadhīyati. Vadhetu. Vadhīyatu. Vadheyya. Avadhi, avadhiṃsu. Ahani,
analyzed: hanai c ca itassa dhātussa vadha ādesaḥ hoti vā sabbattha vibhatti ppaccayesu  vāsaddaḥ vadheti vadhīyati vadhetu vadhīyatu vadheyya avadhi avadhiṃsu ahani
translated: The form of the root is used in the sense of killing, etc., in all cases, with all case-endings, for the purpose of distinguishing the various meanings.🔽The word vāda is used in the sense of killing, etc.

original: ahaniṃsu. Vadhissati, hanissati. Khādese paṭihaṅkhāmi, paṭihanissāmi. Avadhissa, ahanissa iccādi.
analyzed: a haniṃsu vadhissati hanissati khādese paṭihaṅkhāmi paṭihanissāmi a vadhissa a hanissa iccādi
translated: He kills, he is killed, let him kill, let him be killed, he would kill, he killed, they killed, he will kill, he will kill, I will resist, I will resist, he will kill, he will kill, etc.

original: Hūvādinayo.
analyzed: hū vā ādi nayoḥ
translated: The method of hū, etc.

original: Hu dānādanahabyappadānesu, tyādyuppatti, appaccayo ca, “kvacādivaṇṇānamekassarānaṃ dvebhāvo”ti dvittaṃ, “pubbobbhāso”ti abbhāsasaññā.
analyzed: hu dāna āda naha bi appadānesu ti ādi uppatti ca dvebhāvaḥ iti dvittam pubbobbhāsaḥ iti abbhāsa saññā
translated: Hu is the root for giving, taking, killing, abandoning, and giving up. The vowel u is the origin of the affix. The case-ending is the condition. “The vowel of the first member becomes double” (Gr. 11), so the vowel is doubled. “The first member is called the abbhāsā” (Gr. 12), so it is called the abbhāsā.

original: “Abbhāse”ti vattate.
analyzed: ap bhāsā iti vattate
translated: The word abbhāsā is used.

original: 504. Hassa jo.🔽Hakārassa abbhāse vattamānassa jo hoti. “Lopañcetta makāro”ti appaccayalopo, vuddhi. Juhoti.
analyzed: hassa jaḥ  hakārassa ap bhāse vattamānassa jaḥ hoti lopaṃ cetta makāraḥ ti appaccaya lopaḥ juhoti
translated: . The jo of hassa.🔽The jo is substituted for the abbhāsā of the hassa. “The m is elided if it is the first member” (Gr. 13), so the case-ending is elided. The vowel is lengthened. He offers.

original: Lopābhāve “jhalānaṃ, sare”ti ca vattamāne –
analyzed: lopa abhāve sara iti ca vattamāne
translated: If the elision does not take place, then –

original: 505. Yavakārā ca.
analyzed: yava kārā ca
translated: . And the yavakāra.

original: Jhalasaññānaṃ ivaṇṇuvaṇṇānaṃ yakāravakārādesā honti sare pareti apadantassa ukārassa vakāro.
analyzed: jha l a saññānam yakāra vakāra ādesāḥ honti sare para iti a pada antassa ukārassa vakāro
translated: The vowel of the root is changed to the vowel of the first person singular of the present indicative of the corresponding form of jhā, and the final -i of the present participle is elided.

original: Juhvati, juhoti, juhvanti, juhonti. Juhvasi, juhosi, juhvatha, juhotha. Juhvāmi, juhomi, juhvāma, juhoma.
analyzed: juhvati juhoti juhvanti juhonti juhvasi juhosi juhvatha juhotha juhvāmi juhomi juhvāma juhoma
translated: Juhoti, juhanti, juhanti, juhanti. Juhvasi, juhosi, juhvatha, juhotha. Juhvāmi, juhomi, juhvāma, juhoma.

original: Kamme “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dīgho, hūyate, hūyante. Hūyati, hūyanti.
analyzed: kvacid dhātu uti ādinā dīghaḥ hūyate hūyante hūyati hūyanti
translated: In the kammadhāraya compound, the vowel is lengthened by the rule kvaci dhātū, etc. Hūyate, hūyante. Hūyati, hūyanti.

original: Tathā juhotu, juhontu, juhvantu vā. Juhe, juheyya, juheyyuṃ. Ajuhavi, ajuhavuṃ. Ajuhosi,
analyzed: tathā juhotu juhontu juhvantu vā juhe juheyya juheyyum a juhosi
translated: Similarly, juhotu, juhontu, juhvantu or juhothu, juhonthu, juhantu. Juhe, juheyya, juheyyuṃ. Ajuhavi, ajuhavuṃ. Ajuhosi,

original: ajuhosuṃ. Ahūyittha aggi. Juhissati, juhissanti. Juhossati, juhossanti vā. Ajuhissa, ajuhissaṃsu iccādi.🔽Hā cāge, pure viya dvebhāvajādesa appaccayalopā.
analyzed: ajuhosum ahūyittha aggi juhissati juhissanti juhossati juhossanti vā ajuhissa iccādi  hā ca āge pure viya appaccaya lopā
translated: ajuhosuṃ. Ahūyittha aggi. Juhissati, juhissanti. Juhossati, juhossanti or juhissati, juhissanti. Ajuhissa, ajuhissaṃsu, etc.🔽Hā is the verbal noun of the root hu. In the aorist, the vowel of the root is lengthened by the rule kvaci dhātū, etc., and the syllable is reduplicated, but the suffix -ya is not elided.

original: “Abbhāse”ti vattate.🔽506. Rasso.
analyzed: ap bhāsā iti vattate  rasso
translated: The aorist is formed.🔽The reduplicated syllable is short.

original: Abbhāse vattamānassa sarassa rasso hoti.
analyzed: abbhāse vattamānassa sarassa rassaḥ hoti
translated: The reduplicated syllable of the root is short when the aorist is formed.

original: Jahāti, jahanti. Jahāsi, jahātha. Jahāmi, jahāma.
analyzed: jahāti jahanti jahāsi jahātha jahāmi jahāma
translated: Jahāti, jahanti. Jahāsi, jahātha. Jahāmi, jahāma.

original: Kamme “yamhi dādhāmāṭhāhāpāmahamathādīnamī”ti dhātvantassa īkāro. Hīyate, hīyante, hīyare. Hīyati, hīyanti.
analyzed: kamme yamhi dhātu antassa īkāraḥ hīyate hīyante hīyare hīyati hīyanti
translated: In the verb “yamhi dādhāmāṭhāhāpāmahamathādīnamī” the ī of the root is changed to ī.🔽Hīyate, hīyante, hīyare; hīyati, hīyanti.

original: Tathā jahātu, jahantu. Jahe, jaheyya, jaheyyuṃ. Hīyetha, hīyeyya. Ajahāsi, ajahiṃsu,
analyzed: tathā jahātu jahantu jahe jaheyya jaheyyum hīyetha hīyeyya a jahāsi
translated: So jahātu, jahantu; jahe, jaheyya, jaheyyuṃ; hīyetha, hīyeyya.

original: ajahāsuṃ. Pajahi, pajahiṃsu, pajahaṃsu, pajahuṃ. Kamme pajahīyittha, pajahīyi. Pajahissati,
analyzed: ajahāsum pajahi pajahiṃsu pajahaṃsu pajahum kamme pajahīyittha pajahīyi pajahissati
translated: Ajahāsi, ajahiṃsu, ajahaṃsu, ajahaṃsu; pajahi, pajahiṃsu, pajahaṃsu, pajahuṃ. In the passive: pajahīyittha, pajahīyi; pajahissati, pajahissanti.

original: pajahissanti. Hīyissati, hīyissanti. Pajahissa, pajahissaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: pajahissanti hīyissanti hīyissanti pajahissa pajahissaṃsu iccādi
translated: Hīyissati, hīyissanti; pajahissa, pajahissaṃsu, etc.🔽Dā means “giving”; the root is formed by the addition of tyā; the r of the second syllable is elided; the final a is elided; dadāti, dadanti.

original: Dā dāne, tyādyuppatti, dvebhāvarassattāni, appaccayassa lopo, dadāti, dadanti. Dadāsi, dadātha. Dadāmi, dadāma.
analyzed: dā dāne appaccayassa lopaḥ dadāti dadanti dadāsi dadātha dadāmi dadāma
translated: Dadāsi, dadātha; dadāmi, dadāma.

original: Dvittābhāve maṇḍūkagatiyā “vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: dvitta abhāve maṇḍūka gatiyā vāti vattate
translated: In the absence of the dvī-form, the mode of the frog is used: “vā”.

original: 507. Dādhātussa dajjaṃ.
analyzed: dādhātuḥ sa dajjam
translated: The dajjaṃ of the root dā.

original: Dāiccetassa dhātussa sabbassa dajjādeso hoti vā, vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo,
analyzed: dā i t ca itassa dhātussa sabbassa dajja ādesaḥ hoti vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ
translated: In the verb “dāiccetassa dhātussa sabbassa dajjādeso hoti vā” the dajjā-form of the root dā is used, or not, according as the verb is transitive or intransitive. The word vā here is used in the sense of “distinction” or “specification”.

original: appaccayalopo. Dajjati, dajjanti. Dajjasi, dajjatha. Dajjāmi, dajjāma. Dajjādesābhāve
analyzed: ap paccaya lopaḥ dajjati dajjanti dajjasi dajjatha dajjāmi dajjāma dajja ādesa abhāve
translated: The final a is elided. Dajjati, dajjanti. Dajjasi, dajjatha; dajjāmi, dajjāma. In the absence of the dajjā-form:

original: “lopañcettamakāro”ti appaccayassa ekāro, dānaṃ deti, denti. Desi, detha.
analyzed: appaccayassa ekāraḥ dānam deti denti desi detha
translated: “But the vowel a is changed to o by lopa” means that the vowel a of the preceding syllable is changed to o by the elision of the preceding syllable. He gives, they give. He gave, they gave.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.🔽508. Dādantassaṃ mimesu.🔽Dāiccetassa dhātussa antassa aṃ hoti vā mimaiccetesu paresu, niggahītassa vaggantattaṃ. Dammi, damma. Demi, dema.
analyzed: vāti vattate  mimesu  dā i t c e tassa dhātussa antassa aṃ hoti vā mi ma i c c e tesu paresu niggahītassa vak g anta ttam dammi damma demi dema
translated: “Vā” means “is used”.🔽. In the present tense, in the middle voice, in the future tense, and in the imperative mood.

original: Kamme “yamhi dādhā”iccādinā īkāro, dīyate, dīyante. Dīyati, dīyanti. Dīyyate, dīyyante. Dīyyati, dīyyanti vā iccādi.
analyzed: īkāraḥ dīyate dīyante dīyati dīyanti dīyyate dīyyante dīyyanti dīyyante dīyyanti dīyyanti vā it cādi
translated: “If the ending is aṃ, the vowel of the root is changed to ī” means that the vowel of the root is changed to ī if the ending is aṃ. It is given, they are given. It is given, they are given. It is given, they are given. It is given, they are given.

original: Dadātu, dadantu. Dadāhi, dadātha. Dadāmi, dadāma. Dadataṃ, dadantaṃ. Dadassu, dadavho.
analyzed: dadātu dadantu dadāhi dada atha dadāmi dadāma dadatam dadantam dadassu
translated: “Dadātu, dadantu” means “let him give, let them give”. “Dadāhi, dadātha” means “give to me, give to them”. “Dadāmi, dadāma” means “I give, we give”. “Dadataṃ, dadantaṃ” means “they give”. “Dadassu, dadavho” means “he should give, they should give”.

original: Dade, dadāmase. Dajjatu, dajjantu iccādi. Detu, dentu. Dehi, detha. Demi, dema. Kamme
analyzed: dade dadāmase dajjatu dajjantu iccādi detu dentu dehi detha demi dema kamme
translated: “Dade, dadāmase” means “we give”. “Dajjatu, dajjantu” means “let him give, let them give”. “Detu, dentu” means “let him give, let them give”. “Dehi, detha” means “give to me, give to them”. “Demi, dema” means “I give, we give”. In the passive voice

original: dīyataṃ, dīyantaṃ. Dīyatu, dīyantu.
analyzed: dīyatam dīyantam dīyatu dīyantu
translated: “dīyataṃ, dīyantaṃ” means “it is given, they are given”. “Dīyatu, dīyantu” means “let it be given, let them be given”.

original: Sattamiyaṃ dade, dadeyya, dadeyyuṃ. Dadeyyāsi, dadeyyātha. Dadeyyāmi, dadeyyāma. Dadetha, daderaṃ. Dadetho, dadeyyāvho. Dadeyyaṃ, dadeyyāmhe. Dajje, dajjeyya.
analyzed: dade dadeyya dadeyyum dadeyyāsi dadeyyāsi dadeyyāsi dadeyyāmi dadeyyāma dadetha daderam dadethaḥ dadeyya avhaḥ dadeyyam dadeyya amhe dajje dajjeyya
translated: Sattamiyaṃ dade, dadeyya, dadeyyuṃ. Dadeyyāsi, dadeyyātha. Dadeyyāmi, dadeyyāma. Dadetha, daderaṃ. Dadetho, dadeyyāvho. Dadeyyaṃ, dadeyyāmhe. Dajje, dajjeyya.

original: “Kvaci dhātū”tiādinā eyyassāttañca, dajjā, dajjuṃ, dajjeyyuṃ. Dajjeyyāsi, dajjeyyātha.
analyzed: kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dajjā dajjum dajjeyyum dajjeyyāsi dajjeyyātha
translated: “Kvaci dhātū”tiādinā eyyassāttañca, dajjā, dajjuṃ, dajjeyyuṃ. Dajjeyyāsi, dajjeyyātha.

original: Dajjaṃ, eyyāmissa amādeso ca, dajjeyyāmi, dajjeyyāma. Dvittābhāve deyya, deyyuṃ.
analyzed: dajjam eyyāmissa am ādesaḥ ca dajjeyyāmi dajjeyyāma dvitta abhāve
translated: Dajjaṃ, eyyāmissa amādeso ca, dajjeyyāmi, dajjeyyāma. Dvittābhāve deyya, deyyuṃ.

original: Deyyāsi, deyyātha. Dīyetha, dīyeyya.
analyzed: deyyā asi deyyātha dīyetha dīyeyya
translated: Deyyāsi, deyyātha. Dīyetha, dīyeyya.

original: Hiyyattaniyaṃ adadā, adadū. Adado, adadattha. Adadaṃ, adadamha. Adadattha, adadamhase. Kamme adīyittha.
analyzed: hiyyattaniyam adadā adadū adadaḥ adadattha adadam adadamha adadattha adadamhase kamme adīyittha
translated: Hiyyattaniyaṃ adadā, adadū. Adado, adadattha. Adadaṃ, adadamha. Adadattha, adadamhase. Kamme adīyittha.

original: Ajjatanimhi adadi, adadiṃsu, adaduṃ. Adajji, adajjiṃsu. Adāsi, adaṃsu. Adāsi, ado, adittha. Adāsiṃ, adāsimha, adamha. Adādānaṃ purindado. Kamme adīyittha, adīyyi.
analyzed: adadi adadiṃsu adadum adajji adajjiṃsu adāsi adaṃsu adāsi ado adittha adāsim adāsimha adamha adādānam purindado kamme adīyittha adīyyi
translated: Ajjatanimhi adadi, adadiṃsu, adaduṃ. Adajji, adajjiṃsu. Adāsi, adaṃsu. Adāsi, ado, adittha. Adāsiṃ, adāsimha, adamha. Adādānaṃ purindado. Kamme adīyittha, adīyyi.

original: Bhavissantiyaṃ ikārāgamo, saralopādi, dadissati, dadissanti. Dajjissati, dajjissanti.
analyzed: bhavissantiyam ikāra āgamaḥ sara lopa ādi dadissati dadissanti dajjissati dajjissanti
translated: The affix -i- will be added to this, the -ra- will be elided, etc., and the following forms will be formed: dadissati, dadissanti; dajjissati, dajjissanti.

original: Rassattaṃ, dassati, dassanti. Dassasi, dassatha. Dassāmi, dassāma. Dassate. Dīyissate, dīyissati.
analyzed: rassattam dassati dassanti dassasi dassatha dassāmi dassāma dassate dīyissate dīyissati
translated: Rassattaṃ, dassati, dassanti; dassasi, dassatha; dassāmi, dassāma; dassate; dīyissate, dīyissati.

original: Kālātipattiyaṃ adadissa, adajjissa, adajjissā, adassa, adassā, adassaṃsu. Adīyissatha, adīyissa iccādi.
analyzed: kāla atipattiyam adadissa adajjissa adajjissā adassa adassā adassaṃsu adīyissatha adīyissaḥ iccādi
translated: In the case of the violation of the time-periods, the following forms will be formed: adadissa, adajjissa, adajjissā, adassa, adassā, adassaṃsu; adīyissatha, adīyissa, etc.

original: Dhā dhāraṇe, pure viya vibhattuppatti, dvittarassattāni, appaccayalopo ca, “dutiyacatutthānaṃ
analyzed: dhā dhāraṇe pure viya appaccaya lopaḥ ca dutiya catutthānam
translated: Dhā, to hold: As in the past, the case-endings are added, and the following forms are formed: rassattaṃ, dvittarassattāni, appaccayalopo, “dutiyacatutthānaṃ

original: paṭhamatatiyā”ti dhakārassa dakāro, dadhāti, dadhanti. Apipubbo tassa “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā
analyzed: paṭhama tatiyā ti dhakārassa dakāraḥ dadhāti dadhanti apipubbaḥ tassa tesu vuddhi iti ādinā
translated: paṭhamatatiyā” (Pā. 1.1.55), therefore the -dhā- becomes -dhā-, dadhāti, dadhanti. The augment -pi- is added by the rule “tesu vuddhī” (Pā. 1.1.56),

original: akāralopo, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhakārassa hakāro, rassattañca, dvāraṃ pidahati,
analyzed: akāra lopaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dhakārassa hakāraḥ dvāram pidahati
translated: therefore the -ā- becomes -ā-, “kvaci dhātū” (Pā. 1.1.57), therefore the -dhā- becomes -dhā-, and rassattañca, dvāraṃ pidahati,

original: pidahanti. Dvebhāvābhāve nidhiṃ nidheti, nidhenti.
analyzed: pidahanti dvebhāva abhāve nidhim nidheti nidhenti
translated: pidahaṃti. In the absence of the dual and plural, nidhiṃ nidheti, nidhenti.

original: Kamme dhīyate, dhīyati, pidhīyate, pidhīyati.
analyzed: dhīyate dhīyati pidhīyate pidhīyati
translated: In the passive voice, dhīyate, dhīyati; pidhīyate, pidhīyati.

original: Tathā dadhātu, pidahatu, nidhetu, nidhentu. Dadhe, dadheyya, pidahe, pidaheyya, nidhe, nidheyya. Dadhāsi, pidahi. Dhassati, pidahissati, paridahessati. Adhassa, pidahissa iccādi.
analyzed: tathā dadhātu pidahatu nidhetu nidhentu dadhe dadheyya pidahe pidaheyya nidhe nidheyya dadhāsi pidahi dhassati pidahissati paridahessati adhassa pidahissa iccādi
translated: Likewise dadhātu, pidahatu, nidhetu, nidhentu. Dadhe, dadheyya, pidahe, pidaheyya, nidhe, nidheyya. Dadhāsi, pidahi. Dhassati, pidahissati, paridahessati. Adhassa, pidahissa.

original: Juhotyādinayo.
analyzed: juhoti ādinayaḥ
translated: Juhotyādinayo.

original: Avuddhikā tudādī ca, hūvādi ca tathāparo;
analyzed: ca ca
translated: Avuddhikā tudādī ca, hūvādi ca tathāparo;

original: Juhotyādi catuddhevaṃ, ñeyyā bhūvādayo idha.
analyzed: juhoti ādi ñeyyāḥ bhū ādayaḥ
translated: Juhotyādi catuddhevaṃ, ñeyyā bhūvādayo idha.

original: Bhūvādigaṇo.
analyzed: bhū ādi gaṇaḥ
translated: Bhūvādigaṇo.

original: Rudhādigaṇa
analyzed: rudh ādi gaṇa
translated: Rudhādigaṇa

original: Rudha āvaraṇe, pure viya dhātusaññādimhi kate vibhattuppatti.
analyzed: rudhaḥ āvaraṇe pure viya dhātu saññā ādimhi kate
translated: Rudha in the sense of covering, as before, the state of being a base is made, and then the case-ending is formed.

original: “A”iti vattate.
analyzed: aiti vattate
translated: “A” is added.

original: 509. Rudhādito niggahītapubbañca.
analyzed: rudh āditaḥ niggahīta pubban ca
translated: Rudhādito niggahītapubbañca.

original: Catuppadamidaṃ. Rudhaiccevamādito dhātugaṇato appaccayo hoti kattari vibhattippaccayesu,
analyzed: catuppadam idam dhātu gaṇataḥ ap paccayaḥ hoti kattari vibhatti ppaccayesu
translated: This is a group of four words. The base ending in -a is a suffix to the base ending in -a, in the sense of the agent, in the case-endings,

original: niggahītañca tato pubbaṃ hutvā āgamo hoti, tañca niggahītaṃ pakatiyā sarānugatattā
analyzed: niggahītam ca tatas pubbam hutvā āgamaḥ hoti tat ca niggahītam pakatiyā sara anugata ttā
translated: and the prefix niggahi is made first. And that prefix, because it is naturally connected with the base,🔽is after the base and the vowel-digraph,

original: dhātussarato paraṃ hoti. Casaddena iīeopaccayā ca, niggahītassa vaggantattaṃ. Idha
analyzed: dhātuḥ sarataḥ param hoti ca saddena i ī e o paccayā ca niggahītassa vagga anta ttam idha
translated: by the word ca, and the vowel-digraph iī is a suffix to the prefix niggahi, because the prefix niggahi has the state of being a vowel-group.

original: saṃyogantattā na vuddhi hoti, tadāgamassa taggahaṇena gahaṇato.
analyzed: na hoti tad āgamassa tad gahaṇena gahaṇato
translated: It does not grow by addition, because it is grasped by the grasping of that which is grasped by the grasping of that .

original: So maggaṃ rundhati, rundhanti. Rundhasi, rundhatha. Rundhāmi, rundhāma. Rundhate, rundhante iccādi, ikārādippaccayesu pana rundhiti, rundhīti, rundheti, rundhotītipi hoti.
analyzed: saḥ maggam rundhati rundhanti rundhasi rundhatha rundhāmi rundhāma rundhate rundhante iccādi ikāra ādi ppaccayesu pana rundhiti rundhi iti rundha iti rundha uti iti pi hoti
translated: He obstructs the path, they obstruct. You obstruct, you all obstruct. I obstruct, we all obstruct. They obstruct, they all obstruct. And so on. But in the case of the indeclinable particles beginning with i, the forms rundhiti, rundhīti, rundheti, rundhotī also occur.

original: Kamme nipubbo yappaccayassa “tassa cavagga”iccādinā sadhātvantassa jhakāre kate “vagge
analyzed: kamme nipubbaḥ ya p paccayassa tassa ca vagga e c ca ādinā sa dhātu antassa jha kāre kate vagge
translated: In the verb rundhati, the vowel of the root is changed to jhak by the rule “tassa cavagga” , etc., and then the reduplication is made by the rule “vagge ghosā” , etc.

original: ghosā”tiādinā dvittaṃ, maggo nirujjhate tena, nirujjhante. Parassapadatte nirujjhati,🔽nirujjhanti. Nirujjhasi, nirujjhatha. Nirujjhāmi, nirujjhāma.🔽Rundhatu, rundhantu. Rundhāhi, rundhatha. Rundhāmi, rundhāma. Rundhataṃ, rundhantaṃ.
analyzed: ghosa ati ādinā maggaḥ nirujjhate tena nirujjhante nirujjhati  nirujjhanti nirujjhasi nirujjhatha nirujjhāmi nirujjhāma  rundhatu rundhantu rundhāhi rundhatha rundhāmi rundhāma rundhatam rundhantam
translated: The path is obstructed by that, by them. It is obstructed, they are obstructed. It is obstructed by you, you all are obstructed. I am obstructed, we all are obstructed.🔽You obstruct, you all obstruct. You (sing.) obstruct, you all (pl.) obstruct. I obstruct, we all obstruct. They obstruct, they all obstruct.

original: Rundhassu, rundhavho. Rundhe, rundhāmase. Nirujjhataṃ, nirujjhantaṃ. Nirujjhatu,
analyzed: rundhassu rundhavhaḥ rundhe rundhāmase nirujjhatam nirujjhantam nirujjhatu
translated: You (sing.) should obstruct, you (pl.) should obstruct. You (sing.) obstruct, we all obstruct. They should obstruct, they all should obstruct. They obstruct, they all obstruct.

original: nirujjhantu. Rundhe, rundheyya, rundheyyuṃ. Rundhetha, rundheraṃ. Nirujjhetha, nirujjheyya🔽iccādi. Rundhi, rundhiṃsu. Arundhi, nirujjhittha. Nirujjhi, nirujjhiṃsu. Rundhissati,
analyzed: nirujjhantu rundhe rundheyya rundheyyum rundhetha rundheram nirujjhetha nirujjheyya  i c ca ādi rundhi rundhiṃsu arundhi nirujjhittha nirujjhi nirujjhiṃsu rundhissati
translated: May they cease. He would cut, they would cut. He should cut, they should cut. He would cease, they would cease.🔽Thus etc. He cut, they cut. He ceased, they ceased. He ceased, they ceased.

original: rundhissanti. Nirujjhissate, nirujjhissante. Nirujjhissati, nirujjhissanti. Arundhissa,
analyzed: rundhissanti nirujjhissate nirujjhissante nirujjhissati nirujjhissanti a rundhissa
translated: He will cut, they will cut. He will cease, they will cease. He will cease, they will cease. He would cut, they would cut.

original: arundhissaṃsu. Nirujjhissatha, nirujjhissa iccādi.
analyzed: nirujjhissatha nirujjhissaḥ iccādi
translated: They will cease, they will cease. Thus etc.

original: Chidi dvidhākaraṇe, chindati, chindanti. Kamme chijjate, chijjante. Chijjati, chijjanti.
analyzed: chidi dvidhākaraṇe chindati chindanti kamme chijjate chijjante chijjati chijjanti
translated: Chidi = to cut in two, he cuts, they cut. In the passive voice: it is cut, they are cut. It is cut, they are cut.

original: Tathā chindatu, chindantu. Chijjatu, chijjantu. Chinde, chindeyya. Chijjeyya. Achindi,🔽chindi, chindiṃsu. Achijjittha, chijji. Chindissati, chindissanti. Ssassa chādese
analyzed: tathā chindatu chindantu chijjatu chijjantu chinde chindeyya chijjeyya a chindi  chindi chindiṃsu achijjittha chijji chindissati chindissanti ssassa chādese
translated: Thus let him cut, let them cut. Let it be cut, let them be cut. He should cut, he should cut. It should be cut. He did not cut,🔽he cut, they cut. He did not cease, he ceased, they ceased. He will cut, they will cut. In the future passive:

original: – checchati, checchanti. Checchiti vā. Kamme chijjissate, chijjissante. Chijjissati,
analyzed: checchati checchanti checchiti vā kamme chijjissate chijjissante chijjissati
translated: – checchati, checchanti. Or checchiti. In the passive voice: it will be cut, they will be cut. It will be cut,

original: chijjissanti. Achindissa. Achijjissa iccādi.
analyzed: chijjissanti achindissa achijjissa iccādi
translated: will be cut. He would not cut. He would have cut.

original: Bhidi vidāraṇe, bhindati, bhindanti iccādi.🔽Yuja yoge, yuñjati, yuñjanti. Yujjate, yujjante. Yujjati, yujjanti. Yuñjatu. Yujjataṃ.🔽Yuñje. Yujjetha. Ayuñji, ayuñjiṃsu. Ayujjittha, ayujji. Yuñjissati, yuñjissanti.
analyzed: bhidi vidāraṇe bhindati bhindanti it ca ādi  yuja yoge yuñjati yuñjanti yujjate yujjante yujjanti yuñjatu yujjatam  yuñje yujjetha ayuñji ayuñjiṃsu ayujjittha ayujji yuñjissati yuñjissanti
translated: Bhidi means to split. He splits. They split.🔽Yuja means to yoke. He yokes. They yoke. He is yoked. They are yoked. He yokes. They yoke. He should yoke. They should yoke.

original: Yujjissate, yujjissante. Yujjissati, yujjissanti. Ayuñjissa. Ayujjissatha, ayujjissa iccādi.
analyzed: yujjissate yujjissante yujjissati yujjissanti ayuñjissa ayujjissatha ayujjissa iccādi
translated: He yoked. He should yoke. They yoked. They should yoke. He would yoke. They would yoke. He would have yoked. They would have yoked. He would yoke. They would yoke. He would have yoked. They would have yoked.

original: Bhuja pālanabyavaharaṇesu, bhuñjati, bhuñjanti iccādi.
analyzed: bhuja pālana byavaharaṇesu bhuñjati bhuñjanti iti cādi
translated: Bhuja means to protect and to use. He uses. They use.

original: Bhavissantiyaṃ “karassa sappaccayassa kāho”ti sutte sappaccayaggahaṇena bhujato ssassa
analyzed: bhavissantiyam karassa sa paccayassa sutte sa paccaya ggahaṇena bhujataḥ ssassa
translated: In the sutta “Karassa sappaccayassa kāho” the word “sappaccaya” is used. Therefore, the “ss” of bhuja is changed to “kh”

original: khādeso, “ko khe cā”ti dhātvantassa kakāro, vuddhi, bhokkhati, bhokkhanti. Bhokkhasi,
analyzed: kha ādesaḥ kaḥ khe ca ati dhātu antassa kakāraḥ bhokkhati bhokkhanti bhokkhasi
translated: by the rule “Ko khe cā” the vowel of the root is changed to “ā” and there is lengthening. He uses. They use. You use.

original: bhokkhatha. Bhokkhāmi, bhokkhāma. Khādesābhāve bhuñjissati, bhuñjissanti iccādi.
analyzed: bhokkhatha bhokkhāmi bhokkhāma khādesa abhāve bhuñjissati bhuñjissanti iccādi
translated: We use. I use. We use. In the absence of the change of “ss” to “kh” he will use. They will use.

original: Muca mocane, muñcati, muñcanti. Muccate, muccante. Muñcatu, muñcantu. Muccataṃ, muccantaṃ.🔽Muñce, muñceyya, muñceyyuṃ. Muccetha, mucceraṃ. Amuñci, amuñciṃsu. Amuccittha. Mokkhati,
analyzed: muca mocane muñcati muñcanti muccate muccante muñcatu muñcantu muccatam muccantam  muñce muñceyya muñceyyum muccetha mucceram amuñci amuñciṃsu amuccittha mokkhati
translated: Muñcati, muñcanti. Muccate, muccante. Muñcatu, muñcantu. Muccatu, muccantu.🔽Muñce, muñceyya, muñceyyuṃ. Muccetu, mucceram. Amuñci, amuñciṃsu. Amuccittha. Mokkhati,

original: mokkhanti. Muñcissati, muñcissanti. Muccissate, muccissante. Amuñcissa, amuccissatha iccādi.
analyzed: muñcissanti muñcissanti muccissate muccissante amuñcissa amuccissatha iccādi
translated: mokkhanti. Muñcissati, muñcissanti. Muccissate, muccissante. Amuñcissa, amuccissatha, etc.

original: Rudhādigaṇo.
analyzed: rudh ādi gaṇaḥ
translated: The group of roots beginning with rudh.

original: Divādigaṇa
analyzed: divādi gaṇa
translated: The group of roots beginning with div

original: Divu kīḷāvijigīsābyavahārajutithutikantigatīsu. Pure viya dhātvantalopavibhattuppattiyo.🔽510. Divādito yo.🔽Divādito dhātugaṇato yappaccayo hoti kattari vihitesu vibhattippaccayesu.
analyzed: divu kīḷā vijigīsā byavahāra juti thuti kanti gatīsu pure viya dhātu anta lopa vibhatta uppattiyaḥ  divā t itaḥ yaḥ  div āditaḥ dhātu gaṇataḥ ya paccayaḥ hoti kattari vihitesu vibhatti ppaccayesu
translated: Divu is a root meaning “to play,” “to conquer,” “to eat,” “to shine,” “to praise,” “to be beautiful,” and “to go.” As in the past, the vowel of the root is lost, and the augment -i- is added.🔽. The suffix -ya is added to the roots of the divā group.

original: “Yaggahaṇaṃ, cavagga yakāra vakārattaṃ sadhātvantassa, pubbarūpa”nti ca vattate.🔽511. Tathā kattari ca.🔽Yathā bhāvakammesu yappaccayassādeso hoti, tathā kattaripi yappaccayassa sadhātvantassa
analyzed: ya ggahaṇam ca vagga yakāra vakāra ttam sa dhātu antassa pubba rūpam ti ca vattate 🔽tathā kattari ca 🔽yathā bhāva kammesu ya ppaccayassa ādesaḥ hoti tathā kattari pi ya ppaccayassa sa dhātu antassa
translated: . The suffix -ya is added to the roots of the divā group when the verbal noun is expressed by the suffixes -tvā, -itvā, -itvāna, -itvāka, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ, -itvākaṃ

original: cavagga yakāravakārādeso, pubbarūpañca kātabbānīti dhātvantassa vakārattā saha tena🔽yakārassa vakāre kate dvibhāvo, “do dhassa cā”ti ettha caggahaṇena “bo vassā”ti vuttattā🔽vakāradvayassa bakāradvayaṃ, dibbati, dibbanti. Dibbasi, dibbatha. Dibbāmi, dibbāma.
analyzed: ca vagga yakāra vakāra ādesaḥ pubbarūpam ca kātabbāni iti dhātu antassa vakāra ttā saha tena  yakārassa vakāre kate dvi bhāvaḥ daḥ dhassa ca ati ettha ca ggahaṇena baḥ vassa ati vutta ttā  vakāra dvayassa bakāra dvayam dibbati dibbanti dibbasi dibbatha dibbāmi dibbāma
translated: After the vowel of the first syllable has been lengthened, the vowel of the second syllable is contracted.🔽The reduplication is dibba-, dibba-.

original: Kamme dibbate, dibbante. Dibbati, dibbanti. Dibbatu. Dibbataṃ. Dibbe. Dibbetha. Adibbi. Adibbittha. Dibbissati. Dibbissate. Adibbissa iccādi.
analyzed: kamme dibbate dibbante dibbati dibbanti dibbatu dibbatam dibbe dibbetha adibbi adibbittha dibbissati dibbissate adibbissaḥ icca ādi
translated: In the passive voice: dibbate, dibbante. Dibbati, dibbanti. Dibbatu. Dibbataṃ. Dibbe. Dibbetha. Adibbi. Adibbittha. Dibbissati. Dibbissate. Adibbissa.

original: Sivu tantasantāne, sibbati, sibbanti. Sibbatu. Sibbeyya. Asibbi, sibbi. Sibbissati. Asibbissa iccādi.🔽Pada gatimhi, upubbo dvittaṃ, “tathā kattari cā”ti sadhātvantassa yakārassa jakāro, dvittañca.
analyzed: tanta santāne sibbati sibbanti sibbatu sibbeyya a sibbi sibbi sibbissati a sibbissaḥ iccādi  pada gatimhi u pubbaḥ dvittam tathā kattari ca ati sa dhātu antassa yakārassa jakāraḥ dvittam ca
translated: Sibbati, sibbanti. Sibbatu. Sibbeyya. Asibbi, sibbi. Sibbissati. Asibbissa.🔽The reduplication is uppa-, uppa-.

original: Uppajjati, uppajjanti. Uppajjate, uppajjante, uppajjare.
analyzed: uppajjati uppajjanti uppajjate uppajjante uppajjare
translated: Uppajjati, uppajjanti. Uppajjate, uppajjante, uppajjare.

original: Kamme paṭipajjate, paṭipajjante. Paṭipajjati, paṭipajjanti. Bhāve uppajjate tayā.
analyzed: kamme paṭipajjate paṭipajjante paṭipajjati paṭipajjanti bhāve uppajjate tayā
translated: He practises in the action, he practises in the practice. He practises, they practise. He arises in the development by you.

original: Tathā uppajjatu. Uppajjeyya. Udapajjā. Udapajjatha. Udapādi, uppajjī. Uppajjittha. Uppajjissati. Uppajjissa, uppajjissā iccādi.
analyzed: tathā uppajjatu uppajjeyya udapajjā udapajjatha udapādi uppajjī uppajjittha uppajjissati uppajjissa uppajjissa iccādi
translated: So let him arise. He would arise. He arose. You arose. He arose, they arose. He arose, they arose. He will arise, he will arise, they will arise.

original: Budha avagamane, yappaccayaparattā na vuddhi, jhakārādesova viseso, dhammaṃ bujjhati, bujjhanti. Bujjhate, bujjhante, bujjhare vā.
analyzed: avagamane ya ppaccaya parattā na vuddhi jhakāra ādesaḥ uva visesaḥ dhammam bujjhati bujjhanti bujjhate bujjhante vā
translated: Budha = to understand: there is no increase in the sense of growth, but only a difference in the vowel sound, he understands the Dhamma, they understand. He understands, they understand, or he understands, they understand.

original: Kamme bujjhate mayā dhammo, bujjhante. Bujjhati, bujjhanti. Bujjhatu. Bujjheyya. Abujjhi. Abujjhittha. Bujjhissati. Abujjhissa.
analyzed: kamme bujjhate mayā dhammaḥ bujjhante bujjhati bujjhanti bujjhatu bujjheyya abujjhi abujjhittha bujjhissati abujjhissa
translated: He understands the Dhamma by me, they understand. He understands, they understand. Let him understand. He would understand. He understood. They understood. He will understand. He will understand, they will understand.

original: Yudha sampahāre, yujjhati, yujjhanti.
analyzed: yudha sampahāre yujjhati yujjhanti
translated: Yudha = to fight: he fights, they fight.

original: Kudha kope, kujjhati, kujjhanti.
analyzed: kudha kope kujjhati kujjhanti
translated: Kudha = to be angry: he is angry, they are angry.

original: Vidha tāḷane, vijjhati, vijjhanti iccādi.
analyzed: tāḷane vijjhati vijjhanti iti ca ādi
translated: Vidha = to strike: he strikes, they strike.

original: Naha bandhane, “ha vipariyayo”ti yogavibhāgena vipariyayo. Sannayhati, sannayhanti iccādi.
analyzed: naha bandhane ha yoga vibhāgena sannayhati iccādi
translated: Naha = to bind: “ha is the opposite” by the rule of the interchange of ha and na, he binds, they bind.

original: Mana ñāṇe, ñādesova viseso, maññati, maññanti iccādi.
analyzed: manaḥ ñāṇe ña ādesaḥ uva visesaḥ maññati maññanti iccādi
translated: Mana in the sense of knowing: the difference is only in the vowel; he thinks, they think, and so on.

original: Dā ādāne, saṃāpubbo “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā yamhi dhātvantassa ikāro, sīlaṃ samādiyati, samādiyanti iccādi.
analyzed: dāḥ ādāne sam ā pubbaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā yamhi dhātu antassa ikāraḥ sīlam samādiyati samādiyanti iccādi
translated: Dā in the sense of taking: the vowel i is substituted for the final vowel of the verbal base according to the rule “kvaci dhātū” , etc.; he undertakes, they undertake, and so on.

original: Tusa pītimhi, yappaccayassa pubbarūpattaṃ, tussati, tussanti iccādi.
analyzed: tusa pītimhi yap paccayassa pubbarūpattam tussati tussanti iccādi
translated: Tusa in the sense of delight: the form of the present participle is used as the verbal base; he delights, they delight, and so on.

original: Tathā samu upasame, sammati, sammanti.
analyzed: tathā samu upasame sammati sammanti
translated: So in the sense of peace: it is peaceful, they are peaceful.

original: Kupa kope, kuppati, kuppanti.
analyzed: kupa kope kuppati kuppanti
translated: Kupa in the sense of anger: it is angry, they are angry.

original: Janajanane, “janādīnamā timhi cā”ti ettha “janādīnamā”ti yogavibhāgena yamhi dhātvantassa ākāro. Jāyati, jāyanti. Jāyate, jāyante.
analyzed: jana janane jana ādīnamā timhi ca ati ettha jana ādīnamā ati yoga vibhāgena yamhi dhātu antassa ākāraḥ jāyati jāyanti jāyate jāyante
translated: Jana in the sense of being born: the form of the verbal base is used as the verbal base according to the rule “janādīnamā timhi ca” , etc.; it is born, they are born; it is born, they are born.

original: Kamme janīyati, janīyanti. Jāyatu. Jāyeyya. Ajāyi, ajani. Jāyissati, janissati. Ajāyissa, ajanissa iccādi.
analyzed: janīyati janīyanti jāyatu jāyeyya ajāyi ajani jāyissati janissati ajāyissa ajanissa iccādi
translated: In the passive voice: it is being born, they are being born. May it be born! It might be born. It was born, it was being born. It will be born, it will be being born. It would be born, it would be being born.

original: Divādigaṇo.🔽Svādigaṇa🔽Su savaṇe, pure viya vibhattuppatti.
analyzed: div ādi gaṇaḥ  su ādi gaṇa  su savaṇe pure viya
translated: The group of words beginning with divā .🔽The group of words beginning with svā .🔽Su in the sense of hearing: the formation of the verbal noun is as in the case of pure ;

original: 512. Svādito ṇuṇāuṇā ca.
analyzed: su āditaḥ ṇu ṇa au ṇā ca
translated: The verbal noun is formed in ṇuṇā and ṇā.

original: Suiccevamādito dhātugaṇato ṇu ṇāuṇāiccete paccayā honti kattari vihitesu vibhattippaccayesu.🔽“Aññesu cā”ti ettha caggahaṇena ṇuppaccayassa vuddhi. Tatthevānuvattitavāggahaṇena🔽svādīnaṃ ṇuṇādīsu na vuddhi.🔽Dhammaṃ suṇoti, saralopādi, suṇanti. Suṇosi, suṇotha. Suṇomi, suṇoma. Ṇāpaccaye suṇāti, suṇanti. Suṇāsi, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā rassattaṃ, suṇasi, suṇātha, suṇatha. Suṇāmi, suṇāma.
analyzed: su it ca evamāditaḥ dhātu gaṇataḥ ṇu ṇā u ṇā it ca ete paccayāḥ honti kattari vihitesu vibhatti ppaccayesu  aññesu ca ati ettha ca ggahaṇena ṇup paccayassa  su ādīnam ṇu ṇ ādīsu na vuddhi  dhammam suṇoti sara lopa ādi suṇanti suṇosi suṇotha suṇomi suṇoma ṇā paccaye suṇāti suṇanti suṇāsi kvacid dhātu uti ādinā rassattam suṇasi suṇātha suṇatha suṇāmi suṇāma
translated: Thus, when the suffixes are added to the verbal roots, the following are the conditions for the case endings in the active voice:🔽In the words beginning with “aññesu ca” the suffix ṇu is extended by the word ca.🔽In the words beginning with “tatheva anuvattitvā” the suffix ṇu is not extended.🔽He hears the Dhamma. The letter ra is elided. They hear. You hear. You all hear. I hear. We hear. In the case of the suffix ṇā, he hears. They hear. You hear. In some verbal roots, the letter a is elided. You all hear. You hear. We hear.

original: Kamme yappaccaye “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dīgho, sūyate, sūyante. Sūyati, sūyanti. Dvitte rassattaṃ, suyyati, suyyanti. Sūyyati, sūyyanti vā.🔽Suṇotu, suṇantu. Suṇohi, suṇotha. Suṇomi, suṇoma. Suṇātu, suṇantu. Suṇa, suṇāhi,🔽suṇātha. Suṇāmi, suṇāma. Suṇataṃ, suṇantaṃ. Suṇassu, suṇavho. Suṇe, suṇāmase. Kamme
analyzed: kamme ya p paccaye kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dīghaḥ sūyate sūyante sūyati sūyanti dvitte rassattam vā 🔽suṇotu suṇantu suṇohi suṇotha suṇomi suṇoma suṇātu suṇantu suṇa suṇāhi 🔽suṇātha suṇāmi suṇāma suṇatam suṇantam suṇassu suṇavhaḥ suṇe suṇāmase kamme
translated: Thus, in the case of the verbs beginning with the present tense, the following are the conditions for the addition of the case endings when the agent is expressed: ṇu, ṇā, ṇā, ṇi, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe, ṇe,

original: sūyataṃ, sūyantaṃ. Sūyatu, sūyantu.🔽Suṇe, suṇeyya, suṇeyyuṃ. Suṇeyyāsi, suṇeyyātha. Suṇeyyāmi, suṇeyyāma. Suṇetha, suṇeraṃ. Suṇetho, suṇeyyāvho. Suṇeyyaṃ, suṇeyyāmhe. Sūyetha, sūyeyya.
analyzed: sūyatam sūyantam sūyatu sūyantu  suṇe suṇeyya suṇeyyum suṇeyyāsi suṇeyyātha suṇeyyāmi suṇeyyāma suṇetha suṇeram suṇethaḥ suṇeyyāvhaḥ suṇeyyam suṇeyyāmhe sūyetha sūyeyya
translated: May he hear, may they hear. Let him hear, let them hear.🔽He would hear, they would hear. You would hear, you all would hear. I would hear, we would hear. Let him hear, let them hear. Let you (sg.) hear, let you (pl.) hear. Let me hear, let us hear. Let him hear, let them hear.

original: Asuṇi, suṇi, asuṇiṃsu, suṇiṃsu. Asuṇi, asuṇittha. Asuṇiṃ, suṇiṃ, asuṇimha, suṇimha.🔽Asuṇittha, suṇittha. Ṇāpaccayalopo, vuddhi, sassa dvibhāvo, sāgamo, assosi, assosiṃsu,
analyzed: asuṇi suṇi asuṇiṃsu suṇiṃsu asuṇi asuṇittha asuṇim suṇiṃ asuṇimha suṇimha  a suṇittha suṇittha ṇā paccaya lopaḥ vuddhi sassa dvi bhāvaḥ sa āgamaḥ assosi assosiṃsu
translated: He heard, he heard. They heard, they heard. He heard, they heard. He heard, they heard. We heard, we heard.🔽The negative prefix a-, the elision of ṇā, the augment -ss-, the doubling of the final consonant, the augment -o-, the form assosi, they heard,

original: paccassosuṃ. Assosi, assosittha. Assosiṃ, assosimha, assosimhā vā, assosittha. Asūyittha, assūyi.🔽Saralopādi, suṇissati, suṇissanti. Suṇissasi, suṇissatha. Suṇissāmi, suṇissāma. Suṇissate,
analyzed: paccassosum assosi assosittha assosiṃ assosimha assosimha vā assosittha asūyittha assūyi  sara lopa ādi suṇissati suṇissanti suṇissasi suṇissatha suṇissāmi suṇissāma suṇissate
translated: they all heard. He heard, they heard. He heard, we heard, we two heard, they heard. He heard, they heard.🔽The elision of ṇā, the augment -ss-, the augment -o-, the form suṇissati, he will hear, they will hear. You will hear, you all will hear. I will hear, we will hear. He will hear,

original: suṇissante. Suṇissase, suṇissavhe. Suṇissaṃ, suṇissāmhe. Ṇāpaccayalopo, vuddhi, sossati,
analyzed: suṇissante suṇissase suṇissavhe suṇissam suṇissāmhe ṇā paccaya lopaḥ sossati
translated: they will hear. You (sg.) will hear, you (pl.) will hear. I will hear, we will hear. The elision of ṇā, the augment -ss-, the augment -o-, the form sossati,🔽he will hear,

original: sossanti. Sossasi, sossatha. Sossāmi, sossāma. Sossate. Sūyissate, sūyissati. Asuṇissa. Asūyissa iccādi.
analyzed: sossanti sossasi sossatha sossāmi sossāma sossate sūyissate sūyissati asuṇissa asūyissa iccādi
translated: Sossati, sossasi, sossatha, sossāmi, sossāma, sossate, sūyissate, sūyissati, asuṇissa, asūyissa, etc.

original: Hi gatimhi, papubbo ṇāpaccayo, pahiṇāti, pahiṇati vā, pahiṇanti. Pahiṇātu, pahiṇantu. Pahiṇeyya. Pahiṇi, dūtaṃ pāhesi. Pahiṇissati. Pahiṇissa iccādi.
analyzed: hi gatimhi pa pubbaḥ ṇā paccayaḥ pahiṇāti pahiṇati vā pahiṇanti pahiṇātu pahiṇantu pahiṇeyya pahiṇi dūtam pāhesi pahiṇissati pahiṇissaḥ iccādi
translated: Hi means ‘going’, and papubbo is the affix ṇā, as in pahiṇāti, pahiṇati, pahiṇanti, pahiṇātu, pahiṇantu, pahiṇeyya, pahiṇi, dūtaṃ pāhesi, pahiṇissati, pahiṇissa, etc.

original: Vu saṃvaraṇe, āvuṇāti, āvuṇanti iccādi.
analyzed: saṃvaraṇe āvuṇāti āvuṇanti iccādi
translated: Vu means ‘covering’, as in āvuṇāti, āvuṇanti, etc.

original: Mi pakkhepe, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ṇassa nattaṃ, minoti, minanti iccādi.🔽Apa pāpuṇane, papubbo saralope “dīgha”nti dīgho, uṇāpaccayo, sampattiṃ pāpuṇāti, pāpuṇanti. Pāpuṇāsi, pāpuṇātha. Pāpuṇāmi, pāpuṇāma.
analyzed: mi pakkhepe kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ṇassa nattam minoti minanti iccādi  apa pāpuṇane papubbaḥ sara lope dīghanti dīghaḥ uṇā paccayaḥ sampattim pāpuṇāti pāpuṇanti pāpuṇāsi pāpuṇātha pāpuṇāmi pāpuṇāma
translated: Mi means ‘throwing away’, as in minoti, minanti, etc.

original: Kamme pāpīyati, pāpīyanti. Tathā pāpuṇātu. Pāpīyatu. Pāpuṇe, pāpuṇeyya. Pāpīyeyya. Pāpuṇi, pāpuṇiṃsu. Pāpīyi. Pāpuṇissati. Pāpīyissati. Pāpuṇissa. Pāpīyissa iccādi.
analyzed: kamme pāpīyati pāpīyanti tathā pāpuṇātu pāpīyatu pāpuṇe pāpuṇeyya pāpīyeyya pāpuṇi pāpuṇiṃsu pāpīyi pāpuṇissati pāpīyissati pāpuṇissa pāpīyissa iccādi
translated: Apa means ‘to reach’, as in sampattiṃ pāpuṇāti, pāpuṇanti, pāpuṇāsi, pāpuṇātha, pāpuṇāmi, pāpuṇāma, pāpīyati, pāpīyanti, pāpuṇātu, pāpīyatu, pāpuṇe, pāpuṇeyya, pāpīyeyya, pāpuṇi, pāpuṇiṃsu, pāpīyi, pāpuṇissati, pāpīyissati, pāpuṇissa, pāpīyissa, etc.

original: Saka sattimhi, dvibhāvo, sakkuṇāti, sakkuṇanti. Bhāve “pubbarūpañcā”ti pubbarūpattaṃ,
analyzed: saka sattimhi dvi bhāvaḥ sakkuṇāti sakkuṇanti bhāve pubbarūpam ca ati pubbarūpattam
translated: In the case of the word sakka, the form sakkuṇāti is made by adding the suffix -ṇāti to the root sakkuṇ-, which is formed by adding the suffix -u- to the root sak-, and the forms sakkuṇanti and sakkuṇāti are made by adding the suffix -anti and -ati respectively to the same root sakkuṇ-. The form sakkuṇeyya is made by adding the suffix -eyya to the same root sakkuṇ-.

original: sakkate tayā, sakkati vā, sakkuṇātu. Sakkuṇeyya. “Kvaci dhātū”tiādinā sakantassa
analyzed: tayā sakkati vā sakkuṇātu sakkuṇeyya kvaci dhātu uti ādinā sakantassa
translated: The form sakkate is made by adding the suffix -te to the root sak-, and the forms sakkati and sakkuṇātu are made by adding the suffixes -ti and -tu respectively to the same root sak-.

original: khādeso ajjatanādimhi, asakkhi, sakkhi, asakkhiṃsu, sakkhiṃsu. Sakkhissati, sakkhissanti.
analyzed: kha ādesaḥ ajja tana ādimhi asakkhi sakkhi asakkhiṃsu sakkhiṃsu sakkhissati sakkhissanti
translated: The forms asakkhi, sakkhi, asakkhiṃsu, sakkhiṃsu are made by adding the suffixes -i, -iṃsu, -iṃsu respectively to the root sak-. The forms sakkhissati and sakkhissanti are made by adding the suffixes -issati and -issanti respectively to the same root sak-.

original: Asakkhissa, asakkhissaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: asakkhissa iccādi
translated: The forms asakkhissa, asakkhissaṃsu are made by adding the suffixes -issa and -issaṃsu respectively to the same root asakkh-.

original: Svādigaṇo.
analyzed: su ādi gaṇaḥ
translated: The group with svā as the first member.

original: Kiyādigaṇa
analyzed: kiyā ādi gaṇa
translated: The group with kī as the first member

original: Kī dabbavinimaye, vipubbo dvittaṃ, pure viya vibhattuppatti.🔽513. Kiyādito nā.
analyzed: kī dabba vinimaye vi pubbaḥ dvi ttam pure viya  kiyāt itaḥ nā
translated: The form kīyati is made by adding the suffix -i to the root kī, which is formed by adding the suffix -u- to the root ki-. The form vipubbo is made by adding the suffix -ubbo to the root vi-. The form dvittaṃ is made by adding the suffix -ttaṃ to the root dvi-. The form pure is made by adding the suffix -e to the root pu-.🔽The form nā is made by adding the suffix -ā to the root na.

original: Kīicceva mādito dhātugaṇato nāpaccayo hoti kattari. Nāparattā na vuddhi, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā kiyādīnaṃ nāmhi rassattaṃ, kīto nāpaccayanakārassa ṇattañca.
analyzed: kī i t ca iva ma āditaḥ dhātu gaṇataḥ na a paccayaḥ hoti kattari na aparattā na kvaci dhātu uti ādinā kiyā ādīnam nāmhi rassa ttam kī taḥ nā paccaya nakārassa ṇa ttam ca
translated: The form nā is made by adding the suffix -ā to the root na, but not in the sense of “another” or “increase”. The forms kīto and nāpaccayanakārassa ṇattañca are made by adding the suffixes -o and -ṇattaṃ respectively to the roots kī and na.

original: Bhaṇḍaṃ vikkiṇāti, vikkiṇanti. Vikkīyati, vikkīyanti. Vikkiṇātu, vikkiṇantu. Vikkīyatu,
analyzed: bhaṇḍam vikkiṇāti vikkiṇanti vikkīyati vikkīyanti vikkiṇātu vikkiṇantu vikkīyatu
translated: The forms vikkiṇāti and vikkiṇanti are made by adding the suffixes -ati and -anti respectively to the root vikkiṇ-. The forms vikkīyati and vikkīyanti are made by adding the suffix -i to the same root

original: vikkīyantu. Vikkiṇe, vikkiṇeyya. Vikkīyeyya, vikkīyeyyuṃ. Avikkiṇi, vikkiṇi. Vikkīyittha,
analyzed: vikkīyantu vikkiṇe vikkiṇeyya vikkīyeyya vikkīyeyyum a vikkiṇi vikkīyittha
translated: Let them be sold. He would sell, they would sell. He would sell, they would sell. He did not sell, he sold. He sold, they sold.

original: vikkīyi. Vikkiṇissati, vikkiṇissanti. Vikkīyissati, vikkīyissanti. Avikkiṇissa, avikkiṇissaṃsu.
analyzed: vikkīyi vikkiṇissati vikkiṇissanti vikkīyissati vikkīyissanti a vikkiṇissan
translated: He will sell, they will sell. He will be sold, they will be sold. He will not sell, they will not sell.

original: Vikkīyissa, vikkīyissaṃsu iccādi.
analyzed: vikkīyissa iccādi
translated: He will be sold, they will be sold.

original: Ji jaye, kilese jināti, jinanti. Jīyati, jīyanti. Evaṃ jinātu. Jīyatu. Jineyya. Jīyeyya.
analyzed: ji jaye kilese jināti jinanti jīyati jīyanti evam jinātu jīyatu jineyya jīyeyya
translated: Ji means to conquer, he conquers defilements, they conquer. He is conquered, they are conquered. Thus let him conquer. Let him be conquered. He would conquer. He would be conquered.

original: Ajini, jini, ajiniṃsu, jiniṃsu. Ajesi, ajesuṃ. Ajinittha. Ajīyittha, ajīyi. Jinissati,
analyzed: ajini jini ajiniṃsu jiniṃsu ajesi ajesum ajinittha ajīyittha ajīyi jinissati
translated: He did not conquer, he conquered, they did not conquer, they conquered. He caused to conquer, they caused to conquer. He conquered, they conquered. He conquered, they conquered. He will conquer,

original: jinissanti. Vijessati, vijessanti. Jīyissati, jīyissanti. Ajinissa. Ajīyissa iccādi.
analyzed: jinissanti vijessati vijessanti jīyissanti jīyissanti ajinissa ajīyissaḥ iccādi
translated: they will conquer. He will be conquered, they will be conquered. He will be conquered, they will be conquered. He will not conquer, he will not be conquered.

original: Tathā ci caye, cināti, cinanti iccādi.
analyzed: tathā ci caye cināti cinanti it cādi
translated: Ci means to collect, he collects, they collect, etc.

original: Ñā avabodhane nāpaccayo.
analyzed: ñā avabodhane nā paccayaḥ
translated: Ñā means to understand.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: vāti vattate
translated: The particle “vā” is used.

original: 514. Ñāssa jā jaṃ nā.🔽Ñāiccetassa dhātussa jā jaṃ nāiccete ādesā honti vā.
analyzed: ñāssa jāḥ jam nā  ñā i t ca itassa dhātussa jā jam nā i t ca ite ādesāḥ honti vā
translated: Ñāssa jā jaṃ nā.🔽The substitution of jā jaṃ nā for the root ñā occurs optionally.

original: Jādeso nāmhi jaṃ ñāmhi, nābhāvo timhi evidha;
analyzed: ja ādesaḥ nāmhi jam ñāmhi nā bhāvaḥ timhi e vidha
translated: The substitution called jā is ñā, the substitution called jaṃ is ñā, the substitution called nā is ñā, the state of non-existence is in timhi and evidha;

original: Vavatthitavibhāsattha-vāsaddassānuvattanā;
analyzed: vavatthita vibhāsa ttha vā saddassa anuvattanā
translated: The meaning of the words vavatthita, vibhāsita, and vāsaddassana is in accordance with the words vavatthāna, vibhāsā, and vāsaddassana.

original: Dhammaṃ vijānāti, vināyati vā, vijānanti.🔽Kamme viññāyati, viññāyanti. Ivaṇṇāgame pubbalopo, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ekāro, dvittañca,🔽ñeyyati, ñeyyanti. Vijānātu, vijānantu, rassattaṃ. Vijāna, vijānāhi, vijānātha. Vijānāmi,
analyzed: dhammam vijānāti vināyati vā vijānanti  kamme viññāyati viññāyanti i vaṇṇa āgame pubba lopaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ekāraḥ  vijānātu vijānantu rassattam vijāna vijānāhi vijānātha vijānāmi
translated: The meaning of the words vijānāti, vināyati, vijānanti, and vijānanti is in accordance with the words vijānāti, vināyati, vijānanti, and vijānanti.

original: vijānāma. Vijānataṃ, vijānantaṃ. Vijānassu. Viññāyatu, viññāyantu.
analyzed: vijānāma vijānatam vijānantam vijānassu viññāyatu viññāyantu
translated: The meaning of the words kamme viññāyati, viññāyanti is in accordance with the words kamme viññāyati, viññāyanti. The meaning of the words ñeyyati, ñeyyanti is in accordance with the words ñeyyati, ñeyyanti. The meaning of the words vijānātu, vijānantu, rassattaṃ, vijān, vijānāhi, vijānātha, vijānāmi, vijānāma, vijānataṃ, vijānantaṃ, vijānassu, viññāyatu, viññāyantu is in accordance with the words vijānātu, vijānantu, rassattaṃ, vijān, vijānāhi, vijānātha, vijānāmi, vijānāma, vijānataṃ, vijānantaṃ, vijānassu, viññāyatu, viññāyantu.

original: 515. Eyyassa ñāto iyā ñā vā.🔽Eyyassa vibhattissa ñāiccetāya dhātuyā parassa iyā ñāiccete ādesā honti vā, saralopādi. Vijāniyā.
analyzed: eyyassa ñā taḥ iyāḥ ñā vā  eyyassa vibhattissa ñā i c ca etāya dhātuyā parassa iyāḥ ñā i c ca ete ādesāḥ honti vā sara lopa ādi
translated: The meaning of the words eyyassa ñāto, iyā ñā vā is in accordance with the words eyyassa ñāto, iyā ñā vā.

original: Ñādese ñāssa jaṃādeso.
analyzed: ña ādese ña assa ja ṃ ādesaḥ
translated: The meaning of the words vijāniyā is in accordance with the words vijāniyā.🔽The meaning of the words ñādese ñāssa jaṃādeso is in accordance with the words ñādese ñāssa jaṃādeso.

original: “Ñāto, vā”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: ñātaḥ vāti ca vattate
translated: The meaning of the words ñāto, vā is in accordance with the words ñāto, vā.

original: 516. Nāssa lopo yakārattaṃ.🔽Ñāiccetāya dhātuyā parassa nāpaccayassa lopo hoti vā, yakārattañca, vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo. Tena –
analyzed: na assa lopaḥ yakāra ttam  ñā i t ca i tāya dhātuyā parassa nā paccayassa lopaḥ hoti vā vā saddaḥ tena
translated: The meaning of the words nāssa lopo yakārattaṃ is in accordance with the words nāssa lopo yakārattaṃ.

original: Ñāmhi niccañca nālopo,
analyzed: ñāmhi niccam ca na a lopaḥ
translated: The meaning of the words ñāmhi niccañca nālopo is in accordance with the words ñāmhi niccañca nālopo.

original: Vibhāsājjatanādisu;
analyzed: vibhāsāt ja tan ādisu
translated: The meaning of the words vibhāsājjatanādisu is in accordance with the words vibhāsājjatanādisu.

original: Aññattha na ca hotāyaṃ,
analyzed: aññattha na ca hotā ayam
translated: And this is not elsewhere,

original: Nāto timhi yakāratā.
analyzed: na a taḥ timhi yakāra tā
translated: So the yak-vowel is not here.

original: Niggahītassa vaggantattaṃ, vijaññā, vijāneyya, vijāneyyuṃ. Vijāneyyāsi, vijāneyyātha. Vijāneyyāmi, vijāneyyāma, vijānemu vā. Vijānetha. Viññāyeyya, viññāyeyyuṃ.🔽Samajāni, sañjāni, sañjāniṃsu. Nālope aññāsi, aññāsuṃ. Vijānittha. Viññāyittha. Paññāyi,
analyzed: niggahītassa vagganta ttam vijaññā vijāneyya vijāneyyum vijāneyyāsi vijāneyyātha vijāneyyāmi vijāneyyāma vijānemu vā vijānetha viññāyeyya viññāyeyyum  samajāni sañjāni sañjāniṃsu na a lope aññāsi aññāsum vijānittha viññāyittha paññāyi
translated: The state of being a vag-vowel of the reduplicated syllable should be known, should be known, should be known, you should know, you should know, we should know, we should know, or we should know, you all should know. He should be known, they should be known.

original: paññāyiṃsu. Vijānissati, vijānissanti. Ñassati, ñassanti. Viññāyissate, viññāyissante.
analyzed: paññāyiṃsu vijānissati vijānissanti ñassati ñassanti viññāyissate viññāyissante
translated: They have known, they have known, they have known, he did not know, they did not know, they knew, they knew. He will know, they will know. He will know, they will know. He will be known, they will be known.

original: Paññāyissati, paññāyissanti. “Kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ssassa hi ca, paññāyihiti, paññāyihinti.
analyzed: paññāyissati paññāyissanti kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ssassa hi ca paññāyihiti paññāyihinti
translated: He will be known, they will be known. “In some bases” and so on: the hi and ca are elided. He would know, they would know.

original: Ajānissa. Ajānissatha. Aññāyissatha, aññāyissa iccādi.
analyzed: ajānissa ajānissatha aññāyissatha aññāyissa iccādi
translated: He would not know, they would not know. They would know, he would know. They would know, they would know.

original: Mā māne, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā māntassa ikāro, mināti, minanti. Kamme mīyati, mīyanti iccādi.
analyzed: mā māne kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ma antassa ikāraḥ mināti minanti kamme mīyati mīyanti iccādi
translated: “In some bases” and so on: the ikā vowel is elided of the mānt ending. He sinks, they sink. In the passive: it sinks, they sink.

original: Lū chedane, nāmhi rassattaṃ, lunāti, lunanti. Lūyati, lūyanti iccādi.
analyzed: chedane nāmhi rassattam lunāti lunanti lūyati lūyanti iccādi
translated: Lū means “to cut,” as in nāmhi rassattaṃ, he cuts, they cut. It is cut, they are cut.

original: Dhū kampane, dhunāti, dhunanti. Dhūyati, dhūyanti iccādi.
analyzed: kampane dhunāti dhunanti dhūyati dhūyanti it ca ādi
translated: In dhū, the meaning of shaking, dhūyati, dhūyanti, etc.

original: Gaha upādāne, nāmhi sampatte –
analyzed: gaha upādāne nāmhi sampatte
translated: In gaha, the meaning of seizing, I do not seize,

original: 517. Gahāditoppaṇhā.
analyzed: gaha ādi taḥ uppaṇhā
translated: Gaha, etc., with ppa ṇhā.

original: Gahaiccevamādito dhātuto ppa ṇhāiccete paccayā honti kattari. Ādisaddoyaṃ pakāro.
analyzed: gaha e c ca ivamāditaḥ dhātutaḥ ppa ṇha a i c ca ete paccayāḥ honti kattari ādi saddaḥ yam pakāraḥ
translated: Gaha, etc., with ppa ṇhā, these are the conditions for the active voice. The word ādi is the pattern.

original: “Gahassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: gahassā iti vattate
translated: “Of gaha” is said.

original: 518. Halopo ṇhāmhi.
analyzed: ha lopaḥ ṇha āmhi
translated: In ṇhāmhi, the syllable ha is elided.

original: Gahaiccetassa dhātussa hakārassa lopo hoti ṇhāmhi paccaye pare. Sīlaṃ gaṇhāti, rassatte gaṇhati vā, gaṇhanti. Gaṇhāsi, gaṇhātha. Gaṇhāmi, gaṇhāma.
analyzed: dhātussa hakārassa lopaḥ hoti ṇhāmhi paccaye pare sīlam gaṇhāti gaṇhati vā gaṇhanti gaṇhāsi gaṇhātha gaṇhāmi gaṇhāma
translated: In ṇhāmhi, the syllable ha of the base gaha is elided after the condition. He seizes virtue, he seizes a small one, he seizes, they seize. You seize, you all seize. I seize, we seize.

original: Kamme “ye”ti vattamāne “havipariyayo lo vā”ti hakārassa yakārena vipariyayo hoti. Gayhati, gayhanti.🔽Gaṇhātu, gaṇhantu. Gaṇha, gaṇhāhi, gaṇhātha. Gaṇhāmi, gaṇhāma. Gaṇhataṃ, gaṇhantaṃ.🔽Gayhataṃ, gayhantaṃ. Gayhatu, gayhantu. Gaṇhe, gaṇheyya, gaṇheyyuṃ. Gayheyya, gayheyyuṃ.
analyzed: kamme yā iti vattamāne ha vipariyayaḥ laḥ vāti hakārassa yakārena vipariyayaḥ hoti gayhati gayhanti  gaṇhātu gaṇhantu gaṇha gaṇhāhi gaṇhātha gaṇhāmi gaṇhāma gaṇhatam gaṇhantam  gayhatam gayhantam gayhatu gayhantu gaṇhe gaṇheyya gaṇheyyum gayheyya gayheyyum
translated: When “ye” is said, “ha-vipariyayo lo vā” means that there is reversal with ya for the syllable ha. He seizes, they seize.🔽He should seize, they should seize. You seize, you seize, you all seize. I seize, we seize. You all seize, you all seize.🔽You all should seize, you all should seize. You should seize, you should seize, you all should seize. You should seize, you all should seize.

original: Aggaṇhi, gaṇhi, aggaṇhiṃsu, gaṇhiṃsu.
analyzed: aggaṇhi gaṇhi aggaṇhiṃsu gaṇhiṃsu
translated: He did not seize, he seized, they did not seize, they seized.

original: Yadā “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā asabbadhātuke vikaraṇapaccayassa lopo, ikārāgamassa ekāro ca, tadā sāgamo.
analyzed: yadā kvaci dhātu uti ādinā asabbadhātuke vikaraṇa paccayassa lopaḥ ikāra āgamassa ekāraḥ ca tadā sa āgamaḥ
translated: When, by the rule “kvaci dhātū” , etc., the elision of the reduplication and the shortening of the vowel take place in the non-universal-base, then the augment is added.

original: Aggahesi, aggahesuṃ. Aggahi, aggahiṃsu, aggahuṃ. Aggayhittha, aggayhi. Gaṇhissati,
analyzed: aggahesi aggahesum aggahi aggahiṃsu aggahum aggayhittha aggayhi gaṇhissati
translated: Aggahesi, aggahesuṃ. Aggahi, aggahiṃsu, aggahuṃ. Aggayhittha, aggayhi. Gaṇhissati,

original: gaṇhissanti. Gahessati, gahessanti. Gahīyissate, gahīyissante. Gayhissati, gayhissanti.
analyzed: gaṇhissanti gahessati gahessanti gahīyissate gahīyissante gayhissati gayhissanti
translated: gaṇhissanti. Gahessati, gahessanti. Gahīyissate, gahīyissante. Gayhissati, gayhissanti.

original: Aggaṇhissa, aggahissa. Aggaṇhissatha, aggahissatha. Aggayhissatha, aggayhissa iccādi.
analyzed: aggaṇhissa aggahissa aggaṇhissatha aggahissatha aggayhissatha aggayhissa iccādi
translated: Aggaṇhissa, aggahissa. Aggaṇhissatha, aggahissatha. Aggayhissatha, aggayhissa, etc.

original: Ppappaccaye –
analyzed: ppa ppa caye
translated: In the reduplication of the present tense,

original: 519. Gahassa ghe ppe.
analyzed: gahassa ghe ppe
translated: . Gahassa ghe ppe.

original: Gahaiccetassa dhātussa sabbassa gheādeso hoti ppappaccaye pare. Gheppati iccādi.
analyzed: gaha e c ca itassa dhātussa sabbassa ghe ādesaḥ hoti ppa ppaccaye pare ghe ppati iccādi
translated: In the reduplication of the present tense, the substitution of ghe takes place for all the bases ending in a vowel. Gheppati, etc.

original: Kiyādigaṇo.
analyzed: kiyā ādi gaṇaḥ
translated: The group of verbs beginning with ki.

original: Tanādigaṇa
analyzed: tan ādi gaṇa
translated: The group of verbs beginning with tanu.

original: Tanu vitthāre, pure viya dhātvantalopavibhattuppattiyo.
analyzed: tanu vitthāre pure viya
translated: Tanu means “to extend,” and the elision of the final vowel of the base and the addition of the vibhatti are as in the case of pure.

original: 520. Tanādito oyirā.
analyzed: tan ā t itaḥ oy irā
translated: . Tanādito oyirā.

original: Tanuiccevamādito dhātugaṇato oyiraiccete paccayā honti kattari. Karatovāyaṃ yirappaccayo.
analyzed: tanu it ca ivamāditaḥ dhātu gaṇataḥ o y irai c ca ete paccayāḥ honti kattari
translated: In the case of the verbs beginning with tanu, the reduplication of the base ending in a vowel takes place in the active voice. The reduplication is called yirappaccayo.

original: Dhammaṃ tanoti, tanonti. Tanosi, tanotha. Tanomi, tanoma.
analyzed: dhammam tanoti tanonti tanosi tanotha tanomi tanoma
translated: He spreads out Dhamma, they spread out. He spread out, you spread out. I spread out, we spread out.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.
analyzed: vāti vattate
translated: The word “vā” is used.

original: 521. Uttamokāro.🔽Tanādito okārappaccayo uttamāpajjate vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo. Ettha
analyzed: uttamaḥ okāraḥ  tan āditaḥ okāra ppaccayaḥ uttamā āpajjate vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ ettha
translated: The letter “o” is the last.🔽The condition of the last is called the condition of the last. This word “vā” has the meaning of distinguishing and dividing.

original: ca vikaraṇakāriyavidhippakaraṇato “okāro”ti ovikaraṇaṃ gayhati. Tanute, bahuvacane
analyzed: ca vikaraṇa kāriya vidhi ppakaraṇato okāroti o vikaraṇam gayhati tanute bahuvacane
translated: And here, from the root, the function, and the injunctive, “o” is taken as the root. He spreads out, in the plural

original: “yavakārā cā”ti vattaṃ, tanvante. Tanuse, tanuvhe. Tanve, tanumhe.
analyzed: yavakārā ca ati vattam tanvante tanuse tanuvhe tanve tanumhe
translated: The usage is “and the letter ‘y’” is used. They spread out. He spread out, you spread out. He spread out, we spread out.

original: Kamme “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā tanudhātvantassa yamhi ākāro, patāyate, patāyante. Patāyati,🔽patāyanti. Ākārābhāve pataññati, pataññanti. Tanotu, tanontu. Taneyya, taneyyuṃ.
analyzed: kamme kvaci dhātu uti ādinā tanu dhātu antassa yamhi ākāro patāyate patāyante patāyati  patāyanti ākāra abhāve pataññati pataññanti tanotu tanontu taneyya taneyyum
translated: In the verb, by “sometimes the root” and so on, the letter “a” is used at the end of the root “tanu”. It spreads out, they spread out. It spreads out, they spread out. In the absence of the letter “a”, it spreads out, they spread out. Let it spread out, let them spread out. It should spread out, they should spread out.🔽It spread out, they spread out. It spread out, they spread out. It will spread out, they will spread out. It will spread out, they will spread out.

original: Atani, ataniṃsu. Atāyittha, patāyi. Tanissati, tanissanti. Patāyissati, patāyissanti.🔽Atanissa. Patāyissa iccādi.
analyzed: atani ataniṃsu atāyittha patāyi tanissati tanissanti patāyissati patāyissanti  atanissa patāyissa it ca ādi
translated: It would spread out, they would spread out. It would spread out, they would spread out.

original: Kara karaṇe, puññaṃ karoti.🔽Bahuvacane “vā”ti vattamāne, “uttamokāro”ti utte kate –
analyzed: kara karaṇe puññam karoti 🔽bahuvacane vā ati vattamāne utte kate
translated: “Kara” means “to do”, he does merit.

original: “Vā, utta”nti ca vattate.
analyzed: vā uttanti ca vattate
translated: and the word vā, utta is used.

original: 522. Karassākāro ca.🔽Karaiccetassa dhātussa akāro uttamāpajjate vā. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo,
analyzed: karassa ākāraḥ ca  dhātussa akāraḥ uttamā āpajjate vā vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ
translated: And the form of the root.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.

original: “yavakārā cā”ti apadantassa paraukārassa vakāro, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhāturakārassa
analyzed: ya vakārā ca ati a pada antassa para okārassa vakāraḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dhātu rakārassa
translated: The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.

original: vakārasmiṃ lopo, vakārassa dvitte tassa “bbo vvassā”ti bakāradvayaṃ, kubbanti, karonti.🔽Karosi, karotha. Karomi, karoma. Tathā kurute, kubbante. Kuruse, kuruvhe. Kubbe,

translated: The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.

original: kurumhe. Yirappaccaye rakāralopo, kayirati, kayiranti iccādi.🔽Kamme yappaccaye “ivaṇṇāgamo vā”ti īkārāgamo, yakārassa dvittaṃ, karīyyate kaṭo tena,
analyzed: kurumhe yirap paccaye rakāra lopaḥ kayiranti iti ādi  kamme ya p paccaye i vaṇṇa āgamaḥ vāti īkāra āgamaḥ yakārassa dvittam karīyyate kaṭaḥ tena
translated: The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.

analyzed: vā īkāra abhāve tassa ca vagga e c ādinā
translated: The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the ak of the root is changed to ā. This word vā has the meaning of “distinction” or “division”.🔽The ak of the root is changed to ā, or the

original: sadhātvantassa yakārattaṃ, dvittañca. Kayyati, kayyanti. Ikārāgame “kvaci dhātu”iccādisutte🔽caggahaṇena rayānaṃ vipariyayo, kayirati kaṭo tena, kayiranti iccādi.🔽Tathā kusalaṃ karotu, kurutu vā, kubbantu, karontu. Karohi, karotha. Karomi, karoma. Kurutaṃ, kubbantaṃ. Kurussu, kurassu vā, kuruvho. Kubbe, kubbāmase.
analyzed: sa dhātu antassa yakāra ttam dvi ttam ca kayyati ikāra āgame kvaci dhātu icca ādi sutte  ca ggahaṇena vipariyayaḥ tena icca ādi  tathā kusalam karotu kurutu vā kubbantu karontu karohi karotha karomi karoma kurutam kubbantam kurussu kurassu vā kuruvho kubbe kubbāmase
translated: The yak-ending is for the first person dual, and the t-ending for the third person dual. Kayyati, kayyanti. When the i-vowel-sign comes, the y is changed to r by the rule “kvaci dhātu” and so on.

original: Kamme karīyatu, karīyantu, kayyataṃ, kayirataṃ, kayiratu.🔽Sattamiyaṃ kare, kareyya, kareyyuṃ. Kareyyāsi, kareyyātha. Kareyyāmi, kareyyāma. Utte kubbe, kubbeyya.🔽Yirappaccaye –🔽Yirato āttameyyassa, ethādisseyyumādisu;🔽Eyyasaddassa lopo ca, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā.🔽Saralopādi, kayirā, kayiruṃ. Kayirāsi, kayirātha. Kayirāmi, kayirāma. Attanopade
analyzed: karīyatu karīyantu kayyatam kayiratam kayiratu 🔽kare kareyya kareyyum kareyyāsi kareyyāsi kareyyāmi kareyyāmaḥ utte kubbe kubbeyya 🔽y irap paccaye 🔽y i r ataḥ ā t t meyyassaḥ etha ādisseyyum ādisu 🔽eyya saddassa lopaḥ ca kvaci dhātu uti ādinā 🔽sara lopa ādi kayirā kayirum kayirā asi kayirātha kayirāmi kayirāma attana upade
translated: The r is changed to y by the rule “caggahaṇa” and so on. Kayirati, kayiranti, by that. original: kayirātha dhīro, kubbetha, karetha vā, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā kussa kru ca, krubbetha,
analyzed: dhīraḥ kubbetha karetha vā kvaci dhātu uti ādinā kussa ca krubbetha
translated: The wise one should do, should make, should cause to do, should make, should cause to make, should do here and there, etc., with the kusa, kru, krubbhe forms.

original: krubberaṃ. Krubbetho, krubbeyyāvho. Krubbeyyaṃ, krubbeyyāmhe. Kamme karīyeyya, karīyeyyuṃ.🔽Hiyyattaniyaṃ “karassa kā”ti yogavibhāgena kā hoti, saralopādi.🔽Akā, akarā, akarū. Akaro, akattha, akarottha. Akaṃ, akaraṃ, akamha, akaramha. Akattha. Akariṃ, akaramhase.
analyzed: krubberam krubbetho krubbeyya avho krubbeyyam krubbeyya amhe kamme karīyeyya karīyeyyum  karassa kā ati yogavibhāgena kā hoti sara lopa ādi  akā akarā akarū akaraḥ akattha akarottha akam akaram akamha akaramha akattha akarim akaramhase
translated: The wise one would do, would make, would cause to do, would have done, would do, would make, would cause to make, would have made, would make, would cause to make, would have made.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.🔽523. Karassa kāsattamajjatanimhi.🔽Kara iccetassa dhātussa sabbasseva kāsattaṃ hoti vā ajjatanimhi vibhattimhi pare.🔽“Kāsatta”miti bhāvaniddesena aññasmāpi dhātuto sāgamo. Atha vā yadā karassa kā hoti,
analyzed: vāti vattate  karassa kāsa tta majja tanimhi  karaḥ iti ca itassa dhātussa sabbassa iva hoti vā ajja tanimhi vibhattimhi pare  bhāva niddesena aññasma api dhātuto sa āgamaḥ atha vā yadā karassa kā hoti
translated: Would make, would cause to make, would have made, would make, would cause to make, would have made. Would make, would cause to make, would have made, would make, would cause to make, would have made. In the verb-form, would make, would cause to make.

original: sattañcāgamo ajjatanimhi vāti attho, tadā “sattamajjatanimhī”ti yogavibhāgena aññasmāpi
analyzed: sattam ca āgamaḥ ajja tanimhi vā ti attho tadā sattam ajja tanimhi iti yogavibhāgena aññasma api
translated: In the optative, would make, would cause to make, would have made. In the imperative, would make, would cause to make, would have made. In the conditional, would make, would cause to make, would have made. In the optative, would make, would cause to make, would have made.
