translated: Guhadusaiccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ saro dīghamāpajjate kārite pare, vuddhāpavādoyaṃ.

original: Guha saṃvaraṇe, guhituṃ payojayati gūhayati, gūhayanti. Dusa appītimhi, dussantaṃ payojayati dūsayati, dūsayanti iccādi.
analyzed: saṃvaraṇe guhitum payojayati gūhayati gūhayanti appītimhi dussantam payojayati dūsayati dūsayanti iccādi
translated: Guha saṃvaraṇe, guhituṃ payojayati gūhayati, gūhayanti. Dusa appītimhi, dussantaṃ payojayati dūsayati, dūsayanti iccādi.

original: Tathā icchantaṃ payojayati icchāpeti, icchāpayati, eseti, esayati. Niyacchantaṃ payojayati
analyzed: tathā icchantam payojayati icchāpa iti icchāpayati eseti esayati niyacchantam payojayati
translated: Tathā icchantaṃ payojayati icchāpeti, icchāpayati, eseti, esayati. Niyacchantaṃ payojayati

original: niyāmeti, niyāmayati. Āsantaṃ payojayati āseti, āsayati, acchāpeti, acchāpayati.
analyzed: niyāma iti niyāmayati āsantam payojayati āsa iti āsayati acchāpa iti acchāpayati
translated: niyāmeti, niyāmayati. Āsantaṃ payojayati āseti, āsayati, acchāpeti, acchāpayati.

original: Labhantaṃ payojayati lābheti, lābhayati. Vacantaṃ payojayati vāceti, vācayati, vācāpeti,
analyzed: labhantam payojayati lābha iti lābhayati vacantam payojayati vācā iti vācayati vācā apa iti
translated: Labhantaṃ payojayati lābheti, lābhayati. Vacantaṃ payojayati vāceti, vācayati, vācāpeti,

original: vācāpayati. Evaṃ vāseti, vāsayati, vāsāpeti, vāsāpayati. Vāheti, vāhayati, vāhāpeti,
analyzed: vācāpayati evam vāsā iti vāsayati vāsāpa iti vāsāpayati vāhā iti vāhayati vāhāpa iti
translated: vācāpayati. Evaṃ vāseti, vāsayati, vāsāpeti, vāsāpayati. Vāheti, vāhayati, vāhāpeti,

original: vāhāpayati. Jīreti, jīrayati, jīrāpeti, jīrāpayati. Māreti, mārayati, mārāpeti, mārāpayati.
analyzed: vāhāpayati jīra iti jīrayati jīrāpa iti jīrāpayati māra iti mārayati mārāpa iti mārāpayati
translated: He causes to carry, he carries, he causes to carry, he causes to carry. He causes to kill, he kills, he causes to kill, he causes to kill.

original: Dasseti, dassayati iccādi.
analyzed: dasseti dassayati iti cādi
translated: He shows, he causes to show, etc.

original: Tathā tudantaṃ payojayati todeti, todayati, todāpeti, todāpayati. Pavisantaṃ payojayati,
analyzed: tathā tudantam payojayati todeti todayati todāpeti todāpayati pavisantam payojayati
translated: So too, he causes to cut, he cuts, he causes to cut, he causes to cut. He causes to enter,🔽he causes to enter, he causes to enter, he causes to enter. He causes to point out,

original: pavisituṃ vā paveseti, pavesayati, pavesāpeti, pavesāpayati. Uddisantaṃ payojayati🔽uddisāpeti, uddisāpayati. Pahontaṃ payojayati pahāveti, pahāvayati. Sayantaṃ payojayati
analyzed: pavisitum vā paveseti pavesayati pavesāpeti pavesāpayati uddisantam payojayati  uddisāpa iti uddisāpayati pahontam payojayati pahāveti pahāvayati sayantam payojayati
translated: he causes to point out, he causes to point out. He causes to abandon,🔽he causes to abandon, he causes to abandon. He causes to lie down,

original: sāyeti, sāyayati, sāyāpeti, sāyāpayati. Ettha ekārassa āyādeso, sayāpeti, sayāpayati,🔽“kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ṇāpeṇāpayesu āyādesassa rassattaṃ. Nayantaṃ payojayati nayāpeti,
analyzed: sāyeti sāyayati sāyāpeti sāyāpayati ettha ekārassa āya ādesaḥ sayāpeti sayāpayati  kvacid dhātu uti ādinā āya ādesassa rassa ttam nayantam payojayati
translated: he causes to lie down, he causes to lie down, he causes to lie down. Here the āyādes of the e-vowel is lengthened. He causes to lead,🔽he causes to lead, he causes to lead. He causes to establish,

original: nayāpayati. Patiṭṭhantaṃ payojayati patiṭṭhāpeti, patiṭṭhāpayati, patiṭṭhapeti vā.
analyzed: nayāpayati patiṭṭhantam payojayati patiṭṭhāpeti patiṭṭhāpayati patiṭṭhapeti vā
translated: he causes to establish, he causes to establish.

original: Hanantaṃ payojayatīti atthe ṇeṇayādayo.
analyzed: hanantam payojayati iti atthe ṇeṇaya ādayaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘he causes to kill’ the ṇe-aorist nayādayo is used.

original: “Ṇamhī”ti vattate.
analyzed: ṇamhi iti vattate
translated: The rule “Ṇamhī” applies.

original: 544. Hanassa ghāto.🔽Hanaiccetassa dhātussa ghātādeso hoti ṇakāravati kāritappaccaye pare. Ghāteti, ghātayati, ghātāpeti, ghātāpayati, “vadho vā sabbatthā”ti vadhādese vadheti, vadhāpeti.🔽Juhontaṃ payojayati juhāveti, juhāvayati. Jahantaṃ payojayati jahāpeti, jahāpayati,🔽hāpeti, hāpayati. Dadantaṃ payojayati dāpeti, dāpayati. Pidahantaṃ payojayati pidhāpeti,🔽pidhāpayati, pidahāpeti, pidahāpayati.
analyzed: hanassa ghātaḥ  hanai c ca itassa dhātussa ghāta ādesaḥ hoti ṇakāravati kārita ppaccaye pare ghāteti ghātayati ghātāpeti ghātāpayati vadhaḥ vā sabbattha ati vadha ādese vadheti vadhāpeti  juhontam payojayati juhāva iti juhāvayati jahantam payojayati jahāpa iti jahāpayati  hāpa iti hāpayati dadantam payojayati dāpa iti dāpayati pidahantam payojayati pidhāpa iti  pidhāpayati pidahāpeti pidahāpayati
translated: The killing is the killing of the living being.

original: Rundhantaṃ payojayati rodheti, rodhayati, rodhāpeti, rodhāpayati. Chindantaṃ payojayati🔽chedeti, chedayati, chedāpeti, chedāpayati. Yuñjantaṃ payojayati yojeti, yojayati,🔽yojāpeti, yojāpayati. Bhuñjantaṃ payojayati bhojeti, bhojayati, bhojāpeti, bhojāpayati.
analyzed: rundhantam payojayati rodha iti rodhayati rodhāpa iti rodhāpayati chindantam payojayati 🔽cheda iti chedayati chedāpa iti chedāpayati yuñjantam payojayati yoja iti yojayati 🔽yojāpa iti yojāpayati bhuñjantam payojayati bhoja iti bhojayati bhojāpa iti bhojāpayati
translated: The place of the killing is the place of the killing of that living being. The suffix ṇak is added to the root han with the causative affix aya, and the suffix ṭha with the causative affix ṇa. The root han is used in the sense of killing in all the following: he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill, he gets killed, he gets killed by another; he kills, he causes to kill,

original: Muñcantaṃ payojayati moceti, mocayati, mocāpeti, mocāpayati.
analyzed: muñcantam payojayati moca iti mocayati mocāpa iti mocāpayati
translated: He causes to let go, he causes to employ, he causes to release, he causes to release, he causes to release, he causes to release.

original: Dibbantaṃ payojayati deveti, devayati. Uppajjantaṃ payojayati uppādeti, uppādayati.
analyzed: dibbantam payojayati deva iti devayati uppajjantam payojayati uppāda iti uppādayati
translated: He causes to employ the divine, he causes to be divine, he causes to be divine. He causes to employ the arisen, he causes to arise, he causes to arise.

original: Bujjhantaṃ payojayati bodheti, bodhayati. “Dādhāntato yo kvacī”ti yakārāgamo, bujjhāpeti,
analyzed: bujjhantam payojayati bodha iti bodhayati yaḥ kvaci iti yakāra āgamaḥ
translated: He causes to employ the awakened, he causes to awaken, he causes to awaken. “From the root dādhāti, in any place” (is formed) the affix yak, he causes to awaken,

original: bujjhāpayati. Tussantaṃ payojayati toseti, tosayati, tosāpeti, tosāpayati. Sammantaṃ
analyzed: bujjhāpayati tussantam payojayati toseti tosayati tosāpeti tosāpayati sammantam
translated: he causes to awaken. He causes to employ the delighted, he causes to delight, he causes to delight, he causes to delight, he causes to delight. He causes to employ the united,

original: payojayati sameti, samayati, ghaṭādittā na vuddhi. Kuppantaṃ payojayati kopeti, kopayati.
analyzed: payojayati sameti payojayati kopeti kopayati
translated: he causes to unite, he causes to unite. From ghaṭā and the rest there is no augment. He causes to employ the angry, he causes to be angry, he causes to be angry.

original: Jāyantaṃ payojayati janeti, janayati, ghaṭādittā na vuddhi.
analyzed: jāyantam payojayati janeti janayati ghaṭāt itthā na
translated: He causes to employ the born, he causes to be born, he causes to be born. From ghaṭā and the rest there is no augment.

original: Suṇantaṃ payojayati dhammaṃ sāveti, sāvayati. Pāpuṇantaṃ payojayati pāpeti, pāpayati.
analyzed: suṇantam payojayati dhammam sāveti sāvayati pāpuṇantam payojayati pāpeti pāpayati
translated: He causes to employ the heard, he causes to hear the Dhamma, he causes to hear. He causes to employ the reached, he causes to reach, he causes to reach.

original: Vikkiṇantaṃ payojayati vikkāyāpeti, vikkāyāpayati. Jinantaṃ payojayati jayāpeti,
analyzed: vikkiṇantam payojayati vikkāya apeti vikkāya āpayati jinantam payojayati jaya apeti
translated: He causes to employ the sold, he causes to be sold, he causes to be sold. He causes to employ the conquered, he causes to conquer,🔽he causes to conquer.

original: jayāpayati. Jānantaṃ payojayati ñāpeti, ñāpayati. Gaṇhantaṃ payojayati gāheti, gāhayati,
analyzed: jayāpayati jānantam payojayati ñāpa iti ñāpayati gaṇhantam payojayati gāha iti gāhayati
translated: He makes win, jayāpayati. He makes one who knows do, ñāpeti, ñāpayati. He makes one who takes do, gāheti, gāhayati,

original: gāhāpeti, gāhāpayati, gaṇhāpeti, gaṇhāpayati.
analyzed: gāhāpa iti gāhāpayati gaṇhāpa iti gaṇhāpayati
translated: gāhāpeti, gāhāpayati, gaṇhāpeti, gaṇhāpayati.

original: Vitanantaṃ payojayati vitāneti, vitānayati. Yo koci karoti, tamañño “karohi karohi”iccevaṃ bravīti, karontaṃ payojayati, kātuṃ vā kāreti, kārayati, kārāpeti, kārāpayati iccādi.
analyzed: vitanantam payojayati vitāneti vitānayati yaḥ koci karoti tam añño karohi karohi icca evam bravīti karontam payojayati kātum vā kāreti kārayati kārāpeti kārāpayati iccādi
translated: He makes one who spreads out do, vitāneti, vitānayati. Whoever does, another says to him, “Do, do,” thus he makes one who does do, kārayati, kāreti, kāreti, kārāpeti, kārāpayati, etc.

original: Corentaṃ payojayati corāpeti, corāpayati. Cintentaṃ payojayati cintāpeti, cintāpayati, pūjentaṃ payojayati pūjāpeti, pūjāpayati iccādi. Sabbattha subodhaṃ.
analyzed: corentam payojayati corāpeti corāpayati cintentam payojayati cintāpeti cintāpayati pūjentam payojayati pūjāpeti pūjāpayati iccādi sabbattha su bodham
translated: He makes one who steals do, corāpeti, corāpayati. He makes one who thinks do, cintāpeti, cintāpayati. He makes one who worships do, pūjāpeti, pūjāpayati, etc. In all cases it is easy to understand.🔽And also from the cause of the element,

original: Dhātuppaccayato cāpi, kāritappaccayā siyuṃ;
analyzed: dhātu paccayataḥ ca api kārita paccayā siyum
translated: The causes of the action may be,🔽With those who are caused to do,

original: Sakāritehi yuṇvūnaṃ, dassanañcettha ñāpakaṃ.
analyzed: sa kāritehi yuṇvūnam dassanam ca ittha ñāpakam
translated: The seeing here is the reason.

original: Tena titikkhantaṃ payojayati titikkheti, titikkhāpeti. Tikicchantaṃ payojayati tikiccheti,
analyzed: tena titikkhantam payojayati titikkha iti titikkhāpa iti tikicchantam payojayati tikiccha iti
translated: By that he makes one who endures do, titikkheti, titikkhāpeti. He makes one who heals do, tikiccheti,

original: tikicchayati, tikicchāpeti, tikicchāpayati. Evaṃ bubhukkheti, bubhukkhayati, bubhukkhāpeti,
analyzed: tikicchayati tikicchāpeti tikicchāpayati evam bubhukkheti bubhukkhayati bubhukkhāpeti
translated: He treats, he causes to treat, he causes to be treated. So too with the words bubhukkheti, bubhukkhayati, bubhukkhāpeti,

original: bubhukkhāpayati, pabbatāyantaṃ payojayati pabbatāyayati. Puttīyayati iccādipi siddhaṃ bhavati.
analyzed: bubhukkhāpayati pabbatāyantam payojayati pabbatāyayati puttīyayati iti ca ādi pi siddham bhavati
translated: bubhukkhāpayati, pabbatāyantaṃ payojayati, pabbatāyayati. Puttīyayati, etc., are also established.

original: Dhātuppaccayantanayo.
analyzed: dhātup paccaya ntanayaḥ
translated: The method of the conditions of the elements.🔽The method of the conditions of the roots.🔽The method of the conditions of the bases.🔽The method of the conditions of the faculties.

original: Sāsanatthaṃ samuddiṭṭhaṃ, ākhyātaṃ sakabuddhiyā;
analyzed: sāsana attham samuddiṭṭham ākhyātam sakabuddhiyā
translated: The method of the conditions of the truths.🔽The method of the conditions of the dependent origination.🔽The method of the conditions of the aggregates.🔽The method of the conditions of the sense-spheres.

original: Bāhusaccabalenīdaṃ, cintayantu vicakkhaṇā.
analyzed: bāhu sacca balena idam cintayantu vicakkhaṇā
translated: The method of the conditions of the elements.🔽The method of the conditions of the past, etc.

original: Bhavati tiṭṭhati seti, ahosi evamādayo;🔽Akammakāti viññeyyā, kammalakkhaṇaviññunā.
analyzed: bhavati tiṭṭhati sa iti ahosi evamādayo  akammakā ati viññeyyā kamma lakkhaṇa viññunā
translated: The method of the conditions of the present, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the future, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the past, present, and future.🔽The method of the conditions of the internal, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the external, etc.

original: Akammakāpi hetvattha-ppaccayantā sakammakā;🔽Taṃ yathā bhikkhu bhāveti, maggaṃ rāgādidūsakanti.
analyzed: akammakā api hetu attha ppaccaya antā sa kammakā  tam yathā bhikkhu bhāveti maggam rāga ādi dūsakanti
translated: The method of the conditions of the internal and external.

original: Iti padarūpasiddhiyaṃ ākhyātakaṇḍo
analyzed: iti ākhyāta kaṇḍo
translated: The method of the conditions of the seen, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the heard, etc.

original: Chaṭṭho.
analyzed: chaṭṭhaḥ
translated: The method of the conditions of the sensed, etc.

original: 7. Kibbidhānakaṇḍa
analyzed: kip bidhāna kaṇḍa
translated: The method of the conditions of the cognized, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, heard, sensed, and cognized.🔽The method of the conditions of the past, etc., of the seen, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the internal, etc., of the seen, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the internal and external of the seen, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the past, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the internal, etc.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the internal and external.

original: Tekālika
analyzed: tekālika
translated: The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the past, present, and future.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the internal, external, and both.🔽The method of the conditions of the seen, etc., of the past, present, and future, of the internal, external, and both.

original: Kiccappaccayantanaya🔽Atha dhātūhiyeva bhāvakammakattukaraṇādisādhanasahitaṃ kibbidhānamārabhīyate.
analyzed: kicca ppacca yanta naya 🔽atha bhāva kamma kattu karaṇa ādi sādhana sahitam kip vidhānam ārabhīyate
translated: The method of the conditions of the seen, etc.,

original: Tattha kiccakitakavasena duvidhā hi paccayā, tesu kiccasaññāya paṭhamaṃ vuttattā, kiccānamappakattā ca kiccappaccayā tāva vuccante.
analyzed: tattha kicca kitaka vasena duvidhāḥ hi paccayā tesu kicca saññāya paṭhamam vutta ttā kiccānam appaka ttā ca kicca ppaccayā tāva vuccante
translated: Herein, conditions are of two kinds, that is to say, by way of function and by way of state. Of these, since the function is the first to appear, and since the function is not complete, the conditions by way of function are stated first.

original: Bhū sattāyaṃ, “bhūyate, abhavittha, bhavissate vā devadattenā”ti viggahe –
analyzed: bhū sattā ayam bhūyate abhavittha bhavissate vā devadattena ati viggahe
translated: In the analysis “Bhū is made, was made, will be made by Devadatta”🔽the “dhātu” is supplied from “dhātu in kamma and so on” in the first line of the stanza.

original: “Dhātuyā kammādimhi ṇo”ti ito “dhātuyā”ti sabbattha paccayādividhāne vattate, “parā, paccayā”ti ca adhikāro.
analyzed: dhātuyā kamma ādimhi ṇaḥ ti i tas dhātuyā ati sabbattha paccaya ādi vidhāne vattate parā paccaya ati ca adhikāraḥ
translated: The “parā” is supplied from “paccayā” in the second line of the stanza.

original: 545. Bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu tabbānīyā
translated: The “tabbā” is supplied from “bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā” in the third line of the stanza.🔽The “anīyā” is supplied from “bhāvakammesu tabbānīyā” in the third line of the stanza.

original: Bhāvakammaiccetesvatthesu sabbadhātūhi tabba anīyaiccete paccayā parā honti. Yogavibhāgena aññatthāpi.
analyzed: bhāva kamma ai c ca itesu atthesu sabba dhātūhi tabba anīya ai c ca ite paccayā parā honti yogavibhāgena aññattha api
translated: The “iccā” is supplied from “iccā” in the fourth line of the stanza.

original: Tattha –🔽Akammakehi dhātūhi, bhāve kiccā bhavanti te;
analyzed: tattha  akammakehi dhātūhi bhāve kiccāḥ bhavanti te
translated: Herein,🔽The functions are made by the non-kamma-resultant elements🔽In the kamma-resultant and functional bases,

original: Sakammakehi kammatthe, arahasakkatthadīpakā.
analyzed: sa kammakehi kammatthe araha sakka ttha dīpakā
translated: The kamma-resultant and functional are shown by the words “kamma” and “attha.”

original: Te ca –🔽546. Ṇādayo tekālikā.
analyzed: te ca 🔽ṇa ādayaḥ tekālikā
translated: And these🔽Are the “ṇā” and so on, and are momentary.

original: Tikāle niyuttā tekālikā, ye idha tatiye dhātvādhikāre vihitā aniddiṭṭhakālā ṇādayo paccayā, te tekālikā hontīti paribhāsato kālattayepi honti.
analyzed: ti kāle niyuttā tekālikāḥ ye idha tatiye dhātu adhikāre vihitā an iddiṭṭha kālāḥ ṇa ādayo paccayā te tekālikāḥ honti iti paribhāsato kāla ttaye pi honti
translated: Those that are limited to the time are the limited-time ones. Those that are not stated as to time, namely, the ṇā-aids, etc., that are given in the third chapter on the bases, are limited-time ones. They are limited to the three times by the rule.

original: Sīhagatiyā “kvacī”ti vattate.
analyzed: sīha gatiyā kvaci iti vattate
translated: The word kvacī is used in the sense of “sometimes.”

original: 547. Yathāgamamikāro.
analyzed: yathāgamamikāro
translated: The order according to the tradition.

original: Yathāgamaṃ yathāpayogaṃ jinavacanānuparodhena dhātūhi paro ikārāgamo hoti kvaci byañjanādikesu
analyzed: yathāgamam yathā apayogam jina vacana an uparodhena dhātūhi paraḥ ikāra āgamaḥ kvaci byañjana ādikesu
translated: The addition of the vowel i to the end of the bases is sometimes according to the tradition, according to the usage, without contradicting the word of the Conqueror, in the case of the kiccā, kitakā, and paccayā.🔽The augment is added in the case of the other words beginning with the consonants by the rule:🔽“aññesu ca.” The vowel o is substituted for the a by the rule:

original: kiccakitakappaccayesu, “aññesu cā”ti vuddhi, “o ava sare”ti avādeso, “naye paraṃ
analyzed: kicca kitaka ppaccayesu aññesu ca ati vuddhi ava sara iti ava ādesaḥ naye param
translated: “o ava sare.” The vowel u is substituted for the a by the rule:

original: yutte”ti paraṃ netabbaṃ.
analyzed: yutta iti param netabbam
translated: “naye paraṃ yutte.”

original: 548. Te kiccā.
analyzed: te k it cā
translated: Those are the kiccā.

original: Ye idha vuttā tabbānīyaṇya teyya riccappaccayā, te kiccasaññā hontīti veditabbā.🔽Tato “aññe kiti”ti vacanato kiccappaccayānamakitakattā nāmabyapadese asampatte “taddhitasamāsakitakā
analyzed: ye idha vuttā ricca ppaccayā te kicca saññāḥ honti iti veditabbā  tatas aññe kit iti vacanataḥ kicca ppaccaya nama kitakattā nāma byapadese a sampatte taddhita samāsa kitakā
translated: Those that are stated here as tabbānīyaṇya teyya riccappaccayā should be understood as being called kiccā.🔽Then, because of the statement “aññe kiti,” the name-base is not formed in the case of the kiccā by the rule:🔽“taddhitasamāsakitakā nāmaṃvātavetunādīsu cā.” The name-base is formed by the inclusion of the word ca in the statement:

original: nāmaṃvātavetunādīsu cā”ti ettha caggahaṇena nāmabyapadeso, tato syādyuppatti. Bhāve
analyzed: ca ati ettha ca ggahaṇena nāma byapadesaḥ bhāve
translated: “nāmaṃvātavetunādīsu cā.” Then the vowel i is added.

original: bhāvassekattā ekavacanameva, “si”nti amādeso. Bhavitabbaṃ bhavatā paññena, bhavanīyaṃ.
analyzed: bhāvassa ikattā ekavacanam eva sinti am ādesaḥ bhavitabbam bhavatā paññena bhavanīyam
translated: The singular is used because of the unity of the state. The form “si” is the mode of the negative particle. It should be done by you, it should be done by the wise, it should be done.

original: Idha byañjanādittābhāvā anuvattitakvaciggahaṇena ikārāgamābhāvo. Bhāve kiccappaccayantā napuṃsakā. Kamme tiliṅgā.🔽Kammani abhipubbo, abhibhūyate, abhibhūyittha, abhibhūyissateti abhibhavitabbo kodho🔽paṇḍitena, abhibhavitabbā taṇhā, abhibhavitabbaṃ dukkhaṃ, evaṃ abhibhavanīyo, abhibhavanīyā,
analyzed: idha byañjana ādi tta abhāvāḥ anuvatti ta kvaci ggahaṇena ikāra āgama abhāvaḥ bhāve napuṃsakā kamme ti liṅgā  kammani abhipubbaḥ abhibhūyate abhibhūyittha abhibhūyissateti abhibhavitabbaḥ kodhaḥ  paṇḍitena abhibhavitabbā taṇhā abhibhavitabbam dukkham evam abhibhavanīyaḥ abhibhavanīyā
translated: Here, because of the absence of the vowel i in the prefix, the absence of the vowel i is shown by the word “etc.” in the definition. In the state, the neuter is used because of the ending in -ya. In the verb, the feminine is used.

original: abhibhavanīyaṃ, purisa kaññā cittasaddanayena netabbaṃ, evaṃ sabbattha.
analyzed: abhibhavanīyam purisa kaññā citta sadda nayena netabbam evam sabbattha
translated: In the verb, the form “abhibhavitabbo” is formed by adding the passive suffix -ya to the verb “abhibhūyate” in the present tense. Anger should be overcome by the wise, craving should be overcome, suffering should be overcome. Thus it should be done, it should be done by her, it should be done by them. The word “purisa” should be taken according to the rule of the feminine form “kaññā”. Thus in all cases.

original: Ettha hi –
analyzed: ettha hi
translated: Here,

original: Tabbādīheva kammassa, vuttattāva punattanā;
analyzed: tabba ādīhi iva kammassa vutta ttā ava punattanā
translated: Because only “tabba” etc. are stated for the verb,

original: Vattabbassa abhāvā na, dutiyā paṭhamā tato.
analyzed: vattabbassa abhāvā na dutiyā paṭhamā tatas
translated: Because there is no second person, the first person is not used.

original: Āsa upavesane, āsīyittha, āsīyate, āsīyissateti āsitabbaṃ tayā, āsanīyaṃ. Kamme upāsitabbo garu, upāsanīyo.
analyzed: āsaḥ upavesane āsīyittha āsīyate āsīyissateti āsitabbam tayā āsanīyam kamme upāsitabbaḥ garuḥ upāsanīyaḥ
translated: The form “āsitabbaṃ” is formed by adding the passive suffix -ya to the verb “āsīyati” in the present tense. It should be sat upon by you, it should be sat upon. In the verb, the feminine is used. It should be worshipped by you, it should be worshipped.

original: Sī saye, asīyittha, sīyate, sīyissateti sayitabbaṃ bhavatā, sayanīyaṃ, “e ayā”ti ayādeso, atisayitabbo paro, atisayanīyo.
analyzed: sī saye asīyittha sīyate sīyissata iti sayitabbam bhavatā sayanīyam ayāti aya ādesaḥ atisayitabbaḥ paraḥ atisayanīyaḥ
translated: Sī, asīyittha, sīyate, sīyissate = sīyitabbaṃ bhavatā, sīyaniyaṃ. “E ayā” = ayādeso. Atisayitabbo paro, atisayanīyo.

original: Pada gatimhi, uppajjittha, uppajjate, uppajjissateti uppajjitabbaṃ tena, uppajjanīyaṃ,
analyzed: pada gatimhi uppajjittha uppajjate uppajjissateti uppajjitabbam tena uppajjanīyam
translated: Pada, gatimhi, uppajjittha, uppajjate, uppajjissate = uppajjitabbaṃ tena, uppajjanīyaṃ.

original: ettha ca “kattarī”ti adhikāraṃ vinā “divādito yo”ti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena yappaccayo,🔽“tassa cavaggayakāra”iccādinā cavaggo, “paradvebhāvo ṭhāne”ti dvibhāvo, paṭipajjitabbo🔽maggo, paṭipajjanīyo.🔽Budha avagamane, abujjhittha, bujjhate, bujjhissateti bujjhitabbo dhammo, bujjhanīyo.🔽Su savaṇe, asūyittha, sūyate, sūyissateti sotabbo dhammo, idha yathāgamaggahaṇena ikārāgamābhāvo, suṇitabbo, “svādito ṇu ṇā uṇā cā”ti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena ṇāpaccayo, savaṇīyo.
analyzed: ettha ca kattari iti adhikāram vinā vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena yap paccayaḥ 🔽tassa cavagga yakāra e c ca ādinā cavaggaḥ para dvebhāvaḥ ṭhāne iti dvibhāvaḥ paṭipajjitabbaḥ 🔽maggaḥ paṭipajjanīyaḥ 🔽avagamane abujjhittha bujjhate bujjhissate iti bujjhitabbaḥ dhammaḥ bujjhanīyaḥ 🔽su savaṇe asūyittha sūyate sūyissate iti sotabbaḥ dhammaḥ idha yathā āgama gahaṇena ikāra āgama abhāvaḥ suṇitabbaḥ su āditaḥ ṇu ṇā ca ati vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena ṇā paccayo savaṇīyaḥ
translated: And here, without the scope “kattarī,” the y affix is by the rule of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the scope of the

original: Kara karaṇe, karīyittha, karīyati, karīyissatīti atthe tabbā’nīyā.
analyzed: kara karaṇe karīyittha karīyati karīyissati iti atthe tabbānīyā
translated: In the sense of ‘is to be done’, ‘is being done’, ‘will be done’, the forms are ‘tabbā’, ‘tabbāni’.

original: “Antassa, karassa, ca, tatta”nti ca vattate.
analyzed: antassa karassa ca tat tanti ca vattate
translated: ‘Antassa, karassa, ca, tatta’ is said.

original: 549. Tuṃ tu na tabbesu vā.
analyzed: tum tu na tap besu vā
translated: Tuṃ tu na tabbesu vā.

original: Karaiccetassa dhātussa antabhūtassa rakārassa takārattaṃ hoti vā tuṃ tu na tabbaiccetesu
analyzed: dhātussa anta bhūtassa rakārassa takāra ttam hoti vā tum tu na
translated: In the sense of ‘is to be done’, ‘is being done’, ‘will be done’, the ra of the root kara becomes ta, optionally, in the following prepositions: tuṃ, tu, na, tabba.

original: paccayesu paresu. Kattabbo bhavatā dhammo, kattabbā pūjā, kattabbaṃ kusalaṃ, tattābhāve
analyzed: paccayesu paresu kattabbaḥ bhavatā dhammaḥ kattabbā pūjā kattabbam kusalam
translated: Dhammo kattabbo bhavatā, pūjā kattabbā, kusalaṃ kattabbaṃ. In the absence of the above prepositions,

original: “karotissā”ti vattamāne “tavetunādīsu kā”ti ettha ādisaddena tabbepi kādeso, kātabbaṃ hitaṃ.
analyzed: karotissa ati vattamāne tava ituna ādīsu kā ati ettha ādi saddena tabbe pi ka ādesaḥ kātabbam hitam
translated: when ‘karoti’ is said, ‘tavetunādīsu kā’ is said. In the sense of ‘is to be done’, the forms are ‘kātabbaṃ hitaṃ’.

original: 550. Rahādito ṇa.
analyzed: raha āditaḥ ṇa
translated: . Rahādito ṇa.

original: Rakāra hahārādyantehi dhātūhi parassa anānīyādinakārassa ṇakāro hoti. Ādisaddena ramu apañātāditopi.
analyzed: rakāra ha hāra ādi antehi dhātūhi parassa an ānīya ādi nakārassa ṇakāraḥ hoti ādi saddena
translated: The na of the following prepositions: raha, aha, ādi, becomes ṇa, after the ra of the root. By the word ‘ādi’, ra and mu are also included.

original: Rahādito parassettha, nakārassa asambhavā;
analyzed: raha ādeḥ parassa ittha nakārassa asambhavā
translated: After raha, etc., the na is not possible;

original: Anānīyādinasseva, sāmathyāyaṃ ṇakāratā.
analyzed: sāmathyā ayam ṇakāra tā
translated: therefore, the ṇa is for the sake of euphony, after anānīya, etc.

original: Karaṇīyo dhammo, karaṇārahoti attho, karaṇīyā, karaṇīyaṃ.
analyzed: karaṇīyaḥ dhammo karaṇa araho ti atthaḥ karaṇīyā karaṇīyam
translated: Dhammo karaṇīyo, karaṇāraho is the meaning. Karaṇīyā, karaṇīyaṃ.

original: Bhara bharaṇe, bharīyatīti bharitabbo, bharaṇīyo.🔽Gaha upādāne, agayhittha, gayhati, gayhissatīti gahetabbo, “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā ikārassekāro,🔽saṅgaṇhitabbo, “gahādito ppaṇhā”ti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena ṇhāpaccayo, halopasaralopādi,
analyzed: bhara bharaṇe bharīyati iti bharitabbaḥ bharaṇīyaḥ  gahaḥ upādāne agayhittha gayhati gayhissati iti gahetabbaḥ tesu vuddhi iti ādinā ikārassa ikāraḥ  saṅgaṇhitabbaḥ gaha āditaḥ vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena ṇhā paccayaḥ ha lopa sara lopa ādi
translated: Bhara means to bear; one who is to be borne is bharitabbo, bharīyyo.

original: saṅgaṇhaṇīyo, gahaṇīyo.
analyzed: saṅgaṇhaṇīyaḥ gahaṇīyaḥ
translated: Gaha means to seize; one who is to be seized is gahetabbo, saṅgahaṇīyo, gahaṇīyo.

original: Ādiggahaṇena ramu kīḷāyaṃ, ramīyittha, ramīyati, ramīyissatīti ramitabbo, ramaṇīyo vihāro.
analyzed: ādi gahaṇena ramu kīḷāyam ramīyittha ramīyati ramīyissati iti ramitabbaḥ ramaṇīyaḥ vihāraḥ
translated: Ramu means to delight; one who is to be delighted is ramitabbo, ramaṇīyo.

original: Apa pāpuṇane, uṇāpaccayo, pāpīyatīti pāpuṇitabbo, “gupādīnañcā”ti dhātvantassa lopo, dvittañca, pattabbo, patteyyo, pāpuṇaṇīyo, pāpaṇīyo.
analyzed: apa pāpuṇane uṇā paccayaḥ pāpīyati iti pāpuṇitabbaḥ gupa ādīnam ca ati dhātu antassa lopaḥ dvittam ca pattabbaḥ patteyyo pāpuṇaṇīyaḥ pāpaṇīyaḥ
translated: Apa means to reach; one who is to be reached is pāpuṇitabbo, pattabbo, patteyyo, pāpuṇaṇīyo, pāpaṇīyo.

original: “Antassa, vā”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: antassa vāti ca vattate
translated: Antassa vā.

original: 551. Gama khana hanādīnaṃ tuṃtabbādīsu na.
analyzed: gama khana hana ādīnam tuṃtabba ādīsu na
translated: Gama khana hanādīnaṃ tuṃtabbādīsu na.

original: Gama khana hanaiccevamādīnaṃ makāra nakārantānaṃ dhātūnamantassa nakāro hoti vā tuṃ
analyzed: gama khana hana e c ca evamādīnam makāra nakāra antānam dhātūnam antassa nakāraḥ hoti vā tum
translated: The k of gama, the n of khana, the n of hana, etc., are not changed to m, b, etc., in the reduplicated aorist, etc.

original: tabba tave tuna tvānatvāiccevamādīsu takārādippaccayesu paresu. Agacchīyittha, gacchīyati,
analyzed: tabba tave tuna tvāna tvā it ca ivamādīsu takāra ādi ppaccayesu paresu agacchīyittha gacchīyati
translated: Agacchīyittha, gacchīyati,

original: gacchīyissatīti gantabbo maggo, gamitabbaṃ, gamanīyaṃ.
analyzed: gacchīyissati iti gantabbaḥ maggaḥ gamitabbam gamanīyam
translated: gacchīyissati: the path to be gone along is gantabbo maggo, gamitabbaṃ, gamanīyaṃ.

original: Khanu avadāraṇe, akhaññittha, khaññati, khaññissatīti khantabbaṃ āvāṭaṃ, khanitabbaṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā khanantassa ṇattañca, khaṇitabbaṃ, khaṇaṇīyaṃ, khananīyaṃ vā.
analyzed: avadāraṇe akhaññittha khaññati khaññissati iti khantabbam āvāṭam khanitabbam kvaci dhātu uti ādinā khanantassa khaṇitabbam khaṇaṇīyam khananīyam vā
translated: Khanu avadāraṇe, akhaññittha, khaññati, khaññissatīti khantabbaṃ āvāṭaṃ, khanitabbaṃ, “kvaci dhātū”ti ādinā khanantassa ṇattañca, khanitabbaṃ, khaṇaṇīyaṃ, khananīyaṃ vā.

original: Hana hiṃsā gatīsu, ahaññittha, haññate, haññissateti hantabbaṃ, hanitabbaṃ, hananīyaṃ.
analyzed: hana hiṃsā gatīsu ahaññittha haññate haññissata iti hantabbam hanitabbam hananīyam
translated: Hana hiṃsā gatīsu, ahaññittha, haññate, haññissateti hantabbaṃ, hanitabbaṃ, hananīyaṃ.

original: Mana ñāṇe, amaññittha, maññate, maññissateti mantabbo, manitabbo, yappaccaye cavaggādi, maññitabbaṃ, maññanīyaṃ.
analyzed: manaḥ ñāṇe amaññittha maññate maññissate iti mantabbaḥ manitabbaḥ yap paccaye ca vagga ādi maññitabbam maññanīyam
translated: Mana ñāṇe, amaññittha, maññate, maññissateti mantabbo, manitabbo, yappaccaye cavaggādi, maññitabbaṃ, maññanīyaṃ.

original: Pūja pūjāyaṃ, apūjīyittha, pūjīyati, pūjīyissatīti atthe tabbānīyā. “Curādito ṇe
analyzed: pūja pūjāyam apūjīyittha pūjīyati pūjīyissati iti atthe tabbānīyā curāditaḥ ṇe
translated: Pūja pūjāyaṃ, apūjīyittha, pūjīyati, pūjīyissatīti atthe tabbānīyā. “Curādito ṇe

original: ṇayā”ti akattaripi ṇeṇayā, ikārāgamānīyesu “saralopo”tiādinā kāritasarassa lopo,
analyzed: ṇayā ti a kattari pi ṇeṇayā i kāra āgama ānīyesu sara lopaḥ iti ādinā kārita sarassa lopaḥ
translated: ṇayā”ti akattaripi ṇeṇayā, ikārāgamānīyesu “saralopo”ti ādinā kāritasarassa lopo,

original: pūjetabbo, pūjayitabbo, pūjanīyo bhagavā.
analyzed: pūjetabbaḥ pūjayitabbaḥ pūjanīyaḥ bhagavā
translated: The Blessed One is to be worshipped, to be honoured, to be revered, to be saluted with joined palms, to be venerated.

original: “Tabbānīyā”ti yogavibhāgena kattukaraṇesupi, yā pāpuṇane, niyyātīti niyyānīko maggo. Gacchantīti gamanīyā bhogā. Naha soce, nahāyati etenāti nahānīyaṃ cuṇṇaṃ.
analyzed: tabbānīyā iti yogavibhāgena kattu karaṇesu pi yā pāpuṇane niyyāti iti niyyānīkaḥ maggaḥ gacchanti iti gamanīyāḥ bhogāḥ naha soce nahāyati etena ati nahānīyam cuṇṇam
translated: “To be reached” is the meaning of “to be attained” . The path is called “to be gone by” because it is gone by . Wealth is called “to be used” because it is used . The powder is called “to be bathed with” because one bathes with it.

original: “Bhāvakammesū”ti adhikāro.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu iti adhikāraḥ
translated: “In the verbal nouns” is the province .

original: 552. Ṇyo ca.
analyzed: ṇyo ca
translated: And ṇyo.

original: Bhāvakammesu sabbadhātūhi ṇyappaccayo hoti, caggahaṇena “ñāteyya”ntiādīsu teyyappaccayo ca.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu sabba dhātūhi ṇyap paccayaḥ hoti ca ggahaṇena ñāteyya nti ādīsu teyyap paccayaḥ ca
translated: The ṇ-suffix is formed in verbal nouns with all the bases, and the tey-suffix is formed with the word ñāteyya, etc., by the inclusion of the ca .

original: 553. Kāritaṃ viya ṇānubandho.🔽Anubandho appayogī, ṇakārānubandho paccayo kāritaṃ viya daṭṭhabboti kāritabyapadeso,
analyzed: kāritam viya ṇa anubandhaḥ  anubandhaḥ appayogī ṇakāra anubandho paccayo kāritam viya daṭṭhabbaḥ iti kārita byapadeso
translated: The ṇ-suffix is like the passive.🔽The ṇ-suffix as a passive-sign is to be regarded as like the passive voice.

original: “kāritānaṃ ṇo lopa”nti ṇalopo, “asaṃyogantassa vuddhi kārite”ti vuddhi, ikārāgamo, kattabbaṃ kāriyaṃ.
analyzed: kāritānam ṇaḥ ṇa lopaḥ a saṃyoga antassa vuddhi kāritā iti vuddhi ikāra āgamaḥ kattabbam kāriyam
translated: The ṇ-suffix is elided by the rule “The ṇ-suffix of the passive is elided” . The vowel-change is by the rule “The vowel-change of the passive is lengthened” . The i-sign is by the rule “The i-sign is added to the passive” . The meaning is “to be done” .

original: Hara haraṇe, aharīyittha, harīyati, harīyissatīti vā haritabbaṃ hāriyaṃ.
analyzed: hara haraṇe aharīyittha harīyati harīyissati iti vā haritabbam hāriyam
translated: The ṇ-suffix is formed in the verbal noun of the verb hara “to carry off” by the rule “The ṇ-suffix is formed in the verbal noun of the verb hara” . The meaning is “to be carried off” .

original: Bhara bharaṇe, bharitabbaṃ bhāriyaṃ.
analyzed: bhara bharaṇe bharitabbam bhāriyam
translated: The ṇ-suffix is formed in the verbal noun of the verb bhara “to carry” by the rule “The ṇ-suffix is formed in the verbal noun of the verb bhara” . The meaning is “to be carried” .

original: Labha lābhe, labhitabbaṃ labbhaṃ, “yavataṃ talana”iccādisutte kāraggahaṇena yavato bhakārassa bhakāro, dvittaṃ.
analyzed: labha lābhe labhitabbam labbham yavatam tala naicca ādi sutte kāra ggahaṇena yavataḥ bhakārassa bhakāraḥ
translated: In the words labha, labbha, labbitabba, labbhaṃ, yavataṃ, talana, etc., the b of the first syllable is changed to bha by the rule of the Kâraka section, and the t of the second syllable is changed to d by the rule of the Dvitta section.

original: Sāsa anusiṭṭhimhi, sāsitabbo sisso, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ākārassikāro.
analyzed: sāsa anusiṭṭhimhi sāsitabbaḥ sissaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ākāraḥ sikāraḥ
translated: In the words sāsana, anusiṭṭhi, sāsitabba, sissa, the s of the first syllable is changed to ss by the rule of the ākāra ssikâra section.

original: Vaca viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, ṇyappaccayādimhi kate “antānaṃ, ṇānubandhe”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: vaca viyattiyam vācāyam ṇi a p paccaya ādimhi kate antānam ṇa anubandhā iti ca vattate
translated: In the words vacana, vākya, the n of the first syllable is changed to ny by the rule of the ṇyappaccaya section, and the t of the second syllable is changed to d by the rule of the antānaṃ ṇānubandha section.

original: 554. Kagā cajānaṃ.
analyzed: kagā cajānam
translated: Kagā cajānaṃ.

original: Cajaiccetesaṃ dhātvantānaṃ kakāra gakārādesā honti ṇakārānubandhe paccaye pareti cassa kādeso. Vacanīyaṃ vākyaṃ.
analyzed: dhātu antānam kakāra gakāra ādesāḥ honti ṇakāra anubandhe paccaye parā iti cassa ka ādesaḥ vacanīyam vākyam
translated: The k of the first syllable of these roots is changed to g, and the g of the second syllable to k, when the affix ṇ is added. The k of the first syllable is changed to c by the rule of the vacanīya section.

original: Bhaja sevāyaṃ, bhajanīyaṃ bhāgyaṃ, jassa gādeso.
analyzed: bhaja seva ayam bhajanīyam bhāgyam jassa
translated: Bhaja sevāyaṃ, bhajanīyaṃ bhāgyaṃ.🔽The j of the first syllable is changed to g by the rule of the jassa gādeso section.🔽Ci caye, acīyittha, cīyati, cīyissatīti cetabbaṃ ceyyaṃ.

original: vinicchitabbaṃ, vinicchanīyaṃ. “Kiyādito nā”ti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena tabbānīya🔽tuṃ tunā dīsu ca nāpaccayo, vinicchinitabbaṃ, vinicchinanīyaṃ.
analyzed: vinicchitabbam vinicchanīyam kiyāt itas na ati vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena  tum tunā dīsu ca nā paccayaḥ vinicchinitabbam vinicchinanīyam
translated: is to be adjudicated, is to be decided. “How many times?” is to be done by the method of the analysis of the number of times.🔽The affix -tuṃ is added to the root tunā, and the affix -dīsu is added to the root na. “Is to be adjudicated,” “is to be decided.”

original: Nī pāpuṇane, anīyittha, nīyati, nīyissatīti neyyo, neyyā, neyyaṃ. Netabbaṃ.
analyzed: nī pāpuṇane anīyittha nīyati nīyissati iti neyyaḥ neyyā neyyam netabbam
translated: Nī means “to reach,” as in anīyittha, nīyati, nīyissati. The word neyyo, neyyā, neyyaṃ is derived from the root nī. It means “is to be led,” “is to be taken.”

original: Ṇyaggahaṇaṃ chaṭṭhīyantavasenānuvattate, maṇḍūkagatiyā antaggahaṇañca tatiyantavasena.
analyzed: ṇya ggahaṇam chaṭṭhī yanta vasena anuvattate maṇḍūka gatiyāḥ anta ggahaṇam ca tatiya nta vasena
translated: The affix ṇya is added to the root gaha, and the affix -gahaṇa is added to the root antagati.

original: 555. Bhūtobba.🔽Bhū iccetasmā parassa ṇyappaccayassa saha dhātvantena abbādeso hoti. Bhavitabbo bhabbo, bhabbā, bhabbaṃ.🔽“Ṇyassa, antenā”ti ca vattate.🔽556. Vada mada gamu yuja garahākārādīhi jjammaggayheyyāgāro vā.🔽Vada mada gamu yuja garahaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi, ākārantehi ca parassa ṇyappaccayassa
analyzed: bhūta ubba  bhū iti ca itasmā parassa ṇi ap paccayassa saha dhātu antena ap bādesaḥ hoti bhavitabbaḥ bhabbaḥ bhabbā bhabbam  ṇyassa antena ati ca vattate  vada mada gamu yuja gara ha ākāra ādīhi jjammaggayheyyāgāraḥ vā  vada mada gamu yuja gara ha e c evamādīhi dhātūhi ākāra antehi ca parassa ṇyap paccayassa

original: ca gārādeso, garahassa garassevāyaṃ gāro. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo.
analyzed: ca gārā ādesaḥ garahassa garassa iva ayam gāraḥ vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ
translated: and gāro is a term of dispraise, and is derived from gara, to dispraise. The word vās is used in the sense of “distinction” and “manifestation.”

original: Vada viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, avajjittha, vajjati, vajjissatīti vā vajjaṃ vadanīyaṃ, rassattaṃ. Vajjaṃ doso.
analyzed: vada viyattiyam vācāyam avajjittha vajjati vajjissati iti vā vajjam vadanīyam rassattam vajjam dosaḥ
translated: Vada is used in the sense of “to be spoken” as in “he is to be spoken of as a fault,” “he is to be spoken of as a vice,” “he is to be spoken of as a sin.”

original: Mada ummāde, amajjittha, majjate, majjissati etenāti majjaṃ madanīyaṃ. Madaggahaṇena karaṇepi ṇyappaccayo. Gamu sappa gatimhi, gantabbaṃ gammaṃ.
analyzed: made ummāde amajjittha majjate majjissati etena ati majjam madanīyam mada ggahaṇena karaṇe pi ṇyap paccayaḥ gatimhi gantabbam gammam
translated: Majja is used in the sense of “to be intoxicated” as in “he is to be intoxicated by this,” “he is to be intoxicated by that.” The ṇy affix is used in the sense of “instrument” by the addition of the affix -a.

original: Yuja yoge, ayujjittha, yujjate, yujjissatīti yoggaṃ, niyojjo vā.🔽Garaha nindāyaṃ, agarayhittha, garahīyati, garahīyissatīti atthe ṇyappaccayo, tassiminā dhātvantena saha yhādeso, garassa gārādeso ca, gārayho, gārayhā, gārayhaṃ, garahaṇīyaṃ.
analyzed: yujaḥ yoge ayujjittha yujjate yujjissati iti yoggam niyojjaḥ vā  garaha ninda ayam agarayhittha garahīyati garahīyissati iti atthe tassiminā dhātu antena saha yha ādesaḥ garassa gārā ādesaḥ ca gārayhaḥ gārayhāḥ gārayham garahaṇīyam
translated: Yuja is used in the sense of “to be yoked” as in “he is to be yoked,” “he is to be yoked to this,” “he is to be yoked to that.”

original: Ādisaddena aññepi damajahantā gayhante. Gada viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, gajjate, gadanīyaṃ
analyzed: ādi saddena aññe pi dama jahantā gayhante gada viyattiyam vācā ayam gajjate gadanīyam

original: vā gajjaṃ. Pada gatimhi, pajjanīyaṃ pajjaṃ gāthā. Khāda bhakkhaṇe, khajjateti khajjaṃ🔽khādanīyaṃ. Damu damane, adammittha, dammate, damīyissatīti dammo damanīyo. Bhuja
analyzed: vā gajjam pada gatimhi pajjanīyam pajjam gāthā khāda bhakkhaṇe khajjata iti khajjam  khādanīyam damu damane adammittha dammate damīyissati iti dammaḥ damanīyaḥ bhuja
translated: and gajjaṃ is a cry. Pada is in the sense of going; pajjanīyaṃ is a bed; pajjaṃ is a verse. Khāda is in the sense of eating; khajjateti is food; khajjanaṃ is what is to be eaten. Damu is in the sense of taming; adammittha is tamed; dammate is being tamed; damīyissati is what is to be tamed. Bhuja is in the sense of enjoyment.

original: pālanabyavaharaṇesu, abhujjittha, bhujjati, bhujjissatīti bhoggaṃ, bhojjaṃ vā, kāraggahaṇena🔽yassa jakāro. Gahetabbaṃ gayhamiccādi.🔽Ākārantato pana dā dāne, adīyittha, dīyati, dīyissatīti atthe ṇyappaccayo, tassiminā🔽dhātvantena ākārena saha eyyādeso, deyyaṃ, dātabbaṃ. Anīye “saralopo”tiādinā pubbasarassa
analyzed: pālana byavaharaṇesu bhujjati bhujjissati iti bhoggam bhojjam vā kāra ggahaṇena  yassa jakāraḥ gahetabbam gayham iccādi  ākāra antataḥ pana dā dāne adīyittha dīyati dīyissati iti atthe ṇya p paccayaḥ tassiminā  dhātu antena ākārena saha eyya ādesaḥ deyyam dātabbam anīye sara lopa uti ādinā pubba sarassa
translated: and gajjaṃ. In the sense of ‘going’, pajjanīyaṃ is pajjaṃ, a verse. In the sense of ‘chewing’, khajjate is khajjaṃ, khajjaniyaṃ. In the sense of ‘subduing’, adammittha, dammate, damīyissatīti is dammo, damanīyo. In the sense of ‘protecting’ and ‘enjoying’, abhujjittha, bhujjati, bhujjissatīti is bhoggaṃ, bhojjaṃ. The ‘jak’ is taken by the ‘ka’ affix. What is to be taken is gayhamiccādi.

original: lope sampatte tattheva tuggahaṇena nisedhetvā “sarā sare lopa”nti ākāre lutte parasarassa dīgho, dānīyaṃ.
analyzed: lope sampatte tattha iva tuk gahaṇena nisedhetvā sarā sare ākāre lutte para sarassa dīghaḥ dānīyam
translated: But from the ‘ā’ group: In the sense of ‘giving’, adīyittha, dīyati, dīyissatīti is the ‘ṇy’ affix, and the ‘eyy’ and so on are substituted for the ‘ā’ in the ‘ā’ group together with the final vowel of the verbal base, thus deyyaṃ, dātabbaṃ. In the sense of ‘to be had’, anīye ‘saralopo’ and so on, and the first ‘sa’ is elided, and then the ‘sa’ is prohibited by the ‘tu’ affix in the same place, and the ‘ra’ is lengthened by the ‘ākāra’ rule ‘sarā sare lopa’, thus dānīyaṃ.

original: Pā pāne, apīyittha, pīyati, pīyissatīti peyyaṃ, pātabbaṃ, pānīyaṃ. Hā cāge, ahīyittha,
analyzed: pā pāne apīyittha pīyati pīyissati iti peyyam pātabbam pānīyam hā cāge ahīyittha
translated: In the sense of ‘drinking’, apīyittha, pīyati, pīyissatīti is peyyaṃ, pātabbaṃ, pānīyaṃ. In the sense of ‘abandoning’, ahīyittha, hīyati, hīyissatīti is hīyitaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ, hīyitabbaṃ

original: hīyati, hīyissatīti heyyaṃ, hātabbaṃ, hānīyaṃ. Mā māne, amīyittha, mīyati, mīyissatīti
analyzed: hīyati hīyissati iti heyyam hātabbam hānīyam mā māne amīyittha mīyati mīyissati iti
translated: What is to be abandoned is what is to be abandoned, what is to be given up, what is to be got rid of. Do not be proud, be not proud, you will be proud, you will be proud.🔽

original: meyyaṃ, mātabbaṃ, minitabbaṃ, metabbaṃ vā. Ñā avabodhane, aññāyittha, ñāyati, ñāyissatīti🔽ñeyyaṃ, ñātabbaṃ, ñāteyyaṃ. “Ñāssa jā jaṃ nā”ti jādese “kiyādito nā”ti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena
analyzed: meyyam mātabbam minitabbam metabbam vā ñā avabodhane aññāyittha ñāyati ñāyissati iti  ñeyyam ñātabbam ñāteyyam ñāssa jā jaṃ na ati jā dese kiyā āditaḥ na ati vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena
translated: is diminished, will be diminished, is to be diminished, is to be abandoned, is to be destroyed.🔽is destroyed, is being destroyed, will be destroyed, is to be destroyed, is to be diminished, is to be measured, is to be weighed.🔽is known, was known, will be known, is to be known, is to be understood.🔽“Ñāssa jā jaṃ nā” is the gerundive. “Kiyādito nā” is the gerundive with the negative.

original: nāpaccayo, ikārāgamo ca, jānitabbaṃ, vijānanīyaṃ. Khyāpakathane, saṅkhyātabbaṃ, saṅkhyeyyaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: nā paccayaḥ ikāra āgamaḥ ca jānitabbam vijānanīyam khyāpa kathane saṅkhyātabbam saṅkhyeyyam iccādi
translated: is to be known, is to be fully known.

original: 557. Karamhā ricca.
analyzed: karamhāḥ rit ca
translated: . The affix -r is added to the root kar.

original: Karadhātuto riccappaccayo hoti bhāvakammesu.🔽558. Ramhi ranto rādi no.
analyzed: kara dhātutaḥ ricca ppaccayaḥ hoti bhāva kammesu  ramhi rantaḥ rādi no
translated: The affix -r is added to the root kar in the sense of “state” and “action.”🔽. The affix -r is added to the root ram in the sense of “number.”

original: Rakārānubandhe paccaye pare sabbo dhātvanto rādi paccayarakāramariyādo no hoti, lopamāpajjateti
analyzed: rakāra anubandhe paccaye pare sabbaḥ dhātu antaḥ ra ādi paccaya rakāra mariyādaḥ no hoti lopam āpajjata iti
translated: When the affix -r is added to the root ram, the final vowel of the root is elided.🔽The meaning is: “it is to be reduced, is to be counted, is to be reckoned.”🔽. The affix -r is added to the root bhar.

original: attho. Rantoti ettha rakāro sandhijo, kattabbaṃ kiccaṃ. “Riccā”ti yogavibhāgena bharāditopi
analyzed: atthaḥ ranto ti ettha rakāraḥ sandhi jo kattabbam kiccam riccā iti yogavibhāgena bhara āditaḥ pi
translated: The affix -r is added to the root bhar in the sense of “state” and “action.”

original: riccappaccayo, yathā, bharīyatīti bhacco, saralopo. I gatimhi, pati etabbo paṭicco.
analyzed: ricca ppaccayaḥ yathā bharīyati iti bhaccaḥ sara lopaḥ i gatimhi pati etabbaḥ paṭiccaḥ
translated: The locative case is the place of action,🔽The locative case is the place of action, the place of origin, the place of destination, the place of support, the place of dependence, the place of connection, the place of accomplishment, the place of duration, the place of falling, the place of attainment, the place of the object, the place of the time, and the place of the reason.

original: 559. Pesātisaggapattakālesu kiccā.
analyzed: pesa atisagga patta kālesu kiccā
translated: The place of action is the place where the action occurs.🔽The place of origin is the place from which something comes.

original: Pesa atisagga pattakālaiccetesvatthesu kiccappaccayā honti. Pesanaṃ nāma “kattabbamidaṃ🔽bhavatā”ti āṇāpanaṃ, ajjhesanañca. Atisaggonāma “kimidaṃ mayā kattabba”nti puṭṭhassa
analyzed: pesa atisagga patta kāla aicca itesu atthesu kicca ppaccayāḥ honti pesanam nāma kattabbam idam  bhavatā ati āṇāpanam ajjhesanam ca atisaggo nāma kim idam mayā kattabbanti puṭṭhassa
translated: The place of destination is the place to which something goes.🔽The place of support is the place on which something is supported.

original: vā “pāṇo na hantabbo”tiādinā paṭipattidassanamukhena vā kattabbassa anuññā. Pattakālo
analyzed: vā pāṇaḥ na hantabbaḥ iti ādinā paṭipatti dassana mukhena vā kattabbassa anuññā patta kālo
translated: The place of dependence is the place on which something depends.🔽The place of connection is the place to which something is connected.

original: nāma sampattasamayo yo attano kiccakaraṇasamayamanupaparikkhitvā na karoti, tassa🔽samayārocanaṃ, na tattha ajjhesanamatthīti. Te ca “bhāvakammesu kiccattakkhatthā”ti
analyzed: nāma sampatta samayaḥ yaḥ attanaḥ kicca karaṇa samayam an upaparikkhitvā na karoti tassa  samaya ārocanam na tattha ajjhesanam atthi iti te ca bhāva kammesu
translated: The place of accomplishment is the place where something is accomplished.🔽The place of duration is the place where something lasts.🔽The place of falling is the place where something falls.🔽The place of attainment is the place where something is attained.🔽The place of the object is the place of the object.🔽The place of the time is the place of the time.🔽The place of the reason is the place of the reason.

original: vuttattā bhāvakammesveva bhavanti.
analyzed: vutta ttā bhāva kammesu eva bhavanti
translated: These locative cases are called “the place of action, etc.” because they are the purpose of the action.

original: Pesane tāva – karīyatu bhavatā kammanti atthe iminā tabbānīyā, sesaṃ vuttanayameva, kattabbaṃ kammaṃ bhavatā, karaṇīyaṃ kiccaṃ bhavatā.
analyzed: pesane tāva karīyatu bhavatā kammanti atthe iminā tabbānīyā sesam vutta nayam eva kattabbam kammam bhavatā karaṇīyam kiccam bhavatā
translated: In the case of the root pes ‘to do’, in the sense of ‘let the business be done by you’, the forms are tabbā, tabbāni, etc., the rest being as already stated. The forms are kattabbaṃ kammaṃ bhavatā, karaṇīyaṃ kiccaṃ bhavatā.

original: Atisagge bhujjatu bhavatāti atthe tabbādi, “aññesu cā”ti vuddhi.
analyzed: atisagge bhujjatu bhavatā ati atthe tabba ādi aññesu ca ati
translated: In the case of the root bhuj ‘to enjoy’, in the sense of ‘let it be enjoyed by you’, the forms are bhujjatā, bhujjantā, etc., the rest being as already stated. The forms are ‘aññesu ca’ is a vuddhi.

original: “Tassā”ti vattate.
analyzed: tassa ati vattate
translated: ‘Tassā’ is repeated.

original: 560. Bhujādīnamanto no dvi ca.
analyzed: bhuja ādīn am antaḥ naḥ dvi ca
translated: The end of bhuj, etc., is not, and the two of the other.

original: Bhujaiccevamādīnaṃ jakārādiantānaṃ dhātūnamanto no hoti, parassa kiccakitakappaccayatakārassa ca dvebhāvo hoti. Bhottabbaṃ bhojanaṃ bhavatā, bhojanīyaṃ bhojjaṃ bhavatā.
analyzed: bhuja e c ca evamādīnam jakāra ādi antānam dhātūnam antaḥ no hoti parassa kitca kitaka ppaccaya takārassa ca dvebhāvaḥ hoti bhottabbam bhojanam bhavatā bhojanīyam bhojjam bhavatā
translated: The end of the roots bhuj, etc., which end in the syllable ja, is not; and the two of the other, i.e. the kicc, kitaka, kappaccaya, and taka, is. The forms are bhottabbaṃ bhojanaṃ bhavatā, bhojanīyaṃ bhojjaṃ bhavatā.

original: Ikārāgamayuttatakāre pana – “namakarānamantānaṃ niyuttatamhī”ti ettha “antānaṃ niyuttatamhī”ti🔽yogavibhāgena dhātvantalopādinisedho, “rudhādito niggahītapubba”nti vinādhikārayogavibhāgena,
analyzed: ikāra āgama yut ta takāre pana ettha antānam niyut ta tamhi iti  yoga vibhāgena dhātu anta lopa ādi nisedhaḥ rudh āditaḥ niggahīta pubbanti vinā adhikāra yoga vibhāgena
translated: But when the taka is formed by the addition of the syllable ika, then ‘the end of the roots that end in a vowel is not, and the two of the other’ is stated in the following way:

original: “niggahītañcā”ti vā niggahītāgamo, bhuñjitabbaṃ tayā, yuñjitabbaṃ.
analyzed: niggahītam ca ati vā niggahīta āgamaḥ bhuñjitabbam tayā yuñjitabbam

original: Samayārocane pana – i ajjhayane adhipubbo, adhīyataṃ bhavatāti atthe tabbānīyādi,
analyzed: samaya ārocane pana i ajjhayane adhipubbaḥ adhīyatam bhavatā ati atthe tabbānīya ādi
translated: But in the case of the Injunction, the root ajjha is the predominant factor in the sense of “should be studied by you,” and so the forms tabbāni, etc., are formed.

original: ikārāgamavuddhiayādesaajjhādesā ca, ṇyappaccaye tu vuddhi, yakārassa dvittañca, ajjhayitabbaṃ,🔽ajjheyyaṃ bhavatā, ajjhayanīyaṃ bhavatā, avassaṃ kattabbanti vākye pana “kiccā”ti
analyzed: ikāra āgama vuddhi aya ādesa ajjha ādesā ca ṇya p paccaye tu vuddhi yakārassa  ajjheyyam bhavatā ajjhayanīyam bhavatā avassam kattabbanti vākye pana kicca ati
translated: And the augment -ya is added, and the vowel-change ā- ī- is substituted, and the augment -ya is added again, and the augment -ya is lengthened, and the -k- of the root is doubled, and the forms ajjhayitabbaṃ,🔽ajjheyyaṃ bhavatā, ajjhayanīyaṃ bhavatā, are formed. But in the phrase “should be done by you” the form avassakātabbaṃ is formed by the rule “kiccā avassakādhamiṇesu ṇī cā” .

original: adhikicca “avassakādhamiṇesu ṇī cā”ti avassakādhamiṇatthe ca tabbādayo, kattabbaṃ
analyzed: adhi kitca avassaka ādhamiṇesu ṇī ca ati avassaka ādhamiṇa atthe ca tabba ādayaḥ kattabbam
translated: And the forms kattabbaṃ,

original: me bhavatā gehaṃ, karaṇīyaṃ, kāriyaṃ. Evaṃ dātabbaṃ me bhavatā sataṃ, dānīyaṃ, deyyaṃ.
analyzed: me bhavatā geham karaṇīyam kāriyam evam dātabbam me bhavatā satam dānīyam deyyam
translated: karaṇīyaṃ, kāriyaṃ are formed in the sense of “should be done by you,” and the forms dātabbaṃ, dānīyaṃ, deyyaṃ are formed in the sense of “should be given by you.”

original: Dhara dhāraṇe, curādittā ṇeṇayā, vuddhi, ikārāgamo ca, dhāretabbaṃ, dhārayitabbaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: dhāraṇe curā t ittā ṇeṇayā vuddhi ikāra āgamaḥ ca dhāretabbam dhārayitabbam iccādi
translated: The root dhara in the sense of “bearing” has the forms dhāretabbaṃ, dhārayitabbaṃ, etc., by the rules “curādittā ṇeṇayā,” “vuddhi,” and “ikārāgamo ca.”

original: “Nudādīhi yuṇvūnamanānanākānanakā sakāritehi cā”ti sakāritehipi yuṇvūnamādesavidhānatoyeva
analyzed: nud ādīhi sa kāritehi ca ati
translated: And the forms dhāretabbaṃ, dhārayitabbaṃ, etc., are formed by the rule “Nudādīhi yuṇvūnamanānanākānanakā sakāritehi cā” , which allows the substitution of -y- for -v- in the future passive participle,

original: dhātuppaccayantatopi kiccakitakappaccayā bhavantīti daṭṭhabbo. Tena titikkhāpīyatīti
analyzed: dhātu ppaccaya antataḥ pi kicca kitaka ppaccayāḥ bhavanti iti daṭṭhabbaḥ tena titikkhā pīyati iti
translated: and by the rule “dhātuppaccayantatopi kiccakitakappaccayā bhavantī” , which allows the substitution of -y- for -v- in the future passive participle by the influence of the root.🔽Therefore the forms titikkhāpīyati,

original: titikkhāpetabbo. Evaṃ tikicchāpetabbo tikicchāpanīyo. Abhāvīyittha, bhāvīyati, bhāvīyissatīti
analyzed: titikkhāpetabbo evam tikicchāpetabbo tikicchāpanīyaḥ abhāvīyittha bhāvīyati bhāvīyissati iti
translated: should be treated with patience. Thus should be treated with patience, is to be treated with patience. He has not developed, is developing, will develop.

original: bhāvetabbo maggo. Bhāvayitabbo, bhāvanīyo, bhāvanīyaṃ, bhāvanīyā, akārīyittha, kārīyati,🔽kārīyissatīti kāretabbaṃ, kārayitabbaṃ, kārāpetabbaṃ, kārāpayitabbaṃ, kārāpanīyamiccādi ca siddhaṃ bhavati.🔽Kattabbaṃ karaṇīyañca, kāriyaṃ kiccamiccapi;🔽Kāretabbaṃ tathā kārā-petabbaṃ kiccasaṅgaho.🔽Kiccappaccayantanayo.
analyzed: bhāvetabbaḥ maggaḥ bhāvayitabbaḥ bhāvanīyaḥ bhāvanīyam bhāvanīyāḥ akārīyittha kārīyati  kārīyissati iti kāretabbam kārayitabbam kārāpetabbam kārāpayitabbam kārāpanīyam iccādi ca siddham bhavati  kattabbam karaṇīyam ca kāriyam kiccam id api  kāretabbam tathā kārāpetabbam kicca saṅgahaḥ  kicca ppaccaya ntanayaḥ
translated: should be endured. Thus should be cured is cured. Should be developed is the path. Should be developed, should be cultivated, should be developed, should be developed, was not done, is done, will be done.

original: Tekālika🔽Kitakappaccayantanaya🔽Idāni kitakappaccayā vuccante.
analyzed: tekālika  kita kap paccaya nta naya  idāni kitaka ppaccayāḥ vuccante

translated: What should be done, what should be done, what should be done, what should be done,

original: 562. Aññe kita.
analyzed: aññe k ita
translated: Others are kita.

original: Tatiye dhātvādhikāre vihitā kiccehi aññe paccayā kiticceva saññā hontīti kitasaññā katā.
analyzed: tatiye dhātu adhikāre vihitā kiccehi aññe paccayāḥ kit icca iva saññāḥ honti iti kita saññā katā
translated: In the third section on the bases, other conditions than those already mentioned, namely, those called kicca, are called kitasaññā, “having the name kit.”

original: 563. Kattari kita.
analyzed: kattari kita
translated: Kittari kita.🔽The kit-condition is invariably in the agent, the doer. And because it is said, “The -ṇ- and so on are in the three tenses,”

original: Kattari kārake kitapaccayo hotīti niyamato kattari bhavati, so ca “ṇādayo tekālikā”ti🔽vuttattā kālattaye ca hoti. Pure viya kāritabyapadesaṇalopavuddhiyo, paccayantassāliṅgattā
analyzed: kattari kārake kita paccayaḥ hoti iti niyamataḥ kattari bhavati saḥ ca ṇa ādayaḥ tekālikā ati  vutta ttā kāla ttaye ca hoti pure
translated: it is in the three tenses. As in the past, the indication of the action to be done, the omission of the -a-, and the addition are the same.🔽Because the condition is in the nominative case,🔽the kit-condition is in the nominative case, because it is said, “In the nominative case, in the accusative case, and so on, in the locative case, and in the instrumental case, and in the ablative case, and in the dative case, and in the genitive case, and in the names of the vocative case, and in the names of the indeclinables, and in the names of the kit-words.”

original: syādimhi asampatte “taddhitasamāsakitakā nāmaṃvātavetunādīsu cā”ti kitakantattā nāmaṃva🔽kate syādyuppatti, tato kumbhaṃ karotīti atthe “amādayo parapadebhī”ti dutiyātappurisasamāso,🔽“nāmāna”ntiādinā samāsasaññā, “tesaṃ vibhattiyo lopā cā”ti vibhattilopo, “pakati
analyzed: sya ādimhi a sampatte taddhita samāsa kitakāḥ nāmaṃvāta vetu nādīsu ca ati kitakantattāḥ nāmaṃva kate kumbham karoti iti atthe ama ādayaḥ para padebhi iti dutiyā tappurisa samāsaḥ  nāma ananti ādinā samāsa saññā tesam vibhattiyaḥ lopā ca ati vibhatti lopo
translated: When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”🔽When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”🔽When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”🔽When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”🔽When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”

original: cassa sarantassā”ti pakatibhāvo, puna samāsattā nāmamiva kate syādyuppatti.
analyzed: cassa sarantassa ati pakati bhāvaḥ puna samāsattā nāmam iva kate
translated: When the kit-condition is in the nominative case, the -a- of the verb is dropped, because it is said, “The -a- of the verb is dropped in the nominative case.”

original: So kumbhakāro, te kumbhakārā iccādi. Itthiyaṃ kumbhakārī, kumbhakāriyo iccādi, tathā
analyzed: saḥ kumbhakāraḥ te kumbhakārāḥ iccādi itthiyam kumbhakārī kumbhakāriyaḥ iccādi tathā
translated: Potter is kumbhakāra, potters are kumbhakārā. Potteress is kumbhakārī, potteresses are kumbhakāriyo.

original: kammaṃ karotīti kammakāro. Evaṃ mālākāro, kaṭṭhakāro, rathakāro, suvaṇṇakāro, suttakāro,
analyzed: kammam karoti iti kammakāraḥ evam mālākāraḥ kaṭṭhakāraḥ rathakāraḥ suvaṇṇakāraḥ suttakāro
translated: So too, he makes a craft, thus he is a craftsman ; thus garland-maker, wood-cutter, chariot-maker, goldsmith, tailor,

original: vuttikāro, ṭīkākāro.
analyzed: vutti kāro ṭīkā kāro
translated: commentator, subcommentator.

original: Gaha upādāne, pattaṃ agaṇhi, gaṇhāti, gaṇhissatīti vā pattaggāho. Evaṃ rasmiggāho, rajjuggāho.
analyzed: gahaḥ upādāne pattam agaṇhi gaṇhāti gaṇhissati iti vā patta ggāhaḥ evam rasmi ggāhaḥ rajju ggāhaḥ
translated: Taking is gaha; he took the bowl, he takes, he will take, thus he is a bowl-taker ; so too, a thread-taker, a rope-taker.

original: Ve tantasantāne, tantaṃ avāyi, vāyati, vāyissatīti vā tantavāyo, “te āvāyā kārite”ti āyādeso, vākye panettha “te āvāyā”ti yogavibhāgena āyādeso. Evaṃ tunnavāyo.
analyzed: te tanta santāne tantam avāyi vāyati vāyissati iti vā tantavāyo te āvāyā kāritā iti āya ādesaḥ vākye pana ittha te āvāyā ati yogavibhāgena āya ādesaḥ evam tunnavāyo
translated: Thread is ve; he wove the thread, he weaves, he will weave, thus he is a weaver ; “te āvāyā kārite” is the āyādesanā ; but in the sentence here the āyādesanā is by resolution of the compound in the sense of “te āvāyā” . So too, a mat-weaver.

original: Mā parimāṇe, dhaññaṃ amini, mināti, minissatīti vā atthe ṇappaccaye kate –
analyzed: mā parimāṇe dhaññam amini mināti minissati iti vā atthe ṇap paccaye kate
translated: Measure is mā; he measured the grain, he measures, he will measure, thus in the sense of “atthe ṇappaccaye kate”

original: “Ṇamhī”ti vattate.
analyzed: ṇamhi iti vattate
translated: “ṇamhī” is said.

original: 564. Ākārantānamāyo.
analyzed: ākāra anta anam āyo
translated: The āyādesanā of those ending in vowels.

original: Ākārantānaṃ dhātūnaṃ antassa āyādeso hoti ṇakārānubandhe paccaye pare, saralopādi. Dhaññamāyo. Evaṃ dānaṃ dadātīti dānadāyo.
analyzed: ākāra antānam dhātūnam antassa āya ādesaḥ hoti ṇakāra anubandhe paccaye pare sara lopa ādi dhañña māyaḥ evam dānam dadāti iti dāna dāyaḥ
translated: The āyādesanā of those verbal roots ending in vowels is the elision of the final, etc., when the following is a ṇ-ending affix. Grain-measure. So too, he gives a gift, thus he is a gift-giver ;

original: Kamu kantimhi, dhammaṃ akāmayi, kāmayati, kāmayissatīti vā dhammakāmo puriso, dhammakāmā
analyzed: kamu kantimhi dhammam akāmayi kāmayati kāmayissati iti vā dhamma kāmaḥ purisaḥ dhamma kāmā
translated: One who is fond of, who delights in, who is intent upon, the Dhamma is a person who delights in the Dhamma, who delights in what is true, who delights in the good, who delights in what is wholesome.

original: kaññā, dhammakāmaṃ cittaṃ. Evaṃ atthakāmo, hitakāmo, sukhakāmo, dhammaṃ pāletīti dhammapālo iccādi.🔽Damu damane, “ariṃ adami, dameti, damissatī”ti viggahe “dhātuyā”ti adhikāro, “kammādimhī”ti ca vattate.🔽565. Saññāyamanu.🔽Kammūpapade ādimhi sati saññāyaṃ gamyamānāyaṃ dhātuyā appaccayo hoti, upapadante🔽nukārāgamo ca. Ettha ca “nu niggahītaṃ padante”ti sutte “padante”ti vacanato upapadanteyeva🔽nukārāgamo hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ. “Tesu vuddhī”tiādinā ukāralopo. Ayaṃ pana nvāgamo samāsaṃ
analyzed: kaññā dhamma kāmam cittam evam attha kāmaḥ hita kāmaḥ sukha kāmaḥ dhammam pāleti iti dhamma pālaḥ iccādi  damane arim adami dameti damissati iti viggahe adhikāraḥ kamma ādimhi iti ca vattate  saññāyam anu  kammu upapade ādimhi sati saññā iyam gamyamānā iyam dhātuyāḥ appaccayaḥ hoti upapad ante  nukāra āgamaḥ ca ettha ca nu niggahītam pad antā iti sutte pad antā iti vacanataḥ  nukāra āgamaḥ hoti iti daṭṭhabbam tesu vuddhi iti ādinā ukāra lopaḥ ayam pana nu āgamaḥ samāsam
translated: One who loves the Dhamma is a person who desires the Dhamma, who has desired the Dhamma, who will desire the Dhamma, thus he is a Dhamma-lover . A Dhamma-loving maiden is a Dhamma-loving girl . A Dhamma-loving mind is a mind that loves the Dhamma. So too with one who loves the meaning, one who loves the welfare, one who loves the pleasure. One who protects the Dhamma is a Dhamma-protector .

original: Upapadabhūtanāmapadante vattamāno nukārāgamo niggahītamāpajjate, niggahītassa vaggantattaṃ, sesaṃ samaṃ, vuddhābhāvova viseso, arindamo rājā.
analyzed: upapada bhūta nāma pada ante vattamānaḥ nukāra āgamaḥ niggahītam āpajjate niggahītassa vagga anta ttam sesam samam vuddha abhāvaḥ uva visesaḥ arindamaḥ rājā
translated: The affix -iṃ is added to the name-base in the sense of the future, and the -t- of the reduplicate is elided, the rest being the same as before. The only difference is the absence of the augment -v- . The King Arindama.

original: Tathā tara taraṇe, vessaṃ taratīti vessantaro, taṇhaṃ karoti hiṃsatīti taṇhaṅkaro bhagavā. Evaṃ medhaṅkaro, saraṇaṅkaro, dīpaṅkaro.
analyzed: tathā tara taraṇe vessam tarati iti vessantaraḥ taṇham karoti hiṃsati iti taṇhaṅkaraḥ bhagavā evam medhaṅkaraḥ saraṇaṅkaraḥ dīpaṅkaraḥ
translated: Similarly, tara means “to cross”: vessaṃ taratīti vessantaro. Taṇhaṃ karoti hiṃsatīti taṇhaṅkaro bhagavā. So too, medhaṅkaro, saraṇaṅkaro, dīpaṅkaro.

original: “Ādimhi, a”iti ca vattate.
analyzed: ādimhi aiti ca vattate
translated: “In the beginning, a” is said.

original: 567. Pure dadā ca iṃ.
analyzed: pure dadā ca iṃ
translated: . In the past, dadā, and iṃ.

original: Purasadde ādimhi sati “dada dāne”iccetāya dhātuyā appaccayo hoti, purasadde akārassa
analyzed: pura sadde ādimhi sati dada dāne icca itāya dhātuyāḥ appaccayaḥ hoti pura sadde akārassa
translated: When the word pura is in the beginning, the affix -iṃ is added to the verbal root dada in the sense of giving, and the -a of the word pura is elided.

original: iñca hoti. Ettha ca “tadanuparodhenā”ti paribhāsato purasaddantasseva iṃ hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: iñca hoti ettha ca tad an uparodhena ati paribhāsato pura sadda antassa iva iṃ hoti iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: And iṃ is added. And here, iṃ should be understood to be added only to the word ending in pura, according to the statement “without contradicting that” .

original: Ṇādīnaṃ tekālikattepi upapadatthavisesena atīteyevāyamappaccayo hotīti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: ṇa ādīnam te kālika tte pi upapada attha visesena atīte iya iva ayam appaccayaḥ hoti iti daṭṭhabbam
translated: Even though ṇ and so on are in the present tense, this affix -iṃ should be understood to be in the past tense only, by the special meaning of the prefix upa.

original: Pure dānaṃ adadīti purindado sakko. Idhāpi vibhattilope kateyeva iṃādeso.
analyzed: pure dānam adadi iti purindadaḥ sakkaḥ idha api vibhatti lope iṃ ādesaḥ
translated: In the past, he gave a gift, purindado Sakka. Here too, the substitution of iṃ is made only after the elision of the case-ending.

original: “Kammādimhi, a”iti ca vattate.
analyzed: kamma ādimhi aiti ca vattate
translated: “In the beginning of a verb, a” is said.🔽.

original: 568. Sabbato ṇvu tvāvī vā.
analyzed: sabbataḥ ṇvu tvāvī vā
translated: Sabbato ṇvu tvāvī vā.

original: Sabbato dhātuto kammādimhi vā akammādimhi vā sati a ṇvu tu āvī iccete cattāro paccayā honti. Vāggahaṇaṃ “akammādimhi vā”ti vikappanatthaṃ.
analyzed: sabbatas dhātutaḥ kamma ādimhi vā akamma ādimhi vā sati a ṇvu tu āvī icca ete cattāro paccayāḥ honti vā aggahaṇam akamma ādimhi vā āti vikappana attham
translated: When there is kamma, etc., or non-kamma, etc., in any of the elements, then these four conditions are: sabbato, ṇvu, tu, and āvī. The word vā is for the purpose of including non-kamma, etc.

original: Appaccaye tāva – dhara dhāraṇe, dhammaṃ adhari, dharati, dharissatīti vā dhammadharo.🔽Evaṃ vinayadharo. Tathā taṃ karotīti takkaro, dvittaṃ. Evaṃ hitakaro, divasakaro,🔽dinakaro, divākaro, nisākaro, dhanuṃ gaṇhātīti dhanuggaho. Evaṃ kaṭaggaho, sabbakāmaṃ
analyzed: appaccaye tāva dhara dhāraṇe dhammam dharati dharissati iti vā dhammadharo  evam tathā tam karoti iti evam hita karaḥ  dinakaraḥ divākaraḥ nisākaraḥ dhanum gaṇhāti iti dhanuggahaḥ evam kaṭaggahaḥ sabba kāmam
translated: As to non-conditions: dhara, bearing, as in dhammadharo , he bears the True Idea, he bears it, he will bear it.

original: dadātīti sabbakāmadado, sabbadado.🔽Āto pana – annaṃ adāsi, dadāti, dadissatīti annado. Evaṃ dhanado, saccaṃ sandahatīti
analyzed: dadāti iti sabba kāma dado sabba dado  ā atas pana annam adāsi dadāti dadissati iti anna do evam dhana do saccam sandahati iti
translated: So vinayadharo . Likewise, he does it thus, takkaro , he is a doubler, dvittako . So hitakaro , divasakaro , dinakaro , divākaro , nisākaro . He takes up a bow, dhanuggaho . So kaṭaggaho , sabbakāmaṃ dadāti, sabbakāmadado , sabbadado .

original: saccasandho. Pā pāne, majjaṃ pivatīti majjapo. Tā pālane, gavaṃ saddaṃ tāyatīti gottaṃ. Evaṃ kattari.
analyzed: saccasandho pā pāne majjam pivati iti majjapo tā pālane gavam saddam tāyati iti gottam evam kattari
translated: But from ā: He gave food, he gives, he will give, annado . So dhanado . He binds truth, saccasandho . He drinks liquor, majjapo . Tā, protection, he protects the cow, gotta . So in the sense of instrument.

original: Akammādimhi pana “yasmā dapetī”ti sutte bhayaggahaṇena sesasādhanepi appaccayo.
analyzed: a kamma ādimhi pana yasmai dapeti iti sutte bhaya ggahaṇena sesa sādhane pi appaccayaḥ
translated: But in the case of akamma, etc., the word bhaya in the sutta “yasmā dapetī” is not a reason for the rest of the sādhana.

original: Nī pāpuṇane vipubbo, vinesi, vineti, vinessati etena, etthāti vā vinayo, “aññesu
analyzed: nī pāpuṇane vipubbaḥ vinesi vineti vinessati etena ettha ati vā vinayaḥ aññesu
translated: Nī is nippabbo in pāpuṇane, vinesi, vineti, vinessati etena, etthāti vā vinayo, “aññesu

original: cā”ti vuddhi, ayādeso ca, nayanaṃ nayo. Si sevāyaṃ nipubbo, nissīyittha, nissīyati,
analyzed: ca ati vuddhi aya ādesaḥ ca nayanam nayaḥ si seva ayam nipubbaḥ nissīyittha nissīyati
translated: cā”ti vuddhi, ayādeso ca, nayanaṃ nayo. Si is nippabbo in sevāyaṃ, nissīyittha, nissīyati,

original: nissīyissatīti vā nissayo. Si saye, anusayi, anuseti, anusessatīti vā anusayo.
analyzed: nissīyissati iti vā nissayaḥ si saye anusayi anuseti anusessati iti vā anusayaḥ
translated: nissīyissatīti vā nissayo. Si is saye, anusayi, anuseti, anusessatīti vā anusayo.

original: I gatimhi patipubbo, paṭicca ekasmā phalametīti paccayo, samudayo. Ci caye, vinicchīyate
analyzed: i gatimhi patipubbaḥ paṭicca ekasmā phalam eti iti paccayaḥ samudayaḥ ci caye vinicchīyate
translated: I is patipubbo in gatimhi, paṭicca ekasmā phalametīti paccayo, samudayo. Ci is caye, vinicchīyate

original: anena, vinicchayanaṃ vā vinicchayo, uccayanaṃ uccayo, sañcayo, dhammaṃ vicinātīti
analyzed: anena vinicchayanam vā vinicchayaḥ uccayanam uccayo sañcayaḥ dhammam vicināti iti
translated: anena, vinicchayanaṃ vā vinicchayo, uccayanaṃ uccayo, sañcayo, dhammaṃ vicinātīti

original: dhammavicayo. Khī khaye, khayanaṃ khayo. Ji jaye, vijayanaṃ vijayo, jayo. Kī dabbavinimaye,
analyzed: dhamma vicayaḥ khī khaye khayanam khayaḥ ji jaye vijayanam vijayaḥ jayaḥ dabba vinimaye
translated: dhammavicayo. Khī is khaye, khayanaṃ khayo. Ji is jaye, vijayanaṃ vijayo, jayo. Kī is dabbavinimaye,

original: vikkayanaṃ vikkayo, kayo. Lī silesane, allīyati etthāti ālayo, layo. Evaṃ ivaṇṇantato.
analyzed: vikkayanam silesane ettha ati ālayaḥ evam
translated: vikkayanaṃ vikkayo, kayo. Lī is silesane, allīyati etthāti ālayo, layo. Thus by the meaning of the words.

original: Āsuṇantīti assavā, avādeso, paṭissavanaṃ paṭissavo. Su gatimhi, ābhavaggā savantīti
analyzed: āsuṇanti iti assavāḥ a v ādesaḥ paṭissavanam paṭissavaḥ su gatimhi ā bha vaggā savanti iti
translated: Āsavā is from su, to go, in the sense of “flowing” (savana).🔽Ravo is from ru, to sound; it is a sound.

original: āsavā. Ru sadde, ravatīti ravo. Bhavatīti bhavo. Pabhavati etasmāti pabhavo. Lū chedane,
analyzed: ravati iti ravaḥ bhavati iti bhavaḥ pabhavati etasmā ati pabhavaḥ chedane
translated: Bhava is from bhu, to be; it is existence.🔽Pabhavo is from bhu, to shine; it is a light.

original: lavanaṃ lavo. Evaṃ uvaṇṇantato.
analyzed: lavanam lavaḥ evam
translated: Lavo is from lu, to cut; it is a drop.

original: Niggaṇhāti, niggahaṇaṃ vā niggaho, paggaho, saṅgaṇhāti tena, saṅgahaṇaṃ vā saṅgaho.🔽Vara varaṇe, saṃvaraṇaṃ saṃvaro. Dara ādare, ādaraṇaṃ ādaro. Āgacchati, āgamananti
analyzed: niggaṇhāti niggahaṇam vā niggahaḥ paggahaḥ saṅgaṇhāti tena saṅgahaṇam vā saṅgahaḥ  vara varaṇe saṃvaraṇam saṃvaraḥ dare ādare ādaraṇam ādaraḥ āgacchati
translated: Niggaho is from gah, to grasp; it is grasping, or the act of grasping.🔽Saṃvaro is from var, to choose; it is the act of choosing.🔽Āgamo is from gam, to go; it is the act of going, or the act of coming.

original: vā āgamo, āgamīyanti ettha, etena vā atthāti āgamo pariyatti. Sappatīti sappo. Dibbatīti
analyzed: vā āgamaḥ āgamīyanti ettha etena vā attha ati āgamaḥ sappati iti sappaḥ dibbati iti
translated: Sappo is from sap, to be satisfied; it is a snake.

original: devo. Kamu padavikkhepe, pakkamanaṃ, pakkamatīti vā pakkamo. Evaṃ vikkamo.
analyzed: pada vikkhepe pakkamanam pakkamati iti vā pakkamaḥ evam vikkamaḥ
translated: Devo is from div, to shine; it is a god.🔽Pakkamo is from kam, to go; it is the act of going.🔽Vanacaro is from car, to go; it is one who goes in the forest.

original: Cara caraṇe, vane caratīti vanacaro, kāmo avacarati etthāti kāmāvacaro loko, kāmāvacarā saññā, kāmāvacaraṃ cittaṃ. Gāvo caranti etthāti gocaro, chaṭṭhītappuriso.
analyzed: cara caraṇe vane carati iti vana caraḥ kāmaḥ avacarati ettha ati kāma avacaraḥ loko kāma avacarā saññā kāma avacaram cittam gāvaḥ caranti ettha ati go caraḥ
translated: Gocaro is from goc, to go; it is the place where cows go.

original: Pādena pivatīti pādapo. Evaṃ kacchapo, tatiyātappuriso.
analyzed: pādena pivati iti pādapaḥ evam kacchapaḥ tatiyātappurisaḥ
translated: A tree is so called because it drinks with its foot. So too, a tortoise, a third-year student.

original: Ruha janane, sirasmiṃ ruhatīti siroruho, guhāyaṃ sayatīti guhāsayaṃ cittaṃ. Evaṃ🔽kucchisayā vātā. Ṭhā gatinivattimhi, pabbate aṭṭhāsi, tiṭṭhati, ṭhassatīti vā pabbataṭṭho
analyzed: janane sirasmin ruhati iti siroruhaḥ guhā ayam sayati iti guhā sayam cittam evam  kucchi sayāḥ vātāḥ gati nivattimhi pabbate aṭṭhāsi tiṭṭhati ṭhassati iti vā pabbataṭṭhaḥ
translated: Ruha is growing. It grows on the head, thus it is a head-growth ; it lies in a cave, thus it is a cave-dweller . So too, the winds that lie in the belly.

original: puriso, pabbataṭṭhā nadī, pabbataṭṭhaṃ osadhaṃ. Evaṃ thalaṭṭhaṃ, jalaṭṭhaṃ, sattamītappuriso.
analyzed: puriso pabbata ṭṭhā nadī pabbata ṭṭham osadham evam thala ṭṭham jala ṭṭham sattamī tappurisaḥ
translated: Ṭhā is in the sense of standing-place. It stands on the mountain, it stands, it will stand, thus a man is a mountain-stander ; a river is a mountain-stander ; a medicinal plant is a mountain-stander. So too, a land-stander, a water-stander, a seventh-year student.

original: 569. Gahassupadhasse vā.
analyzed: gahassa upadhasse vā
translated: . Or in the sense of a place for storing.

original: Gahaiccetassa dhātussa upadhassa ettaṃ hoti vā, upadhāti antakkharato pubbakkharassa parasamaññā, gayhatīti gehaṃ, gahaṃ vā.
analyzed: gaha e c ca itassa dhātussa upadhassa ettam hoti vā upadhā ti anta kkharataḥ pubba kkharassa para samaññā gayhati iti geham gaham vā
translated: The word ettha is used in the sense of a place for storing of that element called a house. Upadhā is a synonym for the first syllable of the second word. It is a house because it is seized , thus it is a house ; or it is a house because it is a place for storing .

original: Ṇvuppaccaye rathaṃ karotīti atthe ṇvuppaccayo, so ca “aññe kita”ti kitasaññattā “kattari kita”ti kattariyeva bhavati, tato kāritabyapadesa ṇalopavuddhiyo.
analyzed: ratham karoti iti atthe ṇu uppaccayaḥ saḥ ca aññe kitati kita saññattā kattari kitati kattariyā iva bhavati
translated: The ṇvu affix is added in the sense of “he makes a chariot” . And that ṇvu affix is called a kit because it is a different kind of kit . So it is only in the sense of an agent that it occurs. Then the ṇu is elided and the vowel i is lengthened.

original: 570. Anakā yuṇvūnaṃ.
analyzed: anakāḥ yuṇvūnam
translated: . Anakā is for yuṇvūnaṃ .

original: Yuṇvuiccetesaṃ paccayānaṃ ana akaiccete ādesā hontīti akādeso. Sesaṃ kumbhakārasaddasamaṃ,🔽rathakārako. Tathā annaṃ dadātīti annadāyako, “ākārantānamāyo”ti āyādeso, “itthiyamato
analyzed: yu ṇ vu iti ca itesam paccayānam ana aka ai c ca ete ādesāḥ honti iti aka ādesaḥ sesam kumbhakāra sadda samam  tathā annam dadāti iti anna dāyakaḥ āya ādeśaḥ itthiya mato
translated: The vowel a is called a vowel,

original: āpaccayo”ti āpaccayo, “tesu vuddhī”tiādinā akārassa ikāro, annadāyikā kaññā, annadāyakaṃ🔽kulaṃ. Lokaṃ netīti lokanāyako, vineti satteti vināyako, “te āvāyā kārite”ti āyādeso.🔽Akammūpapade karotīti kārako, kārikā, kārakaṃ. Dadātīti dāyako, dāyikā, dāyakaṃ.🔽Netīti nāyako, nāyikā, nāyakaṃ. Bhagavato ovādānusāsaniṃ asuṇi, suṇāti, suṇissatīti🔽vā sāvako, sāvikā, āvādeso. Lunātīti lāvako. Pu pavane, punātīti pāvako, bhavatīti
analyzed: āpaccayo ti āpaccayo tesu vuddhi iti ādinā akārassa ikāraḥ anna dāyikā kaññā anna dāyakam  kulam lokam neti iti lokanāyakaḥ vineti satta iti vināyakaḥ te āvāyā kāritā iti āya ādeśaḥ  karoti iti kārakaḥ kārikā kārakam dadāti iti dāyakaḥ dāyikā dāyakam  na iti iti nāyakaḥ nāyikā nāyakam bhagavataḥ ovāda anusāsanim suṇāti suṇissati iti  vā sāvakaḥ sāvikā lunāti iti pavane punāti iti pāvakaḥ bhavati iti
translated: and the rest is like the word potter.

original: bhāvako, upāsatīti upāsako, upāsikā. Gaṇhātīti gāhako.
analyzed: bhāvakaḥ upāsati iti upāsakaḥ upāsikā gaṇhāti iti gāhakaḥ
translated: So too: He gives food, thus he is a giver-of-food . The vowel a is called a vowel. He is a woman, thus he is a woman . The vowel a is called a vowel. He is a man, thus he is a man . The vowel a is called a vowel. He is a boy, thus he is a boy . The vowel a is called a vowel. He is a girl, thus she is a girl . The vowel a is called a vowel. He is a house, thus it is a house .
