analyzed: ṭhā pānam iī ca
translated: . Ṭhāpānamiī ca.

original: Ṭhā pāiccetesaṃ dhātūnaṃ antassa ākārassa yathākkamaṃ ikāraīkārādesā honti tappaccaye,🔽timhi ca. Casaddena aññatrāpi kvaci. Ṭhā gatinivattimhi, aṭṭhāsīti ṭhito, upaṭṭhito🔽garuṃ, ṭhitavā, adhiṭṭhitvā, ṭhānaṃ ṭhiti. Pā pāne, apāyīti pītā, yāguṃ pītavā, pānaṃ pīti, pītvā.
analyzed: ṭhā pā icca itesam dhātūnam antassa ākārassa yathākkamam ikāra īkāra ādesāḥ honti tad paccaye  timhi ca ca saddena aññatra api kvaci ṭhā gati nivattimhi aṭṭhāsi iti ṭhitaḥ upaṭṭhitaḥ  garum ṭhitavā adhiṭṭhitvā ṭhānam pā pāne pāyīti pītā yāgum pītavā pānam pīti pītvā
translated: The vowel of the final syllable of these words is changed to i or ī respectively, in the case-endings beginning with i,🔽and also in timhi. By the word ca also elsewhere in some instances. Ṭhā in the sense of going and standing: aṭṭhāsīti ṭhito, upaṭṭhito; garuṃ, ṭhitvā, adhiṭṭhitvā, ṭhānaṃ, ṭhiti. Pā in the sense of drinking: apāyīti pītā, yāguṃ pītavā, pānaṃ pīti, pītvā.

original: 621. Hantehi ho hassa lo vā adahanahānaṃ.🔽Hakārantehi dhātūhi parassa tappaccayassa, tissa ca hakārādeso hoti, hassa ca dhātvantassa🔽lakāro hoti vā dahanahe vajjetvā, ḍhattāpavādoyaṃ. Ruha janane, aruhīti āruḷho rukkhaṃ.🔽Laḷānamaviseso, ārulho vā, ruhanaṃ ruḷhī. Gāhu viloḷane, agāhīti gāḷho, ajjhogāḷho
analyzed: hanta ihi ho hassa laḥ vā a dahana hānam  hakāra antehi dhātūhi parassa tad paccayassa tissa ca hakāra ādesaḥ hoti hassa ca dhātu antassa  lakāraḥ hoti vā dahana he ḍhattā apavādaḥ yam janane aruhī iti āruḍhaḥ rukkham  laḷānam avisesaḥ ārulhaḥ vā ruhanam ruḷhī gāhu viloḷane agāhi iti gāḷhaḥ ajjhogāḷhaḥ
translated: The vowel of the final syllable of these roots is changed to i or ī respectively, in the Locative case,

original: mahaṇṇavaṃ. Baha vuddhimhi, abahīti bāḷho, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dīgho. Muha vecitte,
analyzed: baha vuddhimhi abahi iti bāḷhaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dīghaḥ muha vecitte
translated: and in the Imperative, and in some other cases also, as shown by the particle ca. The Locative is illustrated by ṭhānaṃ, ṭhitī, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitavā, ṭhitvā, ṭhitena, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamānā, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭhitamhi, ṭ

original: amuyhīti mūḷho. Guha saṃvaraṇe, aguhīti gūḷhaṃ. Vaha pāpuṇane, upavahīti upavuḷho,
analyzed: amuyhi iti mūḍhaḥ guha saṃvaraṇe aguhi iti gūḍham vaha pāpuṇane upavahi iti upavuḷhaḥ
translated: ‘Amūḷho’ means ‘confused’. ‘Guha’ means ‘concealment’, ‘aguhī’ means ‘concealed’. ‘Vaha’ means ‘to reach’, ‘upavaha’ means ‘to be reached’.

original: “vaca vasa vahādīnamukāro vassā”ti yogavibhāgena uttaṃ.
analyzed: vaca vasa yoga vibhāgena uttam
translated: ‘Vaca, vasa, vah, etc.’ is the beginning of the vowel group.

original: Adahanahānanti kimatthaṃ? Daḍḍho, sannaddho. Vāti kiṃ? Duddho, siniddho. “Gahitaṃ, mahita”ntiādīsu pana ikārāgamena byavahitattā na bhavati.
analyzed: kimattham daḍḍhaḥ sannaddhaḥ vāti kim duddhaḥ siniddhaḥ gahitam mahitanti ādīsu pana ikāra āgamena byavahita ttā na bhavati
translated: ‘Adahanahān’ is for what purpose? ‘Daḍḍho’, ‘sanaddho’. What is it? ‘Duddho’, ‘siniddho’. But in ‘gahitam, mahitan’, etc., it is not because of the intervention of the vowel ‘i’.

original: Dhātuppaccayantatopi “atīte ta tavantutāvī”ti tappaccayo, abubhukkhīti bubhukkhito. Evaṃ jighacchito, pipāsito iccādi.
analyzed: dhātup paccaya ntataḥ pi atīte ta tava ntu tāvī iti tad paccayaḥ abubhukkhī iti bubhukkhitaḥ evam jighacchitaḥ pipāsitaḥ iccādi
translated: ‘Dhātuppaccayantatopi’ means ‘atīte ta tavantutāvī’. ‘Abubhukkhī’ means ‘hungry’. Thus ‘jighacchito’, ‘pipāsito’, etc.

original: Evaṃ kattari niṭṭhanayo.🔽“Atīte”ti vattate.
analyzed: evam kattari niṭṭha nayo  atītā iti vattate
translated: Thus the declension of the passive agent is finished.🔽‘Atīte’ is said.

original: 622. Bhāvakammesu ta.
analyzed: bhāva kammesu ta
translated: . In the present and future tenses, ‘ta’.

original: Atīte kāle gamyamāne sabbadhātūhi tappaccayo hoti bhāvakammaiccetesvatthesu.
analyzed: atīte kāle gamyamāne sabba dhātūhi tad paccayaḥ hoti
translated: In the future tense, the passive agent is with all the verbal roots in the present and future tenses in these meanings: the present, the future, and the passive.

original: Bhāve tāva –
analyzed: bhāve tāva
translated: In the present tense, first:

original: Ge sadde, gāyanaṃ, agāyitthāti vā atthe tappaccayo.
analyzed: ge sadde gāyanam agāyittha ati vā atthe tad paccayaḥ
translated: ‘Ge’ means ‘sound’, ‘gāyanaṃ’, ‘agāyitthā’ is the meaning of the passive agent.

original: 623. Sabbattha ge gī.
analyzed: sabbattha ge gī
translated: . ‘Ge’ is everywhere.

original: Geiccetassa dhātussa gīādeso hoti sabbattha, tappaccayatipaccayesvevāyaṃ. Tassa gītaṃ, gāyanaṃ, gāyitabbāti vā gīti.
analyzed: dhātussa gī ādesaḥ hoti sabbattha tad paccaya ti paccayesu eva ayam tassa gītam gāyanam gāyitabbā ati vā gīti
translated: The affix -i is added to the root gā, to denote singing, and the affix -ana to denote the act of singing.

original: Bhāve – tappaccayantā napuṃsakā. Kammani – tiliṅgā.🔽Nata gattavināme, naccanaṃ, anaccitthāti vā atthe tappaccayo.🔽624. Paccayā daniṭṭhā nipātanā sijjhanti.🔽Ye idha sappaccayā saddā paccayehi na niṭṭhaṃ gatā, te nipātanato sijjhantīti dhātvantena
analyzed: bhāve tad paccaya ntā napuṃsakā kammani ti liṅgā  nata gatta vināme nac canam a nac cittha ati vā atthe tad paccayaḥ  paccayāḥ daniṭṭhāḥ nipātanā sijjhanti  ye idha sappaccayā saddā paccayehi na niṭṭham gatā te nipātanataḥ sijjhanti iti dhātu antena
translated: The affix -i is added to the root bhā, to denote the act of being, and the affix -ana to denote the act of being.🔽The affix -ana is added to the root naṭ, to denote dancing, and the affix -ana to denote the act of dancing.

original: saha tappaccayassa cca ṭṭādesā. Naccaṃ, naṭṭaṃ. Hasa hasane, hasanaṃ hasitaṃ, ikārāgamo.
analyzed: saha tad paccayassa c ca ṭṭa ādesāḥ naccam naṭṭam hasa hasane hasanam hasitam ikāra āgamaḥ
translated: The affixes -i and -ana are added to the root has, to denote laughing, and the affix -ana to denote the act of laughing.

original: Gamanaṃ gataṃ. Evaṃ ṭhitaṃ, sayitaṃ, vādhikārassa vavatthitavibhāsattā vuddhi. Ruda
analyzed: gamanam gatam evam ṭhitam sayitam vā adhikārassa vavatthita vibhāsa ttā ruda
translated: The affix -ana is added to the root gam, to denote going, and the affix -ana to denote the act of going.

original: assuvimocane, arujjhitthāti roditaṃ, ruṇṇaṃ vā iccādi.🔽Kammani –
analyzed: assu vimocane roditam ruṇṇam vā iccādi  kammani
translated: The affix -ana is added to the root ru, to denote crying, and the affix -ana to denote the act of crying.

original: Abhibhūyitthāti abhibhūto kodho bhavatā, abhibhūtā, abhibhūtaṃ. Bhāsa byattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ,
analyzed: abhibhūyittha ati abhibhūtaḥ kodhaḥ bhavatā abhibhūtāḥ abhibhūtam vācāyam
translated: The affix -ana is added to the root abhibhū, to denote the act of overcoming, and the affix -ana to denote the act of overcoming.🔽The affix -ana is added to the root bhāṣ, to denote speaking, and the affix -ana to denote the act of speaking.

original: abhāsittha tenāti bhāsito dhammo, bhāsitā gāthā, bhāsitaṃ suttaṃ. Disī uccāraṇe,
analyzed: abhāsittha tena ati bhāsitaḥ dhammaḥ bhāsitā gāthā bhāsitam suttam disī uccāraṇe
translated: The Dhamma spoken by him is bhāsito dhammo, the verse spoken is bhāsitā gāthā, the sutta spoken is bhāsitaṃ suttaṃ. Disī is the base for uccāraṇaṃ.

original: curādittā ṇe. Adesīyitthāti desito dhammo bhagavatā, ikārāgame kāritasaralopo. Ji
analyzed: curā t ittā ne adesīyittha ati desitaḥ dhammaḥ bhagavatā ikāra āgame kārita sara lopaḥ ji
translated: Curādittā ṇe: The Dhamma taught by the Blessed One is adesīyito dhammo. The i is for the sake of the āgama.

original: jaye, ajīyitthāti jito māro. Nī pāpuṇane, anīyiṃsūti nītā gāmamajā, suto tayā dhammo, ñāto.
analyzed: jaye ajīyittha ati jitaḥ māraḥ nī pāpuṇane anīyiṃsu iti nītā gāmam ajā suto tayā dhammo ñāto
translated: Ji jaye, ajīyittha: Māra was conquered. Nī pāpuṇane: The village was led by them. The Dhamma was heard by you. It was known.

original: Sāsa anusiṭṭhimhi, anusāsīyitthāti atthe tappaccayo.
analyzed: sāsa anusiṭṭhimhi anusāsīyittha ati atthe tad paccayaḥ
translated: Sāsa anusiṭṭhimhi: The meaning is anusāsīyittha.

original: 625. Sāsadisato tassa riṭṭho ca.
analyzed: sā sadisataḥ tassa riṭṭhaḥ ca
translated: Sāsadisato tassa riṭṭho ca.

original: Sāsadisaiccetehi dhātūhi parassa tappaccayassa riṭṭhādeso hoti, casaddena tissa riṭṭhi
analyzed: sā sadisa e c ca itehi dhātūhi parassa tad paccayassa riṭṭha ādesaḥ hoti ca saddena tissa riṭṭhi
translated: Sāsadisaiccetehi dhātūhi parassa tappaccayassa riṭṭhādeso hoti, casaddena tissa riṭṭhi

original: ca, disato kiccatakāratuṃtvādīnañca raṭṭha raṭṭhuṃ raṭṭhādesā ca honti, rādilopo,
analyzed: ca disatas kicca takāra tum tu ādīnam ca raṭṭha raṭṭhum raṭṭha ādesā ca honti ra ādi lopaḥ
translated: ca, disato kiccatakāratuṃtvādīnañca raṭṭha raṭṭhuṃ raṭṭhādesā ca honti, rādilopo,

original: anusiṭṭho so mayā, anusiṭṭhā sā, anusiṭṭhaṃ. Disa pekkhaṇe, adissitthāti diṭṭhaṃ me rūpaṃ.
analyzed: anusiṭṭhaḥ saḥ mayā anusiṭṭhā sā anusiṭṭham disa pekkhaṇe adissittha ati diṭṭham me rūpam
translated: Anusiṭṭho so mayā, anusiṭṭhā sā, anusiṭṭhaṃ. Disa pekkhaṇe, adissittha: The form was seen by me.

original: Timhi – anusāsanaṃ anusiṭṭhi, dassanaṃ diṭṭhi.
analyzed: timhi anusāsanam anusiṭṭhi dassanam diṭṭhi
translated: Timhi – Anusiṭṭhi is anusāsanaṃ, diṭṭhi is dassanaṃ.

original: Kiccādīsu – dassanīyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, daṭṭheyyaṃ, passitunti daṭṭhuṃ gacchati, passitvāti
analyzed: kicca ādīsu dassanīyam daṭṭhabbam daṭṭheyyam passitum ti daṭṭhum gacchati passitvā ati
translated: In the case of kicca, etc., the following are the forms: dassanīyaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ, daṭṭheyyaṃ, passitunti daṭṭhuṃ gacchati, passitvā

original: nekkhamaṃ daṭṭhuṃ, daṭṭhā, ikārāgamena antarikassa na bhavati, yathā – anusāsitaṃ,
analyzed: nekkhamam daṭṭhum daṭṭhā ikāra āgamena antarikassa na bhavati yathā anusāsitam
translated: nekkhamaṃ daṭṭhuṃ, daṭṭhā, ikārāgamena antarikassa na bhavati, yathā—anusāsitaṃ,

original: anusāsitabbaṃ, anusāsituṃ, anusāsitvā, dassitaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: anusāsitabbam anusāsitum anusāsitvā dassitam iccādi
translated: anusāsitabbaṃ, anusāsituṃ, anusāsitvā, dassitaṃ iccādi.

original: Tusa pītimhi, atussīti atthe kattari tappaccayo.
analyzed: tusa pi itimhi a tussi iti atthe kattari tad paccayaḥ
translated: Tusa pītimhi, atussīti atthe kattari tappaccayo.

original: “Tassā”ti adhikāro.
analyzed: tassa ati adhikāraḥ
translated: “Tassā”ti adhikāro.

original: 626. Sādi, santapucchabhanjahansādīhi ṭṭho.
analyzed: sa ādi santa puccha bhanja hansa ādīhi ṭṭhaḥ
translated: . Sādi, santapucchabhanjahansādīhi ṭṭho.

original: Ādinā saha vattatīti sādi. Sakārantehi, puccha bhanjahansaiccevamādīhi ca dhātūhi
analyzed: ādinā saha vattati iti sa ādi sakāra antehi ca dhātūhi
translated: Ādinā saha vattatīti sādi. Sakārantehi, puccha bhanjahansaiccevamādīhi ca dhātūhi

original: parassa anantarikassa takārassa sahādibyañjanena dhātvantenaṭṭhādeso hoti. Hansassa
analyzed: parassa anantarikassa takārassa saha ādi byañjanena dhātu antena ṭṭha ādesaḥ hoti ha nsassa
translated: parassa anantarikassa takārassa sahādibyañjanena dhātvantenaṭṭhādeso hoti. Hansassa

original: satipi santatte punaggabhaṇaṃ kvaci ṭṭhādesassa aniccatādīpanatthaṃ, tena “viddhasto
analyzed: satipi santatte punar gabhaṇam kvaci ṭṭhā desassa anicca tā dīpana attham tena
translated: satipi santatte punaggabhaṇaṃ kvaci ṭṭhādesassa aniccatādīpanatthaṃ, tena “viddhasto

original: utrasto”tiādīsu na hoti. Tuṭṭho, santusito. Bhasa bhassane, abhassīti bhaṭṭho, bhassito.
analyzed: na hoti tuṭṭhaḥ santusitaḥ bhasa bhassane abhassi iti bhaṭṭhaḥ bhassito
translated: utrasto”tiādīsu na hoti. Tuṭṭho, santusito. Bhasa bhassane, abhassīti bhaṭṭho, bhassito.

original: Nasa adassane, nassīti naṭṭho. Daṃsa daṃsane, adaṃsīyitthāti daṭṭho sappena, ḍaṃsito
analyzed: nasa a dassane nassīti naṭṭhaḥ daṃsa daṃsane daṃsīyittha ati daṭṭhaḥ sappena ḍaṃsitaḥ
translated: In the sense of ‘not seeing’, the form is nassīti naṭṭho. In the sense of ‘biting’, the form is adaṃsīyitthāti daṭṭho sappena, ḍaṃsito.

original: vā, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dassa ḍattaṃ. Phusa phassane, aphusīyitthāti phuṭṭho rogena,
analyzed: vā kvacid dhātu uti ādinā dassa ḍattam phusa phassane aphusīyittha iti phuṭṭhaḥ rogena
translated: In the sense of ‘touching’, the form is aphusīyitthāti phuṭṭho rogena, phussito.

original: phussito vā. Isu icchāyaṃ, esīyitthāti iṭṭho, icchito, esito. Masa āmasane, āmasīyitthāti
analyzed: phussitaḥ vā isu iccha ayam esīyittha ati iṭṭhaḥ icchitaḥ esitaḥ mase āmasane āmasīyittha ati
translated: In the sense of ‘wishing’, the form is esīyitthāti iṭṭho, icchito, esito. In the sense of ‘touching’, the form is āmasīyitthāti āmaṭṭho.

original: āmaṭho. Vasasecane, avassīti vuṭṭho devo, pavisīyitthāti paviṭṭho, uddisīyitthāti🔽uddiṭṭho. Puccha pucchane, apucchīyitthāti puṭṭho pañhaṃ, pucchito. Bhanja avamaddane,
analyzed: āmaṭhaḥ vasa secane avassi iti vuṭṭhaḥ devo pavisīyittha ati paviṭṭhaḥ uddisīyittha ati  uddiṭṭhaḥ puccha pucchane apucchīyittha ati puṭṭhaḥ pañham pucchitaḥ bhanja avamaddane
translated: In the sense of ‘sprinkling’, the form is avassīti vuṭṭho devo, pavisīyitthāti paviṭṭho, uddisīyitthāti uddiso.

original: abhañjīyitthāti bhaṭṭhaṃ dhaññaṃ. Hansa pītimhi, ahaṃsīti haṭṭho, pahaṭṭho, pahaṃsito.
analyzed: abhañjīyittha ati bhaṭṭham dhaññam hansa pītimhi ahaṃsi iti haṭṭhaḥ pahaṭṭhaḥ pahaṃsito
translated: In the sense of ‘asking’, the form is apucchīyitthāti puṭṭho pañhaṃ, pucchito. In the sense of ‘threshing’, the form is abhañjīyitthāti bhaṭṭhaṃ dhaññaṃ. In the sense of ‘joy’, the form is ahaṃsīti haṭṭho, pahaṭṭho, pahaṃsito.

original: Ādisaddena yaja devapūjāsaṅgatikaraṇadānesu, ijjitthāti atthe tappaccayo, tassa ṭṭhādeso.
analyzed: ādi saddena yaja deva pūjā saṅgati karaṇa dānesu ijjittha ati atthe tad paccayaḥ tassa ṭṭha ādesaḥ
translated: The word ādi is used in the sense of ‘worshipping deities’, ‘being connected with’, ‘giving’. The form is ijjitthāti atthe tappaccayo, tassa ṭṭhādeso.

original: 627. Yajassa sarassi ṭṭhe.
analyzed: yajassa sarassi ṭṭhe
translated: . The form is yajassa sarassi ṭṭhe.

original: Yajaiccetassa dhātussa sarassa ikārādeso hoti ṭṭhe pare. Yiṭṭho mayā jino. Saja vissagge saṃpubbo, saṃsajjitthāti saṃsaṭṭho tena, vissaṭṭho. Maja suddhimhi, amajjīti maṭṭho iccādi.
analyzed: yaja e c ca itassa dhātussa sarassa ikāra ādesaḥ hoti ṭṭhe pare mayā jinaḥ saja vissagge saṃpubbaḥ saṃsajjittha ati saṃsaṭṭhaḥ tena vissaṭṭhaḥ maja suddhimhi amajji iti maṭṭhaḥ iccādi
translated: Saja is used in the sense of “dispersal” and “mixing.” Saṃsajjitthāti saṃsaṭṭho tena, vissaṭṭho. Maja is used in the sense of “purification.” Amajjīti maṭṭho iccādi.

original: Kiccatakārādīsu tussitabbaṃ toṭṭhabbaṃ, phusitabbaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ, pucchituṃ puṭṭhuṃ,
analyzed: kicca takāra ādīsu tussitabbam toṭṭhabbam phusitabbam phoṭṭhabbam pucchitum puṭṭhum
translated: Kiccatakārādīsu tussitabbaṃ toṭṭhabbaṃ, phusitabbaṃ phoṭṭhabbaṃ, pucchituṃ puṭṭhuṃ,

original: yajituṃ yiṭṭhuṃ, abhiharituṃ abhihaṭṭhuṃ, tosanaṃ tuṭṭhi, esanaṃ eṭṭhi, vassanaṃ
analyzed: yajitum yiṭṭhum abhiharitum abhihaṭṭhum tosanam tuṭṭhi esanam eṭṭhi vassanam
translated: yajituṃ yiṭṭhuṃ, abhiharituṃ abhihaṭṭhuṃ, tosanaṃ tuṭṭhi, esanaṃ eṭṭhi, vassanaṃ

original: vuṭṭhi, vissajjanaṃ vissaṭṭhi iccādi.
analyzed: vuṭṭhi vissajjanam vissaṭṭhi iccādi
translated: vuṭṭhi, vissajjanaṃ vissaṭṭhi iccādi.

original: “Tassa, sādī”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: tassa sādi iti ca vattate
translated: “Tassa, sādī”ti ca vattate.

original: 628. Bhanjato ggo ca.
analyzed: bhanjataḥ ggo ca
translated: . Bhanjato ggo ca.

original: Bhanjato dhātumhā tappaccayassa sahādibyañjanena ggo ādeso hoti. Bhaggo rāgo anena.
analyzed: bhanjataḥ dhātumhā tad paccayassa saha ādi byañjanena ggaḥ ādesaḥ hoti bhaggaḥ rāgaḥ anena
translated: The syllable gga is substituted for the syllable of the root bhanj when the syllable tappaccaya follows. Bhaggo rāgo anena.

original: Vasanivāse, parivasīyitthāti parivuṭṭho parivāso, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, uṭṭha uādesā.
analyzed: vasa nivāse parivasīyittha ati parivuṭṭhaḥ parivāsaḥ vusitam brahmacariyam uṭṭhe
translated: Vasanivāse, parivasīyitthāti parivuṭṭho parivāso, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, uṭṭha uādesā.

original: Vasa acchādane, nivasīyitthāti nivatthaṃ vatthaṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā stakārasaṃyogassa
analyzed: vasa a chādane nivasīyittha ati nivattham vattham kvaci dhātu uti ādinā s takāra saṃyogassa
translated: Vasa acchādane, nivasīyitthāti nivatthaṃ vatthaṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā stakārasaṃyogassa

original: tthattaṃ, evaṃ nivatthabbaṃ. Saṃsa pasaṃsane, pasaṃsīyitthāti pasattho pasaṃsito,
analyzed: tthattam evam nivatthabbam saṃsa pasaṃsane pasaṃsīyittha ati pasatthaḥ pasaṃsitaḥ
translated: That is the way to put on a robe. Pasaṃsane, pasaṃsīyitthāti pasattho pasaṃsito,

original: pasaṃsanaṃ pasatthi. Badha bandhane, abajjhitthāti baddho raññā, alabhīyitthāti laddhaṃ
analyzed: pasaṃsanam pasatthi badha bandhane abajjhittha ati baddhaḥ raññā alabhīyittha ati laddham
translated: pasaṃsanaṃ pasatthi. Badha bandhane, abajjhitthāti baddho raññā, alabhīyitthāti laddhaṃ

original: me dhanaṃ, dhattadattāni. Rabha rābhasse, ārabhīyitthāti āraddhaṃ vīriyaṃ. Daha bhasmīkaraṇe,
analyzed: me dhanam dhatta dattāni rabha rābhasse ārabhīyittha ati āraddham vīriyam daha bhasmīkaraṇe
translated: me dhanaṃ, dhattadattāni. Rabha rābhasse, ārabhīyitthāti āraddhaṃ vīriyaṃ. Daha bhasmīkaraṇe,

original: adayhittāti daḍḍhaṃ vanaṃ, abhujjitthāti bhutto odano, bhujādittā dhātvantalopo,
analyzed: daḍḍham vanam abhujjittha ati bhuttaḥ odanaḥ dhātu anta lopaḥ
translated: adayhittāti daḍḍhaṃ vanaṃ, abhujjitthāti bhutto odano, bhujādittā dhātvantalopo,

original: dvittañca. Caja hānimhi, pariccajīyitthāti pariccattaṃ dhanaṃ, amuccitthāti mutto saro.
analyzed: dvittam ca caja hānimhi pariccajīyittha ati pariccattam dhanam amuccittha ati muttaḥ saraḥ
translated: dvittañca. Caja hānimhi, pariccajīyitthāti pariccattaṃ dhanaṃ, amuccitthāti mutto saro.

original: Vaca viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, avacīyitthāti atthe tappaccayo.
analyzed: vaca viyattiyam vācā ayam avacīyittha ati atthe tad paccayaḥ
translated: Vaca viyattiyaṃ vācāyaṃ, avacīyitthāti atthe tappaccayo.

original: “Anto, no, dvi, cā”ti ca adhikāro.
analyzed: antaḥ naḥ dvi ca ati ca adhikāraḥ
translated: “Anto, no, dvi, cā”ti ca adhikāro.

original: 629. Vaca vā vu.
analyzed: vaca vā vu
translated: . Vaca vā vu.

original: Catuppadamidaṃ. Vacaiccetassa dhātussa vakārassa ukārādeso hoti vā, dhātvanto ca
analyzed: catuppadam idam dhātussa vakārassa ukāra ādesaḥ hoti vā dhātu antaḥ ca
translated: Catuppadamidaṃ. Vacaiccetassa dhātussa vakārassa ukārādeso hoti vā, dhātvanto ca

original: cakāro no hoti, tappaccayassa ca dvibhāvo hoti. Vāggahaṇamavadhāraṇatthaṃ, dhātvādimhi
analyzed: cakāraḥ no hoti tad paccayassa ca dvi bhāvaḥ hoti vāc gahaṇam avadhāraṇa attham dhātu ādimhi
translated: The syllable ca is not, and the preceding syllable has a double consonant. The word “vowels” is for the purpose of limitation.

original: vakārāgamo. Vuttamidaṃ bhagavatā, uttaṃ vā.
analyzed: vakāra āgamaḥ vuttam idam bhagavatā uttam vā
translated: The syllable va is added. This was said by the Blessed One: “The best.”

original: 630. Gupādīnañca.
analyzed: gupa ādi inañ ca
translated: . And of gupa, etc.

original: Gupaiccevamādīnaṃ dhātūnamanto ca byañjano no hoti, parassa takārassa ca dvibhāvo
analyzed: dhātūnam antaḥ ca byañjanaḥ no hoti parassa takārassa ca dvi bhāvaḥ
translated: The final syllable of such roots as gupa is not, and the preceding syllable has a double consonant.

original: hoti. Gupa gopane, sugopīyitthāti sugutto, sugopito, ikārena byavahitattā na dhātvantalopo,
analyzed: hoti gupa gopane sugopīyittha ati su guttaḥ su gopitaḥ ikārena byavahita ttā na dhātu anta lopaḥ
translated: Gupa means “to guard”: sugupīyittha = sugutto, sugopito. Because of the intervention of the syllable i, there is no elision of the final syllable of the root.

original: “aññesu cā”ti sutte vādhikārassa vavatthitavibhāsattā niṭṭhatakārepi kvaci vuddhi. Gopanaṃ gutti.🔽Lipa limpane, alimpīyitthāti litto sugandhena. Tapa santāpe, santapīyitthāti santatto
analyzed: aññesu ca ati sutte vā adhikārassa vavatthita vibhāsa ttā niṭṭha takāre pi kvaci  lipa limpane alimpīyittha ati sugandhena tapa santāpe santapīyittha ati santattaḥ
translated: “And in other (words) too,” because of the definition in the Sutta, the augment is sometimes added even to the final syllable. Guppanaṃ = gutti.

original: tejena. Dīpa dittimhi, ādīpīyitthātiāditto agginā, rassattaṃ, dīpanaṃ ditti. Apa
analyzed: tejena dīpa dittimhi ādīpīyittha ati ādittaḥ agginā rassattam dīpanam ditti apa
translated: Lipa means “to smear”: alimpīyittha = litto sugandhena. Tapa means “to heat”: santapīyittha = santatto tejena. Dīpa means “to light”: ādīpīyittha = āditto agginā. Rassattaṃ = ditti. Apa

original: pāpuṇane, pāpīyitthāti patto gāmo, pāpuṇīti patto sukhaṃ, pāpuṇanaṃ patti, pattabbaṃ.
analyzed: pāpuṇane pāpīyittha ati pattaḥ gāmaḥ pāpuṇīti pattaḥ sukham pāpuṇanam patti pattabbam
translated: means “to reach”: pāpīyittha = patto gāmo. Pāpuṇīti = patto sukhaṃ. Pāpuṇanaṃ = patti. Pattabbaṃ.

original: Mada ummāde, pamajjīti pamatto. Supa sayane, asupīti sutto iccādi.
analyzed: made ummāde pamajji iti pamattaḥ supa sayane a supi iti iccādi
translated: Mada, to be intoxicated, ummāde, to be intoxicated, pamajjī, to be heedless, pamatto, heedless. Supa, to sleep, asupī, to have slept, sutto, slept.

original: Cara caraṇe, acarīyitthāti ciṇṇo dhammo, iṇṇādeso, carito vā. Evaṃ puṇṇo, pūrito.
analyzed: cara caraṇe acarīyittha ati ciṇṇaḥ dhammaḥ iṇṇa ādeso caritaḥ vā evam puṇṇaḥ pūritaḥ
translated: Cara, to go, acarī, to have gone, carito, gone. Evaṃ, thus, puṇṇo, filled, pūrito, filled.

original: Nuda khepe, panujjitthāti paṇunno, nassa ṇattaṃ, panudito. Dā dāne, ādīyitthātiādinno, atto vā, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dāsaddassa takāro, rassattaṃ.
analyzed: nuda khepe panujjittha ati paṇunnaḥ nassa ṇattam panuditaḥ dā dāne ādīyittha ati ādinnaḥ attaḥ vā kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dā saddassa takāraḥ rassattam
translated: Nuda, to drive away, panujjitthāti, to have driven away, paṇunno, driven away. Nassa, to be lost, ṇattaṃ, lost. Panudito, driven away. Dā, to give, ādīyitthāti, to have given, ādinno, given. Atto, given. “Kvaci dhātū” etc. The dāsaddha is takāro, rassattaṃ.

original: 631. Bhidādito innaannaīṇā vā.
analyzed: bhida āditaḥ inna anna īṇāḥ vā
translated: Bhidādito innaannaīṇā vā.

original: Bhidaiccevamādīhi dhātūhi parassa tappaccayassa inna annaīṇaiccete ādesā honti vā, anto ca no hoti. Vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, saralopādi.🔽Bhidi vidāraṇe, abhijjitthāti bhinno ghaṭo bhavatā, bhijjīti vā bhinno devadatto.🔽Chidi dvidhākaraṇe, achijjitthāti chinno rukkho, acchinnaṃ cīvaraṃ, ucchijjīti ucchinno.
analyzed: bhida e t ca evamādīhi dhātūhi parassa tad paccayassa i t na anna īṇa e t ca ete ādesāḥ honti vā antaḥ ca no hoti vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ sara lopa ādi 🔽bhidi vidāraṇe bhinnaḥ ghaṭaḥ bhavatā vā bhinnaḥ devadattaḥ 🔽chidi dvidhākaraṇe achijjittha ati chinnaḥ rukkhaḥ acchinnam cīvaram ucchijji iti ucchinnaḥ
translated: Bhida etc. The in, an, and īṇ are the ādeṃs of the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya, or the preceding, or the tappaccaya

original: Adīyitthābhi dinno suṅko. Sada visaraṇagatyāvasānesu, nisīdīti nisinno. Khida uttāsane,
analyzed: adīyittha abhi dinnaḥ suṅko sada visaraṇa gatyā avasānesu nisīdi iti nisinnaḥ khide uttāsane
translated: The word suṅko is derived from the verb suṅka, to be given without being offered. The word nisinno is derived from the verb nisīda, to sit down, in the sense of sitting down in the place of one’s own destination after going by the way of constant departure.

original: khida dīnabhāve vā, akhijjīti khinno.
analyzed: khida dīna bhāve vā khinnaḥ
translated: The word khinno is derived from the verb khīda, to be tired, in the sense of being tired and depressed.

original: Annādese chada apavāraṇe, acchādīyitthāti channo, paṭicchannaṃ gehaṃ, pasīdīti pasanno. Pada gatimhi, uppajjīti uppanno, jhānaṃ samāpanno. Rudi assuvimocane, ruṇṇo, paralopo.🔽Khī khaye īṇādeso, akhīyīti khīṇo doso, khīṇā jāti, khīṇaṃ dhanaṃ. Hā cāge, “kvaci
analyzed: anna ādese chada apavāraṇe acchādīyittha ati channaḥ paṭicchannam geham pasīdi iti pasannaḥ gatimhi uppajji iti uppannaḥ jhānam samāpannaḥ rudi assu vimocane ruṇṇaḥ para lopaḥ  khī khaye īṇā desaḥ khīṇā iti khīṇaḥ dosaḥ khīṇā jāti khīṇam dhanam hā cāge kvaci
translated: The word channo is derived from the verb chāde, to cover, in the sense of covering by a roof. The word pasanno is derived from the verb pasīda, to be pleased. The word uppanno is derived from the verb pada, to arise, in the sense of arising in jhāna. The word ruṇṇo is derived from the verb rudi, to weep, in the sense of weeping with the loss of a dear one.

original: dhātū”tiādinā hādito īṇādese ṇakārassa nattaṃ, pahīyitthāti pahīno kileso, parihāyīti🔽parihīno. Āsa upavesane, acchīti āsīno. Lī silesane, līyīti līno, nilīno. Ji jaye,🔽jiyīti jīno vittamanusocati, jito vā. Dī khaye, dīno. Pī tappane, pīno. Lū chedane,
analyzed: dhātu uti ādinā ha āditaḥ īṇ ādese ṇakārassa pahīyittha ati pahīnaḥ kilesaḥ parihāyi iti  parihīnaḥ āsa upavesane acchi iti āsīnaḥ silesane silesane iti līnaḥ nilīnaḥ ji jaye  jiyīti jīnaḥ vittam anusocati jitaḥ vā khaye dīnaḥ tappane pīnaḥ chedane
translated: The word khīṇo is derived from the verb khīna, to be exhausted, in the sense of the exhaustion of hate, the exhaustion of birth, the exhaustion of wealth. The word pahīno is derived from the verb pahā, to abandon, in the sense of abandoning defilements. The word parihīno is derived from the verb parihā, to fall away, in the sense of falling away from jhāna.🔽The word āsīno is derived from the verb āsī, to sit down, in the sense of sitting down. The word līno is derived from the verb līna, to be hidden, in the sense of being hidden, concealed. The word jīno is derived from the verb jiya, to be defeated, in the sense of being defeated and grieving over his wealth.

original: lūyitthāti lūno iccādi.
analyzed: lūyittha ati lūnaḥ i t ca ādi
translated: The word dīno is derived from the verb dīna, to be exhausted. The word pīno is derived from the verb pīna, to be swollen. The word lūno is derived from the verb lūna, to be cut, in the sense of being cut.

original: Vamu uggiraṇe, vamīyitthāti vantaṃ, vamitaṃ, “pakkamādīhi nto”ti ntādeso. Agacchīyitthāti🔽gato gāmo tayā, gāmaṃ gato vā, “gamakhanahanaramādīnamanto”ti dhātvantalopo. Akhaññitthāti🔽khato kūpo, upahaññitthāti upahataṃ cittaṃ, aramīti rato, abhirato. Mana ñāṇe, amaññitthāti🔽mato, sammato. Tanu vitthāre, atanitthāti tataṃ, vitataṃ. Yamu uparame, niyacchīti niyato.
analyzed: uggiraṇe vamīyittha ati vantam vamitam pakkama ādīhi n taḥ iti n ta ādesaḥ agacchīyittha ati  gataḥ tayā gāmam gataḥ vā gama khana hana rama ādīn amantaḥ iti dhātu anta lopaḥ a khaññ itthā iti  khataḥ kūpaḥ upahaññittha ati upahatam cittam aramīti rataḥ abhirataḥ manaḥ ñāṇe amaññittha ati  mato sammato tanu vitthāre tanittha ati tatam vitatam uparame niyacchi iti niyato
translated: The form vamitaṃ is derived from vamīyittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form gāmo tayā gato is derived from gacchīyittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form gāmaṃ gato is derived from gacchīyittha by the addition of the nominal-affix an. The form khato kūpo is derived from akhaññittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form upahataṃ cittaṃ is derived from upahaññittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form rato is derived from arami by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form abhirato is derived from arami by the addition of the nominal-affix an. The form mato is derived from amaññittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form sammato is derived from amaññittha by the addition of the nominal-affix an. The form tataṃ is derived from atanittha by the addition of the nominal-affix tan. The form vitataṃ is derived from atanittha by the addition of the nominal-affix an. The form niyato is derived from niyacchī by the addition of the nominal-affix tan.

original: “No, tamhi, timhī”ti ca vattate.
analyzed: na u tamhi timhi iti ca vattate
translated: Vamu, to vomit, vamīyittha, he vomited, vamitaṃ, vomited, “vomited and so on” (is the formation). Agacchīyittha, he went, gato gāmo tayā, the village has been gone to by you, or gāmaṃ gato, the village has been gone to, “the ending of gāma, khanha, hana, ramanā and so on” (is the formation). Akhaññittha, he dug, khato kūpo, the well has been dug, upahaññittha, the mind was afflicted, upahataṃ cittaṃ, the mind has been afflicted, aramīti, he delighted, abhirato, he is delighted. Mana, to know, amaññittha, he thought, mato, he is thought, sammato, he is agreed upon. Tanu, to spread, atanittha, it is spread, vitataṃ, it is extended. Yamu, to restrain, niyacchīti, he restrains, “no, tamhi, timhī” is said.

original: 632. Rakāro ca.🔽Rakāro ca dhātūnamantabhūto no hoti tappaccaye, tippaccaye ca pare. Pakarīyitthāti
analyzed: rakāro ca  rakāraḥ ca dhātūnam anta bhūtaḥ no hoti tad paccaye ti paccaye ca pare pakarīyittha ati
translated: And the syllable ra.

original: pakato kaṭo bhavatā, katā me rakkhā, kataṃ me puññaṃ. “Do dhassa cā”ti etta casaddena
analyzed: pakataḥ kaṭaḥ bhavatā katā me rakkhā katam me puññam do dhassa ca ati ca saddena
translated: The syllable ra is not no in the case of the endings of verbs, and in the case of the endings of the words beginning with ti. Pakarīyittha, he made, pakato kaṭo bhavatā, the pot has been made by you, katā me rakkhā, protection has been made for me, kataṃ me puññaṃ, merit has been made by me. “Do dhassa ca” (is the formation).

original: ṭo tassa, yathā – sukaṭaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ, pure akarīyitthāti purakkhato, “purasamupaparīhi
analyzed: ṭaḥ tassa yathā su kaṭam dukkaṭam pure akarīyittha ati purakkhataḥ pura samupaparīhi
translated: The syllable ṭo of that, as in: sukaṭaṃ, dukkaṭaṃ, pure akarīyittha, he was honoured, “purasamupaparīhi (is the formation).

original: karotissa khakharā vā tappaccayesu cā”ti khakāro, paccayehi saṅgamma karīyitthāti
analyzed: karotissa kha kharāḥ vā tad paccayesu ca ati khakāraḥ paccayehi saṅgamma karīyittha ati
translated: The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.

original: saṅkhato, abhisaṅkhato, upakarīyitthāti upakkhato, upakkhaṭo, parikarīyitthāti parikkhato.🔽Tippaccaye pakaraṇa pakati. Sara gaticintāyaṃ, asarīti sato, visarīti visaṭo, saraṇaṃ,🔽sarati etāyāti vā sati, nīharīyitthāti nīhaṭo. Dhara dhāraṇe, uddharīyitthāti uddhaṭo,
analyzed: saṅkhataḥ abhisaṅkhataḥ upakarīyittha ati upakkhataḥ upakkhaṭaḥ parikarīyittha ati parikkhataḥ  tip paccaye sara gati cintā ayam saraṇam  sarati etāyā ati vā sati nīharīyittha ati nīhaṭaḥ dhara dhāraṇe uddharīyittha ati uddhaṭaḥ
translated: The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.

original: abharīyitthāti bhato, bharaṇaṃ, bharati etāyāti vā bhati.🔽Ikārāgamayuttesu “gamito”tiādīsu dhātvantalope sampatte –
analyzed: abharīyittha ati bhataḥ bharaṇam bharati etāyāḥ ati vā  ikāra āgama yuttesu gamita uti ādīsu dhātu anta lope sampatte
translated: The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.

original: “Lopo”ti vattate.🔽633. Namakarānamantānaṃ niyuttatamhi.
analyzed: lopaḥ iti vattate  namakara anamantānam
translated: The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.

original: Nakāra makāra kakāra rakārānaṃ dhātvantānaṃ lopo na hoti ikārāgamayutte takāre pareti🔽lopābhāvo. Agacchī, gamīyitthāti vā gamito, ramitthāti ramito. Evaṃ vamito, namito.
analyzed: nakāra makāra kakāra rakārāṇam dhātu antānam lopaḥ na ikāra āgama yutte takāre pareti 🔽lopa abhāvaḥ agacchī gamīyittha ati vā gamitaḥ ramittha ati ramitaḥ evam vamitaḥ namitaḥ
translated: The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.🔽The khakharā is the vowel a, and the khakharā is the condition.

original: Saki saṅkāyaṃ, saṅkito, sarito, bharito. Tathā khanitabbaṃ, hanitabbaṃ, gamitabbaṃ, ramitabbaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: tathā khanitabbam hanitabbam gamitabbam ramitabbam iccādi
translated: The meaning is: “It is to be dug, cut, gone, enjoyed, etc., in this way.”

original: Nidhīyitthāti nihito, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhissa hi tappaccaye. Evaṃ vihito.🔽Kārite abhāvīyitthāti atthe “bhāvakammesu ta”iti tappaccayo, “yathāgamamikāro”ti
analyzed: nidhīyittha iti nihitaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dhissa hi tad paccaye evam vihitaḥ  kārite abhāvīyittha ati atthe bhāva kammesu ta iti tad paccayaḥ
translated: The meaning is: “It is to be deposited here.” For the affix ta is added to dhā after the preposition ni, as in “kvaci dhātū” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc. Thus it is deposited.🔽The meaning is: “It is to be made, brought into existence.” For the affix ta is added to bhāva after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.

original: ikārāgamo, saralopādi, bhāvito maggo tena, bhāvayito, apācīyitthāti pācito odanaṃ
analyzed: ikāra āgamaḥ sara lopa ādi bhāvitaḥ maggo tena bhāvayitaḥ apācīyittha ati pācitaḥ odanam
translated: The meaning is: “The path is to be developed by him.” For the affix ta is added to bhāva after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.🔽The meaning is: “Rice is to be cooked by Yaññadatta for Devadatta.”

original: yaññadatto devadattena, pācayito, pācāpito, pācāpayito, kammaṃ kārīyitthāti kārito,🔽kārayito, kārāpito, kārāpayito iccādi.🔽“Bhāvakammesu ta”iti ettha “ta”iti yogavibhāgena acalana gati bhojanatthādīhi adhikaraṇepi
analyzed: yaññadattaḥ devadattena pācayito pācāpito pācāpayito kammam kārīyittha ati kārito  kārayito kārāpitaḥ kārāpayito iccādi  bhāva kammesu ettha taiti yogavibhāgena acalana gati bhojana ttha ādīhi adhikaraṇe pi
translated: The meaning is: “The work is to be done by him.” For the affix ta is added to kār after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.🔽The meaning is: “The work is to be caused to be done by him.” For the affix ta is added to kār after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.🔽The meaning is: “The work is to be caused to be done by him.” For the affix ta is added to kār after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.🔽The meaning is: “The work is to be caused to be done by him.” For the affix ta is added to kār after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.

original: tappaccayo, yathā – āsa upavesane, adhikaraṇe acchiṃsu ettha teti idaṃ tesaṃ āsitaṃ
analyzed: tad paccayaḥ yathā āsaḥ upavesane adhikaraṇe ettha te iti idam tesam āsitam
translated: The meaning is: “The work is to be caused to be done by him.” For the affix ta is added to kār after the preposition abhāvi, as in “bhāvakammesu ta” (Pā. 1.1.72), etc.🔽The meaning is:

original: ṭhānaṃ. Bhāve idha tehi āsitaṃ. Kammani ayaṃ tehi ajjhāsito gāmo. Kattari idha te🔽āsitā. Tathā aṭṭhaṃsu etthāti idaṃ tesaṃ ṭhitaṃ ṭhānaṃ, idha tehi ṭhitaṃ, ayaṃ tehi🔽adhiṭṭhito okāso, idha te ṭhitā. Nisīdiṃsu etthāti idaṃ tesaṃ nisinnaṃ ṭhānaṃ, ayaṃ🔽tesaṃ nisinnakālo, te idha nisinnā. Nipajjiṃsu etthāti idaṃ tesaṃ nipannaṃ ṭhānaṃ, idha te nipannā.🔽Yā gatipāpuṇane. Ayāsuṃ te etthāti ayaṃ tesaṃ yāto maggo, idha tehi yātaṃ, ayaṃ tehi🔽yāto, maggo, idha te yātā. original: odano, idha te bhuttā. Piviṃsu te etthāti idaṃ tesaṃ pītaṃ ṭhānaṃ, idha tehi pītā
analyzed: odanaḥ idha te bhuttā piviṃsu te ettha ati idam tesam pītam ṭhānam idha tehi pītā
translated: Rice was eaten by them here. This is the place where they drank. Here they drank rice gruel. This is the place where they drank.

original: yāgu, idha te pītā. Dissanti etthāti idaṃ tesaṃ diṭṭhaṭṭhānaṃ iccādi.
analyzed: idha te pītāḥ dissanti ettha ati idam tesam diṭṭha ṭṭhānam iccādi
translated: This is the place where they saw.

original: “Kattari kiti”ti ito maṇḍūkagatiyā “kattarī”ti vattate.
analyzed: kattari kit iti i taḥ maṇḍūka gatiyā kattari iti vattate
translated: “Kattari kiti” means “kattari” is used in the sense of “maṇḍūkagatiyā”.

original: 634. Kammani dutiyāyaṃ kto.
analyzed: kammani dutiya ayam ktaḥ
translated: . Kammani dutiyāyaṃ kto.

original: Kammatthe dutiyāyaṃ vibhattiyaṃ vijjamānāyaṃ dhātūhi kattari ktappaccayo hoti. Idameva
analyzed: kammatthe dutiyā ayam vibhattiyam vijjamānāyam dhātūhi kattari kta paccayaḥ hoti idam eva
translated: When the second case is used in the sense of “kamman”, the ktvā affix is used in the sense of “kattari”. This

original: vacanaṃ ñāpakaṃ abhihite kammādimhi dutiyādīnamabhāvassa. Dānaṃ adāsīti atthe ktappaccayo,
analyzed: vacanam ñāpakam abhihite kamma ādimhi dutiya ādīnam abhāvassa dānam adāsi iti atthe kta paccayaḥ
translated: statement is the reason for the absence of the second case, etc., in the ablative. The ktvā affix is used in the sense of “dānaṃ adāsī” (he gave the gift).

original: “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā paccayakakārassa lopo, tassa innādeso, dānaṃ dinno devadatto.
analyzed: kvaci dhātu uti ādinā paccaya kakārassa lopaḥ tassa inna ādesaḥ dānam dinnaḥ devadatto
translated: “Kvaci dhātū” means the elision of the affix k by the rule “kvaci dhātū”, and the substitution of in for the final vowel of the root, thus “dānaṃ dinno devadatto”.

original: Rakkha pālane, sīlaṃ arakkhīti sīlaṃ rakkhito, bhattaṃ abhuñjīti bhattaṃ bhutto,
analyzed: rakkha pālane sīlam arakkhi iti sīlam rakkhitaḥ bhattam abhuñji iti bhattam bhuttaḥ
translated: Rakkha pālane, sīlaṃ arakkhīti sīlaṃ rakkhito, bhattaṃ abhuñjīti bhattaṃ bhutto,

original: garuṃ upāsīti garumupāsito iccādi.
analyzed: upāsi iti iti cādi
translated: garuṃ upāsīti garumupāsito iccādi.

original: 635. Bhyādīhi matibudhipūjādīhi ca kto.
analyzed: bhi ādīhi mati budhi pūjā ādīhi ca kto
translated: . Bhyādīhi matibudhipūjādīhi ca kto.

original: Bhīiccevamādīhi dhātūhi, mati budhi pūjādīhi ca ktappaccayo hoti. So ca “bhāvakammesu kiccattakkhatthā”ti vuttattā bhāvakammesveva bhavati.
analyzed: bhī it ca evamādīhi dhātūhi mati budhi pūjā ādīhi ca ktap paccayaḥ hoti saḥ ca bhāva kammesu vutta ttā bhāva kammesu eva bhavati
translated: And since it is said that “the k-suffix is used in the sense of the past tense in verbs and nouns,” it is used only in verbs and nouns.

original: Bhī bhaye, abhāyitthāti bhītaṃ bhavatā. Supa saye, asupīyitthāti suttaṃ bhavatā. Evaṃ sayitaṃ bhavatā. Asa bhojane, asitaṃ bhavatā, pacito odano bhavatā.
analyzed: bhī bhaye abhāyittha ati bhītam bhavatā supa saye asupīyittha ati suttam bhavatā evam sayitam bhavatā asa bhojane asitam bhavatā pacitaḥ odanaḥ bhavatā
translated: Bhī means “fear,” and bhītaṃ bhavatā means “you were afraid.” Supa means “to sleep,” and suttaṃ bhavatā means “you slept.” Evaṃ sayitaṃ bhavatā means “you slept thus.” Asa means “to eat,” and asitaṃ bhavatā means “you ate.” Pacito odano bhavatā means “the rice was cooked by you.”

original: Idha matyādayo icchatthā, budhiādayo ñāṇatthā.
analyzed: idha mati ādayaḥ icchatthāḥ budhi ādayaḥ
translated: Here mati, etc., are in the sense of desire, and budhi, etc., are in the sense of knowledge.

original: Mana ñāṇe saṃpubbo, “budhagamāditthe kattarī”ti tappaccaye sampatte iminā kammani🔽ktappaccayo, “gama khanā”tiādinā dhātvantalopo, raññā sammato. Kappa takkane, saṅkappito.
analyzed: manaḥ ñāṇe saṃpubbaḥ budha gamāt itthe kattari iti tad paccaye sampatte iminā kammani  ktap paccayaḥ gama khana ati ādinā dhātu anta lopaḥ raññā sammataḥ kappa takkane saṅkappito
translated: Mana means “knowledge,” and when the k-suffix is added to it, the root is changed to budha by the rule “The root gam is changed to budha, etc., in the sense of the past tense.”

original: Dhara dhāraṇe, curādittā ṇe, vuddhi, ikārāgamo, saralopādi, avadhārito.
analyzed: dhara dhāraṇe curā t ittā ṇe ikāra āgamaḥ sara lopa ādi avadhāritaḥ
translated: The k-suffix is added by the rule “The k-suffix is used in the sense of the past tense in verbs and nouns.” The final vowel of the root is elided by the rule “The final vowel of a root is elided before the k-suffix.” The k-suffix is elided by the rule “The k-suffix is elided before the suffixes ga, khan, etc.” The word sammato means “approved by the king.” Saṅkappito means “conceived.”🔽Dhara means “to hold,” and the k-suffix is added by the rule “The k-suffix is used in the sense of the past tense in verbs and nouns.” The final vowel of the root is elided by the rule “The final vowel of a root is elided before the k-suffix.” The vowel i is added by the rule “The vowel i is added to the roots cur, etc.” The vowel u is added by the rule “The vowel u is added to the roots sar, etc.” The word avadhārito means “remembered.”

original: Budha avagamane, avabujjhitthāti buddho bhagavā mahesakkhehi devamanussehi. I ajjhayane, adhīyitthāti adhīto.
analyzed: budha avagamane avabujjhittha ati buddhaḥ bhagavā mahesakkhehi deva manussehi i ajjhayane adhīyittha ati adhītaḥ
translated: Budha means “to understand,” and the word buddho means “he understood.” The word bhagavā means “the Blessed One.” The word mahesakkhehi means “by the great gods and men.” I means “to study,” and the word adhīto means “he studied.”

original: I gatimhi, abhisamito. Vida ñāṇe, avedīyitthāti vidito. Ñā avabodhane, aññāyitthāti ñāto. Vidha vedhane, paṭivijjhitthāti paṭividdho dhammo. Takka vitakke, takkito.
analyzed: i gatimhi abhisamitaḥ vida ñāṇe avedīyittha ati viditaḥ ñā avabodhane aññāyittha ati ñātaḥ vidha vedhane paṭivijjhittha ati paṭividdhaḥ dhammo takka vitakke takkito
translated: In the sense of going: he has been measured out in the destiny, thus he is a gatimant; he has been measured out in the destiny, thus he is abhisamita; he has been known in the knowledge, thus he is vidita; he has been known in the understanding, thus he is ñāta; he has penetrated in the sense of piercing, thus he is paṭividdha; he has been thought in the sense of thinking, thus he is takkita.

original: Pūjanatthesu –
analyzed: pūjana atthesu
translated: In the sense of worship:

original: Pūja pūjāyaṃ, apūjīyitthāti pūjito bhagavā. Cāya santānapūjanesu apapubbo, apacāyito.🔽Māna pūjāyaṃ, mānito. Ci caye, apacito. Vanda abhivandane, vandito. Kara karaṇe,
analyzed: pūja pūja ayam apūjīyittha ati pūjitaḥ bhagavā ca āya santāna pūjanesu apapubbaḥ apacāyitaḥ  māna pūjā ayam mānito ci caye apacitaḥ vanda abhivandane vandito kara karaṇe
translated: he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is pūjito; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is apūjito; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is apacāyito.

original: sakkato. Sakkāra pūjāyaṃ, sakkārito iccādi.🔽Huto hutāvī hutavā, vuṭṭho vusita jiṇṇako;
analyzed: sakkato sakkāra pūjā ayam sakkārito iccādi  hutaḥ hutāvī hutavā vuṭṭhaḥ vusita jiṇṇako
translated: He has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is mānito; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is apacito; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is vandito; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is sakkato; he has been worshipped in the worshipping, thus he is sakkārito.🔽He has been burnt, he has been burnt up, he has been burnt out; he has been released, he has lived, he is old;

original: Pakkaṃ pakkantako jāto, ṭhito ruḷho bubhukkhito.🔽Gītaṃ naccaṃ jito diṭṭho, tuṭṭho yiṭṭho ca bhaggavā;
analyzed: pakkam pakkantakaḥ jātaḥ ṭhitaḥ ruḷhaḥ bubhukkhitaḥ  gītam naccam jitaḥ diṭṭhaḥ tuṭṭhaḥ yiṭṭhaḥ ca bhaggavā
translated: he has been cooked, he has been cooked out, he has been cooked up; he has stood, he has grown, he is hungry.🔽He has sung, he has danced, he has won, he has been seen; he has been satisfied, he has been given, he is the Blessed One;

original: Vuttañca gutto acchinno, pahīno gamito gato.🔽Katobhisaṅkhato bhuttaṃ, ṭhānaṃ garumupāsito;
analyzed: vuttaṃ ca guttaḥ acchinnaḥ pahīnaḥ gamitaḥ gataḥ  bhuttam ṭhānam
translated: he has spoken, he has been guarded, he has been cut off, he has been abandoned, he has been sent away, he has gone.🔽He has done, he has been made, he has eaten, he is a place, he is heavy, he is worshipped;

original: Bhītañca sammato buddho, pūjitotītakālikā.
analyzed: bhītañca sammataḥ buddhaḥ pūjita utīta kālikā
translated: he is afraid, he is agreed upon, he is a Buddha, he is worshipped, he is past.

original: Atītappaccayantanayo.
analyzed: atīta ppaccaya ntanayaḥ
translated: The method of past conditions.

original: Tavetunādippaccayantanaya
analyzed: tava itu nādip pacca yantanaya
translated: The method of the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: “Puññāni kātumicchi, icchati, icchissati vā”ti viggahe –🔽636. Icchatthesu samāna kattu kesu ta ve tuṃ vā.
analyzed: puññāni kātum icchi icchati icchissati vā ati viggahe  icchatthesu samāna kattu kesu ta ve tum vā
translated: In the analysis “He wishes to do merit, he wishes, he will wish,”🔽. In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: Icchā attho yesaṃ te icchatthā, tesu icchatthesu dhātūsu samānakattukesu santesu
analyzed: icchā atthaḥ yesam te icchatthā tesu icchatthesu dhātūsu samāna kattukesu santesu
translated: In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: sabbadhātūhi tavetuṃiccete paccayā honti vā, “tavetuṃ vā”ti yogavibhāgena tadatthakriyāyañca,🔽te ca kitakattā kattari honti.
analyzed: sabba dhātūhi tava itum iti ca ete paccayāḥ honti vā tava itum vā ati yogavibhāgena  te ca kita kattā kattari honti
translated: In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: “Karotissa, vā”ti ca vattate.🔽637. Tavetunādīsu kā.
analyzed: karotissa vāti ca vattate  tava itu na ādīsu kā
translated: In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: Tavetunaiccevamādīsu paccayesu paresu karotissa dhātussa kādeso hoti vā, ādisaddena tuṃtvāna tvā tabbesu ca.
analyzed: tava itunā e c ca ivamādīsu paccayesu paresu karotissa dhātussa ka ādesaḥ hoti vā ādi saddena tum tvāna tvā tabbesu ca
translated: In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.

original: “Taddhitasamāsakitakā nāmaṃvātavetunādīsu cā”ti ettha “atave tunādīsū”ti nāmabyapadesassa🔽nisedhanato tadantānaṃ nipātattaṃ siddhaṃ bhavati, tato nipātattā tavetunamantato
analyzed: taddhita samāsa kitakāḥ ca ati ettha nāma byapadesassa 🔽siddham bhavati tatas
translated: In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun, etc.🔽In the verbs of wishing, in the same case, there are the conditions tavetun,

original: “sabbāsamāvuso”tiādinā vibhattilopo. So puññāni kātave icchati, kātumicchati.
analyzed: sabbāsamā avuso tiādinā vibhatti lopaḥ saḥ puññāni kātave icchati kātum icchati
translated: “All, friend,” etc., is a contraction of the case-endings. He wishes to make merit, he wishes to make.

original: Kādesābhāve “tuṃtunatabbesu vā”ti rakārassa tattaṃ. Kattuṃ kāmetīti kattukāmo, abhisaṅkharitumākaṅkhati.
analyzed: ka ādesa abhāve tum tuna tabbesu vā ati rakārassa tattam kattum kāmeti iti kattu kāmaḥ abhisaṅkharitum ākaṅkhati
translated: When there is no k-vowel, the r-vowel of the root becomes t-vowel by “tuṃtunatabbesu vā.” He wishes to make, he desires to make.🔽He longs to make, he is eager to form.

original: Tathā saddhammaṃ sotave, sotuṃ, suṇituṃ vā pattheti. Evaṃ anubhavituṃ, pacituṃ, gantuṃ,
analyzed: tathā saddhammam sotave sotum suṇitum vā pattheti evam anubhavitum pacitum gantum
translated: Likewise he longs to hear the True Idea, to hear, to listen. So he longs to experience, to digest, to go,

original: gamituṃ, khantuṃ, khanituṃ, hantuṃ, hanituṃ, mantuṃ, manituṃ, harituṃ, anussaritumicchati,
analyzed: gamitum khantum khanitum hantum hanitum mantum manitum haritum anussaritum icchati
translated: to go, to dig, to kill, to strike, to think, to carry, to remember.

original: ettha ikārayuttatamhi “namakarāna”miccādinā paṭisiddhattā na dhātvantalopo.
analyzed: ettha ikāra yut tatamhi nama karā nam iti ādinā na dhātu anta lopaḥ
translated: Here, because of the prohibition by “namakarāna” etc., there is no elision of the final vowel of the verbal root when the vowel i is added.

original: Tathā tudabyathane, tudituṃ, pavisituṃ, uddisibhuṃ, hotuṃ, sayibhuṃ, netuṃ, juhotuṃ,
analyzed: tathā tuda byathane tuditum pavisitum uddisibhum hotum sayibhum netum juhotum
translated: Likewise he longs to dig a trench, to dig, to enter, to point out, to be, to lie down, to lead, to offer,

original: pajahituṃ, pahātuṃ, dātuṃ. Roddhuṃ, rundhituṃ, tuṃtunādīsupi yogavibhāgena kattari
analyzed: pajahitum pahātum dātum roddhum rundhitum tuṃtunādī supi yogavibhāgena kattari
translated: to give up, to give up, to give, to weep, to weep, to make a noise, etc. In the case of the passive

original: vikaraṇappaccayā, saralopādi ca. Bhottuṃ, bhuñjituṃ, chettuṃ, chindituṃ. Sibbituṃ,
analyzed: vikaraṇa ppaccayā sara lopa ādi ca bhottum bhuñjitum chettum chinditum sibbitum
translated: the verbal root is changed, and there is elision of the vowel a, etc. He longs to eat, to eat, to cut, to cut, to be,🔽to be.

original: boddhuṃ, bujjhituṃ. Jāyituṃ, janituṃ. Pattuṃ, pāpuṇituṃ. Jetuṃ, jinituṃ, ketuṃ, kiṇituṃ,🔽vinicchetuṃ, vinicchinituṃ, ñātuṃ, jānituṃ, gahetuṃ, gaṇhituṃ. Coretuṃ, corayituṃ, pāletuṃ, pālayituṃ.
analyzed: boddhum bujjhitum jāyitum janitum pattum pāpuṇitum jetum jinitum ketum kiṇitum  vinicchetum vinicchinitum ñātum jānitum gahetum gaṇhitum coretum corayitum pāletum pālayitum
translated: To be awakened, to be enlightened. To be born, to be brought forth. To go, to reach. To conquer, to be conquered, to be a banner, to be bought,🔽To decide, to be decided. To know, to be known. To grasp, to be grasped. To steal, to be stolen. To protect, to be protected.

original: Kārite bhāvetuṃ, bhāvayituṃ, kāretuṃ, kārayituṃ, kārāpetuṃ, kārāpayitumicchati iccādi.
analyzed: kārite bhāvetum bhāvayitum kāretum kārayitum kārāpetum kārāpayitum icchati id cādi
translated: To cause to be done, to cause to be developed, to cause to be done, to cause to be done, to cause to be done, to cause to be done, he wishes.

original: “Tavetuṃ vā”ti yogavibhāgena kriyatthakriyāyañca gammamānāyaṃ tuṃpaccayo. Yathā –
analyzed: vāti yoga vibhāgena yathā
translated: “To be yours” is the particle tuṃ, which is used in the sense of the object of a verb when the verb is in the passive voice. For example,

original: subuddhuṃ vakkhāmi, bhottuṃ vajati, bhojanāya vajatīti attho. Evaṃ daṭṭhuṃ gacchati,
analyzed: su buddhum vakkhāmi bhottum vajati bhojanāya vajati iti atthaḥ evam daṭṭhum gacchati
translated: I will speak of the well-awakened one. To be eaten, he goes. The meaning is: he goes for the purpose of eating. Thus, to be seen, he goes.

original: gantumārabhati, gantuṃ payojayati, dassetumāha iccādi.
analyzed: gantum ārabhati gantum payojayati iti cādi
translated: He begins to go. He employs himself to go. He says in order to show. And so on.

original: “Tu”miti vattate.
analyzed: tum iti vattate
translated: “Tu” is said.

original: 638. Arahasakkādīsu ca.
analyzed: arahasakka ādīsu ca
translated: And in the case of arahasakka, etc.

original: Arahasakkabhabbānucchavikānurūpaiccevamādīsvatthesu payujjamānesu sabbadhātūhi tuṃpaccayo
analyzed: a raha sakka bhabba anucchavika anurūpa e c ca ivamādīsu atthesu payujjamānesu sabba dhātūhi tum paccayaḥ
translated: When such meanings as arahasakka, bhabbānucchavikā, anurūpa, etc. are used, the particle tuṃ is used with all noun bases.

original: hoti, casaddena kālasamayavelādīsupi. Ninda garahāyaṃ, ko taṃ ninditumarahati, rājā
analyzed: hoti ca saddena kāla samaya velā ādī supi ninda garaha ayam tam ninditum arahati rājā
translated: and in the case of time, season, occasion, etc., it is used in the sense of time. The word ninda is used in the sense of blame. Ko taṃ ninditumarahati? means: Who is able to blame him?

original: arahasi bhavituṃ, araho bhavaṃ vattuṃ. Sakkā jetuṃ dhanena vā, sakkā laddhuṃ, kātuṃ
analyzed: a rahasi bhavitum a rahaḥ bhavam vattum sakkā jetum dhanena vā sakkā laddhum kātum
translated: Arahasi bhavituṃ means: You are able to be. Araho bhavaṃ vattuṃ means: You are able to speak. Sakkā jetuṃ dhanena vā means: It is possible to win by wealth. Sakkā laddhuṃ means: It is possible to obtain. Sakkā kātuṃ means: It is possible to do.

original: sakkhissati. Bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ, abhabbo kātuṃ. Anucchaviko bhavaṃ dānaṃ paṭiggahetuṃ.
analyzed: sakkhissati bhabbaḥ niyāmam okkamitum abhabbaḥ kātum anucchavikaḥ bhavam dānam paṭiggahetum
translated: Sakkhissati means: He will be able to. Bhabbo means: He is able. Bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ means: He is able to enter into the certainty of rightness. Anucchaviko means: He is worthy. Anucchaviko bhavaṃ dānaṃ paṭiggahetuṃ means: You are worthy to receive the gift.

original: Idaṃ kātuṃ anurūpaṃ. Dānaṃ dātuṃ yuttaṃ, dātuṃ vattuñca labhati, evaṃ vaṭṭati bhāsituṃ,
analyzed: idam kātum anurūpam dānam dātum yuttam dātum vattum ca labhati evam vaṭṭati bhāsitum
translated: Idaṃ kātuṃ anurūpaṃ means: This is suitable to be done. Dānaṃ dātuṃ yuttaṃ means: It is proper to give the gift. Dātuṃ vattuñca labhati means: He is able to speak of giving. Evaṃ vaṭṭati bhāsituṃ means: It is proper to speak thus.

original: chindituṃ na ca kappati iccādi. Tathā kālo bhuñjituṃ, samayo bhuñjituṃ, velā bhuñjituṃ.
analyzed: chinditum na ca kappati iccādi tathā kālaḥ bhuñjitum samayaḥ bhuñjitum velā bhuñjitum
translated: Chindituṃ na ca kappati means: It is not proper to cut. Kālo bhuñjituṃ means: It is time to eat. Samayo bhuñjituṃ means: It is the right time to eat. Velā bhuñjituṃ means: It is the occasion to eat.

original: “Tu”miti vattate.
analyzed: tum iti vattate
translated: Tu is used.

original: 639. Pattavacane alamatthesu ca.🔽Alamatthesu pattavacane sati sabbadhātūhi tuṃpaccayo hoti, alaṃsaddassa atthā alamatthā
analyzed: patta vacane alam atthesu ca  alam atthesu patta vacane sati sabba dhātūhi tum paccayaḥ hoti alam saddassa atthāḥ alam atthā
translated: . In the sense of “enough” and in the sense of “vessel.”

original: bhūsanapariyattinivāraṇā, tesu alamatthesu. Pattassa vacanaṃ pattavacanaṃ, alameva
analyzed: bhūsana pariyatti nivāraṇā tesu alam atthesu pattassa vacanam patta vacanam alam eva
translated: When the word alaṃ is used in the sense of “enough” and in the sense of “vessel,” the particle tuṃ is formed with all bases, and the meaning of the word alaṃ is “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint,” “limit,” “restriction,” “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint,” “limit,” “restriction,” “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint,” “limit,” “restriction,” “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint,” “limit,” “restriction,” “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint,” “limit,” “restriction,” “enough,” “sufficient,” “restraint

original: dānāni dātuṃ, alameva puññāni kātuṃ, sampattameva pariyattamevāti attho.
analyzed: dānāni dātum alam eva puññāni kātum sampattam eva pariyattam eva ati attho
translated: The meaning is: it is enough to give gifts, it is enough to perform meritorious deeds, it has come to pass, it has been accomplished.

original: Katvā kammaṃ agacchi, gacchati, gacchissatīti vā atthe –
analyzed: katvā kammam agacchi gacchati gacchissati iti vā atthe
translated: In the sense of ‘having done the deed he has gone, is going, will go’,

original: 640. Pubbakālekakattukānaṃ tuna tvāna tvā vā.
analyzed: pubba kāla ika kattukānam tuna tvāna tvā vā
translated: The particles tuna, tvāna, tvā are used.

original: Pubbakāloti pubbakriyā, eko kattā yesaṃ te ekakattukā, tesaṃ ekakattukānaṃ samānakattukānaṃ dhātūnamantare pubbakāle vattamānadhātumhā tuna tvāna tvāiccete paccayā honti vā.🔽Vāsaddassa vavatthitavibhāsattā tunappaccayo katthaciyeva bhavati. Te ca kitasaññattā,
analyzed: pubba kālaḥ ti pubba kriyā ekaḥ kattā yesam te eka kattukā tesam eka kattukānam samāna kattukānam dhātūnam antare pubba kāle paccayāḥ honti vā  vā saddassa vavatthita vibhāsa ttā tu nap paccayaḥ katthaciyā iva bhavati te ca kita saññattā
translated: The past time is the time before the action, those that have one doer are single-doers, for those single-doers, for the verbs that have the same doer, the particles tuna, tvāna, tvā are used as conditions in the past time before the verb.

original: “ekakattukāna”nti vuttattā ca kattariyeva bhavanti. Tune “tavetunādīsu kā”ti kādeso,
analyzed: eka kattukānam ti vutta ttā ca kattariyā iva bhavanti tune tava ituna ādīsu ka ati ka ādesaḥ
translated: The condition tuna is only used in some places because of the definite analysis of the addition of vās. And because of the expression ‘single-doers’, they are only used with the doer. The substitution of kā is in tune ‘tavetuna, etc.’.

original: nipātattā silopo. So kātuna kammaṃ gacchati, akātuna puññaṃ kilamissanti sattā.
analyzed: nipāta ttā si lopaḥ saḥ kātuna kammam gacchati a kātuna puññam kilamissanti sattā
translated: Because of the indeclinable, there is elision of the syllable. The meaning is: ‘having done the deed he goes, beings will be lazy about not doing meritorious deeds such as giving gifts, etc.’

original: Tvānatvāsu “rakāro cā”ti dhātvantalopo, kammaṃ katvāna bhadrakaṃ, dānādīni puññāni
analyzed: rakāraḥ ca ati dhātu anta lopo kammam katvāna bhadrakam dāna ādīni puññāni
translated: In tvāna, tvā, because of ‘the syllable ra is elided at the end of a verb’, having done the deed, having done meritorious deeds such as giving gifts, etc.,

original: katvā saggaṃ gacchati, abhisaṅkharitvā, karitvā. Tathā sibbitvā, jāyitvā, janitvā,
analyzed: katvā saggam gacchati abhisaṅkharitvā karitvā tathā sibbitvā jāyitvā janitvā
translated: having made, he goes to heaven. Having formed, having made. Having scratched, having been born, having been produced.

original: dhammaṃ sutvā, sutvāna dhammaṃ modati, suṇitvā, patvā, pāpuṇitvā. Kiṇitvā, jetvā,
analyzed: dhammam sutvā sutvāna dhammam modati suṇitvā patvā pāpuṇitvā kiṇitvā jetvā
translated: Having heard the Dhamma, having heard the Dhamma he delights, having listened, having attained, having reached. Having bought, having conquered,

original: jinitvā, jitvā. Coretvā, corayitvā, pūjetvā, pūjayitvā. Tathā mettaṃ bhāvetvā, bhāvayitvā,
analyzed: jinitvā jitvā coretvā corayitvā pūjetvā pūjayitvā tathā mettam bhāvetvā bhāvayitvā
translated: having vanquished, having won. Having stolen, having robbed, having worshipped, having paid homage. Having developed loving-kindness, having developed,

original: vihāraṃ kāretvā, kārayitvā, kārāpetvā, kārāpayitvā saggaṃ gamissanti iccādi.
analyzed: vihāram kāretvā kārayitvā kārāpetvā kārāpayitvā saggam gamissanti iccādi
translated: having had a dwelling made, having had made, having had made, having had made, they will go to heaven.

original: Pubbakāleti kimatthaṃ? Paṭhati, pacati. Ekakattukānanti kiṃ? Bhutte devadatte yaññadatto vajati.
analyzed: pubba kāle iti kimattham paṭhati pacati eka kattukānam ti kim bhutte devadatte yaññadattaḥ vajati
translated: What is the purpose of the prefix pu- ? He recites, he cooks. What is the purpose of the prefix ekaka- ? When Devadatta has eaten, Yajñadatta goes.

original: “Apatvāna nadiṃ pabbato, atikkamma pabbataṃ nadī”tiādīsu pana sabbattha “bhavatī”ti sambandhato ekakattukatā, pubbakālatā ca gamyate.
analyzed: a patvāna nadim pabbataḥ atikkamma pabbatam nadī iti ādīsu pana sabbattha bhavati iti sambandhataḥ eka kattuka tā pubba kāla tā ca gamyate
translated: But in such passages as “Without crossing the river, the mountain; without crossing the mountain, the river,” the single-subjectness and the prior-time are understood by implication from the construction.

original: “Vā”ti vattate.🔽641. Sabbehi tunādīnaṃ yo.
analyzed: vāti vattate  sabbehi tuna ādīnam yaḥ
translated: The word “or” is used.🔽The syllable ya of all with tun and so on.

original: Sabbehi sopasaggānupasaggehi dhātūhi paresaṃ tunādīnaṃ paccayānaṃ yasaddādeso hoti
analyzed: sabbehi sa upasagga anupasaggehi dhātūhi paresam tuna ādīnam paccayānam ya sadda ādesaḥ hoti
translated: The syllable ya of all the verbal roots with and without prefix has the vowel ya in the case of the following particles tun and so on.

original: vā. Vanda abhivandane abhipubbo, tvāpaccayassa yo, ikārāgamo ca, abhivandiya bhāsissaṃ,
analyzed: vā vanda abhivandane abhipubbaḥ tvāp paccayassa yaḥ i kāra āgamaḥ ca abhivandiya bhāsissam
translated: Vanda is the root meaning ‘to worship’; abhivandane abhipubbo, tvāpaccayassa yo, ikārāgamo ca, abhivandiya bhāsissaṃ,

original: abhivanditvā, vandiya, vanditvā. Tathā abhibhuyya, dvittarassattāni, abhibhavitvā, abhibhotvā.
analyzed: abhivanditvā vanditvā tathā abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā abhibhotvā
translated: abhivanditvā, vandiya, vanditvā. Tathā abhibhuyya, dvittarassattāni, abhibhavitvā, abhibhotvā.

original: Si sevāyaṃ, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ikārassa āttaṃ, nissāya, nissitvā.
analyzed: si saḥ iva ayam kvaci dhātu uti ādinā ikārassa āttam nissāya nissitvā
translated: Si is the root meaning ‘to serve’; “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā ikārassa āttaṃ, nissāya, nissitvā.

original: Bhaja sevāyaṃ, “tathā kattari cā”ti pubbarūpattaṃ, vibhajja, vibhajiya, vibhajitvā.
analyzed: bhaja tathā kattari ca ati pubbarūpattam vibhajja vibhajiya vibhajitvā
translated: Bhaja is the root meaning ‘to serve’; “tathā kattari cā”ti pubbarūpattaṃ, vibhajja, vibhajiya, vibhajitvā.

original: Disa atisajjane, uddissa, uddisiya, uddisitvā. Pavissa, pavisiya, pavisitvā.
analyzed: disa atisajjane uddissa uddisiya uddisitvā pavissa pavisiya pavisitvā
translated: Disa is the root meaning ‘to exceed’; uddissa, uddisiya, uddisitvā. Pavissa, pavisiya, pavisitvā.

original: Nī pāpuṇane, upanīya, upanetvā. Atiseyya, atisayitvā. Ohāya, ohitvā, jahitvā, hitvā.
analyzed: nī pāpuṇane upanīya upanetvā atiseyya atisayitvā ohāya ohitvā jahitvā hitvā
translated: Nī is the root meaning ‘to attain’; upanīya, upanetvā. Atiseyya, atisayitvā. Ohāya, ohitvā, jahitvā, hitvā.

original: Ādāya, ādiyitvā, “divādito yo”ti yappaccayo, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhātvantassikāro
analyzed: ādāya ādiyitvā divā āditaḥ yap paccayaḥ kvaci dhātu uti ādinā dhātu antassikāraḥ
translated: Ādāya, ādiyitvā, “divādito yo”ti yappaccayo, “kvaci dhātū”tiādinā dhātvantassikāro

original: ca, datvā, datvāna. Pidhāya, pidahitvā. Bhuñjiya, bhuñjitvā, bhotvā. Viceyya, vicinitvā.
analyzed: ca datvā datvāna pidhāya pidahitvā bhuñjiya bhuñjitvā bhotvā viceyya vicinitvā
translated: ca, datvā, datvāna. Pidhāya, pidahitvā. Bhuñjiya, bhuñjitvā, bhotvā. Viceyya, vicinitvā.

original: Viññāya, vijānitvā, ñatvā.
analyzed: viññāya vijānitvā ñatvā
translated: Viññāya, vijānitvā, ñatvā.

original: “Yathāgamaṃ, tunādīsū”ti ca vattate.🔽642. Dadhantato yo kvaci.🔽Dakāradhakārantehi dhātūhi yathāgamaṃ yakārāgamo hoti kvaci tunādīsu paccayesu. Yavato🔽dakārassa jakāro, samāpajjitvā, uppajjitvā, bhijjitvā, chijjitvā gato. Budha avagamane,🔽“tathā kattari cā”ti sakhātvantassa yakārassa cavaggo, bujjhiya, bujjhitvā. Virajjhiya,🔽virajjhitvā. Rundhiya, rundhitvā.🔽“Tunādīna”nti adhikāro, “vā”ti ca.🔽643. Canantehi raccaṃ.
analyzed: yathāgamam tu na ādīsu uti ca vattate  dadhantataḥ yaḥ kvaci  dakāra dhakāra antehi dhātūhi yathāgamam yakāra āgamaḥ hoti kvaci tuna ādīsu paccayesu yavato  dakārassa jakāraḥ samāpajjitvā uppajjitvā bhijjitvā chijjitvā gataḥ budha avagamane  tathā kattari ca ati sa khātu antassa yakārassa cavaggaḥ bujjhiya bujjhitvā virajjhiya  virajjhitvā rundhiya rundhitvā  adhikāraḥ vāti ca  can antehi ra c cam
translated: “As to the letter ya, in the words tunādīsu, etc.” is said.🔽In the words dakārantā, etc., the letter ya is substituted for the letter ka,

original: Cakāranakārantehi dhātūhi paresaṃ tunādīnaṃ paccayānaṃ raccādeso hoti vā, “racca”nti🔽yogavibhāgena aññasmāpi, vavatthitavibhāsatthoyaṃ vāsaddo, rādilopo. Vica vivecane
analyzed: cakāra nakāra antehi dhātūhi paresam tuna ādīnam paccayānam racca ādesaḥ hoti vā raccanti  yoga vibhāgena aññasma api vavatthita vibhāsa atthaḥ yam vā saddaḥ ra ādi lopaḥ vi ca vivecane
translated: in certain conditions beginning with tun, etc., by the addition of the letter ya.

original: Tavetunādippaccayantanayo.
analyzed: tava itu nādip pacca yantanayaḥ
translated: The method of the present-participial-affix-nouns as condition.

original: Vattamānakālikamānantappaccayantanaya
analyzed: vattamāna kālika māna ntap paccaya nta naya
translated: The method of the present-tense-affix-nouns as condition

original: 646. Vattamāne mānantā.
analyzed: vattamāne mānantā
translated: . In the present tense

original: Āraddho aparisamatto attho vattamāno, tasmiṃ vattamāne kāle gammamāne sabbadhātūhi mānaantaiccete paccayā honti. Te ca kitasaññattā “kattari kita”ti kattari bhavanti.
analyzed: āraddhaḥ a parisamattaḥ atthaḥ vattamānaḥ tasmin vattamāne kāle gammamāne sabba dhātūhi māna anta e c ca ete paccayāḥ honti te ca kita saññattā kattari kitati kattari bhavanti
translated: . The meaning begun but not completed is the present. In the present time, while it is going on, these conditions are the present-tense-affix-nouns. And because they are formed by the affix -nt they are in the locative case as “in the doer” .

original: Antamānappaccayānañcettha “parasamaññāpayoge”ti parasamaññāvasena parassapadattanopadasaññattā tyādīsu viya antamānesu ca vikaraṇappaccayā bhavanti.
analyzed: para samaññā apayoge iti para samaññā vasena tya ādīsu viya anta mānesu ca vikaraṇa ppaccayāḥ bhavanti
translated: Herein, the conditions as the present-tense-affix-nouns are the verbal-noun conditions in the sense of the other-recognition, as in the case of the words ty-ādīsu and antamānesu .

original: Teneva mānappaccayo “attanopadāni bhāve ca kammanī”ti bhāvakammesupi hoti, tassa ca “attanopadāni parassapadatta”nti kvaci antappaccayādeso ca.
analyzed: tena iva māna ppaccayaḥ attanopadāni bhāve ca kammani iti bhāva kammesu pi hoti tassa ca attanopadāni kvaci anta ppaccaya ādesaḥ ca
translated: That is why the present-tense-affix-nouns are in the locative case as “in the doing” and “in the action” . And the locative case of the present-tense-affix-nouns is sometimes in the sense of the other-recognition, as in the case of the words ty-ādīsu and antamānesu .

original: Gamu, sappa gatimhi, gacchatīti atthe antappaccayo, “bhūvādito a”iti appaccayo, “gamissanto
analyzed: gamu sappa gatimhi gacchati iti atthe anta paccayaḥ bhū vā āditaḥ aiti a paccayaḥ gamissanto
translated: The verbal-noun condition is in the locative case as “in the going” in the sense of the present tense in the meaning “he goes.” The affix -nt is in the locative case as “in the going” in the sense of the present tense in the meaning “he goes” .

original: ccho vā sabbāsū”ti dhātvantassa cchādeso, saralopādi, nāmabyapadese syādyuppatti.
analyzed: cchaḥ vā sabbāsu iti dhātu antassa ccha ādesaḥ sara lopa ādi nāma byapadese
translated: The affix cchādeso is added to the end of the base, and the elision of the first syllable, etc., occurs by the rule of nāmabyapadesa.

original: Gacchanta si itīdha “vā”ti vattamāne “simhi gacchantādīnaṃ ntasaddo aṃ” iti ntassa amādeso.
analyzed: gacchanta si iti idha vāti vattamāne simhi gacchanta ādīnam nta saddaḥ aṃ iti ntassa am ādesaḥ
translated: When the present tense is expressed by the affix vā, the affix ntasaddo is added to gacchantādīnaṃ, and the elision of the nt affix occurs by the rule ntassa amādeso.

original: Vāsaddassa vavatthibhavibhāsattā ekārokāraparassa na bhavati, saralopādi, so puriso gacchaṃ, gacchanto gaṇhāti, sesaṃ guṇavantusamaṃ.
analyzed: vā saddassa ekāra ukāra parassa na bhavati sara lopa ādi saḥ purisaḥ gaccham gacchantaḥ gaṇhāti sesam
translated: The elision of the first syllable, etc., occurs by the rule of nāmabyapadesa. That man is going, he is going, he takes. The rest is the same as in the case of guṇavant.

original: Itthiyaṃ “nadādito vā ī”ti īpaccayo, “sesesu ntuvā”ti ntubyapadese “vā”ti adhikicca “ntussa tamīkāre”ti takāre saralopasilopā, sā kaññā gacchatī, gacchantī iccādi itthisamaṃ.
analyzed: itthiyam nad āditaḥ vā ī ti ī paccayaḥ sesesu ntu vā āti ntu byapadese vā ati adhikicca ntussa tam īkāre iti takāre sara lopa si lopā sā kaññā gacchatī gacchantī iccādi itthi samam
translated: In the feminine, the affix īpaccayo is added by the rule nadādito vā ī, and the elision of the first syllable, etc., occurs by the rule of nāmabyapadesa, and the elision of the first syllable, etc., occurs by the rule of nāmabyapadesa. That girl is going, she is going, etc. The feminine is the same as in the case of itthi.

original: Napuṃsake pure viya ntassa amādeso, taṃ cittaṃ gacchaṃ, gacchantaṃ, gacchantāni iccādi pulliṅgasamaṃ.
analyzed: napuṃsake pure viya ntassa am ādesaḥ tam cittam gaccham gacchantam gacchantāni iccādi pulliṅga samam
translated: In the neuter, the elision of the nt affix occurs by the rule ntassa amādeso, as in the masculine. That mind is going, it is going, they are going, etc. The neuter is the same as in the case of citta.

original: Tathā gacchatīti atthe mānappaccayo, cchādesādi ca, so gacchamāno gaṇhāti, te gacchamānā
analyzed: tathā gacchati iti atthe māna ppaccayaḥ chā desa ādi ca saḥ gacchamānaḥ gaṇhāti te gacchamānā
translated: Similarly, the affix mānappaccayo is added to the meaning “is going,” and the elision of the first syllable, etc., occurs. He is going, he takes, they are going,

original: iccādi purisasaddasamaṃ. Sā gacchamānā, tā gacchamānāyo iccādi kaññāsaddasamaṃ. Taṃ
analyzed: iccādi purisa saddasamam sā gacchamānā tāḥ gacchamānāyaḥ iccādi kaññā saddasamam tam
translated: When it is going, they are going, it is like the word kaññā.

original: gacchamānaṃ, tāni gacchamānāni iccādi cittasaddasamaṃ.
analyzed: gacchamānam tāni gacchamānāni iccādi
translated: That which is going, those which are going, it is like the word citta.

original: Gacchīyatīti atthe “attanopadāni bhāve ca kammanī”ti kammani mānappaccayo, “bhāvakammesu🔽yo”ti yappaccayo, “ivaṇṇāgamo vā”ti ikārāgamo, cchādeso, so tena gacchiyamāno, sā
analyzed: gacchīyati iti atthe bhāve ca kammani iti kammani māna ppaccayaḥ bhāva kammesu  yaḥ iti ya ppaccayaḥ i vaṇṇa āgamaḥ vā ti ikāra āgamaḥ cha ādesaḥ saḥ tena gacchiyamānaḥ sā
translated: In the sense of “it is being gone,” in the expression “attanopadāni bhāve ca kammanī,” the kammani affix is added, and the y affix is added because of the rule “yo in bhāva and kamma.”

original: gacchiyamānā, taṃ gacchiyamānaṃ.
analyzed: gacchiyamānā tam gacchiyamānam
translated: The vowel i is added because of the rule “ivaṇṇāgamo vā,” and the vowel e is substituted. He is being gone by that, she is being gone by that, it is being gone by that.

original: Cchādesābhāve “pubbarūpañcā”ti yakārassa makāro, dhammo adhigammamāno hitāya bhavati, adhigammamānā, adhigammamānaṃ.
analyzed: cchā desa abhāve pubba rūpam ca ati yakārassa makāraḥ dhammaḥ adhigamma mānaḥ hitāya bhavati adhigamma mānā adhigamma mānam
translated: In the absence of the substitution of the vowel e, the vowel i becomes the vowel o because of the rule “pubbarūpañcā.” The Dhamma, when it is being realized, is for welfare, it is being realized, it is being realized.

original: Tathā maha pūjāyaṃ, mahatīti mahaṃ, mahanto, mahatī, mahantī, mahaṃ, mahantaṃ, mahamāno,
analyzed: tathā maha pūjā ayam mahatī iti maham mahantaḥ mahatī mahantam maham mahantam mahamānaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the expression “mahatī pūjā,” the word mahatī becomes maha, mahanto, mahatī, mahatī, mahaṃ, mahantaṃ, mahamāno,

original: mahamānā, mahamānaṃ. Kammani “yamhi dādhāmāṭhāhāpā maha mathādīnamī”iti dhātvantassa
analyzed: mahamānāḥ mahamānam kammani yamhi dhātu antassa
translated: mahamānā, mahamānaṃ. In the expression “yamhi dādhāmāṭhāhāpā maha mathādīnamī,” the vowel a of the verbal root is changed to the vowel i because of the rule “dhātvantassa akārassa īkāro.”

original: akārassa īkāro, mahīyamāno, mahīyamānā, mahīyamānaṃ.
analyzed: akārassa īkāraḥ mahīyamānaḥ mahīyamānāḥ mahīyamānam
translated: It is being honored, they are being honored, it is being honored.

original: tena. Setīti sento, sentī, sentaṃ, semāno, sayaṃ, sayantī, sayantaṃ, sayamāno, sayāno

translated: Vā, mānassa ānādeso, atisīyamāno.

original: Asa sabbhāve, “sabbatthāsassādilopo cā”ti akārassa lopo, atthīti saṃ, santo, satī, santī, santaṃ, samāno, samānā, samānaṃ.

original: Ṭhā gatinivattimhi, “vā”ti vattamāne “ṭhā tiṭṭho”ti tiṭṭhādeso, tiṭṭhaṃ, tiṭṭhantī,

original: upaṭṭhahaṃ, upaṭṭhahantī, upaṭṭhahantaṃ, upaṭṭhahamāno. Ṭhīyamānaṃ tena, upaṭṭhīyamāno, upaṭṭhahīyamāno.

translated: upaṭṭhahaṃ, upaṭṭhahantī, upaṭṭhahantaṃ, upaṭṭhahamāno. Ṭhīyamānaṃ tena, upaṭṭhīyamāno, upaṭṭhahīyamāno.

original: dhātū”tiādinā bakārassa vattaṃ, pivaṃ, pivantī, pivantaṃ, pivamāno, pīyamāno, pīyamānā, pīyamānaṃ iccādi.🔽Hu dānādanahabyappadānesu, appaccaye pure viya dvibhāvādi, juhotīti juhaṃ, juhantī,🔽juhantaṃ, juhamāno, hūyamāno. Evaṃ jahaṃ, jahantī, jahantaṃ, jahamāno, jahīyamāno.
analyzed: dhātu uti ādinā bakārassa vattam pivam pivantī pivantam pivamānaḥ pīyamānaḥ pīyamānā pīyamānam iccādi  hu dāna āda naha bya ppadānesu appaccaye pure viya dvi bhāva ādi juhoti iti juham juhantī  juhantam juhamānaḥ hūyamānaḥ evam jaham jahantī jahantam jahamānaḥ jahīyamānaḥ
translated: The function of the letter ba is shown by such words as “dhātu” (element).

original: Dadātīti dadaṃ, dadantī, dadantaṃ, dadamāno, dvittābhāve dānaṃ dento, dentī, dentaṃ, dīyamāno.🔽Rudhi āvaraṇe, “rudhādito niggahītapubbañcā”ti appaccayaniggahītāgamā, rundhatīti🔽rundhaṃ, rundhantī, rundhantaṃ, rundhamāno, rujjhamāno. Bhuñjatīti bhuñjaṃ, bhuñjantī,🔽bhuñjantaṃ, bhuñjamāno, bhujjamāno iccādi.
analyzed: dadāti iti dadam dadantī dadantam dadamānaḥ dvitta abhāve dānam dentaḥ dentam dīyamānaḥ  āvaraṇe rudh āditaḥ niggahīta pubbañca ati appaccaya niggahīta āgamāḥ rundhati iti  rundham rundhantī rundhantam rundhamānaḥ rujjhamānaḥ bhuñjati iti bhuñjam bhuñjantī  bhuñjantam bhuñjamānaḥ bhujjamānaḥ it ca ādi
translated: The function of the letter hu is shown by such words as “dāna” (giving), “ādāna” (taking), “habya” (sacrifice), and “padāna” (striving).

original: Divu kīḷāyaṃ, “divādito yo”ti yappaccayo, “tathā kattari cā”ti pubbarūpattaṃ, battañca,
